body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2040, the State of Israel launches a mission that includes at least one human astronaut landing on the surface of the Moon. The astronaut must be a part of the mission from launch and must safely return to Earth for the resolution to be affirmative. The mission must be authorized and recognized by the Israeli Space Agency or its successor, and the landing must be independently verified by at least one of the following entities: NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, or an internationally recognized space monitoring organization. In the event of a joint mission with other countries, the mission will still resolve as Yes if an Israeli astronaut is part of the crew that lands on the Moon. If no such mission is launched, or if a mission is launched but does not meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No. In the case of ambiguity or lack of clear public information by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a biotechnology company be the first to develop a viable method for producing oxygen on Mars before 2035?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2035, a biotechnology company develops and demonstrates a method for producing oxygen on Mars that meets the following criteria:

- Production Capability: The method must be capable of producing at least 5 metric tons of oxygen per Martian year.

- Viability: The method must be demonstrated to be sustainable with resources available on Mars and must not rely on materials that cannot be reasonably sourced or recycled on Mars.

- Verification: The development and demonstration must be verified by at least two independent and reputable scientific organizations, such as NASA, ESA, or an equivalent.

- Public Disclosure: Details of the method must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a recognized scientific conference.

In the event that multiple companies meet these criteria, the resolution will be Yes if the first company to do so is a biotechnology company. If no company or entity has met these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Google develop a satellite-based internet service that covers 95% of the Earth's surface by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Google has developed and is actively operating a satellite-based internet service that provides coverage to at least 95% of the Earth's surface. Coverage is defined as the ability to receive a stable internet connection from the service, regardless of the user's location on the Earth's surface. The service must be commercially available and operational, not merely in a testing or pilot phase.

The assessment of coverage will be based on official statements from Google, corroborated by independent verification from a recognized authority in satellite communications or a reputable global telecommunications regulatory body. In the absence of an official statement or independent verification, credible media reports from at least three major technology news outlets may be used as evidence.

In the event that Google is acquired, merges with another company, or undergoes significant restructuring, the question will resolve based on the actions of the successor entity that inherits Google's satellite internet service project.

If the service is developed but does not reach the 95% coverage threshold by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If the service reaches the coverage threshold but is not operational due to regulatory, technical, or other unforeseen issues, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) announce a new economic initiative related to public health by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by 23:59:59 on December 31, 2025, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has officially announced a new economic initiative specifically aimed at improving public health outcomes. The announcement must be made through an official CDC communication channel, such as a press release, official website update, or a formal statement by a CDC spokesperson. The initiative must be clearly defined as a new economic policy or program with allocated funding and a strategic plan for implementation. The initiative may include, but is not limited to, funding for research, public health infrastructure, disease prevention programs, or health education campaigns. If the CDC announces multiple initiatives, at least one must meet these criteria to resolve the question as Yes. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clarity in the announcement, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative and direct interpretation of the CDC's communication. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

metadata.tags: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

title: Will a major biotechnology firm announce a breakthrough in synthetic biology that significantly impacts the economy by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major biotechnology firm announces a breakthrough in synthetic biology that meets the following conditions:

- The breakthrough must be a novel development or discovery in the field of synthetic biology that has not been previously reported or published.

- The firm must be recognized as a major player in the biotechnology industry, as determined by market capitalization or influence in the field at the time of the announcement.

- The announcement must be made through official channels, such as a press release, scientific publication, or a formal presentation at a reputable scientific conference.

- The breakthrough must have a demonstrable and significant impact on the economy, which could include the creation of new markets, substantial cost reductions in existing markets, or the introduction of new products or services with considerable market demand.

- The economic impact must be confirmed by at least two independent and reputable economic analysts or institutions.

- In the event that multiple firms announce relevant breakthroughs, the resolution will be based on the first such announcement made.

- If no announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announcements made do not meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new pharmacological product with the potential to disrupt the pharmaceutical market be patented by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new pharmacological product is patented that meets the following criteria:

- Market Disruption: The product must be projected to capture at least 10% of the market share in its respective category within 5 years of its release, as reported by at least two independent and reputable market analysis firms.

- Patent Confirmation: The patent must be registered with the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) or the European Patent Office (EPO), and the patent details must be publicly accessible.

- Expert Endorsement: At least three recognized experts in the field of pharmacology or pharmaceuticals must publicly state the product's potential to significantly impact the market.

- Novel Mechanism: The product must introduce a novel mechanism of action or application that is not a mere modification of existing treatments.

In the event that multiple products meet these criteria, the resolution will be based on the product with the earliest patent filing date. If no such product is patented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an AI system be officially used to predict outcomes or assist in decision-making for the 2024 US Elections?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by November 6, 2024, an AI system is officially used by any US government entity or major political party (Democratic or Republican) to predict outcomes or assist in decision-making related to the 2024 US Presidential Election. The AI system must be acknowledged in an official statement, press release, or public documentation from the respective entity. The AI's involvement must be specific to tasks such as voter turnout predictions, electoral vote projections, policy impact forecasts, or candidate selection support. The use of AI for generic data analysis or non-specific tasks will not meet this criterion. In the event of ambiguity regarding the AI's role, a statement from an authoritative figure within the entity confirming the AI's specific election-related function will be required for resolution. If no such AI system usage is confirmed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a robot designed with AI specifically for elder care be commercially available by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a robot designed with artificial intelligence specifically for elder care is available for commercial purchase by consumers or healthcare facilities. The robot must be capable of performing at least the following tasks autonomously: assisting with mobility, providing medication reminders, monitoring health vitals, and offering social interaction to the elderly. The robot must be approved for use by a recognized health regulatory body such as the FDA in the United States or the EMA in the European Union. The availability of the robot must be confirmed by at least two independent and reputable news sources or the manufacturer's official announcement. In the event of a dispute regarding the robot's capabilities or availability, a panel of three experts in robotics and elder care, agreed upon by Metaculus Admins, will make the final determination.

title: Will Tesla announce the establishment of an AI research facility in Spain before the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Tesla, Inc. publicly announces the establishment of an AI research facility in Spain before December 31, 2024. The announcement must be verifiable through an official Tesla press release, a statement from Elon Musk or another Tesla executive, or a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) that explicitly mentions the establishment of such a facility in Spain. The facility must be described as dedicated to AI research, and the announcement should include a location within Spain and a timeline for the facility's development. If Tesla announces plans for multiple facilities, at least one must meet these criteria. In the absence of a clear announcement by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. If Tesla is acquired or ceases to exist as an independent entity before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No unless the establishment of the facility has been confirmed prior to the acquisition or dissolution.

title: Will CRISPR technology be used to cure a genetic disease in humans with a success rate of over 90% by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a CRISPR-based therapy is demonstrated to cure a genetic disease in humans with a success rate of over 90%. The disease must be recognized by the World Health Organization (WHO) and the therapy must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal. The success rate must be determined by a statistically significant sample size as defined by the medical community standards at the time of publication. The therapy must receive approval from a major regulatory body such as the FDA (U.S. Food and Drug Administration), EMA (European Medicines Agency), or an equivalent authority. In the event of multiple therapies, only the first to meet these criteria will be considered. If no therapy meets these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Mexico deploy its first domestically produced satellite into orbit by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Mexican government or a Mexico-based private entity has successfully launched and deployed a satellite into Earth's orbit, and the satellite is confirmed to be functioning for its intended purpose. The satellite must be predominantly manufactured within Mexico, with at least 75% of its components by value being produced domestically. The launch may be conducted from any location, but the satellite must be under the operational control of a Mexican entity. Confirmation must come from an authoritative space agency or organization, such as the Mexican Space Agency (AEM), NASA, or the European Space Agency (ESA). In the event of a dispute regarding the satellite's functionality or domestic production status, a panel of experts from the International Astronautical Federation (IAF) will be consulted for a final decision. If no satellite meeting these criteria is deployed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an AI system be used to officiate a Grand Slam tennis final without human intervention by 2028?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, an AI system has been used to officiate a Grand Slam tennis final without human intervention. The AI system must meet the following criteria:

- Autonomous Decision-Making: The AI must independently make all calls during the match, including but not limited to ball in/out, foot faults, and player conduct.

- Official Recognition: The match must be an official part of a Grand Slam tournament, recognized by the International Tennis Federation (ITF).

- No Human Overrule: There must be no human overruling the AI's decisions during the match.

- Public Confirmation: The use of the AI system must be publicly confirmed by the ITF or the organizing committee of the Grand Slam tournament.

In the event that multiple AI systems are used during the tournament, the resolution will be based on the first instance of an AI system officiating a final match. If no AI system meets these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a COVID-19 vaccine be developed that provides immunity for more than 5 years by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a COVID-19 vaccine has been developed and is publicly available that meets the following criteria:

- Longevity of Immunity: The vaccine must be proven to provide immunity against COVID-19 for a period exceeding 5 years, as evidenced by long-term clinical studies or real-world data.

- Peer-Reviewed Evidence: The duration of immunity must be confirmed through peer-reviewed scientific research published in a reputable medical journal.

- Regulatory Approval: The vaccine must have received approval from a major health regulatory body such as the FDA, EMA, or WHO for general public use.

- Wide Availability: The vaccine must be available to the general public in at least three G7 countries.

In the event that no vaccine meeting these criteria is publicly available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

If the vaccine's longevity of immunity is still under investigation by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No unless interim results strongly suggest that the 5-year immunity threshold will be met, subject to confirmation by an independent panel of experts.

title: Will Taiwan establish a dedicated technology park for semiconductor research and development by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the government of Taiwan has officially designated and established a dedicated technology park specifically for semiconductor research and development. The park must be operational with at least one semiconductor company conducting active R&D within its premises. The establishment of the park must be confirmed by an official government announcement or by credible news sources such as Reuters or Bloomberg. If the park is announced but not operational, or if it is operational but not dedicated exclusively to semiconductor R&D, the question will resolve as No. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear public information by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US Congress pass a bill specifically addressing the regulation of artificial intelligence technologies by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United States Congress has passed federal legislation that explicitly aims to regulate artificial intelligence technologies. The bill must be signed into law by the President of the United States or otherwise enacted into law. The legislation should address at least one of the following aspects of artificial intelligence: development standards, ethical guidelines, usage restrictions, or oversight mechanisms. The resolution will be based on credible media reports, official government publications, or direct statements from members of Congress or the President. In the event of a government shutdown or other extraordinary circumstances that prevent the passage of bills, the resolution date may be extended to accommodate such delays. If no bill is passed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a breakthrough in chemistry that significantly impacts the global economy before 2030?
body:
A 'breakthrough in chemistry' is defined as a discovery or innovation that leads to the creation of a new product, process, or technology with the potential to influence the global economy significantly. This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2030, any of the following occur:

1. A new chemical compound or material is developed that results in a market valuation exceeding $10 billion USD within five years of its introduction, as reported by a recognized financial news source.

2. A chemical process innovation that reduces production costs by at least 50% for a major industry (e.g., pharmaceuticals, plastics, energy), as confirmed by at least three independent industry analyses.

3. The introduction of a chemical technology that leads to a measurable increase of at least 5% in global GDP within a five-year period, as reported by the World Bank or International Monetary Fund.

In the event that multiple potential breakthroughs are announced, the earliest one that meets the above criteria will be considered the resolution of the question. If no such breakthrough occurs, the question will resolve as No.

In cases where the impact of a breakthrough is disputed, a panel of five experts from the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) will be consulted to determine if the criteria have been met. The decision of the panel will be considered final.

title: Will Canada's GDP growth outpace that of the United States in any year before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, for any fiscal year before January 1, 2030, the percentage increase in Canada's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) from the previous year is greater than that of the United States for the same period. The GDP growth rates must be the final revised figures as reported by Statistics Canada and the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA), respectively. In the event that either agency ceases to exist, is not considered authoritative, or does not provide the necessary data, the resolution will be based on the data from the most reputable and authoritative source available at the time. If both countries report the same growth rate for a given year, the question will resolve as No. If no data is available for any year before 2030, the question will resolve as N/A (Not Applicable).

title: Will the World Health Organization announce a global economic impact due to a pandemic before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the World Health Organization (WHO) makes a formal announcement stating that a pandemic has caused a significant global economic impact. The announcement must explicitly attribute the economic impact to the effects of a pandemic and must be made through an official WHO communication channel, such as a press release, official report, or a statement by a designated WHO spokesperson. The economic impact must be quantifiable and must be reported as having a substantial negative effect on global economic indicators such as GDP, trade volumes, or employment rates. In the absence of a direct statement from the WHO, the question may also resolve as Yes if a formal declaration is made by a coalition of at least five G20 nations, or by an authoritative global economic institution such as the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank, attributing a significant economic downturn to a pandemic. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Russia develop a new state-sponsored cryptocurrency by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Russian government or any entity acting on its behalf has officially announced and demonstrated the functioning of a new state-sponsored cryptocurrency. The cryptocurrency must be recognized by the Central Bank of Russia or another relevant regulatory authority and be available for use by the public or specific sectors. The announcement must be verifiable through official government channels, press releases, or statements from recognized financial news sources. In the event of ambiguity regarding the cryptocurrency's status as state-sponsored, a majority decision by a panel of five recognized experts in cryptocurrency and international finance will be used to determine the resolution. If Russia develops a digital currency that is not a cryptocurrency but serves a similar purpose, this will not count towards the resolution of the question.

title: Will there be a discovery of a new fundamental particle by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new fundamental particle not currently included in the Standard Model of particle physics is discovered and confirmed. The discovery must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and subsequently confirmed by at least one independent research group. The particle must be observed directly or indirectly through reproducible experimental results and recognized by the scientific community, including major institutions such as CERN or the American Physical Society. In the event of a dispute or ambiguity regarding the discovery, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the scientific community as reflected in major scientific publications and statements by recognized authorities in the field of particle physics. If no such consensus can be reached, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will FIFA implement AI referees in official matches by 2026?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, FIFA has officially implemented AI technology as the primary decision-making referee in at least one official international or club-level match. The AI referee must autonomously make and communicate key match decisions such as goals, penalties, offsides, and red or yellow cards without human override during live gameplay. The implementation must be acknowledged in an official statement by FIFA or corroborated by credible news reports from major sports news outlets. Exhibition, test, or non-competitive matches are excluded. In the event that FIFA is dissolved or fundamentally restructured before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Canada have a national AI strategy focused on healthcare applications by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Canadian government has officially announced and begun implementing a national AI strategy that is specifically focused on healthcare applications. The strategy must include clear objectives, allocated budget, and designated agencies or committees responsible for its execution. The announcement must be verifiable through official government publications or statements from a federal minister. In the event of ambiguity regarding the focus on healthcare, the strategy must explicitly mention healthcare applications as a primary objective. If no such strategy is announced, or if the strategy does not primarily focus on healthcare applications, the question will resolve as No. In the case of a partial strategy announcement without full implementation details, the resolution will be based on the most comprehensive information available from official sources by the resolution date.

title: Will an AI system be approved for autonomous monitoring and adjustment of COVID-19 vaccine storage temperatures by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, an AI system has been officially approved by a recognized regulatory body such as the FDA (U.S. Food and Drug Administration) or EMA (European Medicines Agency) for the autonomous monitoring and adjustment of COVID-19 vaccine storage temperatures. The AI system must be capable of continuously monitoring storage conditions, making real-time adjustments to maintain optimal temperatures, and providing alerts for any critical deviations. The approval must be for actual operational use in facilities that store COVID-19 vaccines, and not just for trial or experimental purposes. The resolution will rely on public announcements or documentation from the regulatory body or the organization implementing the AI system. In the event that no specific AI system is approved, but a regulatory framework allowing for such systems is established, the question will resolve as No unless an AI system is explicitly mentioned as being compliant with the new regulations.

title: Will NATO establish a dedicated AI defense initiative to counter cyber threats by 2026?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, NATO has officially announced and established a dedicated Artificial Intelligence (AI) defense initiative specifically aimed at countering cyber threats. The initiative must be recognized by an official NATO press release or statement, detailing the scope, objectives, and operational status of the AI defense program. The initiative must be distinct and primarily focused on AI applications for cyber defense, rather than being a component of a broader technology or cybersecurity program. In the event of ambiguity regarding the initiative's focus on AI, the resolution will be based on the predominant narrative in reports from at least three reputable international news organizations. If NATO is disbanded or undergoes a significant structural change that renders the question non-applicable, the question will resolve as N/A.

title: Will Australia enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth, by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS) reports two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point before December 31, 2025. The GDP growth rates must be seasonally adjusted and compared to the immediately preceding quarters. A recession will be considered to have occurred even if it is followed by a period of positive growth within the same timeframe. If the ABS revises its data after the initial report, the outcome will be based on the revised data if the revisions are published before the resolution date. In the event that the ABS ceases to exist, fails to report, or there is a significant delay in reporting, the resolution will be based on the data and reports from an authoritative economic institution designated by the Australian government to fulfill the ABS's role. If no such institution is designated or available, the question will resolve as N/A (Not Applicable).

title: Will DeepMind develop an AI capable of passing the Turing Test by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, DeepMind has developed an artificial intelligence (AI) system that has passed the Turing Test as defined by the following criteria:

1. Test Administration: The Turing Test must be administered by a panel of experts in AI and cognitive science, with the panel being recognized by the International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence (IJCAI) or a similar authoritative body in the field of AI.

2. Test Format: The AI must engage in a series of text-based conversations with human interlocutors, where the interlocutors are unaware of whether they are conversing with a human or the AI. The conversations should cover a range of topics, including but not limited to current events, philosophy, and everyday social interactions.

3. Success Threshold: The AI is considered to have passed the Turing Test if at least 70% of the human interlocutors cannot reliably distinguish the AI from a human after a series of conversations, each lasting up to 30 minutes.

4. Public Disclosure: The results of the Turing Test must be publicly disclosed in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or at a major AI conference, with the methodology, conversations, and results available for scrutiny.

5. Independent Verification: An independent third party, such as a major university or research institution, must verify the results.

In the event that DeepMind is acquired, merges, or undergoes significant structural changes, the question will resolve based on the actions of the successor entity. If DeepMind ceases to exist without a clear successor, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Brazil's inflation rate exceed 10% in any year before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the annual inflation rate in Brazil, as reported by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE), exceeds 10% in any year before January 1, 2025. The inflation rate to be considered is the National Consumer Price Index (IPCA), which is the official measure used by the Brazilian government to monitor inflation trends. The resolution will be based on the final and official IPCA figures for each year, as initially reported by the IBGE, without subsequent revisions. If the IBGE ceases to exist, is unable to report the IPCA, or the IPCA is no longer the official measure of inflation, the question will resolve using the data from the next most authoritative source that is recognized by the Brazilian Central Bank. In the event of hyperinflation leading to a change in currency or a re-denomination of the Brazilian real, the percentage increase will be calculated based on the value of the new currency unit relative to the real at the time of the change.

title: Will the US Senate pass a major electoral reform bill by the end of 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the United States Senate has passed a bill that includes at least two of the following major electoral reforms: 

1. Implementation of a ranked-choice voting system for federal elections.
2. Establishment of independent redistricting commissions to address gerrymandering.
3. Expansion of early voting periods to a minimum of two weeks for all federal elections.
4. Enactment of automatic voter registration nationwide.

The bill must be signed into law by the President of the United States or enacted through a congressional override of a presidential veto. The resolution will rely on official records from the U.S. Congress and statements from the President's office. In the event that multiple bills are passed, the one with the greatest number of the listed reforms will be considered for resolution. If no bill is passed, or if a bill is passed without at least two of the listed reforms, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a political leader publicly endorse a major philosophical ideology, such as utilitarianism or deontology, as a basis for their policy platform before 2023 ends?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2023, a currently serving head of state or government publicly endorses utilitarianism, deontology, or another major philosophical ideology as a foundational element of their policy platform. The endorsement must be explicit, referencing the ideology by name, and must be made in a public speech, official statement, or published document. The endorsement should be reported by at least two reputable media outlets with national or international circulation. In the event of a dispute over the interpretation of the endorsement, the resolution will be based on the consensus of at least three subject matter experts in political philosophy. If no such endorsement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Russia hold a national referendum on government structure reform before the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2025, the Russian government officially announces and holds a national referendum on government structure reform. The referendum must be recognized as legitimate by at least three of the following organizations: the United Nations, the European Union, the Council of Europe, or the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe. The question will resolve as No if no such referendum is held by the specified date. In the event of a dispute over the legitimacy of the referendum, the decision of the majority of the aforementioned organizations will be considered final. If the referendum is announced but not held by the resolution date due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., natural disaster, political upheaval), the question will resolve as No. If the referendum is held but the results are not publicly disclosed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Major League Baseball implement AI-powered umpires for official games by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, Major League Baseball (MLB) has officially implemented AI-powered umpires in at least one regular season or postseason game. Implementation is defined as the use of AI technology to make binding decisions on gameplay events such as balls, strikes, outs, and plays at bases, without the need for confirmation or override by a human umpire. The AI umpire system must be acknowledged by the MLB as an official part of the game rules and used in the decision-making process during the game. The resolution will be based on public announcements by the MLB, credible media reports, or direct observation of an MLB game. In the event that the MLB season is disrupted or altered in a way that prevents the use of AI umpires (e.g., a strike, lockout, or significant rule changes), the question will resolve as No unless the AI umpires were used in official games prior to the disruption.

title: Will NASA launch a mission to explore the surface of Europa, one of Jupiter's moons, by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, NASA has launched a mission with the primary objective of exploring the surface of Europa, one of Jupiter's moons. The mission must be designed to land on the surface of Europa and conduct in-situ analysis or exploration. The launch must be officially confirmed by NASA through a press release or a statement on their official website. In the event that NASA is dissolved or integrated into another space agency, the question will resolve as Yes if the successor agency launches a mission that meets the above criteria. If the mission is launched but fails to land on Europa due to unforeseen circumstances, such as technical failures or destruction during the journey, the question will still resolve as Yes, provided the launch occurred before the resolution date. If multiple agencies collaborate on a mission that fulfills these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes only if NASA is a primary contributor and decision-maker in the mission's objectives and execution.

title: Will the US Congress pass a bill mandating the use of blockchain technology for voting systems by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United States Congress has passed federal legislation that mandates the use of blockchain technology in voting systems for federal elections. The bill must be signed into law by the President of the United States or otherwise become law. The legislation must specifically reference 'blockchain technology' or an equivalent term that unambiguously pertains to a decentralized digital ledger or cryptographic system used to record votes in a tamper-evident manner. The resolution will rely on official records from the United States Congress, such as the Congress.gov database, and public statements from the President of the United States. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clarity in the legislation's language regarding the use of blockchain technology, the resolution will default to No. If no such bill is passed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a pharmacological agent be developed that can mitigate the effects of radiation exposure from nuclear accidents by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a pharmacological agent is developed and has been proven to mitigate the effects of radiation exposure from nuclear accidents. The agent must meet the following criteria:

- Efficacy: Demonstrated in at least two independent peer-reviewed clinical trials to significantly reduce mortality or morbidity associated with acute radiation syndrome (ARS).

- Approval: Received approval from a recognized regulatory body such as the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), the European Medicines Agency (EMA), or an equivalent authority.

- Availability: The agent must be commercially available or provided through a national health service.

- Scope: The agent should be effective for a broad range of radiation doses and applicable to both planned (e.g., radiotherapy) and unplanned (e.g., nuclear accidents) exposure scenarios.

In the event that multiple agents are developed, the resolution will be based on the first agent to meet all the above criteria. If no agent meets these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

Fallback Scenario: If regulatory approval is pending but all other criteria are met, the question will resolve as Yes if the pending approval is for the specific indication of mitigating effects of radiation exposure from nuclear accidents.

title: Will an international treaty on the ethical use of nuclear technology be ratified by more than 100 countries by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by 11:59 PM UTC on December 31, 2030, an international treaty focused on the ethical use of nuclear technology has been ratified by at least 100 member states of the United Nations. The treaty must explicitly address the ethical considerations in the development, deployment, and disarmament of nuclear technology, including but not limited to nuclear energy, nuclear weapons, and nuclear medicine. Ratification is defined as the formal expression of a country's consent to be bound by the treaty, typically through the passing of domestic legislation or issuance of a formal declaration. The count of ratifying countries will be based on official records from the United Nations Treaty Collection or a successor organization recognized as authoritative on international treaties. In the event of discrepancies between sources or lack of clarity on the ratification status of certain countries, the United Nations' official announcements or clarifications will take precedence. If the treaty is amended to include ethical use provisions after the initial ratification by some countries, only those ratifications that occur after the amendment will count towards the total. If no such treaty exists or has been ratified by the required number of countries by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major philosophical movement emerge by 2030 that fundamentally opposes the use of nuclear technology on ethical grounds?
body: A 'major philosophical movement' is defined as a movement that has been recognized by at least three established academic journals in the field of philosophy or ethics, or has a dedicated following of at least 10,000 individuals on a major social media platform. The movement must explicitly state opposition to the use of nuclear technology on ethical grounds, which includes but is not limited to nuclear energy, nuclear weapons, and medical applications of nuclear technology. The opposition must be based on newly formulated ethical principles that have not been a central part of previous movements or widely recognized ethical theories prior to 2023. The emergence of such a movement must be confirmed by credible news outlets, academic publications, or a statement from a recognized authority in the field of philosophy or ethics. In the event that multiple movements arise, the one with the largest following or the most significant academic recognition will be considered for resolution. If no movement meets these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Japan deploy autonomous delivery robots in more than 10 major cities by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, autonomous delivery robots are actively deployed and operational in more than 10 major cities in Japan. 'Major cities' are defined as cities with a population exceeding 300,000 residents according to the most recent census data available from the Statistics Bureau of Japan. 'Autonomous delivery robots' are defined as unmanned ground vehicles equipped with automated navigation systems that can deliver goods without human intervention. Deployment must be confirmed by either government press releases, credible media reports, or statements from companies involved in the deployment. The robots must be in regular operation, which is defined as completing delivery tasks at least five days a week. If deployment in more than 10 cities is announced but not confirmed to be operational by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In the event of a dispute over the definition of 'operational,' the resolution will defer to the judgment of a panel of three experts in the field of robotics, whose decision will be final.

title: Will a new antiviral drug for a novel virus be developed and approved by the FDA by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new antiviral drug specifically targeting a novel virus (a virus identified after the date of this question's posting) is developed, has completed all required clinical trials, and has received approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for public use. The drug must be intended for the treatment or prevention of a viral infection in humans and must demonstrate efficacy and safety in accordance with FDA standards. The approval must be for a New Drug Application (NDA) or a Biologics License Application (BLA) and not for an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA). The resolution will be based on official FDA announcements or press releases. In the event that the FDA is no longer the authoritative body for drug approval in the U.S., the resolution will defer to the equivalent authoritative body at that time. If multiple drugs meet these criteria, the resolution will still be Yes.

title: Will a new type of antibiotic, effective against multi-drug resistant bacteria, be discovered and enter phase 3 clinical trials by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new type of antibiotic that demonstrates effectiveness against multi-drug resistant bacteria is discovered and has entered phase 3 clinical trials. The antibiotic must show a clear statistical advantage over existing treatments in combating at least one type of multi-drug resistant bacteria. The phase 3 clinical trials must be registered and recognized by a major health authority such as the FDA, EMA, or WHO. The trials must be intended to assess the safety and efficacy of the antibiotic in a large patient population. In the event that the antibiotic enters phase 3 trials but is not publicly disclosed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If the antibiotic is discovered and enters phase 3 trials after the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No. Any disputes regarding the resolution will be settled by an independent panel of experts in the field of microbiology and pharmacology.

title: Will the Republican Party adopt an official platform supporting the development of AI for national security purposes by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Republican Party officially adopts a platform or policy statement that explicitly supports the development of artificial intelligence (AI) for national security purposes. The platform must be adopted by a formal decision of the Republican National Committee (RNC) or a similar governing body within the party. The policy must be publicly available and verifiable through official Republican Party channels or major media outlets. The resolution criteria will also consider the following edge cases: 

- If the Republican Party merges with another party or undergoes a significant rebranding that includes a change in name, the successor party's platform will be considered for resolution.

- If the Republican Party splits into factions, the faction recognized as the official continuation of the party by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) will be considered for resolution.

- In the event of ambiguity in party statements or platforms, a majority consensus among five leading political analysts, as reported by major media outlets, will be used to determine the resolution.

- If no official platform or policy statement is adopted by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will California implement a statewide AI-driven traffic management system by 2027?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the State of California has officially implemented a traffic management system that utilizes artificial intelligence (AI) across the state. The system must be capable of real-time traffic analysis, optimization of traffic flow, and incident response coordination. The implementation is confirmed through a public announcement by the California Department of Transportation (Caltrans) or a similar authoritative body. The system should be operational and managing traffic in at least 75% of the state's jurisdictions. In the event of partial implementation, the question will resolve as No unless the system is actively managing traffic in the majority of the state and there is a clear, publicly available roadmap for statewide coverage within the following year. If no system is implemented, or if the system does not utilize AI as defined by the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) standards, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a robot perform surgery without human assistance in the US by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, there is a verified instance of a robot performing an entire surgical procedure without human assistance in the United States. The procedure must be a recognized surgical operation typically requiring a licensed surgeon, and the robot must autonomously handle all aspects of the surgery from incision to closure. Verification must come from a credible medical institution or a peer-reviewed scientific publication. The robot must not be remotely controlled or guided by humans during the procedure. In the event of conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the consensus of at least three reputable sources in the medical field. If no such event is confirmed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a professional golfer announce a candidacy for a major political office by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by 11:59 PM UTC on December 31, 2025, a professional golfer who has participated in at least one of the four major golf championships (The Masters, the U.S. Open, The Open Championship, or the PGA Championship) publicly announces their candidacy for a major political office. A 'major political office' is defined as a position that is part of the legislative, executive, or judicial branch of government at the national or state/provincial level, or a mayoral position in a city with a population of at least 300,000 residents. The announcement must be verifiable through credible media reports or an official statement from the golfer or their representative. If the golfer retracts their candidacy before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In the event that no such announcement is made, or if the golfer's professional status or the political office's significance is ambiguous, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will evidence of a black hole merger be detected by the LIGO-Virgo collaboration before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the LIGO-Virgo collaboration or any authoritative astronomical organization officially announces the detection of a black hole merger before January 1, 2025. The announcement must be based on data collected by the LIGO-Virgo detectors or any other gravitational wave observatory that is part of an official collaboration with LIGO-Virgo. The detection must be confirmed through peer-reviewed publication or an official press release by the collaboration. In the event of a detection being announced but later retracted or disproven, the question will resolve as No. If no detection is announced by the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will SpaceX successfully land humans on Mars before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if SpaceX successfully lands at least one human on the surface of Mars before December 31, 2030. A successful landing is defined as a mission where a human safely descends and sets foot on the Martian surface, with the event being confirmed by SpaceX through official communication channels or by at least two reputable and independent news agencies. The individual must survive the landing process and be capable of performing at least one extravehicular activity (EVA) on Mars. In the event of a dispute regarding the mission's success, video evidence or telemetry data released by SpaceX or an international space agency will be used to determine the outcome. If no such mission is attempted or no clear evidence is provided by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the implementation of blockchain technology in carbon credit trading significantly enhance transparency in climatology data by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a widespread adoption of blockchain technology in carbon credit trading that leads to a significant enhancement in the transparency of climatology data. 'Significant enhancement' is defined as a measurable increase in the availability, accuracy, and verifiability of data related to carbon emissions, carbon offset projects, and carbon credit transactions. This must be evidenced by a comparative study or report from a recognized authority in the field of climatology or environmental policy, such as the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) or the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). The study should demonstrate improvements in transparency compared to the state of climatology data as of January 1, 2020. In the absence of a definitive report, a consensus among experts in the field, as reflected in peer-reviewed publications, may also be considered sufficient for resolution. Edge cases, such as partial adoption without significant data enhancement or improvements in transparency that are not attributable to blockchain technology, will not meet the resolution criteria.

title: Will the United Nations adopt a cryptocurrency as a standard for any of its funding programs by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United Nations (UN) has officially adopted a cryptocurrency as a standard for any of its funding programs. Adoption is defined as the UN having made a formal announcement or having issued official documentation that specifies the use of a cryptocurrency for funding transactions within any of its programs, departments, or agencies. The cryptocurrency must be a digital or virtual currency that uses cryptography for security and operates independently of a central bank.

The resolution will be based on official UN press releases, reports, or financial statements. If the UN announces the adoption of a cryptocurrency but later retracts the decision or the program is canceled before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In the event that the UN adopts multiple cryptocurrencies or changes the standard cryptocurrency during the period, the question will still resolve as Yes, provided that at least one cryptocurrency remains officially adopted by the resolution date.

If there is no clear evidence of adoption by the UN by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In the case of ambiguity or lack of clarity in the UN's statements or documentation, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative and recent information available from the UN or related entities.

title: Will FIFA create an official cryptocurrency for transactions within its organization by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, FIFA has officially created and recognized a cryptocurrency that is used for any form of transactions within its organization. The cryptocurrency must be blockchain-based and serve as a medium of exchange, store of value, or unit of account within FIFA's operations. The creation of the cryptocurrency must be confirmed by an official FIFA press release or announcement on their official website. Transactions can include, but are not limited to, ticket sales, merchandise purchases, player transfers, or any other financial operations conducted by FIFA or its member associations. If FIFA announces the development of a cryptocurrency but it is not in use by the resolution date, or if the cryptocurrency is created for promotional purposes only without serving as a functional currency within the organization, the question will resolve as No. In the event that FIFA is dissolved or undergoes a significant restructuring that makes the question non-applicable, the question will resolve as N/A (Not Applicable).

title: Will France elect a president from a newly formed political party in the 2027 presidential election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a candidate from a political party that was officially registered after January 1, 2022, wins the majority of votes in the 2027 French presidential election. The outcome will be determined based on the official results published by the French Ministry of the Interior. In the event of a dispute or a re-election, the question will resolve based on the final, legally binding outcome as determined by the Constitutional Council of France. If no candidate from a newly formed party participates in the election, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the European Space Agency, in collaboration with France, launch a mission to study black holes by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the European Space Agency (ESA), in collaboration with France, has successfully launched a space mission with the primary objective of studying black holes. The mission must be officially recognized by the ESA and must have been launched with the intention of directly observing, analyzing, or collecting data on black holes. The mission may include, but is not limited to, deploying telescopes, satellites, or probes specifically designed for black hole research.

In the event that the ESA announces the launch of such a mission but the launch is delayed past the resolution date due to unforeseen circumstances, the question will resolve as No. However, if the mission is launched and is en route to its target but has not yet begun collecting data by the resolution date, the question will resolve as Yes, provided that the launch occurred before the resolution date.

If the ESA collaborates with countries or organizations other than France, but France is still a significant partner in the mission, the question will resolve as Yes. If the mission's primary objective changes from studying black holes to another focus, the question will resolve as No, even if black hole study remains a secondary objective.

Authoritative sources for confirmation include official press releases, mission briefings, or announcements from the ESA, as well as reputable scientific publications and news outlets reporting on the mission's launch and objectives.

title: Will Elon Musk run for a political office in any country by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by 23:59:59 UTC on December 31, 2025, Elon Musk has publicly announced his candidacy for any political office in any country, or if official election records from a recognized government authority confirm that Elon Musk has filed the necessary paperwork to appear as a candidate on an election ballot. The resolution will be based on credible media reports, official statements from Elon Musk or his representatives, or direct evidence from government election authorities. If Elon Musk announces an intention to run but does not officially file candidacy papers, or if he files papers but withdraws his candidacy before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In the event of conflicting reports, the question will be resolved using the most reliable and authoritative sources available at the time of resolution.

title: Will Donald Trump launch a new technology-related business venture before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, Donald Trump publicly announces and initiates a new business venture that is primarily focused on the development, production, or distribution of technology-related products or services. The venture must be verifiable through official statements, press releases, or legal business registration documents. The technology-related products or services should be innovative or significantly different from existing offerings, and not merely a rebranding or minor modification of existing products. The venture should be operational, with either products available for purchase or services being offered, by the resolution date. If Donald Trump announces a venture but it does not become operational, or if it is not primarily technology-focused, the question will resolve as No. In the event of Donald Trump's incapacitation, passing, or any other circumstance that prevents him from participating in business activities, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Google introduce a major update to its search algorithm that significantly changes SEO practices by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Google has officially announced and implemented a major update to its search algorithm that results in widespread changes to Search Engine Optimization (SEO) practices. The update must be recognized by at least three leading digital marketing or technology news outlets (e.g., Search Engine Journal, TechCrunch, The Verge) as having a significant impact on SEO strategies. The resolution will consider changes such as alterations to ranking factors, the introduction of new search features, or adjustments to content evaluation methods that require a notable shift in SEO tactics. Minor updates, routine adjustments, or incremental improvements to the existing algorithm will not qualify for this resolution. In the absence of a clear announcement by Google, credible reports from multiple authoritative sources confirming the update and its effects on SEO practices will be considered sufficient for resolution. If there is ambiguity regarding the significance of the update, a panel of three SEO experts will be consulted to determine if the changes meet the criteria for a 'major update.'

title: Will a new infectious disease be identified as a global pandemic by the World Health Organization before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares a new infectious disease as a global pandemic before January 1, 2025. The disease must be a novel pathogen not previously identified or classified as a variant of an existing pathogen. The declaration must be made through an official WHO statement or press release. The resolution will not consider diseases that are only regionally significant or declared as epidemics unless the WHO escalates the status to a global pandemic. In the absence of an official WHO declaration, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US House of Representatives pass a significant piece of legislation regarding the regulation of artificial intelligence by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the US House of Representatives passes a bill that is subsequently signed into law by the President of the United States, which includes substantial regulatory measures specifically addressing the development, deployment, or management of artificial intelligence technologies. The legislation must include clear definitions of 'artificial intelligence' and the scope of regulation, establish regulatory bodies or frameworks, and provide guidelines for compliance and enforcement. The bill must be recognized as significant by at least two major media outlets and one AI policy think tank. In the event of a veto, the question will resolve as Yes only if the veto is overridden and the bill becomes law. If no such legislation is passed, or if the legislation is deemed insubstantial or not primarily focused on artificial intelligence, the question will resolve as No. In the case of ambiguity or lack of clarity regarding the significance or focus of the legislation, the resolution will be based on the consensus of a panel of three experts in AI policy, whose decision will be final.

title: Will a dark matter detection experiment confirm the existence of a new particle by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a dark matter detection experiment confirms the existence of a new particle that is widely accepted by the scientific community as constituting dark matter. The confirmation must come from a peer-reviewed study published in a reputable scientific journal, such as Physical Review Letters, Nature, or Science. The study must provide clear evidence of a new particle, distinct from known particles, with properties consistent with those theoretically predicted for dark matter particles. The discovery must be confirmed by at least two independent experiments or observations. In the event that multiple particles are discovered, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of the particles meets the criteria. If the discovery is later retracted or disproven by the end of 2025, the question will resolve as No. In the absence of a clear confirmation or refutation, the question will resolve as ambiguous.

title: Will Iran unveil a state-sponsored quantum computing initiative by 2027?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the government of Iran has officially announced and demonstrated the existence of a state-sponsored quantum computing initiative. The initiative must be confirmed through one or more of the following: 

1. An official press release from the Iranian government or its designated agencies.
2. Coverage by at least three reputable international news organizations, which must include technical details and evidence of the initiative's state sponsorship.
3. A peer-reviewed publication in a recognized scientific journal that describes the initiative's scope, goals, and progress.

In the absence of direct evidence, credible reports from at least three independent and reputable sources in the field of quantum computing may be considered sufficient. If the initiative is announced but not demonstrated, or if there is significant international dispute over the authenticity of the announcement, the question will resolve as ambiguous until conclusive evidence is provided.

title: Will any NBA team launch a cryptocurrency or blockchain-based fan token by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any NBA team has officially launched a cryptocurrency or blockchain-based fan token. The launch must be confirmed through an official announcement by the NBA team or a verifiable press release. The fan token must be a digital asset that provides holders with access to a range of fan-related membership benefits, rewards, and experiences. The token must be tradable on at least one public cryptocurrency exchange or platform. In the event of a dispute over whether a digital asset qualifies as a fan token, the resolution will defer to the classification by the leading cryptocurrency data authority CoinMarketCap. If no NBA team has launched such a token by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Tesla announce the acceptance of cryptocurrency payments in Spain by the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by 23:59:59 UTC on December 31, 2024, Tesla, Inc. has made an official announcement that it will accept one or more forms of cryptocurrency as a payment method for its products or services in Spain. The announcement must be verifiable through Tesla's official communication channels, such as press releases, official social media accounts, or statements from authorized company representatives. The acceptance of cryptocurrency must be implemented and available for use by customers in Spain, as confirmed by Tesla's official website or customer service. In the event that Tesla announces the acceptance of cryptocurrency payments in Spain but later retracts the decision before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If Tesla is acquired or ceases to exist before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No unless the acceptance of cryptocurrency payments in Spain has been implemented prior to the acquisition or cessation of operations.

title: Will Ukraine legalize the use of cryptocurrencies as a legal payment method by the end of 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, the government of Ukraine has passed legislation that recognizes cryptocurrencies as a legal payment method within its jurisdiction. The legislation must be signed into law by the President of Ukraine and officially published in the government's legislative database. The law must explicitly state that cryptocurrencies can be used for the purchase of goods and services and for the settlement of debts. In the event of ambiguity or partial recognition (e.g., only certain cryptocurrencies are legalized, or only for specific types of transactions), the question will resolve as Yes only if the majority of everyday transactions, such as retail purchases and bill payments, can be legally conducted using cryptocurrencies. If no such law is passed, or if the law is passed but does not come into effect by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In the case of a significant political event that disrupts the legislative process, such as a change in government or a declaration of martial law, the resolution date may be extended by up to six months to allow for the stabilization of the political situation.

title: Will California lead the United States in the number of electric vehicle charging stations per capita by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the state of California has the highest number of electric vehicle (EV) charging stations per capita compared to all other states in the United States. The count of EV charging stations will be based on the data provided by the U.S. Department of Energy's Alternative Fuels Data Center (AFDC) or its successor agency. Per capita calculations will be based on the most recent U.S. Census Bureau population estimates for each state as of December 31, 2025. In the event that the AFDC is no longer active or does not provide the necessary data, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative and comprehensive dataset available at that time. If no reliable data can be obtained, the question will resolve as N/A (Not Applicable).

title: Will there be a breakthrough in environmental science that enables a 50% reduction in solar panel production costs by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a verifiable report or publication by a recognized authority in the field of environmental science or renewable energy (such as the International Energy Agency, the U.S. Department of Energy, or an equivalent organization) that confirms a breakthrough in environmental science or technology that has led to a reduction in the production costs of solar panels by at least 50% compared to the cost recorded on January 1, 2020. The cost reduction must be attributable to new technology or processes and not due to subsidies, tax incentives, or other economic factors. The breakthrough must be applicable on a commercial scale and not limited to laboratory or pilot projects. In the event that multiple reports provide conflicting information, the consensus among the majority of recognized authorities will be considered. If no such consensus can be reached, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will FIFA implement a technology by 2026 that can automatically detect offside positions in real-time during matches?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, FIFA has officially implemented and used in at least one official international match a technology system that can automatically detect offside positions in real-time. The technology must be able to determine whether a player is in an offside position at the moment the ball is played by a teammate with a margin of error no greater than 5 centimeters. The system must be endorsed by FIFA and must have been used without manual intervention to make a decision during a match. The resolution will be based on official FIFA announcements, match reports, or credible media coverage. In the event that FIFA is dissolved or replaced by another governing body for international football, the resolution will refer to the actions of the successor organization. If no such technology is implemented, or if the technology is implemented but not used in an official match by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a cryptocurrency be officially adopted as a transactional currency at the Olympic Games by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any cryptocurrency is recognized and utilized as an official currency for transactions by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or the organizing committee of the Olympic Games. The cryptocurrency must be used for at least one of the following: purchasing tickets, buying merchandise, or paying for services at the Olympic venues. The adoption must be confirmed through official statements or press releases by the IOC or the organizing committee, and the cryptocurrency must be actively in use during the Olympic Games. In the event of multiple Olympic Games occurring before the resolution date, the criteria must be met during at least one of those events. If the Olympic Games are not held for any reason, or if the use of cryptocurrency is not officially sanctioned by the IOC or the organizing committee, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major pharmaceutical company adopt a cryptocurrency for international transactions by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a major pharmaceutical company, defined as one listed in the top 20 by market capitalization according to the GlobalData's Pharma 2000 ranking, publicly announces and demonstrates the use of a cryptocurrency for at least one international transaction. The transaction must be verifiable through a press release, official financial statements, or a public ledger. The cryptocurrency used must be a digital or virtual currency that uses cryptography for security and operates independently of a central bank. If no such announcement or demonstration occurs, or if the use of cryptocurrency is only for domestic transactions or pilot projects not intended for full-scale implementation, the question will resolve as No. In the event that the GlobalData's Pharma 2000 ranking is no longer published, a comparable and reputable industry ranking will be used to determine what constitutes a 'major pharmaceutical company.'

title: Will a biotechnology firm hold an initial coin offering (ICO) to fund a CRISPR gene editing project by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a biotechnology firm specializing in CRISPR gene editing technology announces and initiates an initial coin offering (ICO) with the explicit purpose of funding a CRISPR gene editing project. The firm must be legally incorporated and the ICO must be compliant with the relevant securities and financial regulations applicable at the time of the offering. The announcement must be verifiable through a press release, official company announcement, or coverage by a reputable financial news outlet. In the event of a dispute regarding the legitimacy of the ICO or the firm's specialization in CRISPR technology, the resolution will be based on the consensus opinion of three recognized experts in the field of biotechnology or finance, selected by a neutral third party.

title: Will France establish a permanent human presence on the Moon before 2050?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1, 2050, the French government or any France-based private entity has successfully established and maintained a human presence on the Moon for at least 30 consecutive days. A 'permanent human presence' is defined as the ability to support human life continuously, with at least one person physically present at the lunar base at all times during the 30-day period. The presence must include living quarters, life support systems, and a means of communication with Earth. The establishment of the presence must be confirmed by the French government or an internationally recognized space agency such as the European Space Agency (ESA) or NASA. In the event of a dispute regarding the permanence or legitimacy of the presence, a panel of experts from the United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs (UNOOSA) will be consulted for a final decision. If no human presence is established by the resolution date, or if the presence does not meet the criteria above, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United Kingdom launch an independent, unmanned interstellar probe before 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2040, the United Kingdom successfully launches an unmanned interstellar probe that is intended to leave the Solar System. The probe must be launched by or on behalf of a UK-based organization, agency, or company, and must be confirmed to have the capability to reach an escape velocity from the Solar System. The launch and the probe's capabilities must be verified by the UK Space Agency or an equivalent authoritative body recognized internationally. In the event that the UK Space Agency is not operational or does not exist at the time of the probe's launch, verification may come from an authoritative international space exploration organization such as NASA or ESA. If the probe is launched but fails to achieve its mission due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., malfunction, destruction), the question will resolve as No. If no launch has occurred by the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will a major space mission in the next decade be primarily focused on addressing an environmental science issue?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2033, there is an official announcement or mission launch of a major space mission that is primarily focused on addressing an environmental science issue. A 'major space mission' is defined as one that is funded and executed by a recognized space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, ISRO) or a recognized private spaceflight company (e.g., SpaceX, Blue Origin, Rocket Lab). The mission must have a primary objective that directly pertains to the study, monitoring, or mitigation of environmental issues on Earth, such as climate change, atmospheric pollution, deforestation, or ocean health. Secondary objectives or missions with broader scientific goals that include environmental studies as a minor component do not qualify. The mission must be new, not a continuation or extension of existing missions. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear public information, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative public statements from the mission's leading organization or a consensus of expert opinion in the field.

title: Will a cryptocurrency be officially adopted as a means of payment by a Major League Baseball team by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any Major League Baseball (MLB) team officially adopts a cryptocurrency as a means of payment for any of the following: 

- Ticket sales for games.
- Merchandise sold at official team stores or online platforms.
- Concessions and other in-stadium purchases.

An 'official adoption' is defined as the team or its authorized representatives publicly announcing the acceptance of cryptocurrency and successfully processing at least one transaction using the cryptocurrency. The transaction must be for a legitimate purchase related to the team's activities and not a symbolic or test transaction.

The resolution will rely on public announcements from the MLB team, verified news reports, or official statements from the MLB organization. If no MLB team has adopted a cryptocurrency by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear public information, the resolution will be based on the most reliable and authoritative sources available at the time of the resolution date. If a cryptocurrency is adopted and then discontinued before the resolution date, the question will still resolve as Yes, provided the initial adoption was confirmed and met the above criteria.

title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics begin tracking employment in the cryptocurrency sector separately by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1, 2024, the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) has officially announced and implemented a separate tracking category for employment within the cryptocurrency sector. The category must be distinct from other sectors and specifically reference employment related to cryptocurrency businesses, blockchain technology, or similar terminologies that unambiguously cover the cryptocurrency industry. The resolution will be based on public records, press releases, or official statements from the BLS. If the BLS announces the intention to track such employment but has not implemented it by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In the event that the BLS is dissolved or its functions are significantly altered before the resolution date, an equivalent authoritative source or successor organization will be considered for the resolution of this question.
