In the event of a dispute regarding the novelty or classification of the phenomenon, the decision of an independent panel of experts convened by a recognized scientific institution will be considered final. Edge cases, such as phenomena that occur at the edge of the Earth's atmosphere but are influenced by space conditions, will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis, with a preference for inclusion if they represent a significant departure from known atmospheric behaviors.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration approve a medication specifically designed for long-duration space missions before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approves a medication specifically designed to prevent or treat health conditions caused by long-duration space missions. The medication must be intended for use by astronauts or space travelers and address issues such as radiation exposure, microgravity-induced bone density loss, or psychological stressors of space travel. Approval must be full and not conditional or for emergency use only. The resolution will rely on official FDA announcements or press releases. In the absence of a clear approval announcement by the FDA, credible news sources reporting on the approval based on FDA statements will also be considered valid. If multiple medications meet these criteria, the resolution will occur upon the first approval. If no medication is approved by the deadline, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new radiopharmaceutical for cancer treatment that utilizes nuclear technology be approved by the FDA by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, at least one new radiopharmaceutical that utilizes nuclear technology for cancer treatment receives approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA). The radiopharmaceutical must be explicitly designed for the treatment of cancer and must represent a novel therapy not previously approved or a significant modification of an existing therapy that enhances efficacy, reduces side effects, or both. The approval must be for use in humans and must be a full approval, not conditional or for compassionate use only. The resolution will rely on public announcements from the FDA or the drug's developer as authoritative sources. In the event that the FDA is restructured or its responsibilities for drug approval are transferred to another federal agency, the decision of that agency will be considered authoritative. If no public announcement is made by the resolution date but there is credible evidence of approval (e.g., publication in a reputable medical journal), this will also be considered sufficient for resolution. In case of ambiguity regarding the novelty or significance of the modification, a panel of experts in radiopharmaceuticals and nuclear medicine, agreed upon by Metaculus Admins, will make the final determination.

title: Will Israel decommission its Dimona nuclear reactor by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Israeli government officially announces the decommissioning of the Dimona nuclear reactor, or if credible evidence emerges that the reactor has ceased operations and is undergoing decommissioning processes before December 31, 2030. The announcement must be verifiable through official government channels or major international news organizations. In the absence of a clear announcement, the question will resolve as No. If the reactor is temporarily shut down for maintenance or upgrades without a formal decommissioning process, this will not count towards resolution. In the event of conflicting reports about the reactor's status, the resolution will be based on the preponderance of credible evidence available by the resolution date.

title: Will South Korea announce the construction of a new type of nuclear fusion reactor by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the South Korean government or any South Korean-based corporation officially announces the initiation of construction for a new type of nuclear fusion reactor before January 1, 2025. The announcement must specify the reactor as being of a "new type," indicating a significant advancement or innovation in nuclear fusion technology not previously operational or under construction. The announcement can come from official government channels, corporate press releases, or verified news sources. In the event of ambiguous or conflicting reports, the resolution will defer to the most authoritative source available at the time of judgment. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, "new type" refers to advancements in reactor design, fuel use, containment method, or efficiency improvements that are clearly distinct from existing or previously announced reactors.

title: Will the US House of Representatives pass a significant bill funding scientific research in biology by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the US House of Representatives passes a bill that allocates at least $1 billion USD to scientific research in the field of biology. The bill must be specifically aimed at funding research in areas such as genetics, molecular biology, cellular biology, and biotechnology. The funding must be new or additional, not a reallocation of existing funds. The bill's passage is defined as the successful vote in the House of Representatives, followed by the President's signature into law. In the event of a government shutdown or other significant political event that prevents the passage of any legislation, the question will resolve as No. The resolution will be based on official statements from the US House of Representatives and the White House, as well as coverage in major media outlets.

title: Will a new species previously unknown to science be discovered and classified by the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a new species, previously unknown to science, is officially discovered, described, and classified in a peer-reviewed scientific journal by December 31, 2024. The species must be distinct from any previously identified species, with genetic or morphological evidence supporting its classification as a new species. The discovery must be recognized by a leading scientific authority, such as the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) or a similar organization, and must be reported in a publication that is accessible to the public. In the event of a dispute over the classification, the decision of a recognized scientific committee or panel will be considered final. If no such discovery is reported by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a scientific study linking soccer playing to improved cognitive function be published in a peer-reviewed journal by the end of 2023?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, a scientific study is published in a peer-reviewed journal that establishes a statistically significant link between playing soccer and improved cognitive function. The study must meet the following criteria:

- The study is conducted with a sample size of at least 500 participants.
- The study's findings are statistically significant with a p-value of less than 0.05.
- The study is published in a journal with an impact factor of at least 2.0, as listed in the Journal Citation Reports.
- The cognitive improvements must be measured using standardized cognitive tests recognized by the scientific community, such as the Cambridge Brain Sciences battery or the NIH Toolbox Cognitive Battery.

In the event that multiple studies are published, the resolution will be based on the first study that meets these criteria. If no such study is published by the end date, the question will resolve as No.

In case of any disputes regarding the study's validity or the interpretation of its results, the final decision will be made by a panel of three experts in the field of cognitive science, selected by the question's administrators.

title: Will Amazon accept Bitcoin or any other major cryptocurrency for transactions on its platform by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Amazon has officially announced and implemented support for transactions using Bitcoin or any other major cryptocurrency (e.g., Ethereum, Ripple, Litecoin) on its platform. Major cryptocurrencies are defined as those listed in the top 10 by market capitalization according to CoinMarketCap or a similar authoritative source at the time of the announcement. The announcement must be verifiable through Amazon's official channels (e.g., press release, official blog, or a statement from a company executive). Transactions must be fully executable using the specified cryptocurrencies, including the completion of purchases and processing of returns. This resolution criteria does not include the use of intermediary services that convert cryptocurrencies to fiat currencies for transactions on Amazon's platform. In the event that Amazon announces the acceptance of cryptocurrencies but retracts the decision before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency undergo a significant protocol change due to a breakthrough in quantum computing by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major cryptocurrency (defined as one of the top 10 by market capitalization at the time of the event) implements a significant protocol change specifically attributed to advancements in quantum computing. The protocol change must be:

- Publicly announced by the official development team or governing body of the cryptocurrency.
- Aimed at addressing security vulnerabilities exposed by quantum computing advancements.
- Implemented and active on the main network of the cryptocurrency.

A "significant protocol change" is defined as an update or modification that fundamentally alters the cryptographic algorithms or security protocols used by the cryptocurrency to protect transactions, wallet addresses, or the integrity of the blockchain.

In the event that multiple cryptocurrencies meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first instance. If no such change is publicly announced and implemented by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

Authoritative sources for confirmation include official cryptocurrency project announcements, verified news outlets, and peer-reviewed publications in the field of quantum computing.

title: Will the Biden administration implement a regulatory framework specifically for cryptocurrencies that includes consumer protection by the end of 2024?
body:
The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Biden administration has officially announced and implemented a regulatory framework for cryptocurrencies that includes specific measures for consumer protection. This framework must be documented in official government publications or announcements, such as the Federal Register, press releases from relevant regulatory bodies (e.g., the Securities and Exchange Commission, the Commodity Futures Trading Commission), or official statements from the White House. The framework should address, at a minimum, the following areas: 

- Standards for transparency and disclosure by cryptocurrency issuers and platforms
- Anti-fraud and anti-manipulation measures
- Consumer rights and protections in the event of loss or theft
- Regulatory oversight mechanisms for cryptocurrency exchanges and wallets

In the absence of a comprehensive framework, the question will resolve as No. If the administration announces a framework but it is not fully implemented by the deadline, the question will also resolve as No. In the event of ambiguity regarding the implementation status, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative and recent information available from the aforementioned sources.

title: Will a space exploration-related blog post by Scott Alexander reach over 1 million views by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a blog post written by Scott Alexander, specifically related to space exploration, accumulates over 1 million unique views by 23:59 UTC on December 31, 2025. The blog post must be published on Scott Alexander's current platform, Slate Star Codex, or any future platform he may use for publishing his writings. The count of unique views will be verified through the platform's analytics tools or an official statement from Scott Alexander or the platform's administrators. In the event that the platform's analytics are not publicly accessible or verifiable, an official statement from Scott Alexander confirming the view count will be considered sufficient for resolution. If Scott Alexander publishes multiple space exploration-related blog posts, the question will resolve based on the first post to reach the milestone. In case of any disputes regarding the content's relevance to space exploration, the decision will be made by a panel of three experts in the field, chosen by the Metaculus community.

title: Will Information Technology be the primary industry driving space exploration investments by 2030?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, more than 50% of the total documented financial investment in space exploration comes from companies whose primary business is Information Technology, including but not limited to software development, hardware manufacturing, cloud computing, and data processing. This assessment will be based on financial reports, market analysis, and investment tracking by authoritative financial and industry analysis firms such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or similar. In cases where direct financial data is not available, credible market estimates will be considered. Investments by subsidiaries of IT companies will be counted towards this total, provided the subsidiary's primary business aligns with the IT sector. If there is ambiguity in determining the primary industry of a company, the most recent fiscal year's revenue source breakdown will be used as the deciding factor. Edge cases, such as investments made by conglomerates with significant but not primary IT operations, will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis, with a preference for transparency and the most straightforward interpretation of 'primary industry.' Should there be significant changes in industry definitions or classifications before the resolution date, an updated assessment may be conducted to ensure fairness and accuracy in resolving the question.

title: Will the scientific community reach a consensus on a universal code of ethics for AI research by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a universal code of ethics for AI research is adopted by at least 75% of the countries represented in the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO). The code must cover at least the following areas: 

- AI safety and reliability
- Transparency and accountability in AI development and deployment
- Privacy and data protection
- Fairness and non-discrimination in AI applications
- Human oversight and control over AI systems

The adoption of the code must be confirmed through official statements or publications by UNESCO or the respective national governments. In the event of a dispute over whether the code is "universal" or covers the required areas, the resolution will be based on the interpretation by a panel of at least three experts in AI ethics, appointed by the Metaculus community admin team. 

In the absence of a clear consensus or if less than 75% of the countries have adopted the code by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new biotechnology treatment for Alzheimer's disease show a success rate of over 70% in clinical trials by 2030?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new biotechnology treatment for Alzheimer's disease is developed and demonstrates a success rate of over 70% in Phase III clinical trials. The success rate is defined as the percentage of patients who show significant cognitive improvement or stabilization without severe side effects, as reported in a peer-reviewed medical journal. The treatment must be a novel biotechnology approach (e.g., gene therapy, stem cell therapy, or a novel biologic) not previously approved for any condition. In the event that multiple treatments meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one treatment achieves the specified success rate. If no peer-reviewed publication is available by the resolution date, the question will resolve based on data released by the primary clinical trial sponsor or a recognized health authority (e.g., FDA, EMA). In case of conflicting reports, the resolution will defer to the most comprehensive and recent peer-reviewed study available at the time of resolution.

title: Will SpaceX successfully complete a manned mission to Mars using its reusable launch system by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if SpaceX successfully lands at least one manned spacecraft on Mars and returns at least one crew member safely to Earth using its reusable launch system before January 1, 2031. The mission must be officially recognized by SpaceX and an authoritative space exploration agency (e.g., NASA, ESA) as a successful manned mission to Mars. The criteria for a successful mission include, but are not limited to, the safe landing of the spacecraft on Mars, the completion of the mission's primary objectives (e.g., research, exploration), and the safe return of the crew to Earth. In the event that multiple missions are launched, only the first to meet all the criteria will be considered for resolution. If no mission is launched or if all launched missions fail to meet the criteria by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In case of ambiguity regarding the mission's success, the decision will be deferred to a panel of experts agreed upon by SpaceX and an authoritative space exploration agency.

title: Will NASA's budget exceed 1% of the US federal budget by the year 2030?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, at any point before January 1, 2030, NASA's annual budget is officially set at or exceeds 1% of the total US federal budget for the same fiscal year. The US federal budget refers to the total spending authorized by Congress in the annual budgetary process, as reported by the Office of Management and Budget (OMB). NASA's budget will be considered based on the figures provided in the annual budget request documents submitted to Congress, as well as the final approved budget figures as reported by NASA and the OMB. In the event of a government shutdown or any other scenario where the budget is not formally approved by the start of the fiscal year, the resolution will be based on the continuing resolutions or any temporary funding measures that specify budget allocations. If no specific allocation for NASA is provided in such measures, the question will remain unresolved until an official budget is approved. Edge cases, such as budget amendments or supplemental funding specifically for NASA that occurs after the initial budget approval, will be included in the calculation for NASA's budget percentage. The resolution will be considered final based on the budget figures for the fiscal year 2030, as reported by the end of the calendar year 2029.

title: Will the discovery of dark matter lead to a Nobel Prize in Physics that significantly impacts the global economy by 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, any of the following conditions are met:

A Nobel Prize in Physics is awarded for the discovery of dark matter, and within five years of the award, there is a measurable and significant impact on the global economy as reported by at least three major financial institutions or economic research bodies. Significant impact is defined as a change in global GDP by at least 0.5% attributable directly to technologies or innovations derived from the discovery of dark matter.

A Nobel Prize in Physics is awarded for the discovery of dark matter, and it leads to the development of a new industry or the significant expansion of an existing industry, with a global market value exceeding $100 billion within five years of the award.

In the absence of a Nobel Prize, if an equivalent prestigious international award is given for the discovery of dark matter and meets the above economic criteria, it will also be considered for resolution.

Fallback scenario: If there is controversy or ambiguity regarding the discovery of dark matter or its economic impact, a panel of experts from leading scientific and economic institutions will be convened to make a determination based on available evidence and expert consensus.

title: Will Elon Musk's net worth exceed $300 billion by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, according to Forbes or Bloomberg's official billionaire tracker, Elon Musk's net worth is reported to exceed $300 billion at any point before December 31, 2025. The net worth calculation will be based on the most recent valuation of his holdings in publicly traded companies, private companies, real estate, cash, and other assets minus liabilities. The resolution will rely on the highest reported net worth by either Forbes or Bloomberg from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2025. In the event of discrepancies between Forbes and Bloomberg, the higher reported value will be used for resolution. If neither Forbes nor Bloomberg provides an update on Musk's net worth in 2025, the question will resolve as No. In case of any disputes over the valuation methods used by Forbes or Bloomberg, the question will remain unresolved until a clear consensus is reached or a third-party authoritative financial analysis is provided.

title: Will Ukraine join the European Union before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Ukraine becomes a full member of the European Union (EU). Full membership is defined as the completion of all necessary accession negotiations, the ratification of the accession treaty by all current EU member states, and the formal granting of EU membership status to Ukraine by the European Council. The resolution will be based on official announcements from the European Council, the European Commission, or the Ukrainian government. In the event of a reformation or dissolution of the EU as it is known today, or a significant change in the membership process, this question will resolve based on the most comparable official successor entity or process. If Ukraine obtains a status that is equivalent to full membership but under a different designation due to changes in EU structure or terminology, this will also be considered as fulfilling the criteria for a Yes resolution.

title: Will a major political figure be implicated in a scandal involving genetic data privacy before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a major political figure (defined as a current or former head of state, government, or a cabinet-level official in any of the G20 countries) is publicly implicated in a scandal involving the misuse, unauthorized access, or illegal sharing of genetic data. The implication must be supported by credible evidence, such as official legal documents, investigative journalism reports from reputable media outlets, or public admissions by the individuals involved. The scandal must involve a clear violation of existing laws or ethical standards regarding genetic data privacy at the time of the incident. In the event of conflicting reports or lack of clear evidence, the question will resolve as No unless further verified information becomes available.

title: Will SpaceX's Reusable Launch System play a significant role in a political decision or legislation related to space exploration before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, SpaceX's Reusable Launch System (RLS) is directly cited in the text of a law, executive order, or significant policy decision by any of the G7 countries (United States, United Kingdom, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan) as a contributing factor or consideration in the decision-making process related to space exploration or commercial space activities. The citation must be explicit, mentioning SpaceX's RLS by name or a clearly identifiable description of its technology. Secondary references, such as news articles or expert analyses, will be considered valid only if they directly quote the official document or statement. In the event of ambiguity or lack of direct citations, a panel of experts in space policy and technology, agreed upon by Metaculus Admins, will make the final determination based on the available evidence. This panel will also serve as a fallback mechanism in case of disputes or unclear situations.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US make a ruling that significantly impacts the US economy by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Supreme Court of the United States issues a ruling that directly leads to a change in federal economic policy or legislation that is widely recognized by major news outlets (e.g., The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, BBC) and economic analysts as having a significant impact on the US economy. Significant impact is defined as causing a change in the GDP growth rate by more than 0.5 percentage points within a year of the ruling, or leading to a substantial shift in employment rates, stock market indices, or federal economic policy. In cases where the impact of a ruling is disputed, a consensus among at least three reputable economic analysis institutions (e.g., The Brookings Institution, The National Bureau of Economic Research, The Federal Reserve) will be required for resolution. If no such ruling occurs by the specified date, or if the impact of a ruling is not clearly significant as defined above, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new robotics company achieve a market valuation of over $10 billion by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a robotics company that was founded after January 1, 2020, achieves a market valuation of over $10 billion USD. The valuation must be confirmed by at least one of the following authoritative sources: 

1. Financial statements audited by a recognized accounting firm.
2. Public filings with a securities regulatory authority (e.g., SEC in the United States).
3. Public announcement from the company, corroborated by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters).

In the event that multiple companies meet this criterion, the resolution will still be Yes. If no public information is available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. 

For the purpose of this question, a "robotics company" is defined as a company whose primary business is the development, manufacturing, or sale of robots or robotic systems. Companies that pivot to robotics after being founded will not be considered.

title: Will a discovery in chemistry lead to a new industry with a market size exceeding $50 billion by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a discovery in the field of chemistry leads to the creation of a new industry or significantly transforms an existing industry, resulting in a market size exceeding $50 billion. The market size will be measured based on the combined revenue of companies operating within this new or transformed industry, as reported by authoritative financial analysis firms such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or similar. The discovery must be clearly identifiable as the primary catalyst for the industry's creation or transformation, with evidence of its impact provided through peer-reviewed scientific publications, industry reports, or statements from leading companies in the sector. In cases where the market size is close to the threshold, a margin of error of 5% will be allowed for the final determination. If no single discovery can be identified as meeting these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In the event of disputes over the interpretation of 'discovery in chemistry' or 'new industry,' a panel of experts in chemistry and industry analysis will be consulted to make a final decision.

title: Will NATO employ an AI-driven defense system for collective security operations by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, NATO has officially announced and demonstrated the deployment of an AI-driven defense system specifically designed for collective security operations. The system must be operational and integrated into NATO's defense strategy, with capabilities including but not limited to automated threat detection, decision-making, and execution of defensive measures without human intervention in real-time scenarios. The announcement must come directly from an official NATO source or be confirmed through official NATO documentation. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear public announcement, the resolution will be based on the most credible and authoritative sources available at the time. The system must be distinct from semi-automated systems by its ability to operate independently in critical decision-making processes. If multiple systems are announced, the resolution will consider the first system that meets these criteria. In the absence of such a system by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an AI system solve a previously unsolved problem in theoretical physics by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, an AI system is officially credited with solving a problem in theoretical physics that, as of the date of this question, has not been solved. The problem must be recognized as unsolved by a reputable scientific body (e.g., the International Union of Pure and Applied Physics) and the solution must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal of high impact (e.g., Nature, Science, Physical Review Letters). The AI's contribution must be substantial and clearly delineated, with the AI being the primary solver of the problem. The solution must be acknowledged by the scientific community and lead to a significant advancement in the field. In case of disputes, a panel of experts appointed by a recognized scientific organization will make the final determination. Edge cases, such as partial solutions or contributions to a larger team effort, will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis, with the AI needing to be the key contributor to the solution. Solutions achieved through brute force methods without demonstrating novel insight or understanding will not qualify.

title: Will an AI system be used to make a significant policy decision during Joe Biden's presidency?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, during Joe Biden's presidency, an AI system is directly used to make or significantly influence a policy decision at the federal level in the United States. The AI system must be involved in the analysis, drafting, decision-making process, or implementation of a policy that is officially adopted or enacted. Significant influence is defined as the AI's contribution being publicly acknowledged by the administration or through official documentation as critical to the policy's development or enactment. The policy in question must be of national significance, impacting a wide range of the population or having substantial economic, social, or environmental implications. Verification can come from official government announcements, credible media reports, or direct statements from involved parties. In the event of ambiguity or disputed outcomes, a panel of experts from relevant fields (AI, policy analysis, and law) will be consulted to determine the resolution. Edge cases, such as the use of basic decision support tools or AI systems with minimal impact, will not qualify for this question's resolution.

title: Will OpenAI release a new language model that significantly outperforms GPT-4 by 2025?
body:
The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, OpenAI releases a new language model that meets all of the following criteria:

Significant Performance Improvement: The new model must demonstrate a clear and significant improvement over GPT-4 in at least three of the following areas: natural language understanding, natural language generation, computational efficiency, and task-specific benchmarks. The improvement must be quantifiable, with at least a 15% increase in performance metrics compared to GPT-4.

Public Availability: The model must be made publicly available, either through OpenAI's API or as a downloadable software package, allowing for independent verification of its capabilities.

Peer Review: The model's performance improvements must be documented and verified through a peer-reviewed publication or an equivalent authoritative source.

In the event that OpenAI is rebranded, merges with another entity, or undergoes significant organizational changes, the resolution will still apply to the entity responsible for the development and release of the language model.

title: Will Australia launch a space mission to the moon by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Australian government or any Australia-based private entity successfully launches a spacecraft that reaches the lunar surface before January 1, 2030. The mission must be intended for exploration, research, or commercial purposes and must achieve a soft landing or deploy a rover or other equipment designed for lunar exploration. The spacecraft's launch and lunar landing must be verified by at least one of the following: the Australian Space Agency, an internationally recognized space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA), or a reputable scientific journal. In the event of a dispute regarding the mission's success or objectives, the resolution will defer to the Australian Space Agency's official statements or, if unavailable, to the consensus among recognized space exploration experts. Launches intended solely for orbit around the moon without a landing or deployment of equipment on the lunar surface will not meet the resolution criteria. In the case that no mission is launched by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Virginia Department of Health implement a statewide electronic health record system by 2025?
body:
The Virginia Department of Health will be considered to have implemented a statewide electronic health record (EHR) system if, by December 31, 2025, a unified digital platform is operational and accessible by all public health facilities within the state of Virginia. This platform must enable the sharing and management of patient health records across different healthcare providers, including hospitals, clinics, and general practitioners. The system must meet the following criteria:

- Interoperability: The EHR system must be capable of exchanging information with other health systems and databases, both within and outside the state, without significant barriers.
- Security and Privacy Compliance: The system must adhere to federal and state regulations regarding patient data privacy and security, including HIPAA.
- Coverage: At least 90% of public health facilities in Virginia must be actively using the system for it to be considered fully implemented.
- Verification: The implementation of the EHR system will be verified through official statements from the Virginia Department of Health, corroborated by reports from independent health IT auditors or relevant governmental oversight bodies.

In the event that the Virginia Department of Health announces the project's discontinuation or a significant delay beyond 2025, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US Congress pass a bill that specifically regulates the issuance of stablecoins by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the US Congress has passed and the President has signed into law a bill that explicitly regulates the issuance, management, or operation of stablecoins. The bill must address one or more of the following aspects: 

- Licensing or registration requirements for stablecoin issuers.
- Compliance standards for stablecoin operations, including but not limited to, reserve requirements, consumer protection, and anti-money laundering (AML) measures.
- Reporting obligations to federal regulatory bodies such as the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) or the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC).

For the purpose of this question, "stablecoins" are defined as digital currencies pegged to a stable asset, such as fiat currencies or commodities, designed to minimize the volatility typically associated with cryptocurrencies.

In the event that multiple bills are passed, the one with the most comprehensive coverage of the above aspects will be considered for resolution. If no bill is passed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United Nations create a special task force dedicated to the study and regulation of cryptocurrencies by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the United Nations announces the creation of a special task force dedicated to the study and regulation of cryptocurrencies. The task force must be officially recognized by the UN, with a clear mandate that includes both the study of cryptocurrencies and the development of regulatory frameworks. The announcement must be made through official UN channels, such as a press release on the UN website, an official statement by a UN spokesperson, or a documented resolution passed by a UN body. The task force must have a scheduled first meeting date and a list of initial members or participating countries to be considered valid. In the event that the UN discusses the creation of such a task force but does not officially announce its formation by the resolution date, or if the task force is announced but lacks a clear mandate on cryptocurrencies, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases, such as the announcement of a broader digital finance task force that includes cryptocurrencies as one of many topics, will be evaluated based on the explicit inclusion of cryptocurrencies in the task force's official mandate.

title: Will a major philosophical debate on the ethics of cryptocurrency mining emerge in academic circles by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, there is a significant increase in academic discourse on the ethics of cryptocurrency mining, evidenced by:

At least three peer-reviewed academic papers published in recognized journals within the fields of ethics, technology, or economics, specifically addressing the ethical implications of cryptocurrency mining.

The organization of at least one major international conference or symposium dedicated to the discussion of cryptocurrency mining ethics, with participation from leading scholars in the field.

Public statements or position papers from at least two prominent ethics or technology ethics organizations, explicitly addressing the ethical considerations of cryptocurrency mining.

For the purposes of this question, 'major philosophical debate' is defined as a widespread discussion within the academic community that significantly influences the discourse on technology ethics. 'Cryptocurrency mining' refers to the process of validating transactions and creating new coins within a blockchain network.

In the event that the criteria are met before the specified date, the question will resolve immediately. If there is ambiguity regarding the fulfillment of these criteria, a panel of experts in ethics, technology, and economics will be consulted to make a final determination.

title: Will a new medication developed with the aid of advanced pharmacological AI be approved by the FDA by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new medication that has been developed with the significant aid of advanced pharmacological AI is approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for any therapeutic use. The medication must be explicitly acknowledged by the FDA as having utilized AI technologies in its development process, either through direct mention in the approval announcement or in accompanying FDA documentation. The AI's involvement must be substantial, contributing to either the discovery of the drug, its formulation, or the optimization of its therapeutic efficacy. In cases where the FDA's announcement does not explicitly mention the AI's contribution, credible evidence from the developing company or peer-reviewed scientific publications must confirm the AI's significant role in the drug's development. If multiple medications meet these criteria before the resolution date, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first approval. In the event of a dispute regarding the AI's contribution, a panel of experts from relevant fields (pharmacology, AI research, and regulatory affairs) will be convened to make a determination based on available evidence. This panel's decision will be final.

title: Will the global market share of robotics in manufacturing surpass 50% by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the global market share of robotics in manufacturing exceeds 50%, as reported by a recognized authority such as the International Federation of Robotics or an equivalent organization. The market share will be determined by the percentage of manufacturing processes that utilize robotics technology in any capacity, including but not limited to assembly, packaging, and quality control. In the event that specific data for the year 2030 is not available by the resolution date, the most recent data available will be used to determine the outcome. If no authoritative report or data is released by July 1, 2031, the question will resolve as No due to insufficient evidence.

title: Will the World Health Organization declare a new global pandemic by 2025?
body:
The World Health Organization (WHO) will declare a new global pandemic if it officially announces, through a press release or a public statement by its Director-General, the emergence of a novel infectious disease that meets the following criteria:

- The disease must be identified as a new strain not previously recognized in humans.
- It must have sustained human-to-human transmission across at least three countries in two WHO regions.
- The declaration must be based on the assessment of the International Health Regulations (IHR) Emergency Committee or a similar authoritative body designated by the WHO.

This question will resolve as Yes if such a declaration is made on or before December 31, 2024. In the absence of a formal declaration by the WHO, but with widespread media reports and scientific consensus indicating the global spread of a novel infectious disease meeting the above criteria, the question may also resolve as Yes, subject to Metaculus Admins' approval.

In the event that the WHO is dissolved, incapacitated, or otherwise unable to perform its duties, the resolution will be based on the declarations made by a successor or equivalent global health authority recognized by the United Nations.

title: Will a major energy company announce a breakthrough in fusion energy technology before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a major energy company (defined as a company listed in the top 50 of the Fortune Global 500 energy sector companies as of 2023) announces a breakthrough in fusion energy technology that meets the following criteria:

- The breakthrough must be described in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or presented at a recognized international scientific conference.
- The technology must demonstrate a net energy gain, meaning the energy output from the fusion process exceeds the energy input required to sustain the fusion reaction.
- The announcement must include verifiable evidence of the breakthrough, such as experimental results or detailed technical specifications.
- Independent verification by a recognized scientific body or institution is required to confirm the claims made in the announcement.

In the event that multiple companies announce qualifying breakthroughs, the resolution will be based on the date of the first public announcement. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Israel's GDP growth rate exceed 4% in any year before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Israel's annual GDP growth rate exceeds 4% in any calendar year before January 1, 2030, as reported by the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF). The GDP growth rate will be considered based on the real GDP growth (annual percentage), which adjusts for inflation and is the standard measure for comparing economic growth over time. In the event that neither the World Bank nor the IMF provides the necessary data for a given year, the resolution will be based on the data available from the Israeli Central Bureau of Statistics. If none of these sources provide the necessary data by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases, such as revisions of previously reported growth rates that would change the outcome, will be considered if the revisions are published by the aforementioned sources before the resolution date.

title: Will a new engineering process that significantly reduces manufacturing costs be patented before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a new engineering process is patented that results in a reduction of manufacturing costs by at least 20% across any major manufacturing sector (e.g., automotive, electronics, pharmaceuticals). The process must be verifiable through a patent granted by the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) or the European Patent Office (EPO), and the cost reduction must be demonstrated in a peer-reviewed study or through an official statement by a recognized industry body. The manufacturing sector in question must represent a significant portion of the market, with 'significant' defined as having at least a 5% share of the global market in its category. In the event of a dispute over the resolution, the question will be resolved by a panel of three experts in the field of manufacturing engineering, with their decision based on the evidence available by the resolution date.

title: Will the Republican Party introduce a bill that significantly limits the use of facial recognition technology nationwide by 2025?
body:
The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a bill sponsored by a member of the Republican Party is introduced in either the United States House of Representatives or the Senate that proposes significant limitations on the use of facial recognition technology across the United States. Significant limitations are defined as any of the following: 

- A nationwide ban on the use of facial recognition technology by law enforcement or other government agencies.
- Substantial restrictions on the collection, storage, and use of facial recognition data by private entities, including requirements for explicit consent.
- Implementation of stringent accuracy and bias testing requirements for any facial recognition technology used in public decision-making processes.

The bill must be formally introduced and must not merely be a draft or proposal. The resolution will rely on official records from the United States Congress and reputable news sources for verification. In the event that multiple bills are introduced, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one bill meets the above criteria. If no such bill is introduced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Biden administration implement a major policy initiative focused on artificial intelligence ethics by 2024?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, the Biden administration has officially announced and begun the implementation of a major policy initiative specifically focused on the ethics of artificial intelligence. This initiative must be comprehensive, addressing at least three of the following areas: data privacy, algorithmic bias, AI safety, and the impact of AI on employment. The policy must be new or a significant expansion of existing policies, not a continuation or minor update. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the White House, the Department of Commerce, or the National Science Foundation. In the event of ambiguity regarding the policy's focus on AI ethics, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative public statements available from the administration. If no such initiative is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Democratic Party propose a federal investment of over $1 trillion in green technology by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Democratic Party, either through legislative proposals introduced in the United States Congress or official party platforms, commits to a federal investment exceeding $1 trillion in green technology. Green technology is defined as technology aimed at significantly reducing or eliminating the environmental impact of energy production, including but not limited to renewable energy sources (solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal), energy efficiency technologies, and carbon capture and storage. The resolution will rely on official documents, press releases, or public statements from recognized leaders of the Democratic Party or relevant congressional committees. In the event of ambiguity, the resolution will defer to the most authoritative source available at the time. If multiple proposals are made, the cumulative investment amount across all proposals will be considered. Should the Democratic Party no longer exist or undergo a significant rebranding that questions its continuity as the same political entity, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will South Korea's GDP growth rate exceed 3% in any year before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if South Korea's GDP growth rate exceeds 3% in any calendar year before January 1, 2030, according to data released by the Bank of Korea or the World Bank. The GDP growth rate is defined as the annual increase in the value of all goods and services produced by the economy, adjusted for inflation and expressed as a percentage. Preliminary, revised, and final GDP growth rate figures will be considered, but the question will resolve based on the final figures for each year as reported by the end of the following year. If the Bank of Korea or the World Bank do not release the necessary data by January 1, 2031, or if there is significant discrepancy between their reports, the question will resolve using the figures from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) as a fallback.

title: Will the global economy experience a recession in 2023 as defined by the International Monetary Fund?
body: A "recession" is defined according to the International Monetary Fund's (IMF) criteria, which typically involves a significant decline in economic activity spread across the economy, lasting more than a few months, and is visible in real GDP, real income, employment, industrial production, and wholesale-retail sales. This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, the IMF or a similarly authoritative global economic organization officially declares that the global economy has entered a recession at any point in 2023. The declaration must be explicit and publicly accessible. In the absence of such a declaration, the question will resolve as No. If the IMF revises its criteria for defining a recession in 2023, the revised criteria will be used to determine the resolution of this question. In the event that the IMF is dissolved or ceases to function in 2023, the resolution will be based on the declaration from the next most authoritative global economic organization.

title: Will the string theory be utilized in a major technological breakthrough that impacts the global economy before 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2040, a technological breakthrough directly utilizing principles of string theory is achieved and has a significant, measurable impact on the global economy. The breakthrough must:

Be recognized by at least two leading scientific journals or institutions as a direct application of string theory.
Demonstrate a clear, quantifiable economic impact, such as the creation of a new industry, substantial growth in an existing market, or a notable increase in global economic productivity.

In cases where the application of string theory is part of a broader technological development, the specific contribution of string theory must be clearly identified and validated by independent experts in the field.

Fallback scenario: If no single breakthrough meets these criteria but there is cumulative evidence of string theory's application in multiple smaller-scale innovations contributing significantly to the economy, this will also result in a Yes resolution.

title: Will the NBA establish a team on the International Space Station for exhibition games by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2039, the National Basketball Association (NBA) officially announces the establishment of a team based on the International Space Station (ISS) for the purpose of playing exhibition games. The team must be recognized by the NBA as a legitimate extension of its league operations, with plans for at least one scheduled game to be played in microgravity conditions. The announcement must be verifiable through official NBA press releases, statements on the NBA's official website, or public declarations by the NBA Commissioner. In the event that the NBA dissolves, merges with another sports organization, or undergoes significant structural changes before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No unless the successor or restructured organization carries forward the plan to establish an ISS-based team. If the NBA announces plans for exhibition games in space that do not involve the creation of a new team (e.g., existing NBA teams playing in space), this will not meet the resolution criteria.

title: Will the Artemis program include a message from President Joe Biden on its first crewed mission to the Moon?
body:
The question will resolve as Yes if any of the following conditions are met before the launch of the first crewed mission under NASA's Artemis program:

A message from President Joe Biden is officially included in the mission's payload, as confirmed by NASA or a statement from the White House.

The message can be in any form (audio, video, written) but must be intended for delivery or presentation on the Moon as part of the mission.

In the event that President Joe Biden is no longer in office at the time of the mission, a message prepared by him while in office for this specific purpose will still qualify.

If the Artemis program's first crewed mission is delayed beyond 2024 without a clear rescheduled date, this question will resolve as No by default unless a message from President Joe Biden specifically intended for the mission has been confirmed prior to the delay.

Edge case consideration: If the Artemis program is renamed or rebranded but continues to pursue its goal of a crewed lunar mission, any confirmed message from President Joe Biden intended for this mission will still lead to a resolution of Yes.

title: Will a space agency successfully develop a virology lab on the Moon to study viruses in microgravity by 2035?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, any national or private space agency has successfully developed and operationalized a virology laboratory on the Moon designed to study viruses in microgravity conditions. The lab must be capable of conducting at least three different types of virological studies, including but not limited to the effects of microgravity on virus mutation rates, virus-host interactions, and vaccine efficacy in reduced gravity environments. The development of the lab must be confirmed by either: 

1. An official announcement from the space agency responsible for the lab's development. 
2. Publication of research findings in a peer-reviewed scientific journal that explicitly mentions the use of the lunar virology lab. 
3. Independent verification by a recognized international space exploration or scientific organization. 

In the event that multiple agencies announce the development of a virology lab on the Moon, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first confirmed operational lab. If no such lab is developed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a new space policy initiative named after Donald Trump by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, any official space policy initiative, program, or mission is formally named after Donald Trump. The initiative must be recognized and announced by a major space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, ISRO) or a recognized governmental body responsible for space affairs in any country. The naming must be confirmed through official press releases, government records, or direct statements from the agency's or government's official spokespersons. The initiative can be related to manned or unmanned space exploration, satellite deployment, space science, or any other space-related activity. In the event of multiple initiatives being named, the resolution will consider the first officially announced initiative. If no such initiative is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases or ambiguities will be resolved based on the most authoritative and direct sources available at the time of resolution.

title: Will a climatology-focused satellite mission be launched by NASA to study Venus' atmosphere by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if NASA launches a satellite mission specifically aimed at studying the atmosphere of Venus before January 1, 2030. The mission must be primarily focused on climatology and atmospheric studies of Venus, including but not limited to, the composition, structure, and dynamics of Venus' atmosphere. Launches aimed at broader planetary exploration without a primary focus on Venus' atmosphere will not count towards this question's resolution. The launch must be officially confirmed by NASA through a press release or a public announcement on their official website. In the event of a launch delay, the question will resolve as No if the delay extends past the resolution date. If no official announcement is made by NASA regarding such a mission by December 31, 2029, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will a biotechnology company announce a project for developing synthetic organisms for terraforming Mars by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a biotechnology company, defined as an entity primarily engaged in the applications of biological systems and living organisms to develop products or technologies, announces a project aimed at developing synthetic organisms specifically designed for the purpose of terraforming Mars. The announcement must be verifiable through a press release, official statement, or public disclosure on the company's official website or through a recognized media outlet. The project must explicitly mention the goal of terraforming Mars, including the development or deployment of synthetic organisms to alter the Martian environment to make it more habitable for human life or Earth-originating life forms. In the event of multiple announcements, the earliest will be considered for resolution. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In cases where the announcement is made but the project is not clearly defined or does not specifically mention terraforming Mars, the question will not resolve as Yes. Should the announcement come from a joint venture or collaboration between multiple entities, at least one of the primary entities must be a biotechnology company.

title: Will an infectious disease outbreak occur on a spacecraft or space station resulting in a quarantine situation by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a confirmed case of an infectious disease outbreak on a spacecraft or space station that leads to an official quarantine situation. An "infectious disease outbreak" is defined as the occurrence of cases of disease in excess of what would normally be expected in a defined community, group, or area. A "quarantine situation" refers to the imposition of restrictions on the movement of people, animals, or goods which are designed to prevent the spread of disease or pests. The confirmation must come from an official space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, ISRO) or a recognized health organization (e.g., WHO, CDC). In the event that multiple outbreaks occur, the resolution will be based on the first confirmed case. If no such outbreak is confirmed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases or disputes will be resolved based on the most reliable and authoritative information available at the time of resolution.

title: Will OpenAI develop an AI capable of autonomously operating a spacecraft by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if OpenAI develops an AI system capable of autonomously operating a spacecraft, including launch, navigation, and landing procedures, without human intervention, by December 31, 2024. The AI must demonstrate its capability through a successful mission, which could be either a simulated environment approved by NASA or an actual space mission. The mission must include critical decision-making in real-time, responding to unforeseen circumstances, and executing a complete mission cycle from launch to landing. Verification of the AI's capabilities must be confirmed by an independent panel of experts in AI and aerospace, including at least one member from NASA or ESA, and must be documented and publicly disclosed. The resolution will not consider AI systems that require human intervention for decision-making processes or emergency situations. In the event that OpenAI merges with another entity or its AI technology is acquired by another company, the question will still resolve as Yes if the developed AI system meets the above criteria under the new ownership.

title: Will Japan launch a mission to mine resources from an asteroid by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Japanese space agency or any Japan-based private or public entity officially announces and demonstrates the launch of a mission aimed at mining resources from an asteroid before January 1, 2035. The mission must be intended for resource extraction, including but not limited to water, metals, or minerals, and must have left Earth's atmosphere. Demonstrations can include, but are not limited to, live broadcasts, official press releases, or documented evidence of the spacecraft en route to or arriving at the asteroid. In the event of a mission announcement without a subsequent launch by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. If multiple entities announce similar missions, the resolution will be based on the first successful launch. In cases where the mission's status is unclear by the resolution date, an extension of up to 6 months may be granted for clarification. If no mission has been launched or announced by the end of this extension period, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will machine learning be used to significantly improve the efficiency of nuclear fusion reactors by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is published evidence in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or an official statement from a major nuclear fusion research institution (e.g., ITER, National Ignition Facility) that machine learning algorithms have been successfully applied to increase the efficiency of nuclear fusion reactors. Efficiency improvement must be quantified as at least a 20% increase in net energy output compared to the best-recorded efficiency levels as of 2020. The improvement must be attributed directly to the application of machine learning techniques in reactor design, operation, or maintenance. In the absence of such evidence, the question will resolve as No. If multiple sources provide conflicting information, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the most reputable sources. In the event of a significant global disruption that halts progress in nuclear fusion research for an extended period, the resolution date may be adjusted accordingly.

title: Will the Democratic Party in the US pass significant legislation related to nuclear energy safety by 2026?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Democratic Party in the United States has successfully passed and enacted legislation at the federal level that significantly enhances nuclear energy safety standards or regulatory measures. Significant legislation is defined as a law or set of laws that introduce new safety protocols, enhance existing regulations, or provide substantial funding for nuclear safety improvements. The legislation must be recognized as a major advancement in nuclear energy safety by a reputable energy policy organization or a federal energy regulatory body. In the event that the Democratic Party is not in a position to pass such legislation due to not holding a majority in either the House of Representatives or the Senate, or if there is a veto that is not overridden, the question will resolve as No. If the legislation is passed but its implementation is delayed beyond 2026, the question will still resolve as Yes, provided the delay is not due to the legislation being overturned or deemed unconstitutional.

title: Will the United States decommission more than 10 nuclear reactors by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, more than 10 nuclear reactors in the United States have been officially decommissioned. Decommissioning is defined as the process of retiring a nuclear reactor from service and ensuring that all nuclear material is removed, the site is decontaminated, and the facility is dismantled to a state that no longer requires nuclear regulatory oversight. The count of decommissioned reactors will be based on official announcements from the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) or equivalent authoritative body. In the event of a reactor being decommissioned and then recommissioned before the resolution date, it will not count towards the total. If the status of a reactor is disputed, the resolution will be based on the most recent and authoritative public statement by the NRC or an equivalent body.

title: Will France launch a mission to explore an exoplanet by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the French Space Agency (CNES) or any France-based entity, either governmental or private, officially announces and initiates a mission aimed at exploring an exoplanet by December 31, 2030. The mission must be beyond the planning phase and must have entered either the construction, testing, or execution phase. The exploration can include, but is not limited to, direct observation, sending probes, or any other form of remote or direct analysis. The mission's primary objective must be the exploration of an exoplanet, and this objective must be clearly stated in official documents or announcements. In the event that multiple countries or entities collaborate on a mission where France is not the lead but contributes significantly, the question will resolve as Yes, provided that the French contribution is pivotal to the mission's core exploration objectives. If no such mission is announced or initiated by the specified date, or if the mission's objectives change to no longer include exoplanet exploration, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Iran successfully send an astronaut to the International Space Station by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the Iranian Space Agency (ISA) or any other official Iranian governmental body announces and confirms the successful launch, mission, and safe return of at least one Iranian astronaut to the International Space Station (ISS). The astronaut must complete at least one orbit around the Earth while aboard the ISS to qualify. 

Verification of this event must come from either the ISA, the ISS's international partners (NASA, Roscosmos, JAXA, ESA, or CSA), or a reputable international news organization. In the event of conflicting reports, the majority consensus among these sources will be used to determine the outcome. 

Should the ISS no longer be in operation or accessible to Iranian astronauts by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Additionally, if Iran sends an astronaut to an equivalent international space station or space habitat recognized by the United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs (UNOOSA) as a valid alternative to the ISS, this will also be considered a successful resolution.

title: Will Virginia be the site of a new major NASA mission launch by 2027?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, NASA officially announces and schedules a major mission launch to take place in Virginia. A "major mission" is defined as any mission that is part of NASA's Artemis program, Mars exploration efforts, or any other mission classified by NASA as "major" due to its budget, scale, or significance in terms of scientific research, exploration, or human spaceflight. The announcement must be confirmed through an official NASA press release or a public statement by a NASA administrator. In the event that NASA restructures or renames its key programs, the mission must be directly comparable in scope and significance to the missions defined as "major" as of 2023. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In case of ambiguity regarding the classification of a mission as "major," the decision will be deferred to a panel of experts agreed upon by the question's administrators.

title: Will the European Union introduce a unified cryptocurrency regulation framework by the end of 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the European Union (EU) has officially announced and published a comprehensive set of regulations governing the use, trade, and legal status of cryptocurrencies within its member states. The regulations must apply uniformly across all EU countries and address at least the following areas: 

- Licensing requirements for cryptocurrency exchanges and wallet providers
- Anti-money laundering (AML) and counter-terrorism financing (CTF) compliance standards
- Consumer protection measures, including but not limited to, fraud prevention, data security, and transaction transparency
- Taxation guidelines for cryptocurrency transactions

The resolution will rely on official publications from the European Commission or the European Parliament as authoritative sources. In the event of a partial introduction of regulations that do not cover all the specified areas, the question will resolve as No. If the EU disbands or undergoes significant restructuring that makes the introduction of a unified framework impractical or impossible, the question will be considered void and will not resolve.

title: Will California implement a state-wide cryptocurrency tax by the end of 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the state of California has enacted legislation that imposes a tax specifically on cryptocurrency transactions or holdings. This includes any form of tax directly applied to the buying, selling, holding, or mining of cryptocurrencies. 

For the purpose of this question, "cryptocurrency" refers to digital or virtual currencies that use cryptography for security and operate independently of a central bank. 

The resolution will be based on official statements from the California State Legislature or the Governor of California's office. In the event of ambiguous or partial legislation that does not clearly define a tax on cryptocurrencies but could be interpreted as such, the question will resolve as Yes only if an official clarification or subsequent legal interpretation confirms the tax's applicability to cryptocurrencies. 

If no such legislation is enacted by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Biden administration issue an executive order specifically addressing cryptocurrency market regulations by the end of 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, the Biden administration has issued an executive order that directly addresses cryptocurrency market regulations. The executive order must specifically mention cryptocurrencies or digital assets and outline regulatory measures, guidelines, or intentions regarding their market, trading practices, taxation, or legal status within the United States. The resolution will be based on official publications from the White House or the Federal Register. In the event of ambiguity or partial measures that do not fully address market regulations but mention cryptocurrencies, the question will resolve as Yes only if the primary focus is on regulatory actions. If no such executive order is issued by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases will be considered based on the spirit of the question, focusing on the intent to regulate the cryptocurrency market.

title: Will an AI system be officially used by a Major League Baseball team for real-time strategy decisions by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, an AI system is officially adopted and used by at least one Major League Baseball (MLB) team for making real-time strategy decisions during official games. The AI system must be capable of making decisions on player positioning, pitching changes, and batting order adjustments without human intervention during the game. The adoption of the AI system must be confirmed through an official statement by the MLB team, a press release, or a credible news source. The AI system's performance and decision-making process must be documented and available for public review. In the event that the MLB ceases to exist, merges with another league, or undergoes significant structural changes, the resolution will consider the use of AI in the highest level of professional baseball that directly succeeds the MLB.

title: Will the United Kingdom deploy an AI-powered public surveillance system with real-time facial recognition capabilities by 2025?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United Kingdom has officially deployed a public surveillance system that utilizes artificial intelligence for real-time facial recognition across any part of its public spaces. The system must be capable of identifying individuals and matching them to a database with at least an 85% accuracy rate. The deployment of such a system must be confirmed by an official government announcement or documentation. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters) will be considered sufficient evidence. The system must be operational and not in a trial phase. If multiple systems are deployed, the resolution will consider the first system that meets these criteria. In the event of a partial deployment (e.g., limited to specific cities or areas), the question will resolve as Yes if the system is intended to be expanded nationwide. Edge cases, such as temporary deployments for specific events or the use of similar technology in private spaces, will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Tesla announce an AI-based autonomous vehicle specifically designed for urban environments in Spain by 2027?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if Tesla, Inc. announces the development, testing, or release of an AI-based autonomous vehicle specifically designed for urban environments in Spain before January 1, 2027. The announcement must be made through official Tesla communication channels, including but not limited to press releases, official social media accounts, or statements during public events by Tesla executives. The vehicle must be explicitly described as being autonomous and intended for urban use within Spain. This includes any form of autonomous driving technology that allows the vehicle to navigate city streets and urban environments without human intervention for the majority of its operation. In the event that Tesla, Inc. is acquired, merges, or undergoes significant corporate restructuring, announcements made by the succeeding entity regarding the project will be considered valid for the resolution of this question. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in immunotherapy that impacts the global economy by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant breakthrough in immunotherapy that meets the following criteria:

1. A new immunotherapy treatment is developed that demonstrates a statistically significant improvement in survival rates for at least one of the following diseases: cancer, HIV/AIDS, or autoimmune diseases. The improvement must be at least 20% over existing treatments based on phase III clinical trial results.

2. The treatment must be approved by either the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), the European Medicines Agency (EMA), or an equivalent regulatory authority in another major market (e.g., Japan, China).

3. The breakthrough must have a demonstrable impact on the global economy, such as a reduction in healthcare costs, an increase in productivity due to improved health outcomes, or a significant market valuation (over $10 billion) for the company or companies developing the treatment.

In the event that multiple treatments meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes at the time the first treatment is approved. If no treatment meets these criteria by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

Fallback scenario: If there is controversy or ambiguity regarding the approval or effectiveness of a treatment, a panel of experts in the field of immunotherapy, appointed by a recognized international health organization, will make the final determination.

title: Will the total market value of the global golf industry exceed $100 billion by 2025?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, according to the most recent report by a recognized authority in the sports industry (e.g., Forbes, Statista, or the National Golf Foundation), the total market value of the global golf industry is reported to exceed $100 billion at any point before December 31, 2025.
