The market value includes revenues from all segments of the industry, including but not limited to equipment sales, course fees, sponsorships, and professional tournaments. In the event that no report is published by December 31, 2025, or if reports from different authorities conflict, the question will resolve using the median value of all authoritative reports published in the year 2025. If no authoritative reports are available for 2025, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United Kingdom experience a recession with a GDP contraction of over 2% in any quarter before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the United Kingdom's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) contracts by more than 2% in any single quarter before January 1, 2025, compared to the previous quarter. The GDP data must be the final (not preliminary) figures released by the Office for National Statistics (ONS) in the UK. A recession is typically defined as two consecutive quarters of GDP contraction, but for the purposes of this question, a single quarter of over 2% contraction will suffice. If the ONS revises its GDP figures after initially reporting a contraction of over 2%, the resolution will be based on the revised (final) figures. In the event that the ONS ceases to exist, is unable to provide the data, or there is a significant delay in data release, the resolution will defer to the most comparable authoritative source available at the time.

title: Will there be a significant amendment to the US Electoral College system by 2030 following the controversies of the 2020 US presidential election?
body:
A "significant amendment" to the US Electoral College system is defined as any change that alters the method of allocating electoral votes, the process of electing the President and Vice President of the United States, or the total number of electoral votes required for a win. This includes, but is not limited to, the adoption of a proportional allocation system, the implementation of a national popular vote interstate compact, or a constitutional amendment that changes the electoral vote count necessary for victory.

The resolution will be based on the passage of federal legislation, ratification of a constitutional amendment, or any state-level actions that collectively lead to a change in the national outcome of presidential elections. The determination will rely on official announcements from the United States Congress, the National Archives, or the relevant state legislatures.

In the event of ambiguous or partial changes, a panel of constitutional experts will be consulted to determine if the changes meet the criteria for a "significant amendment." The decision of this panel will be final.

title: Will a major political party in any G7 country adopt a policy platform that includes genetic data privacy by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any of the major political parties in the G7 countries (Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, and the United States) officially adopts a policy platform or manifesto that includes specific measures for the protection of genetic data privacy. The policy must explicitly address the collection, use, storage, and sharing of genetic information, and provide clear guidelines for consent and individual rights in relation to genetic data. The adoption of the policy must be confirmed through official party documents, public announcements, or verified media reports. In the event that multiple parties in different G7 countries meet this criterion, the question will resolve as Yes once the first party's adoption is confirmed. If no such policy adoption is confirmed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, a 'major political party' is defined as one that is currently in government or has been within the last two election cycles in its respective country.

title: Will Japan decommission more than half of its nuclear reactors by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, more than half of Japan's operational nuclear reactors as of January 1, 2023, have been officially decommissioned. Decommissioning is defined as the process of retiring a nuclear reactor from service and ensuring that it has been made safe from radiation hazards permanently. The count of Japan's operational nuclear reactors will be based on the International Atomic Energy Agency's (IAEA) official records as of January 1, 2023. In the event of any discrepancies in data reporting, the IAEA's most recent and comprehensive report will be considered authoritative. If new reactors are constructed and become operational after January 1, 2023, they will not be included in the initial count for this resolution. In cases where a reactor is temporarily shut down for maintenance or upgrade but not officially decommissioned, it will not count towards the resolution. The resolution will rely on public announcements from the Japan Atomic Energy Agency (JAEA) or equivalent national authority, verified by the IAEA's reports.

title: Will a Major League Baseball stadium in the United States install a nuclear-powered lighting system by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any Major League Baseball (MLB) stadium in the United States has installed and is operating a nuclear-powered lighting system. The system must be fully functional and approved by the relevant regulatory bodies, including but not limited to the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) and local government authorities. The installation must be confirmed through official MLB announcements, statements from the stadium's management, or credible news sources. In the event of a partial installation or testing phase that does not lead to full operational status, the question will resolve as No. If no official confirmation is available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, a "nuclear-powered lighting system" refers to a lighting system for the stadium that derives the majority of its power directly from nuclear energy, as opposed to being powered by electricity generated from nuclear power plants.

title: Will Japan deploy a quantum computer for commercial use by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Japan has officially deployed at least one quantum computer for commercial use. Commercial use is defined as the quantum computer being available for use by businesses or the public for a fee or as part of a service offering. The deployment must be confirmed by either: 

1. An announcement from a recognized Japanese technology firm or government agency. 

2. Coverage in at least two reputable technology or science news outlets, based in Japan or internationally, confirming the deployment. 

In the event of a dispute regarding the deployment's commercial nature, the decision will be based on the most widely accepted definition of commercial use at the time of resolution. If no quantum computer has been deployed for commercial use by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will SpaceX successfully land a reusable launch system on the moon by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if SpaceX successfully lands a reusable launch system on the moon and returns it to Earth by December 31, 2030. A "reusable launch system" is defined as a spacecraft that is capable of being launched to the moon, landing on its surface, returning to Earth, and being capable of being relaunched without significant refurbishment. Success is defined as a complete mission where the spacecraft lands on the moon, performs a pre-defined mission (e.g., cargo delivery, scientific research), returns to Earth, and is recovered in a condition deemed reusable. The mission must be officially confirmed by SpaceX through a public announcement or press release. In the event of a dispute regarding the mission's success or the reusability of the launch system, an independent panel of aerospace experts will be convened to make a final determination. Edge cases, such as partial success (e.g., successful moon landing but failure to return), will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with the final decision resting with the independent panel. In the absence of a clear resolution by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the James Webb Space Telescope discover a previously unknown exoplanet that is confirmed to be Earth-like by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) has discovered at least one previously unknown exoplanet that meets all of the following criteria:

- Located within the habitable zone of its star, where conditions may allow for the presence of liquid water on the surface.
- Possesses an atmosphere with chemical signatures indicative of biological activity, similar to those sought in current exoplanet research (e.g., oxygen, ozone, methane).
- Confirmed through follow-up observations by either JWST itself or other telescopes capable of exoplanet characterization.

An exoplanet will be considered 'Earth-like' based on the above criteria and must be confirmed by a recognized authority in the field, such as the NASA Exoplanet Archive or the European Space Agency.

In the event that multiple exoplanets are discovered that meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the confirmation of the first such exoplanet. If no such discovery is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

Should the JWST become inoperable or unable to perform the necessary observations before the resolution date, an alternative authoritative source or mission capable of similar discoveries will be considered valid for the resolution of this question.

title: Will the United Kingdom hold a general election before the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a general election for the United Kingdom's House of Commons is officially announced and takes place before December 31, 2024. The election must be recognized and confirmed by the UK Electoral Commission. In the event of a postponement, the question will resolve as Yes only if the election occurs within the specified timeframe. If no election is announced or if it is scheduled for a date after December 31, 2024, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, a 'general election' refers to a nationwide election where all seats in the House of Commons are contested. Snap elections, if called and held within the timeframe, will also result in a Yes resolution. In cases where the election date is announced but later changed to a date beyond the specified timeframe, the resolution will default to No, unless the election is held within 2024 due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., national emergency).

title: Will a political figure be appointed as the head of the International Cricket Council by the end of 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, a person who has held a political office (elected or appointed) within the last 10 years is officially announced as the head of the International Cricket Council (ICC). The political office in question must be a recognized position within a government structure, including but not limited to roles such as mayor, senator, member of parliament, or cabinet minister. The announcement must come directly from an official ICC communication channel or a reputable news source. Interim or acting heads will be considered valid for resolution if they serve in the role beyond a temporary emergency appointment period. In the event of a dispute over the eligibility of the political figure or the authenticity of the announcement, the resolution will default to the most recent and authoritative public statement by the ICC.

title: Will a major engineering company announce a breakthrough in renewable energy storage technology by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major engineering company (defined as a company with a market capitalization of over $10 billion USD or equivalent in other currencies at the time of the announcement) publicly announces a breakthrough in renewable energy storage technology that meets the following criteria:

- Energy Density: The technology must demonstrate an energy density of at least 400 Wh/kg at the cell level.
- Scalability: The technology must be scalable to industrial levels, with potential for mass production.
- Efficiency: The technology must exhibit an efficiency rate (energy out/energy in) of over 90%.
- Longevity: The technology must guarantee a lifespan of at least 10,000 charging cycles without significant degradation in performance.
- Safety: The technology must pass international safety standards for energy storage systems.

The announcement must be verified through official press releases, reputable media coverage, or direct communication from the company. In the case of multiple companies making similar announcements, the resolution will be based on the first verified announcement. If no such technology is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Virginia's GDP exceed $600 billion by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of Virginia, as reported by the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) or an equivalent authoritative source, exceeds $600 billion at any point before December 31, 2025. The GDP should be measured in nominal terms, not adjusted for inflation. In the event that the BEA discontinues its reporting or is replaced as the authoritative source, the next most authoritative source available will be used to determine the outcome. If there is any ambiguity in the data reported by the authoritative source, such as revisions or disputes over the accuracy of the data, the question will resolve based on the most recent and final data published by the authoritative source as of the resolution date. Edge cases, such as significant changes in the methodology for calculating GDP or the redefinition of the geographical boundaries of Virginia, will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with a preference for interpretations that remain true to the spirit of the question.

title: Will there be a significant economic downturn globally due to an epidemiological event by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, there is a global economic downturn defined by at least two of the following criteria being met:

A decrease in global GDP by at least 5% over a consecutive 12-month period, as reported by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank.

An increase in global unemployment rates by at least 2 percentage points over a consecutive 12-month period, as reported by the International Labour Organization (ILO).

A significant increase in global poverty rates, defined as a 10% rise in the number of people living below the international poverty line, as reported by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP).

For the purpose of this question, an "epidemiological event" is defined as an outbreak of a contagious disease that results in the World Health Organization (WHO) declaring a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC).

In the event that multiple sources provide conflicting data, the source with the most comprehensive and recent data will be considered authoritative. If no authoritative source can be agreed upon, a panel of experts from the IMF, WHO, ILO, and UNDP will be convened to make a determination based on the available evidence.

title: Will the Democratic Party introduce a bill focused on significantly increasing federal minimum wage to $20 per hour before the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2024, a bill is introduced in either the United States House of Representatives or the Senate by a member(s) of the Democratic Party that proposes to increase the federal minimum wage to $20 per hour or more. The bill must be officially recognized and recorded in the Congressional Record. Amendments to existing bills that meet these criteria will also result in a Yes resolution. The resolution will rely on official announcements from the United States Congress or verified news sources. In the event of a dispute over the bill's intent or the increase amount, the final decision will be based on the bill's text as introduced. If no such bill is introduced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a COVID-19 vaccine be approved that provides immunity for more than one year with a single dose by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, at least one COVID-19 vaccine has been approved by either the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), the European Medicines Agency (EMA), or an equivalent national health authority in countries with a population exceeding 50 million people. The vaccine must demonstrate, through peer-reviewed scientific studies, the ability to provide immunity against COVID-19 for more than one year following a single dose. Immunity is defined as the significant reduction in the risk of contracting COVID-19, as evidenced by clinical trials or widespread post-marketing surveillance. The vaccine's approval and its efficacy data must be publicly available and verified by the respective health authority. In the event of multiple vaccines meeting these criteria, the resolution will consider the first vaccine to be approved that meets all the specified conditions. If no such vaccine is approved by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Formula 1 announce a new team entry from a major global corporation not currently involved in the sport by the end of 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, Formula 1 officially announces the entry of a new team for a future season that is owned, sponsored, or otherwise significantly backed by a major global corporation not currently participating in any capacity in Formula 1 racing. A "major global corporation" is defined as a company listed in the Fortune Global 500 list at the time of the announcement or a company with a comparable size and global presence, as determined by the latest available financial reports. The announcement must be made through official Formula 1 channels, including but not limited to press releases, official social media accounts, or a statement on the Formula 1 website. In the event of ambiguity regarding the corporation's involvement or the announcement's validity, the resolution will defer to the most recent and authoritative public statements made by Formula 1's governing body or the corporation itself. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will quantum computing significantly impact election security measures in the United States by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any of the following conditions are met:

1. A quantum computer is used in a successful demonstration to break current cryptographic standards that are in use for securing electronic voting systems in the United States, with the demonstration being recognized and verified by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) or a similar authoritative body.

2. The United States government officially adopts quantum-resistant cryptographic standards for election security purposes, as announced by the Department of Homeland Security or a similar authoritative body.

3. A peer-reviewed study is published in a reputable scientific journal that conclusively shows quantum computing has directly led to the development and implementation of new election security measures in the United States.

In cases where the impact of quantum computing on election security is ambiguous, a panel of experts from the National Academy of Sciences will be consulted to make a final determination. The resolution of this question will not consider developments related solely to theoretical advancements without practical application in election security.

title: Will the US dollar lose its status as the world's primary reserve currency by 2040?
body:
The US dollar will be considered to have lost its status as the world's primary reserve currency if, by December 31, 2040, any of the following conditions are met:

More than 50% of global foreign exchange reserves are held in currencies other than the US dollar, as reported by the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

A different single currency (e.g., Euro, Chinese Yuan) surpasses the US dollar in value held as foreign exchange reserves globally, according to IMF data.

The US dollar is no longer the most widely used currency for international trade settlements, as evidenced by reports from the Bank for International Settlements (BIS).

In the event that the IMF or BIS ceases to exist or does not provide relevant data by the resolution date, alternative authoritative financial institutions or datasets recognized by the global financial community will be used to determine the outcome.

Should there be any ambiguity in data interpretation, a panel of five economic experts, agreed upon by Metaculus Admins, will make the final decision based on available data and expert analysis.

title: Will a major political decision be directly influenced by atmospheric science predictions by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major political decision or policy (e.g., legislation, executive order, significant regulatory change) in any G7 country is officially announced and can be directly attributed to atmospheric science predictions. The decision must be acknowledged by the government as being influenced by such predictions, with evidence provided in official government publications, statements from relevant officials, or reputable media reports. The influence of atmospheric science predictions must be clear and significant, contributing directly to the decision-making process. In cases where the influence is disputed, a consensus among at least three reputable sources (academic, governmental, or major media) will be required to confirm the resolution. If no such decision is publicly acknowledged by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Japan launch a manned mission to the Moon by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) or any other officially recognized Japanese space agency or private Japanese space company successfully launches a manned mission to the Moon, where "manned mission" refers to a spaceflight with at least one human crew member aboard the spacecraft at the time of lunar orbit or landing. The mission must be officially confirmed as successful by JAXA or an equivalent authoritative body. In the event that a mission is launched but its success is disputed or unclear, the resolution will be based on the consensus of international space agencies or a designated expert panel. If no manned mission is launched by the specified date, or if a mission is launched but fails to meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics create a new occupational category for space exploration-related jobs by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) has officially announced the creation of one or more new occupational categories specifically related to space exploration. These categories must be distinct and separate from existing categories and must be designed to encompass jobs directly involved in space exploration activities, including but not limited to astronauts, engineers, scientists, and support staff involved in space missions. The announcement must be made through official BLS publications or press releases. In the absence of a direct announcement by the BLS, credible news sources reporting on the new category, corroborated by evidence from the BLS website, will also be considered sufficient for resolution. If the BLS undergoes significant restructuring or is replaced by another entity assuming its responsibilities, the decision of the new or restructured entity regarding space exploration-related job categories will be considered for resolution. In the event that the BLS or its successor does not exist by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will SpaceX successfully land humans on Mars by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if SpaceX successfully lands at least one human on Mars and returns them safely to Earth before January 1, 2031. The landing must be confirmed by at least two of the following authoritative sources: NASA, the European Space Agency (ESA), or SpaceX's official communication channels. The criteria for a successful landing include the astronaut(s) surviving the landing and performing at least one extravehicular activity (EVA) on the Martian surface. The return journey must also be completed with the astronaut(s) safely returning to Earth. In the event that multiple missions are launched, the question will resolve as Yes upon the successful completion of the first mission meeting these criteria. If no official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases, such as the involvement of other space agencies or private entities in a joint mission with SpaceX, will be considered on a case-by-case basis by a panel of Metaculus Admins.

title: Will Switzerland become a global leader in blockchain technology adoption by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Switzerland meets all of the following criteria:

1. Switzerland is ranked within the top 3 countries globally for blockchain technology adoption, according to the Global Blockchain Technology Adoption Index or an equivalent authoritative source.

2. At least three Swiss-based companies are among the top 10 blockchain companies worldwide, based on market capitalization or technological impact, as reported by Forbes, Bloomberg, or an equivalent authoritative source.

3. The Swiss government has implemented legislation that significantly facilitates blockchain technology development and adoption, including but not limited to tax incentives, regulatory clarity, and support for blockchain startups.

4. A Swiss city is recognized as a global hub for blockchain innovation, hosting major international blockchain events and housing significant blockchain research centers or incubators.

In the event that the Global Blockchain Technology Adoption Index or equivalent authoritative sources cease to exist or do not provide a clear ranking, the resolution will be based on the consensus of at least three recognized experts in the field of blockchain technology.

Fallback scenario: If Switzerland splits, merges with another country, or undergoes significant territorial changes before the resolution date, the question will resolve based on the territory and government recognized as Switzerland's legal successor.

title: Will the NHL adopt AI-powered analytics for player performance evaluation league-wide by 2025?
body:
The NHL (National Hockey League) will be considered to have adopted AI-powered analytics for player performance evaluation league-wide if, by December 31, 2024, all of the following conditions are met:

1. At least 75% of NHL teams officially announce the use of AI-powered tools for evaluating player performance.

2. The NHL central office releases a statement confirming the league-wide implementation of AI-powered analytics for player performance evaluation.

3. Publicly available evidence (e.g., press releases, official team or league websites) confirms the adoption of such technologies across the league.

In cases where specific teams have not publicly announced their use of AI analytics, credible reports from reputable sports journalists or industry experts will be considered sufficient evidence of adoption.

Should the NHL dissolve, merge with another league, or undergo significant restructuring that makes it impossible to verify the use of AI analytics as described, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the World Health Organization launch a global digital health platform by 2025?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially launches a global digital health platform by December 31, 2024. The platform must be designed to facilitate worldwide health data exchange, support telemedicine services, and provide access to digital health resources and tools for both healthcare professionals and the general public. The launch must be publicly announced by the WHO through an official press release or a formal declaration at a recognized international health conference. In the event that the WHO announces the discontinuation of the project or fails to launch the platform by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. If the WHO merges or collaborates with another organization to release a similar platform, this will also be considered a successful resolution, provided the core functionalities as described are included.

title: Will Mexico launch its own satellite into space by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Mexican government or any Mexico-based private entity successfully launches a satellite into Earth's orbit before January 1, 2030. The satellite must be launched from either Mexican territory or any other location worldwide, with the primary purpose of serving Mexican interests in areas such as telecommunications, scientific research, national security, or environmental monitoring. The launch must be officially confirmed by either the Mexican Space Agency (AEM) or a recognized international space agency such as NASA, ESA, or Roscosmos. In the event of a dispute regarding the satellite's primary purpose or the success of the launch, the resolution will defer to the official statement from the AEM or the involved international space agency. Satellites launched as part of international collaborations where Mexico is not the leading or a significant contributing partner will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will an international space mission be aborted due to ethical concerns by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, an international space mission (defined as a mission involving two or more countries' space agencies or private space entities) is officially canceled, postponed indefinitely, or significantly altered in scope due to ethical concerns raised either by the public, participating entities' internal ethics boards, or international regulatory bodies. Ethical concerns may include, but are not limited to, issues related to human rights, environmental impact, the use of AI, and the treatment of animals. The cancellation, postponement, or alteration must be publicly acknowledged by the leading organization(s) of the mission and reported by at least two reputable international news outlets. In the event that multiple missions meet these criteria, the resolution will be based on the first such occurrence. If no such mission is publicly acknowledged to be affected by ethical concerns by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will OpenAI develop an AI capable of autonomously designing a space mission by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, OpenAI has developed an AI system that meets the following criteria:

- Autonomous Design: The AI must demonstrate the ability to autonomously design a complete space mission, including spacecraft design, mission trajectory, and payload requirements, without human intervention.

- Verification: The design must be verified by an independent panel of experts in aerospace engineering and AI, confirming that the design is viable and meets current space mission standards.

- Public Disclosure: OpenAI or the verifying body must publicly disclose the AI's capabilities and the details of the designed space mission.

- Implementation Potential: The design does not need to be implemented or launched, but it must be deemed feasible for current or near-future technology by the verifying panel.

In the event that OpenAI merges with, is acquired by, or otherwise becomes part of another entity, the question will resolve based on the capabilities of the AI developed by the resulting entity.

title: Will a cryptocurrency be officially recommended for international COVID-19 vaccine donations by the WHO before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially recommends any cryptocurrency as a preferred method for international donations specifically aimed at COVID-19 vaccine distribution or support. The recommendation must be clearly stated in an official WHO publication, press release, or official statement made by a WHO representative in a public forum. The recommendation must specify one or more cryptocurrencies by name and explicitly state their suitability for facilitating international donations for COVID-19 vaccine efforts. In the event that the WHO disbands, is restructured, or otherwise ceases to exist in its current form before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If the WHO makes a recommendation for a digital or virtual currency that is not a cryptocurrency (e.g., a digital fiat currency), this will not meet the resolution criteria.

title: Will SpaceX announce a partnership with a major cryptocurrency for transactions related to its reusable launch system before 2026?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if SpaceX officially announces a partnership with a major cryptocurrency entity for transactions related to its reusable launch system before January 1, 2026. A "major cryptocurrency" is defined as one that is listed in the top 10 by market capitalization according to CoinMarketCap or a similar authoritative source at the time of the announcement. The announcement must be verifiable through SpaceX's official channels, such as their website, official press release, or statements from Elon Musk or other high-ranking SpaceX executives on record. In the event of ambiguity or disputes regarding the announcement's validity, the resolution will defer to the most recent and direct public statement or documentation from SpaceX. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases or scenarios not covered by these criteria will be resolved at the discretion of Metaculus Admins, with a focus on the spirit of the question.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US issue a decision that significantly affects the legal status of cryptocurrencies by the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Supreme Court of the United States issues a decision that directly addresses the legal status, regulation, or taxation of cryptocurrencies in a manner that represents a significant change from prior law or policy. A "significant change" is defined as a ruling that alters the legal framework for cryptocurrencies in a way that affects their use, taxation, regulation, or classification in a substantial manner. The resolution will be based on the official opinion published by the Supreme Court. In the event that the Supreme Court's decision is ambiguous or open to interpretation, a consensus of legal analyses from at least three recognized legal experts or institutions will be used to determine the significance of the change. If the Supreme Court has not issued any decision directly related to cryptocurrencies by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will any candidate from the Republican Party win the popular vote in the 2024 US presidential election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a candidate from the Republican Party wins the majority of the popular vote in the 2024 US presidential election, as reported by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or any other authoritative and non-partisan source recognized for election reporting. In the event of a dispute or recount, the question will resolve based on the final, certified election results. If no candidate from the Republican Party participates in the 2024 presidential election, the question will resolve as No. The resolution will not consider any votes that are declared invalid or are subject to legal challenges that could change the outcome.

title: Will the Republican Party hold a majority in both the House of Representatives and the Senate after the 2022 midterm elections?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, after the certification of the 2022 midterm election results, the Republican Party holds a majority of seats in both the House of Representatives and the Senate of the United States. A majority is defined as having more than half of the total seats in each chamber. The resolution will be based on the official certification of election results by the relevant state authorities and the subsequent announcement by the Clerk of the House and the Secretary of the Senate. In the event of any disputes or recounts that affect the outcome, the question will not resolve until all legal challenges have been concluded and the final results are certified. If any seats are vacant at the time of resolution, they will not be counted towards the total number of seats for determining the majority.

title: Will Russia experience a change in presidential leadership before the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, there is an official announcement by the Kremlin or a recognized international news organization (e.g., BBC, CNN, Reuters) confirming that a person other than Vladimir Putin has taken the oath of office as the President of Russia. This includes scenarios where Putin is no longer able to perform his duties due to health reasons, resignation, impeachment, or any other legal or constitutional process leading to a change in leadership. In the absence of clear, verifiable information by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, acting or interim presidents will not be considered as a change in leadership unless they are officially sworn in as president.

title: Will an AI system be officially used in Formula 1 to make strategic decisions during a race by 2025?
body:
An "AI system" for Formula 1 strategic decisions is defined as a software system that autonomously makes real-time decisions regarding pit stops, tire changes, and race strategies without human intervention. This system must be officially recognized and utilized by at least one Formula 1 team during a competitive race in the Formula 1 World Championship.

The AI system's use must be confirmed through official statements from the Formula 1 team, race broadcasts, or Formula 1's governing body. In the event of a dispute regarding the AI system's autonomy or official use, a statement from the FIA (Fédération Internationale de l'Automobile) will be considered definitive.

If no AI system is officially recognized for use in Formula 1 races by the end of the 2024 season, the question will resolve as No. In case of a season disruption (e.g., due to a global pandemic), the resolution date will be extended to include the next complete Formula 1 season.

title: Will an AI-designed component be used in a commercially available engineering product by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, an engineering component designed entirely or in significant part by an Artificial Intelligence (AI) system is incorporated into a product that is commercially available for purchase by the general public. The AI's involvement must be in the design phase of the component, contributing to its structural, functional, or aesthetic specifications. 

The product must be verifiable through a manufacturer's announcement, patent filings, or credible media reports. The AI's contribution to the design must be explicitly acknowledged in at least one of these sources. 

In cases where the AI's contribution is disputed, the resolution will defer to the consensus of a panel of three experts in the field of AI and engineering, selected by a recognized authority in AI research. 

If no such component is commercially available by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will South Korea deploy an AI system for national defense purposes by 2025?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the South Korean government or any of its defense agencies officially announces the deployment of an AI system specifically for national defense purposes. The AI system must be described as having capabilities that include, but are not limited to, autonomous decision-making in real-time defense operations, strategic planning assistance, or cyber defense enhancements. The announcement must be verifiable through official government or defense agency press releases, public records, or statements in reputable media outlets. In the event of ambiguous or partial deployment announcements, the resolution will consider the most comprehensive and detailed descriptions available at the time of resolution. If no such system is publicly acknowledged by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases, such as AI systems deployed for dual civilian and defense purposes, will be evaluated based on the primary function as described in official sources. If no clear primary function can be determined, the question will resolve as ambiguous and further clarification will be sought from authoritative sources.

title: Will an AI system be officially used to make real-time decisions in NBA games by 2030?
body: An "AI system" for the purposes of this question is defined as a software system capable of making real-time decisions regarding game rulings, player substitutions, and strategy adjustments during NBA games. This system must be officially recognized and utilized by the NBA or an NBA-affiliated league for at least one full regular season or playoff game. The AI's decisions must directly influence game outcomes, including but not limited to foul calls, player substitutions, and play calls. Verification of the AI system's use will be based on official NBA announcements, game broadcasts, and credible media reports. In the event that multiple AI systems are implemented, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first system's official game use. If the NBA ceases to exist or merges with another league, the question will resolve based on the use of an AI system within the successor organization's games, if applicable.

title: Will the NBA implement a blockchain-based ticketing system by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the National Basketball Association (NBA) has officially announced and implemented a blockchain-based system for the distribution and management of tickets for its games. The system must be in active use for at least one full NBA season, providing a secure, decentralized method for purchasing, selling, and transferring tickets. The resolution will rely on official statements from the NBA, press releases, or credible news sources confirming the system's implementation and use. In the absence of such an announcement, the question will resolve as No. If the NBA announces the implementation of a blockchain-based ticketing system but it is not in use for a full season by the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No. Edge cases, such as a partial implementation for select games or a pilot program, will not be considered as meeting the criteria unless the NBA explicitly states that these are the first steps of a full-scale implementation.

title: Will the NFL adopt helmet technology that can detect concussions in real-time by 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1, 2028, the National Football League (NFL) has officially adopted and implemented helmet technology capable of detecting concussions in real-time during official games. The technology must be able to accurately identify and alert medical staff of potential concussions immediately after they occur, with a verification process involving at least two independent medical studies confirming its accuracy and reliability. The adoption refers to the use of this technology across all NFL teams during regular season and playoff games. In the event that the NFL ceases to exist or merges with another league, the question will resolve based on the actions of the successor organization. If no such technology has been adopted by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an AI system be developed to predict epidemics with over 90% accuracy before 2030?
body: An "AI system" for predicting epidemics is defined as a software solution capable of forecasting the outbreak, spread, and containment of infectious diseases worldwide with a minimum accuracy of 90% over a 12-month prediction horizon. This accuracy must be validated by at least two independent studies published in peer-reviewed scientific journals or reports from recognized health organizations (e.g., WHO, CDC). The system must demonstrate its predictive capabilities across multiple diseases and geographies, with its results being publicly accessible and verified by the aforementioned entities. Predictions must include, but are not limited to, the timing of the outbreak, regions affected, estimated scale (number of cases), and duration of the epidemic. The system should also provide actionable insights for prevention and containment strategies. In the event that multiple systems meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first system's public acknowledgment of achieving the stated accuracy.

title: Will Amazon deploy an AI-based customer service system capable of handling over 50% of customer interactions autonomously by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Amazon has deployed an AI-based customer service system that autonomously handles more than 50% of all customer service interactions, including but not limited to inquiries, complaints, and transaction processing. The system must be capable of understanding and responding to customer needs without human intervention for the majority of interactions. Verification will be based on official statements from Amazon, credible news reports, or financial filings that confirm the system's deployment and its autonomous handling rate. In the absence of direct evidence, credible industry analyses or expert consensus may be considered. If Amazon splits, merges, or undergoes significant corporate restructuring, the question will resolve based on the entity inheriting the customer service operations.

title: Will the Biden administration implement a major AI initiative for national security purposes before the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2024, the Biden administration officially announces and begins the implementation of a major artificial intelligence (AI) initiative aimed at enhancing national security. The initiative must be distinct and substantial, involving significant funding (exceeding $1 billion USD) or a comprehensive strategy that includes the development, deployment, and integration of AI technologies into national security operations. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the White House, Department of Defense, or National Security Council. In the case of ambiguity regarding the initiative's scale or focus, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative public statements available. If the initiative is announced but not clearly underway by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with a preference for direct government statements and documented evidence of implementation.

title: Will the global renewable energy capacity exceed 3 terawatts by the end of 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, according to the International Energy Agency (IEA) or an equivalent authoritative body, the total installed capacity of renewable energy sources (including solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, and biomass) worldwide exceeds 3 terawatts (TW) by December 31, 2030. Renewable energy capacity installed in all contexts (commercial, residential, and utility-scale) will be considered. 

In the event that the IEA discontinues its reporting or is otherwise unable to provide the necessary data, this question will resolve based on the most reliable and comprehensive data available from other authoritative sources, such as the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) or the Renewable Energy Policy Network for the 21st Century (REN21). 

Should there be any discrepancies in data reporting between authoritative sources, the source providing the most detailed and comprehensive data set will be used for resolution. 

Edge cases, such as the reclassification of energy sources (e.g., if a new technology is widely recognized as renewable but was not considered as such by the end of 2020), will be considered on a case-by-case basis by a panel of experts in the field, whose decision will be final.

title: Will a major tech company publicly denounce climate change denial as a threat to technological progress before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a major tech company (defined as a company with a market capitalization of over $100 billion USD or a global workforce of over 50,000 employees) publicly denounces climate change denial as a threat to technological progress. The denouncement must be made through an official statement released on the company's primary communication channels (e.g., official website, press release, or an official social media account) and must explicitly mention "climate change denial" as a threat to "technological progress." In the event of ambiguity or disputes over the interpretation of a statement, the resolution will be based on the consensus of at least three reputable media outlets' coverage. If no such denouncement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration approve a digital health device for diabetes management that uses artificial intelligence before the end of 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2025, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approves a digital health device for diabetes management that utilizes artificial intelligence (AI). The device must meet the following criteria:

- It must be primarily AI-driven, with the AI component playing a central role in the device's operation and decision-making processes.
- The device must be intended for consumer use outside of a clinical setting.
- Approval must be for a new device, not an update or modification of an existing product.
- The approval must be a full approval, not an emergency use authorization or a conditional approval.

The resolution will be based on official announcements from the FDA or the device's manufacturer. In the absence of clear public announcements, credible news sources reporting on the approval will be considered sufficient. If multiple devices meet these criteria before the end date, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first device's approval.

title: Will SpaceX successfully land a crewed mission on Mars before 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if SpaceX successfully lands at least one crewed spacecraft on Mars before January 1, 2030. The criteria for a successful landing include:

All crew members must survive the landing and be able to perform at least one EVA (Extravehicular Activity) on the Martian surface.
The spacecraft must land on Mars as confirmed by at least two independent and authoritative sources, such as NASA, ESA (European Space Agency), or a recognized scientific journal.
A successful return mission from Mars to Earth is not required for this question to resolve as Yes, but the ability to communicate with Earth post-landing must be demonstrated.
In the event that SpaceX merges with, is acquired by, or otherwise becomes part of another entity, the mission must still be primarily attributed to SpaceX's efforts and technology.
If no crewed SpaceX mission attempts a Mars landing before the deadline, the question will resolve as No.
Edge case resolution: If a landing occurs but communication is lost immediately upon landing and before any EVA is performed, the question will resolve as No unless conclusive evidence of the crew's survival and EVA capability is later provided.

title: Will Australia launch its own sovereign satellite navigation system by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the Australian government, or any entity officially sanctioned by the Australian government, successfully launches and operationalizes a satellite navigation system distinct from existing systems (e.g., GPS, GLONASS, Galileo, BeiDou) by December 31, 2030. The system must be declared fully operational and capable of providing independent navigation services to civilian and/or military users within Australia and potentially to other countries. 

The resolution will rely on official announcements from the Australian government or the responsible entity, as well as verification from recognized international space or satellite navigation authorities. In the absence of clear public announcements or in the case of partial deployment (e.g., some satellites launched but the system not fully operational), the question will resolve as No. 

In the event that the project is officially canceled, postponed beyond 2030, or transitions to a collaboration using existing satellite systems without developing a unique Australian system, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will a major global IT company experience a data breach affecting over 100 million users before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a data breach is publicly confirmed by either the affected company, a reputable cybersecurity firm, or a major news outlet to have exposed the personal data of over 100 million users of a single, identifiable global IT company. The breach must involve unauthorized access to personal data such as names, email addresses, passwords, or financial information. The data breach must be distinct and not a cumulative total of smaller breaches over time. In the absence of a public confirmation, credible reports from multiple independent and reputable cybersecurity researchers or news outlets will be considered sufficient for resolution. If the company in question disputes the claim but the evidence is overwhelmingly in favor of a breach having occurred, the question will resolve as Yes. In cases where the data number is close to 100 million but not definitively over, a margin of error of 1% will be allowed for the resolution.

title: Will the US Senate pass a significant piece of legislation specifically addressing climate change by the end of 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the US Senate has passed a bill that meets the following criteria:

- The bill is specifically focused on addressing climate change, including but not limited to greenhouse gas emissions reduction, renewable energy expansion, and climate resilience and adaptation measures.
- The bill must be significant, defined as allocating at least $10 billion in funding towards climate change initiatives or introducing substantial regulatory changes aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
- The bill must be signed into law by the President of the United States.

For the purpose of this question, "significant piece of legislation" will be determined based on the allocated funding, scope of regulatory changes, and potential impact on climate change mitigation and adaptation efforts. The resolution will rely on official legislative records and statements from the US Congress and the White House as authoritative sources. In the event of ambiguity or dispute regarding the significance or focus of the legislation, a panel of experts from environmental policy organizations will be consulted to make a final determination.

title: Will a major scientific breakthrough in renewable energy technology be attributed to research conducted in Virginia by the end of 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major scientific breakthrough in renewable energy technology is officially recognized and attributed to research conducted in Virginia. A "major scientific breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that significantly enhances the efficiency, cost-effectiveness, or sustainability of renewable energy sources, such as solar, wind, hydroelectric, or geothermal energy. The breakthrough must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or officially recognized by a leading global energy organization (e.g., International Renewable Energy Agency, World Energy Council). The breakthrough should represent a clear advancement beyond the current state of the art and have the potential for widespread application or significant impact on the renewable energy sector. In the case of multiple claims, the earliest documented and verified discovery will be considered. If no such breakthrough is publicly recognized by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will California implement a state-wide ban on single-use plastics in retail stores by the end of 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the state of California has enacted legislation or regulations that prohibit the distribution, sale, and use of single-use plastic items (such as bags, straws, cutlery, plates, and bottles) in retail stores across the entire state. The ban must apply to all retail establishments, including but not limited to supermarkets, convenience stores, and restaurants offering takeout. 

For the purpose of this question, "single-use plastics" are defined as plastic products that are designed to be used once before they are thrown away or recycled. This includes biodegradable plastics if they are intended for single use. 

The resolution will rely on official statements from the California State Legislature, the Governor of California, or any relevant state department tasked with environmental regulation. In the event that partial bans are implemented in a way that does not cover the entire state or all specified single-use plastic items, the question will resolve as No. 

In case of ambiguity regarding the implementation or scope of the ban, the question will resolve based on the most comprehensive and authoritative source available at the time of resolution.

title: Will quantum computing technology be utilized to significantly improve the accuracy of space weather forecasting by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is at least one instance where quantum computing technology has been utilized to improve the accuracy of space weather forecasting significantly. Significant improvement is defined as a 20% or greater increase in forecasting accuracy compared to the best available conventional methods as of 2023. The improvement must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or officially recognized by a major space weather forecasting authority, such as the NOAA Space Weather Prediction Center or the European Space Agency. In the event of conflicting reports about the improvement's significance, the majority consensus within the scientific community will be considered. If no such consensus can be reached, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases, such as improvements in related fields that indirectly benefit space weather forecasting, will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) issue guidelines for the prevention of infectious disease transmission on manned space missions by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has officially published guidelines specifically aimed at the prevention of infectious disease transmission on manned space missions. These guidelines must be accessible through the CDC's official website or through an official press release by the CDC. The guidelines should cover preventive measures, diagnosis, and treatment protocols for infectious diseases in the context of manned space missions. In the event that the CDC merges with another entity or its responsibilities are significantly altered, the resolution will be based on the actions of the successor organization or the entity assuming those responsibilities.

metadata.tags: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

title: Will the Republican Party introduce a major economic policy proposal focused on reducing the national debt before the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2024, the Republican Party officially introduces a major economic policy proposal specifically aimed at reducing the national debt of the United States. The proposal must be formally presented by a current Republican member of Congress or a Republican Presidential candidate and must include specific measures intended to significantly reduce the national debt within a 10-year period. The policy proposal must be detailed enough to allow for a clear analysis of its potential impact on the national debt, including estimated reductions in dollar terms or as a percentage of the GDP. The introduction of the policy must be widely reported by at least three major news outlets (e.g., The New York Times, The Washington Post, CNN) and must include a formal announcement or publication of the policy details. In the event that multiple proposals are introduced, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. If no such proposal is introduced by the specified date, or if the proposals introduced do not meet the detailed criteria, the question will resolve as No. In case of ambiguity or dispute over the proposal's significance or details, the resolution will be based on the consensus of a panel of economic experts.

title: Will Germany enter a recession, as defined by two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth, before the end of 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Germany experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point before December 31, 2023, according to data released by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany (Statistisches Bundesamt Deutschland). The GDP growth rates must be based on the final, not preliminary, quarterly national accounts data. If the relevant data for the fourth quarter of 2023 is not published by the resolution date, the question will resolve using the most recently available data. In the event of a revision of previously published data after the resolution date that would change the outcome, the resolution will not be affected.

title: Will the NHL announce a new expansion team to be added to the league before the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the National Hockey League (NHL) officially announces the addition of a new expansion team to the league before January 1, 2026. The announcement must be made through an official NHL press release or a public statement by the NHL Commissioner. The resolution will consider the establishment of a new team, not the relocation of an existing team. In the event that the NHL announces the addition of more than one expansion team, the question will still resolve as Yes. If the NHL dissolves or merges with another league before this date, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, "official announcement" refers to a communication made on official NHL platforms, including but not limited to the NHL website, official social media accounts, or a press conference specifically convened for this announcement.

title: Will the US dollar be involved in over 80% of global cryptocurrency transactions by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, over 80% of global cryptocurrency transactions (by volume) are conducted in, or directly tied to, the US dollar. Transactions include but are not limited to trades, purchases, and exchanges involving cryptocurrencies and tokens. The assessment will be based on data reported by a selection of leading cryptocurrency exchanges and financial analysis firms, including but not limited to Coinbase, Binance, and Chainalysis. The percentage will be calculated as the total US dollar volume over the total global cryptocurrency transaction volume. Transactions involving stablecoins pegged to the US dollar, such as USDT (Tether), USDC (Circle), and BUSD (Binance USD), will be included in the calculation. In the event of discrepancies between sources, the average of the reported percentages from the three mentioned sources will be used. Edge cases, such as transactions involving multiple currencies where the US dollar is one of the currencies, will be counted towards the US dollar's volume. If reliable data from the specified sources is not available, the resolution will be based on the best available data from reputable financial news outlets and market analysis reports.

title: Will the first direct image of an exoplanet's surface be captured by astronomers by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, astronomers have captured and publicly released a direct image of an exoplanet's surface, where a "direct image" is defined as an image obtained without the use of indirect methods such as transit photometry or radial velocity measurements. The image must clearly depict surface features such as continents, oceans, or ice caps, and must be verified by at least two independent and reputable astronomical institutions (e.g., NASA, ESA, or a similar level of authority). In the event that multiple claims of direct imaging are made, the question will resolve in favor of the first verified claim. If no such image has been publicly released by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In cases where verification is pending as of the resolution date, the question will remain open until a conclusive verification is provided or until it is clear that no verification will be forthcoming.

title: Will a candidate with a technology-focused platform win the 2024 US Presidential Elections?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a candidate whose campaign platform primarily focuses on technology (including but not limited to digital infrastructure, cybersecurity, artificial intelligence regulation, and technology education) wins the 2024 US Presidential Election. The candidate's platform must be clearly documented in major media outlets, official campaign materials, or public statements and must be recognized as technology-focused by at least two major technology news platforms (e.g., Wired, TechCrunch, The Verge). In the event of a dispute over the platform's focus, a consensus among major political analysts will be considered. The resolution will be based on the official election results as certified by the U.S. General Services Administration (GSA). In the case of a contested election, the resolution date may be extended to accommodate the final decision by the U.S. Supreme Court.

title: Will the share of renewable energy sources in Germany's total energy consumption exceed 50% by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the share of renewable energy sources (including wind, solar, hydroelectric, and biomass) in Germany's total energy consumption exceeds 50%, as reported by the German Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy or its successor agency. The calculation of the share will be based on the total energy consumption figures for the year 2030, including electricity, heating, and transportation sectors. If the official report is not available by the resolution date, the question will resolve based on the most recent data published by the International Energy Agency (IEA) or another authoritative source agreed upon by Metaculus Admins. In the event of significant discrepancies between sources, the resolution will be postponed until a consensus is reached or additional data is provided. This question will not consider energy storage technologies as part of the renewable energy share unless they are directly powered by renewable energy sources at the time of use.

title: Will Elon Musk's companies collectively surpass a market capitalization of $2 trillion by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, at any point before January 1, 2025, the combined market capitalization of all companies where Elon Musk holds a significant ownership interest (defined as more than 5% of the company's total shares) surpasses $2 trillion USD. The companies considered for this resolution include, but are not limited to, Tesla, Inc., SpaceX, Neuralink, and The Boring Company. Market capitalization will be determined based on the closing share prices as reported by a major financial news outlet such as Bloomberg or Reuters. In the event of a split, merger, acquisition, or any other corporate action that could affect the calculation of market capitalization, the resolution criteria will adapt to consider the most equitable method of valuation that reflects the spirit of the question. If Elon Musk divests his holdings below the 5% threshold in any of these companies before the resolution date, the market capitalization of that company at the time of divestiture will be locked in as its contribution to the total. This question will resolve as No if the combined market capitalization does not reach $2 trillion USD by the specified date.

title: Will Germany's GDP growth rate exceed 2% in any year before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Germany's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate, as reported by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank, exceeds 2% in any calendar year before January 1, 2025. The GDP growth rate will be considered based on the percentage change in the real GDP from the previous year. If both the IMF and the World Bank report different figures for any year, the higher of the two reported growth rates will be used for resolution. In the event that neither the IMF nor the World Bank provides a GDP growth rate for Germany in any year before 2025, the question will resolve as No. Should there be a significant revision in the reported GDP growth rate after the question has resolved, the resolution will not be affected unless the revision is announced before the resolution date.

title: Will the US Senate pass a significant bill aimed at regulating cryptocurrency transactions by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the US Senate passes a bill that significantly alters the regulatory framework for cryptocurrency transactions within the United States. Significant alteration includes, but is not limited to, changes in taxation, reporting requirements, legal status of cryptocurrencies, or the introduction of new compliance obligations for individuals or entities engaged in cryptocurrency transactions. The bill must be signed into law by the President of the United States to be considered. In the event of a veto, the question will resolve as No unless the veto is overridden and the bill becomes law. For the purposes of this question, authoritative sources such as the official US Senate website, major news outlets, and official government press releases will be used to confirm the passage and signing of the bill. In the case of ambiguity or lack of clear information by the resolution date, the question will remain open until conclusive information is available.

title: Will a new class of medicine emerge that significantly boosts human cognitive abilities and is approved by the FDA by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new class of medicine that significantly boosts human cognitive abilities is developed, tested, and receives approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA). For the purposes of this question, a "new class of medicine" refers to a category of drugs or treatments that are distinct in their chemical composition, mechanism of action, or therapeutic effects from those currently approved or widely recognized. The cognitive abilities in question must include, but are not limited to, memory enhancement, increased focus, and faster learning speeds. The significant boost in cognitive abilities must be demonstrated through clinical trials and recognized by a reputable scientific or medical journal. In the event that multiple candidates are approved on the same day, the resolution will consider the first announcement made by the FDA. If no such medicine is approved by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Germany implement a nationwide minimum wage increase that exceeds 20% from its current level by 2027?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the German government has officially enacted legislation that raises the nationwide minimum wage to a level that is at least 20% higher than its level as of January 1, 2023. The resolution will be based on official statements from the German Federal Ministry of Labour and Social Affairs or equivalent authoritative sources. In the event of a redefinition or restructuring of the minimum wage system that complicates direct comparison, the question will resolve based on the interpretation of the change by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany or another authoritative economic analysis body. If the increase is announced but not implemented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In cases where the increase is part of a multi-step plan, the question will only resolve as Yes if the final step achieving or exceeding the 20% increase is fully implemented by the resolution date.

title: Will Japan lead a major international scientific collaboration that results in a Nobel Prize in Physics by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a Nobel Prize in Physics is awarded to a project or discovery that meets the following criteria:

The project or discovery must be the result of an international collaboration led by Japan, where "led by Japan" means that the principal investigator or the majority of the research team are Japanese nationals or the primary research institution is based in Japan.

The Nobel Prize must be awarded specifically for work done as part of this collaboration, not for prior or unrelated work by the recipients.

In cases where the Nobel Committee does not specify the project or discovery for which the prize is awarded, the resolution will be based on the most credible public statements from the Nobel Committee, the laureates, or their affiliated institutions.

If the Nobel Prize in Physics is not awarded in any year between now and 2030 due to unforeseen circumstances, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a player from the NHL win a Nobel Prize in any category by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any current or former National Hockey League (NHL) player is officially announced as a winner of the Nobel Prize in any of the six categories: Peace, Literature, Chemistry, Physics, Medicine, or Economic Sciences. The announcement must come directly from the Nobel Prize Committee and be verifiable through their official website or an official press release. In the event of a posthumous award, the player must have been alive at the time of the nomination. If the Nobel Prize Committee announces changes to the categories or criteria for winning after the date of this question's posting, such changes will be considered in the resolution of this question. In case of ambiguity regarding the player's status as a current or former NHL player, official NHL records and announcements will be used as the primary source of verification.

title: Will a scientific study on the physiological effects of training for the Olympics lead to a breakthrough in sports medicine by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, a peer-reviewed scientific study or studies demonstrate a significant breakthrough in sports medicine directly attributable to the physiological effects of training for the Olympics. A "significant breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that leads to a substantial improvement in the treatment, recovery, or enhancement of athletic performance, as recognized by at least one of the following: The International Olympic Committee (IOC), The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA), A major sports medicine association (e.g., American College of Sports Medicine). The study must be published in a reputable scientific journal with an impact factor of at least 5.0. In the event that no such study is published by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. If multiple studies meet these criteria, the earliest published study will be considered for resolution. In cases where the direct attribution to Olympic training is ambiguous, a panel of experts from the aforementioned organizations will make the final determination.

title: Will Taiwan hold a referendum on formal independence from China by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, the government of Taiwan officially announces and holds a referendum on formal independence from China. The referendum must be recognized as legitimate by at least one of the following: the United Nations, the United States, the European Union, or any member of the UN Security Council. The question will resolve as No if no such referendum is announced or held by this date. In the event of ambiguity regarding the legitimacy of the referendum or its recognition, the resolution will default to No unless clear evidence is provided to the contrary. This includes situations where the referendum is announced but not held due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., natural disasters, political instability).

title: Will SpaceX successfully complete a crewed interplanetary mission by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if SpaceX successfully completes a crewed mission to another planet (Mars being the primary target) and returns the crew safely to Earth before January 1, 2031. 

Success criteria include:

- Launch from Earth with a crew aboard a SpaceX spacecraft.
- Safe landing on the surface of another planet, with Mars as the primary target.
- Completion of the mission's primary objectives on the planet's surface, which may include scientific research, habitat preparation, and other activities as defined by SpaceX or relevant space agencies.
- Safe return of the crew to Earth, with all crew members surviving the journey and landing.

In the event that SpaceX merges with, is acquired by, or otherwise becomes part of another entity, the mission must still be primarily attributed to SpaceX technology and leadership. 

If no mission is attempted, or if a mission is attempted but fails to meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No.
