Authoritative sources for resolution will include SpaceX official announcements, NASA, and other recognized space exploration organizations.

title: Will Norway implement a policy to phase out all fossil fuel production by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, the Norwegian government has officially announced and enacted legislation or executive actions aimed at phasing out all fossil fuel production within its jurisdiction. The resolution will be based on official statements from the Norwegian government, legislation passed by the Norwegian Parliament, or executive orders signed by the Prime Minister. The policy must explicitly target the cessation of oil, natural gas, and coal production, with a clear timeline and actionable steps towards achieving this goal. In the event of ambiguous or partial measures, the question will resolve as No unless the measures explicitly aim to eliminate all fossil fuel production by the end date. If Norway ceases to exist as a sovereign nation or undergoes significant territorial changes that impact its ability to enforce such policies, the question will resolve as N/A. External verification by international bodies such as the United Nations or the European Union may be considered in case of disputes regarding the implementation or authenticity of the policy.

title: Will Microsoft release an AI-powered coding assistant capable of writing production-level code by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Microsoft has officially announced and released an AI-powered coding assistant that meets the following criteria:

- The assistant can autonomously write, debug, and optimize code for at least three major programming languages (e.g., Python, Java, C#).
- It demonstrates the ability to understand and implement complex programming tasks from natural language descriptions.
- The assistant is integrated into at least one major Integrated Development Environment (IDE) or code editor (e.g., Visual Studio, Visual Studio Code, Eclipse).
- Its capabilities are verified through either a public demonstration, peer-reviewed publication, or an official statement from Microsoft.
- The assistant must be available for commercial or public use, not limited to internal Microsoft use or a closed beta.

In the event that Microsoft announces the discontinuation of the project before the resolution date, or if the project is rebranded or merged into another product without retaining its identity as an AI-powered coding assistant, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Japan deploy AI-powered robots as part of its regular police force by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Japan has officially deployed AI-powered robots within its regular police force operations. Deployment is defined as the use of AI-powered robots in at least one of the following capacities: 

Patrol duties in public spaces
Investigative assistance in criminal cases
Traffic control and management
Public safety and emergency response tasks

For the purpose of this question, "AI-powered robots" are defined as autonomous or semi-autonomous machines capable of performing tasks typically requiring human intelligence, such as decision-making, speech recognition, and problem-solving, without direct human intervention. 

The resolution will be based on official statements from the Japanese National Police Agency, government press releases, or credible news sources. In the event of ambiguous or conflicting information, the question will be resolved by a panel of experts in robotics, AI, and law enforcement.

title: Will Major League Baseball (MLB) implement AI umpires for calling balls and strikes in official games by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Major League Baseball (MLB) has officially announced and implemented the use of artificial intelligence (AI) systems for the purpose of calling balls and strikes in at least one official MLB game. The AI system must be recognized and approved by the MLB and must have been used in real game conditions during the regular season or playoffs. The resolution will be based on official statements from the MLB, news reports from reputable sports news organizations, or direct observation of AI umpire usage in games. In the event that the MLB announces the intention to use AI umpires but does not implement them by the resolution date, or if the implementation is only for exhibition or non-official games, the question will resolve as No. If the MLB ceases operations before the resolution date, the question will resolve as N/A.

title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics release a report focusing on employment trends in the space exploration sector by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) releases a report specifically focusing on employment trends within the space exploration sector, including but not limited to job growth, salary trends, and employment demographics, by December 31, 2024. The report must be publicly accessible through the BLS website or an official BLS press release. In the event that the BLS is dissolved or its responsibilities significantly restructured before this date, the question will resolve as No. If the BLS merges with another governmental body or its functions are transferred to another agency, the resolution will depend on whether the successor agency releases a report meeting the above criteria by the specified date.

title: Will a private space company sponsor an NBA team by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a private space company (defined as a company whose primary business involves the development, manufacture, or operation of spacecraft and/or space exploration technologies) has officially announced or is confirmed to be the primary sponsor of an NBA team. The sponsorship must be for at least one full NBA season and include the company's branding on the team's game uniforms. Confirmation can come from official press releases, verified media reports, or direct confirmation from the NBA or the involved space company. In the event of a dispute over whether a company qualifies as a "private space company," the decision will be made based on the company's primary business activities as of the date of the announcement. If no such sponsorship is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US rule on a case involving AI personhood by 2030?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Supreme Court of the United States has issued a ruling on a case that directly involves the legal personhood of Artificial Intelligence (AI) systems. This includes any decision that addresses whether AI systems can possess legal rights similar to those of human beings or corporations, or if they can be held legally accountable for their actions in a manner akin to human or corporate entities. The resolution will be based on official court documents or statements from the Supreme Court. In the event that the Supreme Court agrees to hear a case on AI personhood but has not issued a ruling by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If the Supreme Court issues a ruling that indirectly affects AI personhood through broader legal principles without directly addressing AI personhood, this will not satisfy the resolution criteria. In cases where official documentation is ambiguous or open to interpretation, a panel of legal experts will be consulted to determine the outcome based on the majority opinion.

title: Will an AI system be officially recommended by the CDC for epidemiology data analysis by 2025?
body: An "AI system" for the purpose of this question is defined as a software solution capable of autonomously analyzing epidemiological data to predict disease outbreaks, trends, and potential public health crises with a minimum accuracy of 90% as compared to retrospective analysis conducted by human experts. This AI system must be officially recommended by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) for use in epidemiological data analysis across the United States. The recommendation must be publicly documented by the CDC through a press release, official report, or a formal endorsement in a CDC-hosted or sanctioned event. The AI system should also demonstrate the ability to integrate with existing public health databases and provide actionable insights that align with CDC guidelines. In the event that multiple AI systems meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes when the first system receives official CDC recommendation. If the CDC is dissolved or its functions significantly restructured before the resolution date, the question will resolve based on the actions of its successor organization with equivalent authority in public health.

title: Will Israel deploy an AI-powered defense system independent of human intervention by 2027?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the State of Israel has officially deployed an AI-powered defense system capable of identifying, engaging, and neutralizing threats without human intervention. The system must be able to operate autonomously in real-time decision-making scenarios, including but not limited to aerial, ground, and cyber threats. Official deployment is defined as the system being actively used in defense operations, with confirmation from the Israeli Ministry of Defense or an equivalent authoritative body. The system's capabilities must be documented in credible media reports, defense white papers, or official government statements. In the event of ambiguous or conflicting reports regarding the system's deployment or capabilities, the question will resolve as No unless clear evidence is provided before the resolution date. Edge cases, such as systems requiring minimal human oversight for initiation or systems with limited autonomous capabilities, will not meet the criteria for resolution as Yes.

title: Will an NFL team sign an official sponsorship deal with a cryptocurrency platform by the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any NFL team has officially announced a sponsorship deal with a cryptocurrency platform. The deal must be confirmed through an official press release by the NFL team or the cryptocurrency platform involved, or through a credible news outlet. The sponsorship must be active, with clear terms indicating the duration and financial details of the agreement. Temporary or one-time promotional events do not qualify. In the event of conflicting reports, the NFL's official communication will be considered authoritative. If no such deal is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will SpaceX accept cryptocurrency as a payment method for its commercial space travel services by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, SpaceX has officially announced and implemented a payment system that accepts at least one form of cryptocurrency (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum) for its commercial space travel services. The announcement must be verifiable through SpaceX's official channels (e.g., press release, official website, public statement by Elon Musk or another high-ranking SpaceX official). In the event of ambiguous statements or partial implementation (e.g., limited to deposits or certain services), the question will resolve as No unless a full payment option for a space travel service is confirmed. If SpaceX ceases operations before this date, the question will resolve as N/A.

title: Will France establish a regulatory framework for cryptocurrencies that is more stringent than the EU's Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) regulation by 2025?
body:
Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the French government officially announces and enacts a set of regulations for cryptocurrencies that includes at least one of the following criteria that are more stringent than those outlined in the EU's Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) regulation:

Higher capital requirements for crypto service providers.
Stricter consumer protection measures.
More comprehensive reporting and transparency obligations.
Enhanced due diligence requirements for anti-money laundering (AML) and counter-terrorism financing (CTF).

The assessment of the stringency of the French regulations compared to the MiCA regulation will be based on analyses from at least three recognized financial regulatory experts or institutions. In the event that the EU's MiCA regulation is amended to be more stringent before the resolution date, the comparison will be made against the updated MiCA regulation.

In the case that France adopts regulations that are part of a broader EU-wide initiative that surpasses the stringency of the existing MiCA regulation, this will also result in a Yes resolution.

If no official announcement or enactment occurs by the specified date, or if the regulations are less stringent or equivalent to the MiCA regulation, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US make a ruling directly affecting the governance of US-based space companies before 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the Supreme Court of the United States issues a ruling that directly affects the governance, operational regulations, or legal standing of any US-based space company. This includes, but is not limited to, decisions impacting regulatory compliance, licensing, space missions, and any form of legal dispute specific to the space industry. 

For the purpose of this question, a "US-based space company" is defined as any corporation or entity primarily engaged in activities related to space exploration, satellite deployment, space tourism, or other space-related technologies, and is headquartered in the United States. 

In the event of a ruling that indirectly affects these companies through broader regulatory changes, a panel of Metaculus Admins will determine if the ruling is significant enough to be considered as directly affecting the governance of these companies. 

Authoritative sources for this resolution will include official Supreme Court announcements, legal analyses from recognized legal experts, and major news outlets' reporting.

title: Will Virginia be the site of a new major NASA facility before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, NASA officially announces the establishment of a new major facility in the state of Virginia. A "major facility" is defined as a site that either hosts a significant new mission control, research, development, manufacturing, or testing center that is directly managed or primarily funded by NASA. The announcement must be confirmed through an official NASA press release or a statement from a NASA administrator. Facilities primarily funded or managed by private entities, even with significant NASA collaboration, will not qualify. In the event of ambiguity regarding the facility's significance or primary management, the resolution will defer to the most recent and direct public statements made by NASA officials. If no such facility is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new major Information Technology standard be adopted by the IEEE by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the IEEE has officially adopted a new major Information Technology standard. A "major" standard is defined as one that establishes a new protocol, data format, or communication method that is expected to have widespread adoption and significant impact on the industry. The adoption must be confirmed through an official announcement by the IEEE or publication in the IEEE Standards Association's official documentation. In the event of ambiguity regarding the significance of the standard, the resolution will be based on the consensus of industry experts. If no such standard is adopted by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a breakthrough in Chemistry lead to a new form of non-volatile memory for computers by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a peer-reviewed scientific publication or a patent filing describes the invention of a new form of non-volatile memory for computers that is based on a chemical process or material not previously used for memory storage. The new memory technology must demonstrate at least one of the following improvements over existing non-volatile memory technologies (as of 2023): 

Increased data storage density by at least 50%
Reduced power consumption by at least 30%
Enhanced durability, with at least a 100% improvement in the number of write/read cycles

The publication or patent must be recognized by a leading scientific journal or patent office (e.g., Nature, Science, IEEE, USPTO, EPO). In the event of multiple claims of discovery, the date of the earliest publication or patent filing will be considered. If the technology is commercially available and meets the above criteria, this will also serve as a valid resolution. 

In the case of ambiguity or dispute over the technology's novelty or improvements, a panel of experts from relevant scientific fields will be convened to make a final determination.

title: Will a new technology emerge by 2024 that can accurately predict the outcome of US presidential elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a new technology has been developed and publicly demonstrated to predict the outcome of US presidential elections with a minimum accuracy of 95% for the election held in 2024. The technology must:

- Utilize a novel approach or significant improvement over existing forecasting methods.
- Be validated through a peer-reviewed process or an equivalent authoritative evaluation.
- Have its results publicly disclosed and verified by at least two independent and reputable organizations involved in election analysis or political science research.

In the event that the 2024 US presidential election is postponed, canceled, or otherwise not held as scheduled, the resolution criteria will adjust to apply to the next US presidential election that is held. If no such technology is demonstrated by the end of 2024 for the 2024 election (or the next election if 2024's is not held), the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Democratic Party implement a policy to regulate AI development in the US by 2030?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Democratic Party, either through legislative, executive, or regulatory action, has successfully implemented a policy aimed at regulating artificial intelligence development within the United States. This policy must be specific to AI and may include, but is not limited to, guidelines on ethical AI use, development standards, privacy protections, and oversight mechanisms. The policy must be enacted into law, signed into executive order, or adopted by a regulatory agency with clear authority over AI development. The resolution will rely on official government publications, statements from relevant authorities, and major media outlets for verification. In the event of a dispute over the policy's relevance or effectiveness in regulating AI, the question will defer to the interpretation of a panel of experts in AI policy, as recognized by major academic or industry bodies.

title: Will AI technology be used to discover a new antibiotic by 2025?
body:
Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a new antibiotic compound is discovered with the significant involvement of AI technology, and the discovery is:

- Published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal of high impact (Impact Factor > 5).
- Confirmed to be effective against at least one type of bacteria for which current antibiotics are less effective or ineffective, as verified by independent laboratory testing.
- The discovery process must involve AI in a crucial role, such as identifying potential compounds, predicting antibiotic properties, or optimizing the chemical structure for effectiveness and safety.

In the event that multiple discoveries are announced, the resolution will be based on the first discovery meeting all the above criteria. If no such discovery is publicly acknowledged by December 31, 2024, the question will resolve as No.

Fallback scenario: If there are disputes about the AI's role in the discovery, a panel of three experts in microbiology and AI, selected by a recognized scientific body, will determine the resolution.

title: Will an AI system outperform humans in creating machine learning models across all major benchmarks by 2030?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, an AI system is demonstrated to outperform human-led teams in creating machine learning models across all major benchmarks, including but not limited to: ImageNet for image classification, GLUE and SuperGLUE for natural language understanding, AlphaFold for protein structure prediction, and any other benchmarks recognized as major by the AI research community at the time of resolution. The AI system must achieve superior results in terms of accuracy, efficiency (time taken to train and infer), and resource utilization (computational and energy resources required) compared to the best human-led efforts as of the resolution date. Verification of the AI system's performance must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or officially recognized by a leading AI research institution. In case of disputes over what constitutes a 'major benchmark,' the decision will be made by a panel of experts appointed by a recognized authority in the AI research field. If no AI system meets these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Sweden launch an independent space mission beyond Earth's orbit by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2031, the Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) or any other Sweden-based entity, publicly announces and successfully launches a space mission that goes beyond Earth's orbit. The mission must be primarily funded and operated by Swedish entities, and its successful launch must be confirmed by either the SSC, the European Space Agency (ESA), or a reputable international space observation organization. 

In the case where a mission is announced but not launched by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If a mission is launched but fails to reach beyond Earth's orbit, the question will also resolve as No. 

For the purpose of this question, "beyond Earth's orbit" refers to any mission that is intended to and successfully travels beyond the geostationary orbit zone, approximately 35,786 kilometers above Earth's equator. This includes missions to the Moon, Mars, or any other celestial body or point in space beyond the defined limit.

title: Will the International Olympic Committee announce the inclusion of a space-based sport in the Olympics by 2040?
body: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) will have announced the inclusion of at least one space-based sport in the Olympic Games by January 1, 2040. A "space-based sport" is defined as any competitive physical activity conducted in a microgravity environment or outer space, which may include but is not limited to: orbital athletics, zero-gravity gymnastics, or lunar surface sports. The announcement must be made through official IOC channels, including press releases, official social media accounts, or during an IOC press conference. The inclusion of the sport must be scheduled for an Olympic event that will take place by 2048, allowing for adequate preparation and qualification processes. In the event of ambiguity regarding the announcement's authenticity or the nature of the sport, the final decision will be deferred to the IOC's official clarification or follow-up announcements. If the IOC is dissolved or undergoes a significant reorganization before 2040, the question will resolve based on the statements or actions of its successor organization, assuming it retains authority over the Olympic Games.

title: Will a professional golf tournament be played in a space environment, such as on the Moon or a space station, by 2050?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2049, an officially sanctioned professional golf tournament takes place in a space environment, such as on the Moon, Mars, or a space station. The tournament must be recognized by at least one of the major golf governing bodies (e.g., the United States Golf Association, the Royal and Ancient Golf Club of St Andrews, or the Professional Golfers' Association). The event must include at least one round of golf played according to the rules set by the governing body, with a minimum of 18 holes. The tournament must be completed, and winners declared, for the question to resolve as Yes. In the event of a cancellation, postponement, or any situation where the tournament does not reach completion, the question will resolve as No. If there is ambiguity regarding the official recognition of the tournament or its completion, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative public statements from the involved golf governing bodies.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency platform publicly endorse a climate change denial stance by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a major cryptocurrency platform (defined as one of the top 10 platforms by market capitalization according to CoinMarketCap) publicly endorses a climate change denial stance. This endorsement must be explicit, such as a public statement from an official platform account or a high-ranking executive, rejecting the scientific consensus on climate change. The statement must be verifiable through reputable news outlets or the platform's official communication channels. In the absence of such an endorsement, the question will resolve as No. If the platform retracts the statement before the resolution date, the question will resolve based on the status at the time of the resolution date. If CoinMarketCap is no longer operational or relevant, a comparable authoritative source will be used to determine the top 10 cryptocurrency platforms.

title: Will a cryptocurrency be used in a significant way to fund a 2024 US presidential campaign?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the end of the 2024 US presidential election cycle, a candidate's campaign for the presidency has received at least 10% of its total funding in the form of cryptocurrency donations. Significant use of cryptocurrency is defined as the receipt of campaign funds in cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, or other widely recognized digital currencies, directly into the campaign's official funding accounts or through officially sanctioned cryptocurrency fundraising platforms. The Federal Election Commission (FEC) or an equivalent authoritative body must verify and publicly report these donations. In the event that the FEC does not provide a clear report on cryptocurrency donations, credible financial disclosures from the campaign(s) in question, verified by at least two independent and reputable financial news sources, will be considered sufficient for resolution. Edge case consideration: If a new form of digital currency becomes widely recognized and is used for campaign funding, it will also be considered under this criterion, provided it meets the other requirements. In the absence of clear data or in the case of disputed amounts, the question will not resolve until conclusive evidence is presented.

title: Will a biotechnology company announce a breakthrough in genetically engineering organisms for space habitation by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a biotechnology company announces a breakthrough in genetically engineering organisms specifically designed for living in space environments. The announcement must be verified through one or more of the following: 

1. A peer-reviewed scientific publication detailing the breakthrough and its applications for space habitation.

2. An official press release from a recognized biotechnology or space exploration company, corroborated by independent scientific analysis or commentary.

3. Public demonstration of the genetically engineered organism's capabilities in a controlled environment simulating space conditions, with results published in a reputable scientific journal or presented at a major scientific conference.

For the purpose of this question, "genetically engineered organisms for space habitation" are defined as any living organisms (microorganisms, plants, animals) that have been genetically modified to survive and thrive in extraterrestrial environments, such as on the Moon, Mars, or in space stations, without the need for Earth-like conditions. This includes modifications for radiation resistance, low gravity tolerance, and the ability to utilize extraterrestrial resources for sustenance.

In the event of multiple announcements, the earliest verified announcement will be considered for resolution. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new infectious disease be identified on the International Space Station by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, an infectious disease not previously identified on Earth is confirmed to have been identified on the International Space Station (ISS). The identification must be confirmed through genetic sequencing and must be recognized by either the World Health Organization (WHO), the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), or an equivalent authoritative body in space medicine. The disease must be confirmed to have been transmitted between humans or between humans and other organisms living on the ISS. In the event that the ISS is decommissioned or ceases operation before the resolution date, the question will resolve based on the latest available data prior to the cessation of operations. If no new infectious disease is identified by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Russia launch a manned mission to the Moon by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Russian space agency, Roscosmos, or any other Russian entity, public or private, successfully launches a manned mission to the Moon and returns the crew safely to Earth before January 1, 2030. The mission must include a lunar landing with at least one astronaut walking on the Moon's surface. The resolution will be based on official announcements from Roscosmos, credible news agencies, or international space monitoring organizations. In the event of a dispute regarding the mission's success, the decision of an international space exploration oversight body will be considered final. If no manned mission is launched by the specified date, or if a mission is launched but fails to meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United States experience a recession with at least two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth before 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the United States experiences at least two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point before January 1, 2025, as reported by the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA). A quarter is defined as a three-month period typical in financial reporting (Q1: January-March, Q2: April-June, Q3: July-September, Q4: October-December). The GDP growth must be negative when compared to the previous quarter within the same year. 

For the purpose of this question, "recession" is defined strictly as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth, regardless of any other economic indicators or conditions. In the event that the BEA revises its GDP growth figures after initially reporting growth as positive for any quarter within the timeframe, the question will resolve based on the revised data if the revision occurs before the resolution date. 

If the BEA does not release the data for Q4 2024 by the resolution date, the question will resolve using the most recent data available from the BEA.

title: Will Italy surpass Germany in GDP per capita at any point before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, according to data from the World Bank or another internationally recognized economic authority, Italy's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) per capita, measured in current US dollars, exceeds that of Germany at any point before January 1, 2030. The measurement will be based on the most recently published data by the specified authority. In the event that the World Bank discontinues its GDP per capita reporting, or if there is a significant change in the methodology making direct comparisons impossible, the resolution will defer to the next most authoritative source of global economic statistics available at that time. Should discrepancies arise between different authoritative sources, the source used by the majority of major global financial institutions for their annual reports in the year prior to the resolution date will be considered definitive. Edge cases, such as significant revisions to previously published data after the resolution date, will be resolved by considering the most up-to-date and accurate information available at the time of resolution, even if this information is published after the resolution date.

title: Will the Dow Jones Industrial Average close above 40,000 points for the first time by the end of 2023?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) closes above 40,000 points on any trading day before December 31, 2023, according to official trading data published by the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE). The closing value must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters) to confirm the event. In the event of discrepancies between sources, the NYSE's official closing value will be considered definitive. If the NYSE is restructured, merges, or ceases to exist in its current form, the primary successor organization's data will be used to resolve this question. If no clear successor exists, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the value of cryptocurrencies collectively exceed $5 trillion USD by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the combined market capitalization of all cryptocurrencies exceeds $5 trillion USD at any point before December 31, 2025, according to data from CoinMarketCap or another reputable financial data provider. The market capitalization will be determined by the sum of the market caps of all cryptocurrencies listed on the provider's platform. In the event that CoinMarketCap is no longer available or considered reputable, a similar authoritative financial data source will be used as a fallback. This resolution criteria does not consider temporary spikes that last less than 24 hours; the market cap must exceed $5 trillion USD for at least a full 24-hour period to count. In case of discrepancies between different data providers, the average of the top three reputable sources will be used to determine the outcome.

title: Will the Biden administration pass a major regulatory bill specifically addressing cryptocurrencies by the end of 2024?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Biden administration successfully passes a bill through both houses of Congress that is then signed into law by the President, specifically addressing the regulation of cryptocurrencies in the United States. The bill must be comprehensive, covering at least three of the following areas: consumer protection, market stability, anti-money laundering (AML) standards, and the prevention of terrorism financing. The resolution will rely on official government publications and major news outlets for verification. In the event that the Biden administration is not in office at the end of 2024 due to any reason, the question will resolve as No. If a bill is passed but vetoed, and the veto is not overridden by Congress, the question will also resolve as No. If no bill is passed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will any NBA team launch an official cryptocurrency or blockchain-based token for fan engagement by the end of 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, any NBA team officially announces or launches a cryptocurrency or blockchain-based token specifically designed for fan engagement. This includes, but is not limited to, tokens for voting on team decisions, digital collectibles, or rewards programs. The announcement must come directly from an NBA team or an official NBA communication channel. Third-party reports without official confirmation will not be considered. In the event of a dispute over the nature of the token or its intended use for fan engagement, the final decision will be made based on the most direct and clear statements from the involved NBA team or the NBA itself. If no such cryptocurrency or token is announced or launched by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a cryptocurrency be used for purchasing COVID-19 vaccines directly by any government by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any national government or its authorized agency directly uses cryptocurrency to purchase COVID-19 vaccines. The transaction must be publicly acknowledged by both the purchasing government and the vaccine supplier, with evidence provided through official government statements, press releases, or transaction records on a blockchain that is publicly verifiable. Cryptocurrency is defined as a digital or virtual currency that uses cryptography for security and operates independently of a central bank. This includes, but is not limited to, Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other major cryptocurrencies recognized by the market. In the event that no such transaction is publicly acknowledged by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. If the use of cryptocurrency for vaccine purchases is announced but not completed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In cases where the transaction is disputed by either party, additional verification may be sought from independent blockchain analysis firms or international regulatory bodies.

title: Will a cryptocurrency trading platform integrate a machine learning algorithm that predicts market trends with over 70% accuracy by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, a cryptocurrency trading platform publicly announces the integration of a machine learning algorithm that demonstrates over 70% accuracy in predicting market trends. The accuracy must be verified by an independent audit from a recognized authority in financial technology or machine learning. The platform must be operational and accessible to the public, and the algorithm's performance metrics must be publicly disclosed and verifiable. In the event of multiple claims, the resolution will be based on the first verified announcement. If no such integration is publicly announced and verified by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a blockchain-based system be implemented for tracking the distribution of COVID-19 vaccines globally by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, a blockchain-based system is officially announced and implemented for tracking the distribution of COVID-19 vaccines on a global scale. The system must be recognized and utilized by at least three of the following entities: World Health Organization (WHO), Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), European Medicines Agency (EMA), or any national government health department of a G7 country. The system should provide real-time tracking information, ensure data integrity, and be accessible to the public or relevant health authorities. In the event that multiple systems are announced, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets these criteria. If no such system is announced by the specified date, or if the system(s) announced do not meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No. In case of ambiguity regarding the system's implementation status or capabilities, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative public statements available from the entities involved or the system developers.

title: Will the US Senate pass a new bill specifically addressing nuclear safety regulations by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the US Senate passes a new bill that explicitly addresses nuclear safety regulations. The bill must be focused primarily on nuclear safety, including but not limited to, reactor safety, nuclear waste management, and emergency preparedness. The resolution will be based on the official announcement from the US Senate or a credible news source confirming the passage of the bill. In the case of ambiguity regarding the bill's focus on nuclear safety, the resolution will defer to the interpretation by a panel of three experts in nuclear policy, selected by Metaculus Admins. If no bill is passed by the specified date, or if a passed bill does not meet the criteria outlined above, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases, such as the passage of a broader energy bill that includes sections on nuclear safety, will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with the final decision resting with the aforementioned expert panel.

title: Will Iran officially announce the completion of a nuclear weapon by 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the government of Iran makes an official public announcement, or if an official government document is leaked, confirming the completion of at least one nuclear weapon before January 1, 2024. The announcement or document must be verified by at least two of the following authoritative sources: The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), the United Nations Security Council, or a government intelligence agency of a P5 country (China, France, Russia, the United Kingdom, and the United States).

In the absence of such an announcement or document, the question will resolve as No. If there are conflicting reports from the listed authoritative sources, the question will resolve as ambiguous and will be subject to further review by a panel of experts agreed upon by the question's administrators.

title: Will a new nuclear medicine treatment for Alzheimer's disease be approved by the FDA by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has officially approved at least one new nuclear medicine treatment specifically for Alzheimer's disease. The treatment must demonstrate significant efficacy in slowing, halting, or reversing the progression of Alzheimer's disease in clinical trials. Approval must be for general or conditional use in patients diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease. The resolution will rely on public announcements or press releases by the FDA or the treatment's developing company. In the event of a dispute over the interpretation of 'significant efficacy,' the decision will be based on the consensus of at least three independent experts in the field of neurology or nuclear medicine, selected by a recognized medical institution. If no treatment is approved by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In case the FDA is dissolved or its responsibilities significantly altered before the resolution date, the question will resolve based on the actions of its successor organization with equivalent authority.

title: Will Germany elect a Chancellor from a party other than the CDU/CSU or SPD by the end of 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a Chancellor of Germany is elected from a political party other than the Christian Democratic Union (CDU), Christian Social Union (CSU), or the Social Democratic Party of Germany (SPD). The resolution will be based on the official election results as reported by the Federal Returning Officer of Germany or any other authoritative source recognized by the German government. In the event of a coalition government where the Chancellor is not from the CDU/CSU or SPD but the coalition includes these parties, the question will still resolve as Yes, provided the Chancellor is officially recognized as being from a different party. If the election results are contested, the resolution date may be extended to accommodate the final legal decision. In the case of an extraordinary event leading to the postponement or cancellation of the election, the question will remain open until a new election date is set and results are announced.

title: Will the NFL adopt a policy mandating political neutrality for its players during games by the end of 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the National Football League (NFL) officially adopts a policy that requires all players to maintain political neutrality during games. This includes, but is not limited to, refraining from any form of protest, demonstration, or political messaging on uniforms, equipment, or through any form of gesture or verbal expression during the game, pre-game ceremonies, and post-game activities. The policy must be publicly announced by the NFL and documented in the NFL's official rules or policy documents. 

For the purpose of this question, "political neutrality" is defined as the absence of any actions, displays, or expressions that can be reasonably interpreted as political statements or endorsements of political causes. 

In the event that the NFL is dissolved, merges with another league, or undergoes a significant restructuring that makes the original question moot, the question will resolve as No. 

The resolution will be based on official statements from the NFL, verified news reports, or official NFL documentation.

title: Will France establish a regulatory framework specifically for cryptocurrencies by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the French government has officially announced and published a comprehensive regulatory framework specifically addressing cryptocurrencies. This framework must cover at least the following areas: 

- Licensing requirements for cryptocurrency exchanges and wallet providers
- Anti-money laundering (AML) and counter-terrorism financing (CTF) compliance standards
- Taxation guidelines for cryptocurrency transactions
- Consumer protection measures

The resolution will rely on official publications from the French Ministry of the Economy and Finance or any other relevant regulatory body designated for financial oversight. In the event of a partial regulatory framework that does not cover all the specified areas, the question will resolve as No. If the government announces plans but does not publish the full framework by the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No. 

In case of ambiguity or lack of clear governmental announcement, the resolution will defer to the interpretation of a panel of three experts in European financial regulation, to be selected by the question's administrators.

title: Will a major pharmaceutical company integrate blockchain technology for supply chain management by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a major pharmaceutical company (defined as one listed in the top 20 by global revenue according to the most recent Forbes or Fortune ranking at the time of resolution) publicly announces and demonstrates the integration of blockchain technology in its supply chain management system. The integration must include, but is not limited to, tracking and verification of drug authenticity, supply chain transparency, and reduction of counterfeit drugs. The announcement must be verifiable through official company press releases, SEC filings, or reputable news outlets. In the event of a dispute regarding the resolution, the decision of a panel of three experts in blockchain technology and pharmaceutical supply chain management, appointed by Metaculus Admins, will be final. Edge cases, such as partial integration or pilot projects, will not count unless they cover the entire supply chain of at least one major drug product.

title: Will a new strain of influenza virus with pandemic potential be identified by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new strain of influenza virus is identified that meets the following criteria:

- The strain must be genetically distinct from previously identified strains, with genetic differences significant enough to be considered a new strain by the World Health Organization (WHO) or a similar authoritative body.

- The strain must have demonstrated the ability to cause human infection and have the potential for sustained human-to-human transmission.

- The strain must be assessed by the WHO or a similar authoritative body as having pandemic potential, meaning it has a significant risk of causing widespread illness across multiple countries or continents.

In the absence of a formal declaration by the WHO or a similar authoritative body, a consensus among at least three leading infectious disease research institutions will be considered sufficient for resolution.

Fallback scenario: If no new strain meeting these criteria has been identified by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major scientific discovery be named after Donald Trump by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, a major scientific discovery is officially named after Donald Trump. A "major scientific discovery" is defined as a discovery that significantly advances our understanding or capabilities in a particular field of science, such as physics, chemistry, biology, or astronomy, and is recognized as such by at least one of the following authoritative bodies: The Nobel Committee, The National Academy of Sciences, The Royal Society, or an equivalent international scientific organization. The naming must be clearly intended to honor Donald Trump, rather than being used in a derogatory or humorous context. The discovery must be named explicitly after Donald Trump, either using his full name, last name, or a widely recognized nickname that can be unambiguously attributed to him. In the event that multiple discoveries are named after Donald Trump, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first such naming. If no such naming occurs by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases or disputes regarding the interpretation of this criterion will be resolved by a panel of three experts in the relevant field of science, appointed by the question's administrators.

title: Will Switzerland become a global leader in quantum computing research by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, Switzerland is recognized as a global leader in quantum computing research based on the following criteria:

1. Switzerland must host at least one research institution or company that is among the top 5 globally in terms of published peer-reviewed research papers in quantum computing.

2. Switzerland must have developed a quantum computer with a minimum of 100 qubits that is publicly demonstrated and verified.

3. The country must have secured at least 20% of the global quantum computing market share, as reported by a reputable market research firm.

4. A Swiss-based entity must have made a significant breakthrough in quantum computing, recognized by an international scientific award or a patent that has had a substantial impact on the field.

In the event that multiple countries meet these criteria, Switzerland must be ranked first among them based on an aggregate score of the above criteria. If no authoritative ranking is available, the resolution will be based on the consensus opinion of a panel of experts in the field, convened specifically for this purpose.

In case of disputes or unclear situations, the final decision will be made by the Metaculus Admins, based on the available evidence.

title: Will Iran launch a domestically-produced satellite into orbit using its own launch vehicle by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the Islamic Republic of Iran successfully launches a satellite into orbit using a domestically-produced launch vehicle. The satellite must complete at least one full orbit around Earth to be considered successful. Verification of the launch and the satellite's orbit must come from at least one of the following authoritative sources: 

- The United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs (UNOOSA)
- The North American Aerospace Defense Command (NORAD)
- A recognized international space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, ISRO)

In the event that the launch occurs but verification from the above sources is not available, credible media reports corroborated by satellite tracking data from independent space monitoring organizations will be considered sufficient. 

If Iran announces a launch but fails to achieve orbit, or if the launch vehicle is not domestically produced, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United Nations establish a global framework for the ethical use of artificial intelligence by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United Nations (UN) has officially announced and adopted a global framework for the ethical use of artificial intelligence (AI). The framework must include guidelines and principles that address at least the following areas:

Transparency: Clear guidelines on how AI systems make decisions.
Accountability: Established mechanisms for holding developers and users of AI systems accountable for their actions.
Privacy and Data Protection: Strong protections for individuals' data and privacy.
Fairness and Non-discrimination: Measures to ensure AI systems do not perpetuate or exacerbate discrimination.
Human Oversight: Requirements for human oversight of AI systems, especially in critical decision-making processes.

The resolution will be based on official UN documents, press releases, or public statements from UN representatives. In the absence of a clear announcement by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. If the UN announces a framework that covers some but not all of the specified areas, the question will resolve as Ambiguous, and further clarification will be sought from Metaculus Admins.

title: Will the US Congress pass a bill specifically regulating the use of cryptocurrencies in the food industry by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, the US Congress has passed and the President has signed into law a bill that specifically addresses the regulation of cryptocurrencies in transactions related to the food industry, including but not limited to the purchase of food products, food services, and food delivery. The bill must explicitly mention cryptocurrencies or digital currencies and their use within the food industry. 

For the purpose of this question, "cryptocurrencies" are defined as digital or virtual currencies that use cryptography for security and operate independently of a central bank. The "food industry" encompasses all sectors involved in the production, processing, distribution, retail, and service of food products and food services. 

In the event that multiple bills are passed, the question will resolve as Yes upon the enactment of the first bill that meets these criteria. If no such bill is passed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. 

Authoritative sources for this resolution will include official legislative documents from the United States Congress and public statements from the President of the United States. In case of ambiguity or lack of clarity in the legislation, the interpretation by a recognized legal authority or commentary by a reputable legal expert will be considered.

title: Will the US Congress introduce a new regulatory framework for cryptocurrencies that includes tax incentives for investors by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the US Congress has passed legislation that introduces a new regulatory framework for cryptocurrencies, which must include specific tax incentives for investors. The legislation must be signed into law by the President of the United States and include provisions such as tax deductions, credits, or other incentives directly aimed at cryptocurrency investments. The resolution will rely on official government publications, statements from the Internal Revenue Service (IRS), and major legal analyses for verification. In the event of a partial introduction of the criteria (e.g., a regulatory framework without tax incentives), the question will resolve as No. If the legislation is passed but not signed into law by the end of 2024, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will a Major League Baseball team launch its own cryptocurrency for fan engagement by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any Major League Baseball (MLB) team officially announces and launches its own cryptocurrency aimed at enhancing fan engagement. The cryptocurrency must be specifically branded or co-branded with the team, and its primary purpose should be for use within the team's ecosystem, including but not limited to purchasing tickets, merchandise, or exclusive fan experiences.

The announcement must come directly from the MLB team or an official league source. Third-party reports without official confirmation will not be considered. In the event of a dispute regarding the cryptocurrency's primary purpose, the resolution will defer to the most recent official statement from the involved MLB team.

If no MLB team has launched such a cryptocurrency by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a significant technological advancement in cyber warfare attributed to the Russo-Ukrainian War by the end of 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is a publicly acknowledged instance or report of a technological advancement in cyber warfare that can be directly attributed to the Russo-Ukrainian War. The advancement must meet the following criteria:

- It significantly enhances offensive or defensive cyber capabilities beyond the current state of the art as of 2023.
- It has been utilized in a cyber operation or has been integrated into the cyber warfare arsenal of a state or recognized non-state actor.
- The advancement is acknowledged by at least one of the following: a government agency of a UN member state, a reputable cybersecurity firm, or a peer-reviewed publication in the field of cybersecurity.

In the event that multiple advancements are reported, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets all the above criteria. If no such advancements are publicly acknowledged by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

Fallback scenario: If there is controversy or ambiguity regarding the attribution of the advancement to the Russo-Ukrainian War, a panel of three independent experts in cybersecurity, appointed by Metaculus, will make the final determination.

title: Will the US Congress pass a major bill specifically addressing the regulation of artificial intelligence technologies before the end of 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the US Congress passes and the President of the United States signs into law a bill that is primarily focused on the regulation of artificial intelligence technologies. The bill must establish clear guidelines, standards, or restrictions that directly impact the development, deployment, or ethical use of AI technologies in the United States. 

For the purpose of this question, a "major bill" is defined as legislation that introduces significant new regulations or amendments to existing laws that have a wide-reaching impact on the AI industry or its governance. This includes, but is not limited to, aspects such as data privacy, algorithmic transparency, AI safety standards, and ethical guidelines for AI use. 

The resolution will rely on official government publications and statements from the US Congress and the Office of the President as authoritative sources. In the event that multiple bills are passed, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of the bills meets the criteria outlined above. 

In case of ambiguity regarding the bill's focus on AI regulation, the decision will be deferred to a panel of experts in AI policy and law, whose determination will be final.

title: Will the Biden administration launch a new federal technology initiative focused on enhancing national cybersecurity by the end of 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, the Biden administration officially announces and launches a new federal technology initiative specifically aimed at enhancing national cybersecurity. The initiative must be distinct from previous programs and must focus on significant improvements in cybersecurity infrastructure, policies, or public-private partnerships. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the White House, the Department of Homeland Security, or a similar authoritative body. In the absence of a clear, public announcement by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, "launch" refers to the formal initiation of the program, including the allocation of budget, resources, or the establishment of a dedicated team or office. If multiple initiatives are announced, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the criteria. In cases where the status of the initiative is ambiguous, a panel of Metaculus admins will make the final determination based on available evidence.

title: Will Canada implement a national cryptocurrency as legal tender by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, the Canadian government officially announces and implements a national cryptocurrency that is recognized as legal tender within Canada. Legal tender is defined as a recognized medium of payment that must be accepted if offered in payment of a debt. The cryptocurrency must be backed or issued by the Bank of Canada or another authorized governmental body and must be usable for all types of transactions within the country, including but not limited to taxes, public services, and retail purchases. 

In the event that a digital currency is introduced but does not meet all the specified criteria for being considered legal tender, or if it is only implemented in a limited capacity (e.g., for specific types of transactions or in certain regions), this will not satisfy the resolution criteria. 

Should there be any ambiguity regarding the status of the cryptocurrency as legal tender, authoritative sources such as official government announcements, the Bank of Canada's publications, or legal documents will be used to determine the outcome. 

In case of a retraction or change in policy before the resolution date that negates the implementation of the cryptocurrency as legal tender, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a cryptocurrency designed to fund environmental science research projects enter the top 50 by market capitalization before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a cryptocurrency specifically designed to fund environmental science research projects enters the top 50 cryptocurrencies by market capitalization before January 1, 2030. Market capitalization will be determined based on data from a recognized financial data provider such as CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko. The cryptocurrency must be explicitly dedicated to funding environmental science research projects, as stated in its whitepaper or official documentation. In the event of a dispute regarding the cryptocurrency's purpose, the final decision will rest with Metaculus Admins. If no cryptocurrency meets these criteria by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will India ban all private cryptocurrencies by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Government of India, through legislative action or executive order, officially bans the use, sale, purchase, trading, or holding of all forms of private cryptocurrencies within its jurisdiction. For the purpose of this question, "private cryptocurrencies" are defined as digital or virtual currencies that are not issued or controlled by any central authority, such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, and similar decentralized assets. This does not include digital currencies issued by the Reserve Bank of India or any other government authority. The resolution will rely on official government announcements, legislation passed by the Parliament of India, or executive orders published by the Government of India. In the event of a partial ban that only restricts certain activities related to private cryptocurrencies but allows others, the question will resolve as No. If the government announces plans for a ban but does not implement it by the specified date, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will a major political decision or legislation involving quantum computing be made by the United States Congress before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the United States Congress passes a bill, ratifies a treaty, or enacts legislation that significantly impacts the development, regulation, or funding of quantum computing technologies in the United States. Significant impact includes, but is not limited to, establishing regulatory frameworks, providing substantial funding (exceeding $1 billion USD), or setting national standards for quantum computing technology and its applications. The resolution will be based on official records from the United States Congress and verified through reputable news sources or direct government publications. In the event of a partial legislation or decision that does not fully meet these criteria but is widely recognized as a major step towards the regulation or support of quantum computing, the question may resolve as Yes at the discretion of Metaculus Admins. Edge cases will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with a preference for inclusion.

title: Will Donald Trump announce a run for the presidency in the 2024 United States election cycle?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump officially announces his candidacy for the presidency in the 2024 United States election cycle through any of the following channels: 

- A public statement made by Donald Trump himself, either in a press conference, through social media, or any other public forum.

- An official campaign launch event.

- A formal announcement via an official campaign website or through a press release distributed to reputable media outlets.

The announcement must be clear, unambiguous, and intended to communicate his intention to run for the presidency in 2024. Any ambiguous statements or speculative interpretations will not be considered as fulfilling the resolution criteria.

In the event that Donald Trump is unable to make such an announcement due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., health issues, legal constraints), the question will resolve as No unless a formal campaign is initiated on his behalf with explicit endorsement from him or his legal representative.

title: Will a significant political scandal involving information technology emerge globally by 2025?
body:
A "significant political scandal involving information technology" is defined as an event that meets all of the following criteria:

Involves a high-ranking public official or a major political party in any of the G20 nations.
Is directly related to the misuse, abuse, or significant breach of information technology systems, including but not limited to data leaks, hacking incidents, misuse of social media platforms for political manipulation, or unauthorized surveillance.
Receives widespread coverage in major international news outlets, including at least three of the following: BBC, CNN, The New York Times, The Guardian, or Al Jazeera.
Leads to at least one of the following consequences: official resignation, significant legal action (e.g., charges, trial, conviction), substantial public protests, or a notable change in legislation or policy related to information technology.

Edge cases and fallback scenarios:

If multiple incidents occur, the one that first meets all the above criteria will be considered for resolution.
In the absence of clear public evidence, credible reports from at least three independent and reputable investigative journalism organizations can be considered sufficient for resolution.
If no single event meets all the criteria by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration approve a new class of digital therapeutics for a major disease by 2025?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has officially approved at least one new class of digital therapeutics specifically designed to treat or manage a major disease (e.g., diabetes, cancer, heart disease). A "new class" refers to digital therapeutics that employ novel mechanisms of action or therapeutic approaches not previously approved or classified by the FDA. Major diseases are defined according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and World Health Organization (WHO) current listings. The approval must be for use in the United States and must be verifiable through FDA press releases, official FDA documentation, or direct communication from the FDA. In the event that the FDA is restructured or its responsibilities significantly altered, the highest relevant regulatory body assuming the FDA's role in drug approval will be considered the authoritative source. Edge cases will be resolved based on the spirit of the question, focusing on the innovation and impact of the digital therapeutic in question.

title: Will the Large Hadron Collider discover a new fundamental particle by 2025?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) experiment team or any authoritative scientific body officially announces the discovery of a new fundamental particle not currently included in the Standard Model of particle physics. The announcement must be accompanied by peer-reviewed research published in a reputable scientific journal, confirming the discovery's validity. The discovery must be recognized and confirmed by the scientific community, including but not limited to endorsements from major scientific organizations such as the International Union of Pure and Applied Physics (IUPAP) or the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). In the event of a dispute over the discovery's validity, the resolution will defer to the consensus of the scientific community as reflected in subsequent peer-reviewed publications and official statements by major scientific organizations. Edge cases, such as the reclassification of known particles or the discovery of composite particles that do not fit the criteria of 'fundamental' as understood in the context of the Standard Model, will not count towards the resolution of this question.

title: Will a private company successfully deploy a space telescope capable of directly imaging exoplanets by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2031, a private company successfully deploys a space telescope that is capable of directly imaging exoplanets. The criteria for "successful deployment" include but are not limited to: 

- The telescope must be launched and reach its intended operational orbit.
- The telescope must demonstrate its capability to directly image at least one exoplanet, with the imaging confirmed through peer-reviewed scientific publication.
- The exoplanet imaged must be previously unobserved through direct imaging methods.

In the event that multiple companies claim this achievement simultaneously, the question will resolve as Yes if the claims are verified by an authoritative astronomical body, such as the International Astronomical Union (IAU) or a similar organization. If no such body can confirm the claims, the earliest documented and verified direct imaging by a private company will be considered for resolution. 

In cases where the deployment is announced but not verified within 2020, the resolution will be extended to allow for verification until December 31, 2031.

title: Will the United States announce a space mission involving collaboration with Iran by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United States government and the Iranian government have officially announced a joint space mission. The announcement must be confirmed through official government channels, such as press releases from NASA, the Iranian Space Agency, or respective government websites. Joint missions may include, but are not limited to, manned spaceflights, unmanned probes, or collaborative research projects. Announcements made through unofficial channels or speculative reports will not be considered. In the event of a dispute regarding the authenticity of the announcement, the resolution will defer to the United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs (UNOOSA) for final verification. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new space policy significantly affecting private space companies be enacted in the US following the 2024 US elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, following the 2024 US elections, a new federal policy or significant amendment to existing space policy is enacted that directly impacts private space companies operating in the United States. The policy must be officially adopted and announced by the US government, with clear implications for the operations, regulations, or funding of private space enterprises. 

Key indicators for resolution include:

- The introduction of new licensing requirements or changes to existing ones for private spaceflight operations.
- Significant alterations in government contracts, grants, or funding opportunities for private space companies.
- Changes in regulatory frameworks that affect the launch, operation, or management of private space activities.

In the event of ambiguous or partial policy changes, the resolution will be determined based on the overall impact on private space companies, as assessed by a panel of experts in space policy and law. If no such policy is enacted by the end of 2025, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United Nations launch a new global scientific initiative focused on climate change mitigation by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United Nations announces the launch of a new global scientific initiative specifically aimed at climate change mitigation. The initiative must be endorsed by at least 75% of UN member states and have a clear operational plan, including objectives, funding sources, and a timeline for implementation. The announcement must be made through official UN channels, such as a press release on the UN website or an official statement during a UN conference. In the event of a rebranding or significant expansion of an existing initiative that meets these criteria, the question will also resolve as Yes. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the initiative lacks the required endorsement, operational plan, or clear focus on climate change mitigation, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) announce the discovery of a novel coronavirus variant with significantly higher transmissibility than previous strains by the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) or any other globally recognized health authority (such as the World Health Organization) officially announces the discovery of a novel coronavirus variant that exhibits a transmissibility rate significantly higher than any previously identified strain. The determination of 'significantly higher transmissibility' must be based on peer-reviewed scientific research or official health advisories, and should be quantified as at least a 20% increase in the R0 (basic reproduction number) compared to the most transmissible variant known as of 2023. In the absence of a clear announcement by the CDC or equivalent authority, credible reports from at least three independent and reputable scientific journals confirming the discovery and characteristics of such a variant will also be considered sufficient for resolution. If no such variant is identified or if the increase in transmissibility is not clearly quantified as specified, the question will resolve as No.

metadata.tags: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

title: Will a peer-reviewed study funded by the COVID-19 Solidarity Response Fund show a breakthrough treatment for COVID-19 with over 90% efficacy by 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2022, a peer-reviewed study funded by the COVID-19 Solidarity Response Fund demonstrates a treatment for COVID-19 that achieves over 90% efficacy in either preventing infection or reducing mortality in infected individuals. The study must be published in a reputable medical journal and be accessible to the public. Efficacy must be determined through a randomized controlled trial with a statistically significant sample size. In the event that multiple studies meet these criteria, the resolution will be based on the first study published. If no such study is published by the deadline, the question will resolve as No. Studies retracted or significantly corrected post-publication will not be considered.

title: Will the World Health Organization declare a new global pandemic by 2030?
body:
The World Health Organization (WHO) will declare a new global pandemic if it officially announces, through a press release or a formal declaration on its official website, the emergence of a novel infectious disease that meets the following criteria:

- The disease must be identified as a new strain or type not previously recognized in humans.
- It must have sustained human-to-human transmission across at least three countries in two WHO regions.
- There must be a significant level of concern regarding its potential impact on global health, as indicated by the WHO.

This question will resolve as Yes if such a declaration is made before January 1, 2030. In the absence of a formal declaration by the WHO, the question will resolve as No.

In the event that the WHO is dissolved or rendered inactive, a declaration by a successor organization with global health authority recognized by the United Nations will be considered equivalent.

title: Will Germany elect a Green Party chancellor by 2030?
