body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a member of the Green Party (Bündnis 90/Die Grünen) is officially inaugurated as the Chancellor of Germany, following a federal election. The resolution will be based on official election results and the formal announcement of the Chancellor's office by the German Federal Government or its official representatives. In the event of a coalition government where the Green Party is a part but does not hold the Chancellor position, this question will resolve as No. Should a federal election not occur before the end of 2030 due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., a state of emergency), the question will remain open until the next federal election is held and a Chancellor is inaugurated. If the Green Party dissolves or merges with another party before 2030, the question will resolve based on the status of the successor party's leadership position in the government, provided the successor party upholds the core environmental and policy principles of the Green Party.

title: Will Sweden decommission any of its existing nuclear reactors by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any of Sweden's currently operational nuclear reactors (as of 2023) are officially decommissioned. Decommissioning is defined as the process of retiring a nuclear reactor from service, which includes the cessation of electricity production and the initiation of the reactor's dismantling or conversion into a safe, non-operational state. Official announcements from the Swedish Radiation Safety Authority or equivalent national regulatory body will be considered authoritative for the purpose of this question. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear public statements regarding the status of a reactor, the question will resolve as No. This resolution criteria is designed to account for both the formal process of decommissioning and any potential delays or changes in policy that may affect the status of nuclear reactors in Sweden.

title: Will a cricket stadium be named after a nuclear physicist by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, a cricket stadium is officially named after an individual who is primarily recognized for their contributions to the field of nuclear physics. The stadium must be recognized by the International Cricket Council (ICC) or a national cricket board member of the ICC. The naming must be confirmed through official documentation or a press release by the ICC, the national cricket board, or the stadium's managing body. In the event of a dispute over the individual's primary recognition, the resolution will defer to the most recent and comprehensive biographical source. If a stadium is named after multiple individuals, including a nuclear physicist, this will also result in a Yes resolution. In the case of temporary naming (e.g., for a specific event), the name must be in place for at least one full cricket season to count.

title: Will a candidate with a policy platform focused on nuclear technology reform win the 2024 US presidential election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a candidate whose policy platform includes significant reforms in nuclear technology (including but not limited to nuclear energy production, nuclear waste management, and nuclear arms control) wins the 2024 US presidential election. The candidate must explicitly mention nuclear technology reform as a key component of their policy platform during their campaign. The resolution will be based on the official results of the 2024 US presidential election as announced by the Federal Election Commission. In the event of a dispute over the election results, the question will not resolve until a final decision is made by the Supreme Court of the United States. If no candidate with a policy platform focused on nuclear technology reform participates in the election, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Mexico's central bank issue a digital currency by the end of 2025?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Banco de México (Mexico's central bank) has officially issued a digital currency available for public use. This includes any form of digital or electronic currency that is recognized as legal tender in Mexico and is directly issued by the Banco de México. The issuance must be confirmed through official statements or press releases by the Banco de México or other authoritative government sources. The digital currency must be operational and transactions with it must be verifiable by the public. In the event of a dispute regarding the definition of 'issued' or 'digital currency,' the resolution will defer to the most recent guidance or definitions provided by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or another relevant international financial institution. If the Banco de México announces the issuance of a digital currency but it is not operational by the end of 2025 due to technical or regulatory issues, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Sweden become the first European country to fully replace its national currency with a cryptocurrency by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2039, the Swedish government officially declares the complete replacement of the Swedish krona (SEK) with a cryptocurrency as the sole legal tender for all types of financial transactions within Sweden. This includes, but is not limited to, retail purchases, taxes, and government fees. The cryptocurrency must be recognized by the Swedish Central Bank and must function as the primary medium of exchange, unit of account, and store of value across the country. The transition must be fully implemented, with the krona no longer being legally recognized for any financial transaction within Sweden. In the event that multiple countries in Europe achieve this milestone simultaneously, or if another European country has already replaced its national currency with a cryptocurrency before Sweden, this question will resolve as No. The resolution will rely on official statements from the Swedish government, the Swedish Central Bank, or any authoritative financial regulatory bodies in Sweden. In the absence of clear evidence by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US Senate pass new legislation specifically addressing the safety of nuclear power plants by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the US Senate has passed new legislation that explicitly addresses the safety of nuclear power plants. The legislation must include specific measures aimed at either improving current safety standards, implementing new safety technologies, or both. The resolution will be based on the official announcement of the passage of such legislation by a recognized government authority, such as the Congressional Record or an official press release from the Senate. In the event that multiple pieces of legislation are passed, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of them meets the criteria specified above. If no such legislation is passed, or if the legislation passed does not specifically address nuclear power plant safety as defined, the question will resolve as No. In case of ambiguity regarding the legislation's focus on nuclear safety, a panel of experts from a recognized nuclear regulatory or advisory body will be consulted to determine the resolution.

title: Will a new type of nuclear reactor be used to power a cricket stadium anywhere in the world by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2039, a cricket stadium anywhere in the world is powered at least in part by a nuclear reactor that is recognized as a new type compared to those operational as of 2023. A "new type" of nuclear reactor is defined as one that utilizes technology or fuel cycles not commercially available or widely implemented as of 2023, including but not limited to thorium reactors, molten salt reactors, small modular reactors, or fusion reactors. The reactor must be operational and providing power to the stadium for at least one official international cricket match. Verification will be based on credible reports from the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), national nuclear regulatory bodies, or major global news outlets. In the event that multiple reactors meet these criteria, the date of the first reactor to become operational and power a stadium will be used for resolution. If no such reactor is operational by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an NFL stadium implement a nuclear-based power system for its operations by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2039, any NFL stadium in the United States has successfully implemented and is actively using a nuclear-based power system for at least 75% of its operational energy needs. The nuclear-based power system must be confirmed to be in continuous operation for a minimum of 3 months prior to the resolution date to qualify. Verification must come from credible sources such as official NFL statements, stadium management announcements, or reputable news outlets. In the event of a temporary shutdown or transition away from nuclear power before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If no official confirmation is available by the resolution date, the question will be considered unresolved and will default to No.

title: Will Virginia launch a state-funded satellite into orbit by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the state of Virginia, either through its government agencies or in partnership with private entities, successfully launches a satellite into Earth's orbit before January 1, 2030. The satellite must be intended for a non-military purpose, such as environmental monitoring, educational projects, or telecommunications, and must achieve a stable orbit for at least 30 days to be considered successful. Launches conducted by private entities must be explicitly funded or co-funded by the state of Virginia, with clear documentation of the state's financial or resource contribution. In the event of a dispute regarding the launch's funding or purpose, the final decision will be made based on the most reliable and authoritative sources available at the time of resolution. If no launch has occurred by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major breakthrough in quantum computing for space exploration be announced by a company headquartered in Virginia by 2025?
body:
A "major breakthrough" in quantum computing for space exploration is defined as a development that significantly enhances the capabilities of quantum computers in solving complex problems related to space exploration, such as optimizing spacecraft trajectories, simulating cosmic phenomena, or improving communication security in space missions. This breakthrough must be:

Publicly announced by a company with its headquarters in Virginia.
Verified through a press release, a peer-reviewed scientific publication, or an official statement from a recognized authority in the field of quantum computing or space exploration.
Recognized as a significant advancement by at least two independent experts in quantum computing or space exploration.

In case of ambiguity regarding the significance of the breakthrough, the resolution will be based on the consensus of a panel of five experts in the field, selected by a recognized scientific organization.

Edge cases, such as announcements made on the boundary of the specified timeframe or breakthroughs achieved by subsidiaries not headquartered in Virginia but claimed by a parent company based in Virginia, will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with the final decision resting with the panel of experts.

title: Will Brazil establish a permanent manned research station on the Moon by 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the Brazilian government, or any entity authorized by it, successfully establishes and maintains a manned research station on the Moon that meets the following criteria before January 1, 2040:

- The station must be continuously inhabited by at least one human for a minimum of 30 consecutive days.
- The station must be capable of supporting at least a four-person crew, providing necessary life support, including air, water, food, and protection from the Moon's environment.
- The station must conduct at least one research project that yields results published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.
- The establishment of the station must be confirmed by an independent international space agency or a recognized authority in space exploration.

In the event that multiple entities claim to have established a manned research station on the Moon, the resolution will be based on the first entity to meet all the above criteria. If no entity meets these criteria by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Israel launch a mission to the Moon that successfully lands by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the State of Israel, or any entity based in Israel or primarily funded by Israeli sources, successfully launches a spacecraft that lands on the Moon's surface before January 1, 2030. The landing is considered successful if the spacecraft transmits data back to Earth for at least 24 hours after touchdown. This includes both government and private sector missions. In the event of a dispute regarding the mission's success, the resolution will be based on reports from the European Space Agency (ESA) or NASA as authoritative sources. If neither ESA nor NASA provide a clear statement, the decision will be deferred to the judgment of a panel of three aerospace experts chosen by the question's administrators.

title: Will Tesla announce a space-related project or initiative by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Tesla, Inc. or any of its subsidiaries officially announces, launches, or significantly invests in a project or initiative directly related to space exploration, space travel, satellite deployment, or any other space-related technology. The announcement must be verifiable through official Tesla press releases, SEC filings, or public statements by Elon Musk or other high-ranking Tesla executives. Projects or initiatives must be new or represent a significant expansion or evolution of existing projects. Collaborations with SpaceX are included only if Tesla's involvement is substantial and not limited to financial investment. In the absence of clear public announcements, credible media reports corroborated by at least two independent and reputable sources may also be considered. If Tesla is acquired or undergoes a major restructuring, the question will resolve based on the status of any space-related projects at the time of the acquisition or restructuring.

title: Will a candidate with a policy platform focused on space exploration win the 2024 US Presidential Elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if a candidate whose policy platform includes significant emphasis on space exploration (defined as policies that allocate at least 20% more federal budget towards NASA or similar space exploration initiatives compared to the 2020 fiscal year) wins the 2024 US Presidential Election. The candidate must explicitly mention space exploration as a key component of their platform during their campaign. 

The outcome will be determined based on the official election results as announced by the Federal Election Commission. In the event of a dispute or recount, the question will not resolve until a final decision is made. If no candidate with such a platform runs or wins, the question will resolve as No. 

In cases where a candidate significantly changes their policy platform after the election but before inauguration, the resolution criteria will consider the platform as it was presented up to the day of the election.

title: Will the development of synthetic biology lead to a breakthrough in nuclear waste remediation by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2039, there is a publicly documented case of a synthetic biology solution that has been successfully applied to nuclear waste remediation, resulting in at least a 50% reduction in radioactivity or toxicity of the treated waste, compared to its initial state. The breakthrough must be recognized by a reputable scientific journal or a governmental environmental agency. The solution must be scalable and have been applied in a real-world setting, not just in laboratory conditions. In the event that multiple synthetic biology approaches are developed, the resolution will consider the first documented case that meets these criteria. If there is any ambiguity regarding the success or applicability of the solution, a panel of experts from the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) or a similar authoritative body will be consulted to make the final determination. Edge cases, such as partial reductions that do not meet the 50% threshold or solutions that are effective but not scalable, will not count towards the resolution of this question.

title: Will Virginia decommission any of its nuclear power plants by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any of the nuclear power plants currently operational in Virginia are officially decommissioned. Decommissioning is defined as the process of retiring a nuclear power plant from service, with the plant having ceased all power generation activities and begun the process of removing nuclear material from the site. Official confirmation must come from the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) or the plant's operating company. In the event of a temporary shutdown for maintenance or upgrade that does not lead to the plant's permanent closure, this will not count towards the question's resolution. If no official announcement or evidence of decommissioning is available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Major League Baseball (MLB) adopt a policy to offset its carbon footprint through investment in nuclear technology by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Major League Baseball (MLB) officially announces and implements a policy to offset its entire carbon footprint through direct investment in nuclear technology or through partnerships aimed at funding nuclear energy projects. The policy must be verifiable through MLB's official communications, such as press releases, official statements, or documented policy changes on the MLB website. The resolution will also consider third-party verifications from reputable environmental organizations or news outlets. In the event of a partial implementation or announcement without clear evidence of action by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If MLB dissolves or undergoes a major reorganization that makes the original question moot, the question will be considered void.

title: Will Mexico establish a legal framework for cryptocurrencies that includes licensing of exchanges by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Mexican government has officially passed and enacted legislation that establishes a comprehensive legal framework for the operation of cryptocurrency exchanges within Mexico. This framework must include, but is not limited to, the following elements:

- Licensing requirements for cryptocurrency exchanges operating within Mexico.
- Regulatory standards for the operation of these exchanges, including consumer protection, anti-money laundering (AML) measures, and counter-terrorism financing (CTF) standards.
- A clear definition of cryptocurrencies in the context of Mexican law, including their classification as assets, currencies, or commodities.

The resolution will be based on official publications from the Mexican government, such as the Diario Oficial de la Federación (Official Gazette of the Federation), or announcements from relevant regulatory bodies such as the Banco de México (Bank of Mexico) or the Comisión Nacional Bancaria y de Valores (National Banking and Securities Commission).

In the event that legislation is passed but lacks clarity or is subject to significant amendments or legal challenges that prevent its full implementation by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Elon Musk's companies launch a cryptocurrency by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any company currently owned or co-owned by Elon Musk announces the launch of a cryptocurrency. The announcement must be verifiable through official company channels (e.g., press release, official social media accounts) or credible news outlets. The cryptocurrency must be a new digital currency developed or directly backed by the company, not merely the adoption of an existing cryptocurrency. In the event of ambiguity regarding ownership or the definition of a 'launch,' the resolution will defer to the most authoritative public statements available at the time. If Elon Musk divests his ownership in all his companies before this date without a cryptocurrency launch, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency integrate a breakthrough from particle physics research into its blockchain algorithm by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a cryptocurrency that is ranked within the top 10 by market capitalization at any point during the year 2030, as reported by a recognized financial news outlet or cryptocurrency market analysis platform, integrates a technology or discovery from particle physics research into its blockchain algorithm. The integration must represent a significant technological advancement and not merely a minor modification or update. The breakthrough must be clearly documented and recognized by a reputable scientific journal or institution, and the cryptocurrency's integration of this technology must be verifiable through a public announcement or technical documentation. In the event that multiple cryptocurrencies meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes for the first cryptocurrency to publicly announce the integration. If no such integration is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In cases where the status of the integration is disputed or unclear, the resolution will be based on the consensus opinion of a panel of experts in blockchain technology and particle physics, convened specifically for this purpose.

title: Will OpenAI develop a nuclear incident simulation model that is adopted by international nuclear regulatory agencies by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, OpenAI has developed a nuclear incident simulation model that has been officially adopted for use by at least one international nuclear regulatory agency, such as the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) or a similar authoritative body. The adoption must be confirmed through official documentation or public statements from the agency itself. The simulation model must be capable of accurately predicting the outcomes of nuclear incidents, including but not limited to reactor meltdowns, radiation leaks, and nuclear material theft. The model should also be validated by independent experts in the field of nuclear safety and must have been used in at least one real-world scenario or drill conducted by the adopting agency to ensure its practical applicability. In the event that multiple models are developed, the question will resolve as Yes only if one of the models meets all the specified criteria and is officially recognized by the agency. If OpenAI develops a model but it is not adopted by any international regulatory agency by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will California decommission its last nuclear power plant by 2025?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, all operational nuclear power plants within the state of California have been officially decommissioned and ceased generating electricity. Decommissioning is defined as the process of safely closing a nuclear power plant and securing its radioactive materials. The status of the nuclear power plants will be verified through official statements from the California Energy Commission or equivalent regulatory authority. In the event that a plant's status is disputed or unclear, the resolution will be based on the most recent and authoritative public documentation available. If a plant is temporarily shut down for maintenance or upgrades but not officially decommissioned, this will not count towards the resolution of the question. In the case of new nuclear power plants being constructed and operational before the resolution date, these will also need to be decommissioned for the question to resolve as Yes.

title: Will Tesla announce a project related to nuclear technology for energy generation or storage in Spain by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Tesla, Inc. has publicly announced a project that involves the development, deployment, or significant innovation in nuclear technology specifically for the purpose of energy generation or storage within the territorial boundaries of Spain. This includes, but is not limited to, nuclear reactors, nuclear batteries, or any form of nuclear fusion or fission technology aimed at energy solutions. The announcement must be verifiable through official Tesla communications channels, such as press releases, official social media accounts, or statements from Tesla's executive team. In the event of ambiguity regarding the project's focus on energy generation or storage, or its location within Spain, the resolution will defer to the most authoritative public statement available from Tesla, Inc. or its representatives. Projects that are purely theoretical, without concrete plans for development or deployment within Spain, will not meet the resolution criteria. In the absence of a clear announcement by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Brazil develop and deploy a nationwide blockchain-based voting system by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Brazilian government has officially announced and demonstrated the operation of a nationwide blockchain-based voting system. The system must meet the following criteria:

- Accessibility: Available to all eligible voters across Brazil, with provisions for secure remote voting.
- Security: Employs advanced cryptographic techniques to ensure the integrity and confidentiality of votes.
- Transparency: Allows for independent verification of vote tallies without compromising voter anonymity.
- Official Endorsement: Must be recognized and endorsed by the Superior Electoral Court of Brazil or an equivalent authoritative body.
- Implementation: Must be actively used in at least one national election or major public referendum before the resolution date.

In the event that a system is announced but not fully deployed nationwide, or if it is deployed for testing in limited areas without full-scale implementation, the question will resolve as No. If the system is deployed after the specified date, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will a machine learning model capable of passing the Turing Test without human detection be developed by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a machine learning model is developed that can pass the Turing Test without human detection. The Turing Test, in this context, is defined as an evaluation where the machine learning model engages in a conversation with human judges through a computer interface for a duration of 5 minutes, without the judges being able to reliably distinguish the machine from a human interlocutor. The test must be conducted under the supervision of a recognized authority in the field of artificial intelligence, such as the Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence (AAAI) or a similar reputable organization. The model must achieve a success rate of at least 90% across a minimum of 100 separate test sessions, with the sessions being conducted by at least 10 different judges. In the event that no machine learning model is publicly acknowledged to have met these criteria by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases, such as models that require human intervention, pre-scripted responses, or other forms of assistance, will not qualify for a positive resolution. The resolution will be based on public announcements, peer-reviewed publications, or official statements from the conducting authority.

title: Will Norway implement a fully electric public transportation system nationwide by 2035?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, Norway has implemented a fully electric public transportation system that covers all public buses, trains, trams, and ferries operating within its national borders. Implementation is defined as the vehicles being powered exclusively by electricity, with no operational fossil fuel-powered vehicles in regular service. Verification will be based on official statements from the Norwegian government, transportation authorities, or recognized international transportation bodies. In the event of a partial implementation, the question will resolve as No unless at least 95% of the public transportation fleet is electric, with allowances for emergency or special circumstance vehicles. The resolution will also consider the infrastructure supporting electric transportation, such as charging stations and maintenance facilities, as integral to the definition of 'fully electric public transportation system.'

title: Will the United Nations adopt a resolution to regulate the use of AI in international conflict by 2030?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United Nations General Assembly or the United Nations Security Council adopts a resolution that explicitly regulates the use of artificial intelligence (AI) technologies in international conflicts. The resolution must specifically address the deployment, development, or use of AI systems in a military context, including but not limited to autonomous weapons systems, surveillance, and decision-making processes. The resolution's adoption should be confirmed through official UN documentation or statements from UN representatives. In the event of ambiguity regarding the resolution's scope or applicability to AI, the final interpretation will be based on the most inclusive and direct references to AI technologies in the context of international conflict. If no such resolution is adopted by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases or scenarios where a resolution is adopted but does not directly mention "AI" but implies its regulation through terminology such as "autonomous systems" or "digital technologies" will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with a preference for inclusion.

title: Will Switzerland implement a nationwide AI-driven public transportation optimization system by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Swiss Federal Government or any recognized cantonal government officially announces the implementation of a nationwide AI-driven public transportation optimization system. The system must be operational and demonstrate significant improvements in at least two of the following areas: efficiency, cost reduction, or passenger satisfaction, compared to the state of public transportation as of 2021. 

For the purpose of this question, an "AI-driven public transportation optimization system" is defined as a system that utilizes artificial intelligence technologies, including but not limited to machine learning, deep learning, and predictive analytics, to optimize public transportation routes, schedules, and resource allocation. 

In the event that multiple systems are announced or implemented, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one system meets the above criteria. If no official announcement or implementation is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. 

Authoritative sources for resolution include official press releases, government publications, and statements from the Swiss Federal Office of Transport.

title: Will an AI system be credited with a significant discovery in particle physics by 2030?
body: An "AI system" is defined as a software entity capable of conducting research and making discoveries in the field of particle physics. A "significant discovery" is one that leads to a publication in a peer-reviewed scientific journal with an impact factor of at least 5.0, or receives a major scientific award (e.g., Nobel Prize, Breakthrough Prize in Fundamental Physics). The discovery must be primarily attributed to the AI's analysis, predictions, or simulations, and must be acknowledged as such by the scientific community. The resolution will rely on public announcements, official press releases, or documentation from the awarding organizations to confirm the AI's contribution. In case of ambiguity, a panel of experts in AI and particle physics, agreed upon by Metaculus Admins, will make the final decision. Edge cases, such as discoveries made by teams including both AI systems and human researchers, will be considered as meeting the criteria only if the AI's contribution is deemed critical and indispensable by the expert panel.

title: Will the first professional basketball game be played in space before 2050?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if a professional basketball game is played in space before January 1, 2050. For the purposes of this question, a "professional basketball game" is defined as a game that involves two teams from any established professional basketball league (e.g., NBA, EuroLeague, CBA) playing a standard regulation game under the official rules of that league, with the following modifications allowed for the environment of space:

- Adjustments to the court size and equipment to accommodate microgravity conditions.
- Use of specialized space suits designed for athletic performance.
- Modifications to game rules to ensure player safety and accommodate the unique conditions of space.

The game must be officially sanctioned by the league and recognized as a professional game. It must be completed in its entirety, and any game that is started but not completed for any reason will not count towards this question's resolution.

In the event that multiple leagues claim to have held the first professional basketball game in space, the game that is first completed in full, according to the official timekeeping of the event, will be considered the qualifying event. If no professional basketball game is played in space by the deadline, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Scott Alexander predict a major space exploration milestone on his blog before 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if Scott Alexander makes a prediction on his blog (Slate Star Codex or any future platform he uses for blogging) about a major space exploration milestone that is subsequently achieved before January 1, 2025. A "major space exploration milestone" is defined as any of the following:

- The launch and successful deployment of a manned mission to Mars.
- The discovery of extraterrestrial life through a space mission.
- The establishment of a permanent human settlement on the Moon or Mars.
- The successful return of samples from an asteroid, comet, or the Martian surface.

The prediction must be clear, specific, and publicly accessible. It should detail the nature of the milestone, the entities involved (e.g., NASA, SpaceX), and an expected timeframe for its achievement. Predictions made in jest, without clear expectation of realization, or as part of fictional works, will not be considered.

In the event that Scott Alexander's blog is no longer accessible, predictions made in archived versions of the blog that are verifiable through the Wayback Machine or similar archival services will also be considered.

title: Will the Virginia Department of Health implement a statewide health monitoring system using AI by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Virginia Department of Health (VDH) has officially announced and implemented a statewide health monitoring system that utilizes artificial intelligence (AI) technologies for at least one of the following purposes:

Disease surveillance and prediction, including but not limited to COVID-19, influenza, and other infectious diseases.
Public health data analysis and forecasting to inform policy decisions and health advisories.
Personalized health recommendations for residents based on AI analysis of health data.

The system must be operational and accessible to the public or to health professionals statewide. The resolution will be based on official statements from the VDH, press releases, or government publications. In the absence of clear public announcements, credible news reports from major media outlets will be considered.

In the event that the VDH announces the development of such a system but it is not fully implemented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If the system is implemented but does not utilize AI technologies as defined by leading industry standards at the time of implementation, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will California establish a new scientific research facility dedicated to renewable energy technology by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the State of California officially announces the establishment of a new scientific research facility dedicated exclusively to renewable energy technology. The facility must be explicitly focused on the development, testing, or improvement of technologies such as solar, wind, hydroelectric, geothermal, or other forms of renewable energy. The announcement must come from an official state government source, such as the Governor's office, the California Energy Commission, or the California Department of Energy. In the event of a dispute regarding the facility's dedication to renewable energy, the resolution will defer to the description provided in the official announcement. If no such facility is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Facilities announced but not begun construction by the resolution date will still count towards resolution, provided the official announcement includes a clear commitment to begin construction within the following year.

title: Will an international scientific organization establish a new global code of ethics for AI research by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, an international scientific organization recognized by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) or a similar authoritative body establishes a new global code of ethics specifically for artificial intelligence research. The code must be publicly available, endorsed by at least 5 countries across at least 3 continents, and address at least the following areas:

- AI safety and reliability
- Transparency and accountability in AI development and deployment
- Privacy and data protection
- Fairness and non-discrimination in AI applications
- Environmental sustainability of AI systems

In the event that multiple organizations propose different codes, the question will resolve as Yes only if one code becomes widely recognized as the standard, receiving formal endorsement from the majority of participating countries. If no such code is established by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Mexico implement a national cryptocurrency by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, the Mexican government or its designated authority officially announces the launch or implementation of a national cryptocurrency. The cryptocurrency must be recognized as legal tender within Mexico and have a framework for widespread public use and transactions. The announcement must be verifiable through official government channels, such as a government website, official press release, or public statement by a high-ranking government official. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., limited regional use or specific sector application), the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a clear timeline and commitment for national rollout by the end of 2030. If there is ambiguity in the announcement regarding the status or timeline of the national cryptocurrency, the question will resolve as Ambiguous until further clarification is provided. If no official announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a cryptocurrency become an official sponsor of a major international soccer event by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a cryptocurrency or a company primarily known for its involvement in cryptocurrency becomes an official sponsor of one of the following major international soccer events: FIFA World Cup, UEFA European Championship, Copa América, or the Olympic Football Tournament. Official sponsorship is defined as the cryptocurrency or company's logo appearing in official event promotions, advertisements, or on the event's official website as a recognized sponsor. The sponsorship must be confirmed through official press releases or announcements by the event organizers or the sponsoring entity. In the event of a dispute regarding the legitimacy of the sponsorship, the final decision will be based on the most authoritative source available at the time of resolution. If no cryptocurrency becomes an official sponsor by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a cryptocurrency be developed specifically for COVID-19 relief funds and gain significant adoption by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a cryptocurrency is developed with the primary purpose of facilitating COVID-19 relief efforts and meets the following criteria for significant adoption:

- It is officially endorsed or adopted by at least one national government or by the World Health Organization (WHO) for COVID-19 relief efforts.
- It has facilitated the transfer of funds amounting to at least $100 million USD for COVID-19 relief.
- It is listed and actively traded on at least three major cryptocurrency exchanges.

For the purpose of this question, "significant adoption" refers to widespread use and recognition within the context of COVID-19 relief efforts. The development of the cryptocurrency must be specifically for the purpose of COVID-19 relief, and not a pre-existing cryptocurrency repurposed for such efforts.

In the event that multiple cryptocurrencies meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of them does so by the specified date. If no cryptocurrency meets these criteria by the end date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Amazon develop or deploy a nuclear-powered data center by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Amazon has either developed or deployed a data center that is primarily powered by nuclear energy. The development or deployment must be confirmed through official Amazon press releases, regulatory filings, or credible media reports. A data center is considered 'nuclear-powered' if over 50% of its energy consumption is sourced from nuclear energy. In the event of ambiguous or conflicting reports, the resolution will be based on the preponderance of evidence available by the resolution date. If Amazon announces the development or deployment of a nuclear-powered data center but it is not operational by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a genetically modified organism designed to absorb or reduce nuclear waste be approved for use by any government by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, at least one government authority, recognized by the United Nations, has officially approved the use of a genetically modified organism (GMO) specifically designed for the absorption, reduction, or neutralization of nuclear waste. The GMO must demonstrate a significant reduction in radioactivity levels, toxicity, or volume of nuclear waste in controlled, peer-reviewed scientific studies. Approval must be documented and publicly accessible through official government channels or recognized international scientific journals. In the event of multiple claims of approval, the earliest documented approval will be considered for resolution. If no such GMO is approved by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases or disputes regarding the definition of 'significant reduction' or 'genetically modified organism' will be resolved by a panel of three experts in genetic engineering and nuclear waste management, appointed by the question's administrators.

title: Will a major policy proposal focused on nuclear technology be a central issue in the 2024 US Elections?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by November 5, 2024, a policy proposal concerning nuclear technology (including but not limited to nuclear energy, nuclear weapons, or nuclear waste management) is prominently featured in the platform of at least one of the two major political parties in the United States (Democratic or Republican) or is a central theme in at least three of the presidential debates. A policy proposal is considered 'central' if it is discussed in more than 25% of the total debate time across the three debates or is listed in the top three priorities on the official party platform. Verification will be based on official party documents, debate transcripts, and major media outlets' coverage. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear consensus among sources, the resolution will default to No. Edge cases, such as the emergence of a third party with significant polling numbers (over 15% in national polls) focusing on nuclear technology, will be considered on a case-by-case basis by a panel of Metaculus admins.

title: Will NASA discover a particle with properties beyond the Standard Model of particle physics by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, NASA (or any entity collaborating with NASA on relevant projects) announces the discovery of a particle that exhibits properties not accounted for by the Standard Model of particle physics. The discovery must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and confirmed by at least one independent research group. The announcement must be made through official NASA channels or a recognized scientific publication. In the event that NASA ceases to exist or is merged into another entity, the resolution will apply to the successor organization. If the discovery is retracted or disproven by December 31, 2035, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will NASA successfully launch and operate a new space telescope specifically to study exoplanets by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if NASA successfully launches and begins operation of a new space telescope dedicated to the study of exoplanets before January 1, 2025. The telescope must be placed in orbit, fully operational, and transmitting data back to Earth for the purpose of exoplanet research. 

For the purposes of this question, "successfully launches and begins operation" means that the telescope has been launched into space, has reached its intended orbit, is functioning as designed without significant malfunctions, and has begun its primary mission of exoplanet study. 

In the event that multiple telescopes are launched, at least one must meet the above criteria for the question to resolve as Yes. If the launch or operation of the telescope is delayed past December 31, 2024, for any reason, the question will resolve as No. 

Authoritative sources for confirmation include NASA press releases, official government documents, and reputable scientific publications. In the absence of clear evidence by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a former or current MLB player travel to space as a private astronaut before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a former or current Major League Baseball (MLB) player travels to space as a private astronaut. For the purposes of this question, "space" is defined according to the Kármán line criteria, which is 100 kilometers (62 miles) above Earth's sea level. A "private astronaut" is defined as an individual who travels to space on a non-governmental, commercial spaceflight. Verification must come from credible sources such as spaceflight companies (e.g., SpaceX, Blue Origin, Virgin Galactic), official press releases, or recognized space agencies (e.g., NASA, ESA). In the event that multiple MLB players travel to space before the resolution date, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first confirmed flight. If there is any ambiguity regarding the status of the individual as a former or current MLB player, official MLB records will be used to confirm their status. In the case that no verifiable space travel by an MLB player occurs before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Australia deploy an AI system for large-scale environmental monitoring and management by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Australian government or any state or territory government within Australia has officially deployed an AI system for the purpose of large-scale environmental monitoring and management. The AI system must be capable of analyzing environmental data across multiple domains (e.g., air quality, water quality, wildlife populations) and making recommendations or decisions to manage these environments effectively. The deployment of the AI system must be confirmed through an official government announcement or documentation. In the event of a dispute regarding the AI system's capabilities or deployment status, a panel of experts in AI and environmental science, agreed upon by Metaculus Admins, will make the final determination. AI systems used for limited or experimental purposes, not intended for full-scale deployment, will not count towards this question's resolution.

title: Will Microsoft release a commercially available general AI that surpasses human performance in software development tasks by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Microsoft has released a commercially available general AI system that surpasses human performance in software development tasks, including but not limited to coding, debugging, software design, and project management. The AI's performance must be validated through:

Independent benchmark tests comparing the AI's capabilities against those of leading software developers.
Publicly available case studies or reports demonstrating the AI's successful application in real-world software development projects.
Recognition by a reputable industry body or technology review panel as having surpassed human performance in these areas.

In the event that Microsoft releases multiple AI systems, the resolution will be based on the capabilities of the system that is most widely recognized for surpassing human performance in software development tasks.

If Microsoft has not released such an AI system by the specified date, or if the system released does not meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an AI system be used to accurately predict a major atmospheric event, such as a hurricane or tornado, with at least 90% accuracy 48 hours in advance by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, an AI system is used to predict a major atmospheric event (defined as a hurricane, tornado, or similar large-scale weather phenomenon) with at least 90% accuracy 48 hours in advance of the event's occurrence. The prediction must be verified by a recognized meteorological organization (such as the National Weather Service in the United States, the Met Office in the United Kingdom, or equivalent bodies in other countries) and must be publicly documented. The AI system must be the primary tool used for the prediction, and the prediction must be specific to the event's timing, location, and severity. In the case of multiple predictions meeting these criteria, the first documented instance will be considered for resolution. If no such prediction is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In the event of a dispute over the accuracy of a prediction, a panel of experts from the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) will be consulted to make a final determination.

title: Will a professional basketball player launch their own cryptocurrency by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a professional basketball player (defined as someone who has played at least one regular season game in the NBA, WNBA, or any top-tier professional basketball league worldwide) has officially launched their own cryptocurrency. The launch must be confirmed through an official announcement by the player or their authorized representative, and the cryptocurrency must be publicly available for trading on at least one recognized cryptocurrency exchange. The resolution will consider the launch date as the date when the cryptocurrency becomes available for trading. In the event of a dispute regarding the player's professional status or the legitimacy of the cryptocurrency, the final decision will be based on the consensus of reputable sports news outlets and financial regulatory bodies, respectively.

title: Will SpaceX create a cryptocurrency specifically for interplanetary trade by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, SpaceX announces the creation of a cryptocurrency designed specifically for the purpose of interplanetary trade. The announcement must be made through an official SpaceX communication channel, such as a press release, official social media account, or a statement from an executive of SpaceX. The cryptocurrency must be explicitly described as intended for use in transactions between Earth and any other celestial body or in interplanetary trade within a solar system. The development of a payment system or digital currency by SpaceX that does not explicitly mention interplanetary trade will not meet the resolution criteria. In the event that SpaceX is acquired, merges, or undergoes significant restructuring, the entity assuming SpaceX's operations must continue the development or announcement of the cryptocurrency for the question to resolve as Yes. If there is ambiguity regarding the cryptocurrency's purpose or if the project is canceled, postponed indefinitely, or not publicly disclosed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics introduce a new occupational category specifically for quantum computing professionals by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) has officially introduced a new occupational category or classification that is specifically designated for professionals working in the field of quantum computing. This includes, but is not limited to, roles such as quantum software developers, quantum hardware engineers, and quantum algorithm researchers. The introduction of the new category must be documented in an official BLS publication or press release. In the event that the BLS is restructured or its responsibilities are transferred to another governmental agency, the equivalent publication by the successor agency will be considered valid for the resolution of this question. If the BLS or its successor does not publish occupational data in the same format as of 2023, an official statement or press release confirming the creation of the new category will suffice for resolution. Edge cases or ambiguities regarding the definition of 'specifically for quantum computing professionals' will be resolved by a panel of three experts in the field, selected by the question administrators.

title: Will North Korea publicly demonstrate a functioning quantum computer by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the government of North Korea or an officially recognized North Korean institution publicly demonstrates a functioning quantum computer. The demonstration must include:

A clear, public test or presentation that showcases the quantum computer performing quantum computations, which are verifiable and significantly beyond the capabilities of classical computers.

The demonstration must be documented and verified by at least one of the following authoritative sources: a recognized scientific journal, an international technology watchdog, or a statement from a government outside of North Korea acknowledging the demonstration.

In the event of a dispute regarding the authenticity or capabilities of the quantum computer, a panel of experts from the International Quantum Computing Association (IQCA), if available, or a similar authoritative body will be consulted to make a final determination.

Edge cases, such as claims of quantum supremacy without verifiable evidence or demonstrations that lack independent verification, will not be considered as fulfilling the resolution criteria.

title: Will a quantum computer successfully break a widely used cryptographic algorithm by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a quantum computer is demonstrated to have successfully decrypted data or communications protected by a cryptographic algorithm that, as of 2023, is widely used for securing digital transactions, including but not limited to RSA, ECC, or AES. The successful decryption must be verifiable and acknowledged by at least one of the following authoritative sources: 

- A peer-reviewed scientific journal of high impact in the field of cryptography or quantum computing.
- An official statement from a recognized standard-setting body in cryptography or digital security, such as NIST (National Institute of Standards and Technology) or the IETF (Internet Engineering Task Force).
- A public disclosure from a major technology company with a detailed technical report confirming the decryption event.

In the event that multiple cryptographic algorithms are broken, the earliest confirmed event will be considered for resolution. If no such event is publicly acknowledged by December 31, 2024, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will South Korea elect a female president by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, South Korea has officially elected a female president. The election must be recognized as legitimate by the National Election Commission of South Korea. Interim or acting presidents will not count towards this resolution. In the event of a dispute regarding the legitimacy of the election, the decision of the Constitutional Court of South Korea will be considered final. If no election has taken place by the resolution date due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., political instability, natural disasters), the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major political decision be influenced by a quantum computing simulation before 2030?
body: A "major political decision" is defined as a decision made by any of the G7 countries (Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, and the United States) that significantly impacts at least one of the following areas: national security, economic policy, or environmental policy. The influence of a quantum computing simulation must be publicly acknowledged by the decision-making body or a credible news source. The simulation must directly contribute to the decision-making process, as evidenced by official documentation or statements. This includes, but is not limited to, simulations that predict economic outcomes, model climate change impacts, or simulate security scenarios. In the event that multiple simulations are reported, the first instance will be considered for resolution. If no public acknowledgment is made but credible evidence emerges after the fact, the question will resolve based on the earliest documented influence. Edge cases or disputes will be resolved by a panel of experts in quantum computing and political science, whose decision will be final.

title: Will the United Nations pass a resolution to regulate the use of lethal autonomous weapons by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United Nations General Assembly or the United Nations Security Council officially passes a resolution that imposes regulations on the development, deployment, or use of lethal autonomous weapons systems (LAWS). The resolution must specifically address the definition, use, and limitations of LAWS, including but not limited to: - Criteria for human control over decision-making in the use of lethal force. - Restrictions on the deployment of LAWS in specific contexts or regions. - Standards for transparency, accountability, and ethical considerations in the development and deployment of LAWS. The resolution can be verified through official UN documents, press releases, or statements from UN representatives. In the event that the UN is restructured or replaced by another international body with similar authority and objectives, a resolution passed by this new body regarding LAWS will also satisfy the resolution criteria. If no such resolution is passed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Biden administration launch a federal program dedicated to the development of personal AI assistants for American citizens by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Biden administration officially announces or launches a federal program specifically aimed at the development, funding, or deployment of personal AI assistants intended for use by American citizens. The program must be distinct and dedicated to personal AI assistants, not a broader technology initiative that includes AI assistants among other technologies. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as a press release from the White House, a bill signed into law, or a public statement from a relevant government agency. In the absence of a direct announcement, credible media reports citing official government documents or statements may also be considered sufficient for resolution. If the administration changes before the end of 2024 without such a program being announced, the question will resolve as No. If the program is announced but not specifically targeted at American citizens or not solely focused on personal AI assistants, the question will also resolve as No. Edge cases or ambiguities will be resolved based on the spirit of the question, aiming to determine whether the initiative truly aims to enhance the personal AI assistant accessibility for American citizens.

title: Will the Republican Party endorse a policy platform that includes significant investment in AI research and development before the 2024 presidential election?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, before the date of the 2024 U.S. presidential election, the Republican Party officially adopts a policy platform or makes a public statement that includes a commitment to significantly increase investment in artificial intelligence research and development. Significant investment is defined as an increase of at least 20% over the current levels of funding or a new funding initiative valued at over $1 billion specifically for AI research and development. The resolution will be based on official documents released by the Republican Party, statements from the Republican National Committee, or public announcements made by the party's officially designated spokespersons. In the event of ambiguity, the resolution will defer to the most authoritative source available at the time. If the party adopts multiple positions or statements are made by different factions within the party, the position of the party's official leadership at the time of the election will be considered definitive.

title: Will the US Senate pass a major bill focused on regulating blockchain technology by the end of 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the US Senate has passed a bill that significantly regulates blockchain technology. The bill must meet the following criteria to be considered "major":

- It introduces new federal regulations specifically targeting the operation, security, privacy, or financial regulation of blockchain technologies.
- It has a substantial impact on the blockchain industry, potentially altering the way blockchain technology is developed, distributed, or utilized in the United States.
- The bill's passage is confirmed through official government channels, such as a press release from the Senate or a publication in the Federal Register.

In the event that multiple bills are passed, the question will resolve as Yes if any one of them meets the above criteria. If the bill is passed but later repealed before the resolution date, the question will still resolve as Yes, provided the bill met the criteria at the time of its passage.

If no bill is passed, or if the bills passed do not meet the specified criteria, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US dollar be replaced by a digital currency as the primary medium for international trade by 2030?
body:
The US dollar will be considered replaced by a digital currency as the primary medium for international trade if, by December 31, 2030, any of the following conditions are met:

More than 50% of the total volume of international trade transactions are conducted in one or more digital currencies, as reported by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Trade Organization (WTO).

A digital currency is officially adopted by the United Nations as the recommended medium for international trade settlements.

At least 75% of the G20 nations have adopted a digital currency for the majority of their international trade transactions.

For the purpose of this question, a 'digital currency' is defined as a currency that exists only in digital form and is not a digital representation of a fiat currency. This includes cryptocurrencies, central bank digital currencies (CBDCs), and other forms of digital money not backed by physical commodities.

In cases where official reports from the IMF or WTO are not available by the resolution date, the most recent reports available will be used to determine the outcome. If no such reports are available, a panel of experts from major economic institutions will be convened to make a determination based on available data and expert opinion.

title: Will there be a significant technological breakthrough in the treatment of infectious diseases by the end of 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, there is a significant technological breakthrough in the treatment of infectious diseases, as evidenced by one or more of the following criteria:

- The development and widespread adoption of a novel therapeutic or vaccine that demonstrates at least a 50% improvement in efficacy over existing treatments or vaccines for a major infectious disease, as reported by the World Health Organization (WHO) or a similar authoritative health body.
- The successful implementation of a new technology that reduces the global incidence of one or more major infectious diseases by at least 30%, as confirmed by the WHO or a comparable health authority.
- The introduction of a groundbreaking diagnostic technology that increases the speed, accuracy, and accessibility of infectious disease detection by at least 50%, as validated by peer-reviewed scientific research.

In cases where multiple sources report conflicting data, the resolution will be based on the consensus of the most reputable sources. If no consensus can be reached, the question will remain unresolved.

title: Will an NBA player publicly endorse a scientific initiative or research project related to climate change by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, at least one current or former NBA player publicly endorses a scientific initiative or research project that is directly related to climate change. The endorsement must be verifiable through reputable media outlets, official social media accounts of the involved player(s), or official statements from the scientific initiative or research project. The initiative or research project must be clearly focused on addressing climate change, including but not limited to, research on reducing carbon emissions, developing renewable energy sources, or enhancing climate resilience. If there are disputes about the validity of the endorsement or the direct relation of the initiative to climate change, a panel of experts from relevant fields (environmental science, sports journalism, etc.) will be consulted to make a final determination. In the event that no such endorsement is made public by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major scientific organization issue a statement addressing ethical concerns in AI research by 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, a major scientific organization such as the National Academy of Sciences, the Royal Society, or an equivalent body issues a formal statement or report that specifically addresses ethical concerns in artificial intelligence research. The statement must be publicly accessible and detail specific ethical guidelines, recommendations, or concerns regarding AI research and development. In the event of multiple statements, the first published statement will be considered for resolution. If no such statement is issued by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Statements must be verifiable through the organization's official website or a reputable news source.

title: Will the number of published scientific papers debunking climate change denial increase by 50% in 2023 compared to 2021?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, the number of scientific papers published that specifically aim to debunk climate change denial has increased by 50% or more compared to the total number published in 2021. The count of relevant papers will be based on data from the Web of Science, Scopus, or similar authoritative bibliographic databases recognized for scientific publications. Papers must be peer-reviewed and explicitly address myths, misconceptions, or denial arguments against the scientific consensus on climate change. Review articles, opinion pieces, and editorials will not be counted. In the event that the databases provide conflicting numbers, the average of the reported numbers will be used. If the required data is not available from these sources by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will SpaceX successfully land a Starship on Mars before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if SpaceX successfully lands a Starship spacecraft on Mars before January 1, 2030. A successful landing is defined as the spacecraft touching down on the Martian surface intact, capable of transmitting data back to Earth post-landing. The landing must be confirmed by SpaceX through official channels (e.g., press release, social media announcement) or by an authoritative space exploration agency such as NASA or ESA. In the event of a dispute regarding the success of the landing, the resolution will defer to the judgment of an independent panel of aerospace experts. If no landing attempt is made by the specified date, or if all attempts result in failure to meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Microsoft announce a partnership with a space agency for cloud computing in space exploration before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, Microsoft officially announces a partnership with any national or international space agency for the purpose of utilizing cloud computing technologies in space exploration. The announcement must be confirmed through an official press release by Microsoft or the space agency involved, or through a joint statement made public by both parties. The partnership must specifically mention the development or deployment of cloud computing solutions aimed at supporting space exploration missions, including but not limited to satellite data processing, interplanetary communication networks, or astronaut support systems. In the event of a dispute regarding the resolution, the final decision will be made based on the most direct and official sources available at the time of resolution. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: What is the probability that a space exploration policy will be a significant topic in the 2024 US presidential election debates?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if space exploration policy is discussed in at least one of the official 2024 US presidential election debates. A "significant topic" is defined as a topic that is discussed for a minimum of 5 continuous minutes or receives at least 5 distinct mentions by the candidates or moderators during a single debate. The debates in question must be part of the official debate schedule recognized by the Federal Election Commission (FEC). Verification will be based on transcripts provided by a reputable source such as the Commission on Presidential Debates or major news outlets (e.g., CNN, BBC, The New York Times). In the event that space exploration policy is mentioned but does not meet the criteria for "significant," the question will resolve as No. If no official debates address space exploration policy, the question will also resolve as No. In the case of ambiguity or lack of clear transcripts, the resolution will defer to the most widely accepted interpretation by major news outlets.

title: Will the European Union fund a major scientific breakthrough in renewable energy technology before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the European Union (EU) officially announces funding for a project or initiative that leads to a significant scientific breakthrough in renewable energy technology. A "significant scientific breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that demonstrably improves the efficiency, cost, or scalability of renewable energy sources (such as solar, wind, hydro, geothermal, or bioenergy) by at least 20% compared to the state of the art at the time of the announcement. The breakthrough must be validated by a reputable scientific or engineering institution and must be widely recognized within the renewable energy community. In the event of multiple claims or announcements, the resolution will be based on the first project to meet these criteria. If no such project is announced by the EU by the deadline, the question will resolve as No. The resolution will rely on official EU announcements, reputable news sources, and publications in recognized scientific journals.

title: Will the United Nations establish a new global scientific initiative focused on pandemic prevention by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the United Nations officially announces the establishment of a global scientific initiative specifically aimed at pandemic prevention. The initiative must be dedicated to the research, development, and implementation of strategies and technologies to prevent future pandemics. This includes, but is not limited to, vaccine development, early detection systems, and international collaboration frameworks.

The announcement must be made through official UN channels, such as a press release on the UN website, an official statement by the UN Secretary-General, or a resolution passed by the UN General Assembly or Security Council. The initiative must be new, not a continuation or rebranding of existing programs, and must have a clear mandate, funding, and timeline for implementation.

In the event that the UN announces multiple initiatives, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the above criteria. If the UN is dissolved or undergoes significant restructuring before this date, an alternative authoritative body's announcement regarding pandemic prevention will be considered.

title: Will Virginia become a leading state in quantum computing research by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Virginia is recognized as a leading state in quantum computing research based on the following criteria:

1. Hosting at least two quantum computing research facilities that are ranked in the top 10 globally by a recognized authority in the field, such as the Quantum Computing Report or a similar entity.

2. Being the location for a significant quantum computing breakthrough, defined as a discovery or technological advancement that is published in a top-tier, peer-reviewed scientific journal (e.g., Nature, Science) and recognized by the global scientific community as a milestone in quantum computing.

3. Having at least one university within the state that is ranked in the top 20 worldwide for quantum computing research, according to academic ranking bodies such as QS World University Rankings or Academic Ranking of World Universities.

In the event that no state meets these criteria by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. If Virginia meets any one of these criteria, the question will be considered to have met the resolution criteria.

title: Will NATO establish a dedicated space force by 2030?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, NATO officially announces the establishment of a dedicated space force, defined as a separate branch of military operations focused on space warfare, satellite defense, and related strategic initiatives. This announcement must be made through official NATO channels, such as a press release, official statement, or public declaration by a NATO spokesperson. The establishment of the space force must include a clear organizational structure, designated funding, and an operational mandate that distinguishes it from existing aerospace or cyber defense units within NATO member countries. In the event of ambiguity regarding the announcement or the operational status of the space force, the resolution will defer to the most recent and authoritative public statement made by NATO officials. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases, such as the announcement of a joint space initiative that does not fully meet the criteria for a 'dedicated space force,' will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with a preference for interpretations that align with the spirit of the question.

title: Will a space mission dedicated to psychological or sociological research be launched by 2030?
