body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is an official announcement or launch of a space mission that is primarily dedicated to psychological or sociological research. The mission must be recognized and confirmed by a reputable space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, ISRO) or a recognized private space exploration company (e.g., SpaceX, Blue Origin, Virgin Galactic). The mission's primary objective must be explicitly stated to be psychological or sociological research, including but not limited to studies on human behavior, social dynamics, mental health, or cultural studies in a space environment. Secondary objectives or missions that include psychological or sociological research as a minor component will not qualify. In the event that multiple missions are announced or launched, the resolution will be based on the first mission that meets these criteria. If there is ambiguity regarding the mission's primary focus, a panel of experts from the aforementioned agencies or companies will be consulted to determine the mission's eligibility for resolving this question. In the absence of such a mission by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a vaccine designed specifically for a space-related illness be developed by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a vaccine targeting an illness that is identified as being uniquely contracted in space or due to space travel conditions is developed, tested, and approved for human use by any world health authority recognized by the World Health Organization (WHO) before January 1, 2030. The vaccine must be designed to prevent or mitigate a condition not commonly found on Earth and must be publicly announced by the developing entity, whether a governmental space agency, private space exploration company, or a pharmaceutical company. In the event that multiple vaccines are developed, the resolution will be based on the first vaccine that meets these criteria. If no such vaccine is developed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In cases where development is announced but not confirmed by the WHO or a similar authoritative body, the question will remain unresolved until such confirmation is received. Edge cases, such as vaccines developed for conditions exacerbated by space travel but not exclusive to it, will not meet the resolution criteria.

title: Will California's economy reach the top 4 global economies by 2030?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, California's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) ranks within the top 4 largest economies worldwide, according to the World Bank's GDP rankings. The GDP will be considered in nominal terms, without adjusting for purchasing power parity (PPP). In the event of discrepancies between different authoritative sources, the World Bank's data will be considered definitive. If the World Bank ceases to exist or does not provide a clear ranking by the resolution date, the International Monetary Fund (IMF)'s data will be used as a fallback. In case both the World Bank and IMF are unable to provide the necessary data, a panel of at least three economic experts from recognized global economic institutions will be convened to determine the ranking based on available global economic data.

title: Will the NHL see an increase in total league revenue to over $6 billion by the year 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the National Hockey League (NHL) reports a total league revenue exceeding $6 billion USD for any fiscal year before January 1, 2025. Revenue figures must be officially published by the NHL or verified by a reputable financial news source such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. In the event of discrepancies between sources, the NHL's official report will take precedence. If the NHL ceases operations or merges with another league before this date, the question will resolve as No. Adjustments for inflation are not considered in this resolution.

title: Will Australia enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth, before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Australia experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point before January 1, 2025, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS). The ABS is the authoritative source for national economic data, and its quarterly GDP reports will be used to determine the outcome. A quarter is defined as a three-month period corresponding to the fiscal quarters used by the ABS. In the event that the ABS revises its GDP data after the initial publication, the revised data will be considered the authoritative source for resolution. If the ABS ceases to exist or no longer publishes GDP data, a comparable Australian governmental or international economic organization's data will be used as a fallback. This question will resolve as No if the specified condition has not been met by the deadline.

title: Will the European Union mandate a universal charging port for all mobile devices by 2025?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the European Union (EU) officially mandates that all mobile devices sold within its member states must use a specific type of charging port (e.g., USB-C, Micro-USB, etc.). This mandate must apply to all mobile devices, including but not limited to smartphones, tablets, and e-readers, and must be enforceable by law. The resolution will be based on official statements, directives, or regulations published by the European Commission or any relevant EU governing body. In the event of a partial mandate (e.g., applying only to smartphones and tablets but not to other categories of devices), the question will resolve as No. If the mandate is announced but the implementation deadline is set for after January 1, 2025, the question will also resolve as No. In case of ambiguity or lack of clear, official documentation by the resolution date, the question will be considered unresolved.

title: Will Taiwan announce the development of a new semiconductor technology that surpasses current 3nm chips by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the government of Taiwan or any Taiwan-based semiconductor company officially announces the development of a semiconductor technology that is more advanced than the current 3nm chip technology. The announcement must specify the technology's capabilities, including but not limited to, smaller nanometer measurements, increased transistor density, or enhanced energy efficiency compared to 3nm technology. The resolution will rely on public statements from authoritative sources such as company press releases, government announcements, or recognized technology news outlets. In the event of a dispute regarding the technology's advancement, the resolution will defer to the consensus opinion of three independent experts in semiconductor technology. If no such technology is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US rule on a case directly involving the regulation of social media platforms by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Supreme Court of the United States issues a ruling on a case that directly involves the regulation of social media platforms before January 1, 2025. The case must specifically address the regulation of content, user behavior, data privacy, or advertising practices on platforms such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or similar. The ruling must be published on the official Supreme Court website or reported by at least three major news outlets (e.g., The New York Times, The Washington Post, CNN). In the event that the Supreme Court agrees to hear such a case but has not issued a ruling by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If the Supreme Court's website is inaccessible, reports from the aforementioned news outlets will be considered sufficient evidence. In case of ambiguity in the ruling's relevance to social media regulation, a consensus among legal experts featured in major news outlets will be used to determine the outcome.

title: Will NASA successfully launch and deploy a new space telescope specifically designed to search for exoplanets by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if NASA successfully launches and deploys a space telescope with the primary mission of searching for exoplanets before January 1, 2030. The telescope must be placed into orbit, fully operational, and begin transmitting data back to Earth. The mission must be officially confirmed by NASA through a press release or a public statement on their official website. In the event of a launch delay or mission failure, the question will resolve as No. If NASA announces the cancellation of the planned telescope or a shift in mission focus away from exoplanet search before the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, "successfully launches and deploys" includes the successful launch, orbital insertion, and operational status confirmation of the telescope. Edge cases, such as partial deployment failures or significant mission alterations post-launch, will be evaluated based on the primary mission's ability to search for exoplanets as stated at the time of launch.

title: Will a quantum computer perform a calculation that cannot be done on any classical computer by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a quantum computer performs a calculation that is provably impossible for any classical computer to execute within a reasonable timeframe (defined as a task that would take more than the estimated age of the universe, 13.8 billion years, using current classical computing technology). The calculation must be verified by a peer-reviewed scientific publication and recognized by a leading authority in quantum computing, such as the Quantum Computing Institute at Oak Ridge National Laboratory or an equivalent organization. In the event of a dispute over the calculation's validity, the decision of a panel comprised of at least three experts in quantum computing, appointed by the International Quantum Computing Association (or a similar authoritative body if the IQCA does not exist), will be considered final. If no such calculation is publicly acknowledged by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United States government allocate more than 20% of its annual scientific research budget to climate change studies by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the end of the fiscal year 2025, the United States government officially allocates more than 20% of its total annual scientific research budget to studies specifically aimed at understanding, mitigating, or adapting to climate change. The budget allocation must be confirmed through official government publications, such as the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) reports or official statements from the Office of Management and Budget (OMB). In the event of a government shutdown or any other scenario where the budget is not formally approved by December 31, 2025, the resolution will be based on the last proposed budget by the government before the deadline. If the specific percentage allocated to climate change studies is not explicitly mentioned in official documents, an estimation based on available data from authoritative sources will be used to determine the outcome. This question will not consider re-allocated funds from other scientific research areas to climate change studies after the initial budget approval.

title: Will the global nuclear energy capacity exceed 500 gigawatts by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, according to the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), the total installed nuclear energy capacity worldwide exceeds 500 gigawatts (electric) by December 31, 2030. The IAEA's annual World Energy Outlook report, or any official press release or statement from the IAEA, will be considered authoritative sources for this data. In the event that the IAEA ceases to exist, is unable to provide the necessary data, or if there is significant dispute about the accuracy of the data provided, the resolution will defer to the next most authoritative source available at the time, such as the World Nuclear Association or the International Energy Agency. The capacity must be operational and connected to the grid; plants under construction or in planning stages will not count towards the total. In case of a tie, where the capacity is exactly 500 gigawatts, the question will resolve as Yes.

title: Will the Republican Party introduce a bill to promote nuclear energy as a primary energy source in the US by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a bill that explicitly promotes nuclear energy as a primary energy source in the United States is introduced in either the House of Representatives or the Senate by a member of the Republican Party. The bill must aim to increase the production, development, or funding of nuclear energy facilities and must be officially recognized and documented by a reputable source such as the U.S. Congress website or a major news outlet. The introduction of the bill must be a formal process, and the bill should seek to make nuclear energy a significant part of the U.S. energy policy. In the event that multiple bills are introduced, the resolution will be based on the first bill that meets these criteria. If no such bill is introduced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, 'primary energy source' refers to nuclear energy being advocated as one of the main sources of energy in the United States, alongside other major sources like fossil fuels, renewables, etc. The resolution will not consider non-legislative actions or statements by political figures that do not result in the formal introduction of a bill.

title: Will a Major League Baseball stadium be powered entirely by nuclear energy by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, at least one Major League Baseball (MLB) stadium is officially confirmed to be powered entirely by nuclear energy. The confirmation must come from an official MLB statement, the stadium's management, or a credible news outlet. The term "powered entirely by nuclear energy" refers to all operations within the stadium, including but not limited to lighting, electronic displays, and concession stands, relying 100% on nuclear energy for at least one full MLB season. This includes the energy used during both regular season and postseason games. In the event that the MLB ceases to exist, merges with another league, or undergoes significant restructuring that makes it unrecognizable compared to its status as of 2023, this question will resolve as N/A. If no stadium is confirmed to meet these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the 2020 US presidential election results be revisited for a formal investigation into space-related campaign funding by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, an official investigation is announced by a recognized federal authority (e.g., the Federal Election Commission or the Department of Justice) into the funding of any campaign related to the 2020 US presidential election, specifically focusing on contributions or expenditures linked to space exploration companies or entities. The investigation must be aimed at determining the legality or ethicality of such funding, and must be publicized through major media outlets. If multiple investigations are announced, only the first will be considered for resolution. In the event that no such investigation is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. If an investigation is announced but later retracted or dismissed without findings before the resolution date, the question will still resolve as Yes, provided the initial announcement was made before the deadline. Edge cases or ambiguities regarding the definition of 'space-related' will be resolved by considering the primary business or mission of the involved entities as defined by their official statements or predominant public perception at the time of the funding.

title: Will the US House of Representatives pass a bill dedicated to the funding of a new space telescope project by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the US House of Representatives passes a bill specifically allocating funds for the development, construction, or deployment of a new space telescope project. The bill must be publicly available and verifiable through official US government sources, such as the Library of Congress or the official US House of Representatives website. The resolution will consider the passage of the bill by the House of Representatives, regardless of subsequent actions by the Senate or the President. In the event that the US government undergoes significant restructuring or the House of Representatives is dissolved or rendered non-functional, the question will resolve as N/A. Edge cases or ambiguities regarding the definition of a 'new space telescope project' will be resolved by referring to the bill's text, with priority given to explicit mentions of 'space telescope' or equivalent terms clearly indicating the intent to fund a space-based astronomical observatory.

title: Will the Russo-Ukrainian War lead to a significant delay in a joint space mission between Russia and another country by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any planned or proposed joint space mission involving Russia and any other country (including but not limited to the United States, European Space Agency member states, China, India, or Japan) is officially delayed or cancelled, with the delay attributed directly or indirectly to the Russo-Ukrainian War. The delay must be confirmed through official statements from the space agencies involved or governmental declarations. In the absence of such a mission being planned by the cutoff date, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, a "significant delay" is defined as a postponement of the original launch date by six months or more. Edge cases will be resolved based on the spirit of the question, focusing on the impact of the Russo-Ukrainian War on international space collaboration.

title: Will a cryptocurrency be developed specifically for the healthcare industry, with widespread adoption by medical institutions for transactions and data management, by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a cryptocurrency has been developed and is being widely adopted by medical institutions globally for transactions and data management. For the purpose of this question, "widespread adoption" is defined as the cryptocurrency being used by at least 25% of hospitals and medical institutions in at least three of the following regions: North America, Europe, Asia, South America, and Africa. The cryptocurrency must be specifically designed for the healthcare industry, with features that address the unique needs of medical data management and financial transactions within the sector. Adoption rates must be verified by credible sources such as government health departments, major healthcare associations, or reputable market research firms. In the event that multiple cryptocurrencies meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of them achieves the specified level of adoption. If no credible source can confirm the adoption rate by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency integrate a carbon offset feature directly into its transaction process, effectively making it carbon-neutral, by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a cryptocurrency that is ranked within the top 10 by market capitalization according to CoinMarketCap or a similar authoritative cryptocurrency market analysis platform has officially integrated a carbon offset feature directly into its transaction process. This feature must automatically calculate and offset the carbon footprint of each transaction, ensuring the cryptocurrency's net carbon emissions are neutral. The integration of this feature must be confirmed through an official announcement by the cryptocurrency's development team or governing body, and the functionality must be verifiable in the cryptocurrency's transaction process. In the event that multiple cryptocurrencies claim to have integrated such a feature, the resolution will be based on the first cryptocurrency to have done so, as verified by the date of the official announcement. If no cryptocurrency within the top 10 by market capitalization has integrated a carbon offset feature by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Ukraine develop a domestically produced quantum computer by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Ukraine has successfully developed and demonstrated a domestically produced quantum computer that meets the following criteria:

- Quantum Supremacy: The computer must demonstrate quantum supremacy by solving a problem that is infeasible for classical computers within a reasonable timeframe, as defined by the current scientific consensus.

- Independent Verification: The achievement must be verified by at least two independent and internationally recognized scientific institutions.

- Public Disclosure: Details of the development and capabilities of the quantum computer must be publicly disclosed in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or at a major scientific conference.

- Domestic Production: The quantum computer must be predominantly developed and produced within Ukraine, including significant contributions from Ukrainian scientists, engineers, and facilities.

In the event that multiple countries develop similar capabilities concurrently, the resolution will consider the date of public disclosure to determine if Ukraine's achievement meets the criteria before the deadline.

title: Will a new genetic editing tool surpassing CRISPR-Cas9 in precision and efficiency be discovered by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new genetic editing tool is discovered and publicly documented to surpass CRISPR-Cas9 in both precision and efficiency. The assessment of "precision" and "efficiency" must be based on peer-reviewed scientific publications that compare the new tool directly with CRISPR-Cas9. The publications must be indexed in major scientific databases such as PubMed, Web of Science, or Scopus. The discovery must be recognized and validated by at least two independent research institutions or a leading scientific committee in the field of genetics. In the event of multiple claims of discovery, the resolution will be based on the earliest documented and verified claim. If no such tool is discovered by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Formula 1 introduce a fully electric racing category by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Formula 1 governing body officially announces the introduction of a fully electric racing category, with the inaugural season to commence no later than the 2035 season. The announcement must be made through official Formula 1 communication channels (e.g., press release, official website, or a public statement by a high-ranking official within the Formula 1 organization).

In the event that Formula 1 merges with or is acquired by another racing organization, the resolution will still be considered Yes if the merged or acquiring organization introduces a fully electric racing category under the Formula 1 brand or as a direct successor to Formula 1.

If the announcement is made but later retracted before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. Similarly, if plans for the electric racing category are postponed beyond the 2035 season, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will any cryptocurrency be officially sanctioned by the Russian or Ukrainian government for trade or fundraising related to the Russo-Ukrainian War by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any cryptocurrency is officially recognized, sanctioned, or adopted by the Russian or Ukrainian government for the purpose of trade, fundraising, or any financial transactions directly related to the Russo-Ukrainian War. Official recognition must come in the form of a government decree, law, or official statement from a relevant authority within either government. The cryptocurrency in question must be explicitly named and its use for the specified purposes clearly outlined. In the event of ambiguous or conflicting reports, the resolution will default to No unless clarified or confirmed by an official government source. This resolution criteria does not include informal endorsements or the use of cryptocurrency by non-governmental organizations or individuals.

title: Will Canada implement a national digital currency based on blockchain technology by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Government of Canada, or any of its official financial institutions, announces the implementation or the official plan to implement a national digital currency based on blockchain technology. The announcement must specify the technology to be used, the timeline for implementation, and the intended use cases for the currency. 

For the purpose of this question, a "national digital currency" is defined as a digital currency that is issued and regulated by the Canadian government, intended for use as legal tender within Canada. Blockchain technology refers to a decentralized, distributed ledger technology that records transactions across multiple computers in such a way that the registered transactions cannot be altered retroactively. 

In the event that multiple digital currencies are announced, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one of them meets the above criteria. If the announcement is made by a private entity without official government endorsement or partnership, it will not count towards the resolution of this question. 

Edge cases or ambiguous announcements will be evaluated based on the clarity of the government's intention to implement the technology as described, and the feasibility of the proposed plan.

title: Will a major biotechnology company adopt a cryptocurrency for funding its research and development activities by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a major biotechnology company (defined as a company with a market capitalization of over $10 billion USD or equivalent in other currencies at the time of adoption) publicly announces and begins the implementation of a cryptocurrency-based funding mechanism for its research and development activities. The announcement must be verifiable through official company press releases, filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) or equivalent regulatory bodies in countries outside the United States, or public statements by company executives. In the event of ambiguity regarding the company's market capitalization or the nature of the cryptocurrency adoption, the resolution will be based on the consensus of credible financial news outlets and industry analysts. If no such adoption is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases or scenarios not covered by these criteria will be resolved at the discretion of the question administrators, with a preference for interpretations that align with the spirit of the question.

title: Will Taiwan establish its own independent space agency by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the government of Taiwan has officially announced the establishment of a space agency that is recognized as an independent entity responsible for the planning, development, and execution of space-related activities and missions. The agency must be funded by the Taiwanese government and have a clear mandate to operate independently of any foreign space agencies. The establishment of the agency should be confirmed through official government channels, such as press releases, official statements, or government websites. In the event that the government of Taiwan announces the intention to establish such an agency but it is not operational by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If there is ambiguity regarding the independence of the agency due to partnerships or collaborations with foreign entities, the resolution will be based on the agency's ability to make autonomous decisions regarding its missions and operations.

title: Will the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) collaborate with the National Hockey League (NHL) for a space-related promotion or event by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, NASA (National Aeronautics and Space Administration) and the NHL (National Hockey League) officially announce a collaboration for a space-related promotion or event. The announcement must be made through official channels such as press releases, official websites, or social media accounts of either organization. Collaborations may include, but are not limited to, space-themed hockey games, astronaut appearances at NHL events, or educational programs combining elements of space exploration and hockey. In the absence of a formal announcement, credible news reports from major media outlets confirming the collaboration will also be considered. If the collaboration is announced but subsequently canceled, the question will still resolve as Yes, provided the cancellation occurs after the initial announcement.

title: Will Iran officially recognize any cryptocurrency as legal tender by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the government of Iran has officially recognized any cryptocurrency as legal tender within its jurisdiction. Recognition as legal tender means that the cryptocurrency can be used for all debts, public charges, taxes, and dues within Iran. This resolution will be based on official statements from the Iranian government, legislation passed by its parliament, or any legal documentation that explicitly states the acceptance of a cryptocurrency as legal tender. In the absence of such direct evidence, credible reports from major international news organizations or financial institutions confirming the change will also be considered sufficient. If multiple cryptocurrencies are recognized, the first instance will be the determining factor for resolution. In the event of a temporary recognition that is later revoked before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No unless another cryptocurrency is recognized and maintains its status as legal tender until the resolution date.

title: Will Russia develop its own state-backed cryptocurrency by the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Russian government or any of its official agencies announces the development, launch, or planned launch of a state-backed cryptocurrency. The announcement must be verifiable through official government channels, such as press releases, official statements, or government websites. Additionally, the cryptocurrency must be designed to be used as a medium of exchange, store of value, or unit of account within the Russian Federation or for transactions involving Russian entities. In the event of ambiguous announcements or developments, the resolution will defer to the most authoritative and recent official source available. If there is no clear announcement or development by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases or developments that do not meet all the specified criteria but suggest the imminent launch of a state-backed cryptocurrency may be considered on a case-by-case basis by a panel of experts familiar with cryptocurrency regulations and developments.

title: Will the global cryptocurrency market capitalization reach $5 trillion by the end of 2025, potentially as a result of economic shifts due to COVID-19?
body: The global cryptocurrency market capitalization is defined as the total value of all cryptocurrencies combined. This question will resolve as Yes if, according to data from CoinMarketCap or another authoritative financial data source agreed upon by Metaculus Admins, the total market capitalization reaches or exceeds $5 trillion USD at any point before December 31, 2025. Daily closing values will be used to determine the market capitalization. In the event that CoinMarketCap becomes unavailable or is deemed unreliable, the resolution will be based on the most credible alternative source available at the time. This question will not consider any market capitalization that results from hyperinflationary events where the USD loses more than 50% of its value in a year, relative to a basket of goods and services from the year 2020.

title: Will Brazil launch a manned mission to space by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Brazilian government or any Brazil-based private entity successfully launches a manned space mission that reaches at least the Karman line (100 kilometers above Earth's surface) before January 1, 2031. The mission must be officially recognized by the International Astronautical Federation (IAF) or a similar authoritative body in space exploration. The crew must include at least one Brazilian national and the mission must be launched from Brazil or with significant Brazilian involvement in terms of technology, funding, or personnel. In the event of a dispute regarding the mission's achievement or the nationality of the crew, the resolution will defer to the official statement from the Brazilian Space Agency or the IAF. If no manned mission is launched by the specified date, or if the mission does not meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the World Health Organization initiate a program dedicated to monitoring health risks associated with long-duration human spaceflight by 2030?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, the World Health Organization (WHO) has officially announced the initiation of a program specifically dedicated to monitoring and addressing health risks associated with long-duration human spaceflight. This program must be distinct from any existing initiatives and must focus on the physical and psychological health risks that astronauts face during missions lasting longer than six months. The announcement must be made through official WHO channels, such as a press release on the WHO website, an official statement during a WHO conference, or a publication in a WHO-endorsed journal. In the event that the WHO is dissolved or undergoes a significant restructuring that makes it unrecognizable in its current form, the question will resolve as No. If the WHO merges with another organization, the resolution will depend on whether the new entity announces a similar program by the specified date.

title: Will France establish a new spaceport on its territory by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the French government or any France-based private or public entity has officially announced and begun construction of a spaceport within the territorial boundaries of France. The announcement must be confirmed through official government channels, recognized news outlets, or press releases from the involved entities. The construction must have commenced with clear evidence of progress, such as site preparation, groundbreaking ceremonies, or the initiation of foundational work. In the event of ambiguity regarding the commencement of construction, the resolution will default to No unless there is incontrovertible evidence to the contrary. Satellite launch platforms at sea, directly controlled and operated by France but located outside of its territorial waters, will not count towards this resolution. In the case where construction begins but is halted indefinitely or the project is officially canceled before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Australia introduce a new significant piece of legislation aimed at reducing carbon emissions by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Australian government has passed and enacted a new piece of legislation that significantly reduces carbon emissions within Australia. The legislation must aim to reduce carbon emissions by at least 10% from the levels recorded in the year 2020. The reduction targets must be enforceable and include specific deadlines for compliance. The legislation should be recognized as significant by at least two of the following authoritative sources: the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), the International Energy Agency (IEA), or major Australian environmental organizations. In the event of a dispute regarding the significance of the legislation, the resolution will be based on the majority opinion of these sources. If no such legislation is passed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In the case where legislation is passed but its implementation is delayed beyond 2030, the question will still resolve as Yes, provided the law is officially enacted before the resolution date.

title: Will a major political party in a developed country adopt climate change denial as part of its official platform by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a major political party in a developed country (as defined by the International Monetary Fund's list of Advanced Economies) officially includes climate change denial or opposition to climate change science in its party platform, manifesto, or official policy documents. Climate change denial is defined as the outright rejection of the scientific consensus that climate change is occurring and is primarily caused by human activities. The resolution will be based on official party documents, public statements by party leaders, or official party websites. In the event of ambiguity, the most recent and authoritative source will be considered definitive. If no major political party in a developed country adopts such a stance by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, a 'major political party' is defined as one that has held or currently holds government office or has a significant representation in the national legislature.

title: Will a political event or decision directly influence a major scientific discovery in the field of chemistry by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major scientific discovery in the field of chemistry is directly attributed to a political event or decision. For the purposes of this question, a "major scientific discovery" is defined as a discovery that leads to a Nobel Prize in Chemistry, a breakthrough that results in a significant shift in scientific understanding, or the development of a technology or process with widespread application and impact. A "political event or decision" includes, but is not limited to, legislation, funding decisions, international agreements, or executive orders that can be directly linked to the facilitation, inspiration, or acceleration of the discovery. The linkage between the political event or decision and the scientific discovery must be acknowledged by at least one of the following: a peer-reviewed scientific journal, a Nobel Prize committee announcement, or a statement from a recognized scientific organization. In the absence of such a discovery, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with a preference for authoritative sources.

title: Will the Virginia Department of Health implement a blockchain-based system for health records by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Virginia Department of Health has officially announced and implemented a blockchain-based system for managing health records. The system must be fully operational and used for storing, accessing, or transmitting patient health records across any of its facilities or services. Implementation is defined as the system being actively used in a live environment, not just in a pilot or trial phase. The announcement must be verifiable through official Virginia Department of Health press releases, government publications, or public statements by department officials. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., only certain types of health records or specific facilities are using blockchain technology), the question will resolve as Yes only if the blockchain-based system is being used for the majority of health records management within the department. If no official announcement or implementation has occurred by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major professional golf tournament implement real-time biometric data tracking for players by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any of the four major professional golf tournaments (The Masters, U.S. Open, The Open Championship, or PGA Championship) officially announces and implements the use of real-time biometric data tracking for players during the tournament. Biometric data tracking includes, but is not limited to, heart rate, body temperature, and muscle activity. The implementation must be confirmed through official tournament communications, such as press releases or official social media announcements. If multiple tournaments announce such a feature, the resolution will still be Yes, regardless of the number. In the event that a tournament announces the implementation but it is not in use by the end of 2024 due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., technical difficulties, regulatory issues), the question will still resolve as Yes, provided the announcement was made. If no official announcement or implementation occurs by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Brazil deploy a nationwide 6G network by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Brazil has officially announced and demonstrated the deployment of a 6G network covering at least 50% of its population. The network must provide connectivity that meets or exceeds the International Telecommunication Union's (ITU) standards for 6G networks, including but not limited to: enhanced mobile broadband (eMBB), ultra-reliable low-latency communications (URLLC), and massive machine type communications (mMTC). The deployment must be confirmed by either the Brazilian government, a major telecommunications authority, or a recognized international telecommunications body. In the event of a partial deployment that does not meet the 50% population coverage requirement, the question will resolve as No. If no official announcement or demonstration has been made by the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No. Edge cases or disputes regarding the definition of 'nationwide' or '6G network' will be resolved by a panel of experts designated by the question's administrators, with a preference for those with expertise in telecommunications.

title: Will South Korea launch a lunar orbiter mission by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the South Korean government or any South Korean entity successfully launches a lunar orbiter mission that reaches the Moon's orbit before January 1, 2030. The mission must be officially recognized by the South Korean Space Agency or an equivalent authoritative body. The orbiter must complete at least one full orbit around the Moon to be considered successful. In the event of a joint mission with other countries or private entities, the mission will still be considered successful if South Korea contributes significantly to the mission's core components or mission control. If no mission is launched or if the mission fails to reach or orbit the Moon by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In cases where the mission's status is ambiguous (e.g., if the orbiter is launched but loses communication before confirming an orbit), the question will resolve based on the last available verified information from the South Korean Space Agency or an equivalent authoritative body.

title: Will Russia deploy a new space station independent of the International Space Station by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Russian government or any Russia-based private or public entity has successfully launched and deployed a space station that operates independently of the International Space Station (ISS). The space station must be capable of hosting human crew for missions longer than 30 days and must have completed at least one crewed mission by the resolution date. 

For the purposes of this question, a "space station" is defined as a manned spacecraft that is designed to remain in space for an extended period of time and is equipped with facilities to support human life for the duration of its mission. The space station must be in orbit around Earth or any other celestial body. 

In the event that multiple entities claim to have deployed such a space station, the resolution will be based on the first entity to achieve this milestone as verified by an authoritative space exploration agency or organization, such as NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, or an equivalent body. 

If there is no clear evidence of deployment by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the National Hockey League (NHL) invest in a space-related marketing campaign by 2025?
body:
The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the National Hockey League (NHL) has officially announced or launched a marketing campaign that includes any form of investment or partnership directly related to space exploration, space technology, or the promotion of hockey in space or space-themed environments. This includes, but is not limited to, partnerships with space agencies, space technology companies, or the use of space imagery and themes in marketing materials.

Verification of the campaign must come from official NHL announcements, press releases, or credible media reports. Social media posts from official NHL accounts will also be considered valid. In the event of ambiguous announcements, the resolution will be based on the most comprehensive and direct interpretation of the NHL's intent as determined by Metaculus Admins.

If no such campaign is announced or launched by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In the case of announcements close to the deadline, the campaign must be clearly defined and officially confirmed by the NHL to count towards resolution.

title: Will the global economic impact of COVID-19 lead to a new international vaccine distribution initiative by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, an international initiative for vaccine distribution is officially announced or launched, with the participation of at least 50 countries and the endorsement of at least one of the following organizations: World Health Organization (WHO), United Nations (UN), or Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance. The initiative must aim to improve vaccine access and distribution in response to the global economic impact of COVID-19, specifically targeting lower-income countries. The resolution will consider the establishment of new funding mechanisms, distribution frameworks, or international agreements that directly address vaccine equity and accessibility. In the event of multiple initiatives, the one with the broadest international support and operational scope will be considered for resolution. If no such initiative is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases or disputes regarding the initiative's scope or impact will be resolved by a panel of experts from the endorsing organizations.

title: Will a candidate endorsed by Donald Trump win the 2024 US Presidential Election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election who has received a formal endorsement from Donald Trump wins the presidency. The outcome will be determined based on the official election results as certified by the U.S. General Services Administration (GSA). In the event of a dispute or recount, the question will not resolve until a final decision is made and the results are certified. If Donald Trump himself runs and wins, this will also result in a resolution of Yes. In cases where multiple candidates claim to have Trump's endorsement, only the endorsement that is publicly acknowledged by Trump via a major communication platform (e.g., social media, press release) prior to the election will be considered valid.

title: Will Donald Trump's business empire see an increase in valuation by more than 50% by the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the combined valuation of Donald Trump's business empire, including but not limited to real estate, branding, and other business ventures, has increased by more than 50% compared to its valuation on January 1, 2021. The valuation will be determined based on financial statements, reports from credible financial analysis firms, or other authoritative sources that can provide a clear and verifiable measure of the empire's worth. In the event of any discrepancies or disputes regarding the valuation, the resolution will defer to the most recent and comprehensive analysis by a recognized financial institution or auditing firm. If Donald Trump's business empire is divided, sold, or undergoes significant structural changes, the valuation will consider the sum total of all constituent parts or their equivalent value at the time of assessment.

title: Will AI be used to discover a new particle in the field of particle physics by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, an AI system or algorithm is credited by a reputable scientific journal or organization (such as Nature, Science, or the International Journal of Particle Physics) with the discovery of a new particle in the field of particle physics. The discovery must be confirmed through peer-reviewed research and recognized by the international scientific community. The AI's role in the discovery must be clearly documented and significant, contributing directly to the identification, analysis, or theoretical prediction of the new particle. In the event of multiple claims, the date of the first publication to meet these criteria will be considered the discovery date. If no such discovery is credited to AI by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases or disputes will be resolved by a panel of experts in the field of particle physics, appointed by the question's administrators.

title: Will FIFA implement an AI system to assist with real-time decision-making in World Cup matches by 2026?
body:
The question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1, 2026, FIFA officially announces the implementation of an Artificial Intelligence (AI) system designed to assist with real-time decision-making in World Cup matches. The AI system must meet the following criteria:

1. Real-time Analysis: Capable of analyzing gameplay footage and data in real-time to assist referees with decisions on goals, offsides, fouls, and other critical match events.

2. FIFA Approval: The system's use must be approved by FIFA's International Football Association Board (IFAB), the body responsible for determining the Laws of the Game.

3. Match Implementation: The system must be deployed and operational in at least one FIFA World Cup match by the end of the 2026 World Cup tournament.

4. Transparency: FIFA must provide a public report detailing the AI system's performance, including accuracy, decision impact, and any errors or controversies.

In the absence of an official announcement or deployment, the question will resolve as No. If the system is announced but not implemented by the end of the 2026 World Cup, or if it is used but does not meet the above criteria, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will Canada deploy AI technology for national defense purposes by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Canadian government or any of its defense agencies officially announces the deployment of AI technology for national defense purposes. Deployment is defined as the operational use of AI in any form within the national defense sector, including but not limited to surveillance, logistics, combat simulations, or autonomous systems. The announcement must be verifiable through official government channels, such as press releases, official statements, or documented evidence of operational use. In the absence of a public announcement, credible reports from at least two reputable media outlets or defense industry publications confirming the deployment will also be considered sufficient for resolution. If there is ambiguity regarding the deployment's nature or extent, the question will resolve as No unless clear evidence is provided that meets the criteria outlined above.

title: Will there be a new technology used at the 2028 Olympics to enhance viewer experience that allows for real-time athlete biometrics tracking?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the start of the 2028 Summer Olympics, a new technology is introduced and used that enables real-time tracking of athlete biometrics (such as heart rate, oxygen levels, and muscle activity) during competitions. The technology must be officially adopted and utilized in at least one Olympic sport by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or a recognized governing body for the sport. The technology's use must be confirmed through official announcements, broadcasts, or reports from credible sources. In the case of multiple technologies being introduced, the resolution will consider the technology that is most widely implemented across different sports. If the technology is introduced but not used due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., technical failures, last-minute regulatory issues), the question will still resolve as Yes, provided there was an official plan to use it. If the technology is used in practice sessions but not in actual competitions, the question will not resolve as Yes.

title: Will Major League Baseball adopt an automated strike zone system by the 2025 season?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the start of the 2025 Major League Baseball season, the MLB has officially adopted and implemented an automated strike zone system for use in regular season games. The system must be used across all MLB teams and be the primary method for determining balls and strikes during the game. The adoption must be confirmed through official MLB press releases, statements from the MLB Commissioner, or through the MLB's official rules and regulations documentation. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., used only in certain stadiums or for a limited number of games), the question will resolve as No unless the MLB announces a clear, time-bound plan for full implementation before the end of the 2025 season. If the 2025 season is significantly delayed or canceled, the resolution date will be extended to the start of the 2026 season.

title: Will California have implemented a statewide earthquake early warning system accessible to all residents via mobile devices by 2027?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2026, the State of California has officially announced and demonstrated the operational status of a statewide earthquake early warning system that is accessible to all California residents through mobile devices. The system must provide real-time alerts with sufficient advance warning to allow for protective actions to be taken before the onset of earthquake shaking. The system's effectiveness and accessibility will be verified through public documentation from the California Governor's Office of Emergency Services (Cal OES) or a similar authoritative body. In the event of a partial deployment that does not cover the entire state or all residents, the question will resolve as No. If the system is deployed but then becomes non-operational before the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No. Edge cases, such as a system that covers 95% of the population but not all, will be considered on a case-by-case basis by a panel of experts designated by the question's administrators.

title: Will Formula 1 influence a major political decision or legislation by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any of the following conditions are met:

A government or major political body (e.g., the United Nations, European Union, or a national government) officially cites Formula 1 as a significant factor in the formulation, amendment, or repeal of a specific piece of legislation or policy decision.

A public statement is made by a recognized political figure or legislative body acknowledging the direct influence of Formula 1 on a major political decision or legislation.

Evidence is presented in reputable media outlets or official documents that a decision or legislation was significantly influenced by Formula 1, including but not limited to environmental policies, economic incentives, or urban planning related to Formula 1 events.

In cases where direct evidence is not available, credible reports from at least three independent and reputable sources will be considered sufficient to meet the resolution criteria.

Fallback scenario: If no direct evidence or credible reports are available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a prominent cricket player run for political office in India before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a cricket player who has represented India in international cricket matches announces their candidacy for a political office in India. The player must have participated in at least one international match for the Indian cricket team within the past 10 years from the date of their political candidacy announcement. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the player themselves, their official social media accounts, or a press release from a recognized political party in India. In the event of ambiguous or conflicting reports, the resolution will rely on the confirmation from at least two reputable news sources. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US rule on a case directly involving the powers of the President before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Supreme Court of the United States issues a ruling on a case that directly involves the interpretation, application, or challenge of the powers of the President of the United States before January 1, 2025. The case must explicitly address powers granted to the President by the Constitution, including but not limited to executive orders, veto powers, the ability to appoint and dismiss officials, and the conduct of foreign policy. Cases that indirectly involve presidential powers or are primarily focused on other issues will not be considered for this question's resolution. The resolution will be based on official announcements from the Supreme Court or reliable news sources recognized for their judicial reporting. In the event of ambiguity or dispute over the case's relevance to presidential powers, a consensus among major legal analysts will be sought to determine the outcome.

title: Will OpenAI develop a nuclear-related AI system for monitoring or managing nuclear reactors by 2030?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, OpenAI has developed and publicly announced an AI system specifically designed for either monitoring or managing nuclear reactors. The AI system must demonstrate the ability to perform real-time analysis of reactor conditions, predict potential safety issues, and provide actionable insights for reactor management. The development and capabilities of the AI system must be confirmed through official OpenAI press releases, peer-reviewed scientific publications, or government regulatory filings. In the event of a dispute regarding the AI system's capabilities or its application to nuclear reactors, a panel of experts in nuclear engineering and artificial intelligence, agreed upon by Metaculus Admins, will make the final determination. AI systems developed for general purposes and later adapted for nuclear applications without significant modifications or enhancements will not meet the criteria for resolution.

title: Will the US House of Representatives pass a bill specifically addressing nuclear risk reduction by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the US House of Representatives passes a bill that explicitly aims to reduce nuclear risks. The bill must include measures such as but not limited to: 

- Enhancements to nuclear arsenal security
- Reductions in the number of nuclear warheads
- Initiatives for nuclear non-proliferation
- Measures to improve nuclear safety standards

The bill must be passed by a majority vote in the House of Representatives and should be focused specifically on nuclear risk reduction, rather than including such measures as part of broader defense or budget legislation. 

In the event that multiple bills are passed, the one with the most comprehensive measures for nuclear risk reduction will be considered for the resolution of this question. 

If no bill is passed by the specified date, or if the passed bill(s) do not meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No. 

Authoritative sources for this resolution will include official publications from the US Congress, including bill texts, voting records, and press releases.

title: Will the World Health Organization initiate a global nuclear accident preparedness program by 2025?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially announces the initiation of a global nuclear accident preparedness program on or before December 31, 2024. The program must be designed to enhance worldwide readiness for nuclear accidents, including but not limited to, reactor meltdowns, nuclear weapon detonations, and radiological dispersal device ("dirty bomb") incidents. The announcement must be made through an official WHO communication channel, such as a press release, official website publication, or a formal statement during a WHO-convened conference. The program should detail specific measures for international coordination, emergency response, public health management, and environmental recovery following nuclear incidents. In the absence of a direct announcement by the WHO, credible reports from at least three major international news organizations confirming the program's initiation will also be considered sufficient for resolution. If the WHO is dissolved or undergoes a significant reorganization before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No, unless a successor organization with equivalent authority announces the initiation of a comparable program.

title: Will NATO establish a unified cryptocurrency for internal transactions by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, NATO officially announces the establishment of a unified cryptocurrency designed specifically for internal transactions among member countries. The announcement must be made through an official NATO communication channel, such as a press release, official website publication, or a statement from a NATO spokesperson. The cryptocurrency must be operational, with clear guidelines on its use, management, and regulation provided by NATO. In the event of a partial announcement or implementation, the question will resolve as Yes only if the cryptocurrency is actively in use for any internal transactions by the specified date. If multiple cryptocurrencies are announced or implemented, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one is designated for exclusive use in internal transactions among NATO members. In the absence of an official announcement or if the project is announced but not implemented by the deadline, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases or ambiguities will be resolved based on the spirit of the question, focusing on the cryptocurrency's intended purpose for internal transactions within NATO.

title: Will the Democratic Party propose legislation to regulate cryptocurrencies as a national security issue before 2024?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2024, a member or members of the Democratic Party in the United States Congress officially propose legislation that explicitly aims to regulate cryptocurrencies due to concerns related to national security. The proposal must be formally introduced in either the House of Representatives or the Senate and must specifically cite national security as a primary reason for the regulation. The resolution will rely on official records from the U.S. Congress, including bill texts and congressional records, to verify the proposal's introduction and its national security context. In the event that multiple proposals are introduced, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first proposal's formal introduction. If no such legislation is proposed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases, such as proposals that indirectly affect cryptocurrencies through broader financial regulations without explicitly citing national security, will not count towards the resolution of this question.

title: Will China lift its ban on cryptocurrency exchanges and allow them to operate freely by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the People's Republic of China officially announces the lifting of the ban on cryptocurrency exchanges, allowing them to operate freely within its jurisdiction. The resolution will be based on official statements from the People's Bank of China or any other relevant government authority. In the absence of direct statements, credible reports from major international news outlets (e.g., BBC, CNN, Reuters) confirming the policy change will also be considered valid. This question will resolve as No if no such announcement or credible report is made by the specified date. In the case of partial lifting of restrictions that allows certain types of cryptocurrency transactions but continues to prohibit others, the question will resolve as Yes only if the allowed transactions include the operation of cryptocurrency exchanges without significant limitations. If there is ambiguity in the policy announcement or reports, the question will be left open until a clear interpretation can be provided.

title: Will the United States deploy an AI system for national cybersecurity defense that autonomously neutralizes cyber threats without human intervention by 2030?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United States government or any of its agencies officially announces the deployment of an AI system specifically designed for national cybersecurity defense that operates autonomously to detect, analyze, and neutralize cyber threats without human intervention. The AI system must be capable of responding to a wide range of cyber threats, including but not limited to malware, ransomware, phishing attacks, and advanced persistent threats (APTs), with a demonstrated effectiveness rate of at least 90% in real-world scenarios. The announcement must be verifiable through official government press releases, public statements by a high-ranking official, or documentation on an official government website. In the event of a dispute regarding the AI system's capabilities or deployment status, a panel of experts from recognized cybersecurity organizations will be consulted to make a final determination. Edge cases, such as temporary deployments or systems requiring occasional human oversight, will not meet the resolution criteria. The resolution criteria are designed to ensure clarity and objectivity in determining the outcome of the question.

title: Will the Virginia Department of Health implement an AI-driven platform to predict public health crises by 2025?
body:
The Virginia Department of Health will be considered to have implemented an AI-driven platform to predict public health crises if, by December 31, 2024, it has officially announced the deployment of a system that meets the following criteria:

1. The platform utilizes artificial intelligence algorithms to analyze health data and predict potential public health crises.

2. The system is operational and has been used in at least one instance to successfully predict a public health crisis, with the prediction being validated by subsequent events.

3. The platform's predictions are made available to relevant stakeholders, including public health officials and government agencies, in a timely manner to facilitate preventative measures.

4. The implementation of the AI platform is documented in an official press release, government report, or through a formal announcement at a recognized public health or technology conference.

In the absence of a direct announcement, credible media reports or statements from Virginia Department of Health officials confirming the system's deployment and operational status will also be considered sufficient for resolution.

title: Will France establish a nationwide AI ethics board to regulate AI development and usage by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the French government officially announces the establishment of a nationwide AI ethics board tasked with regulating AI development and usage within France. The board must be recognized by the French government as the primary authority on AI ethics, with responsibilities including but not limited to: 

- Setting ethical guidelines for AI development and usage
- Reviewing and approving AI projects based on ethical considerations
- Enforcing compliance with ethical standards among AI developers and users

The announcement must be verifiable through official government channels, such as a government website or an official press release. In the event that the French government announces the intention to establish such a board but does not officially do so by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

In case of ambiguity regarding the board's authority or scope, the question will resolve based on the most authoritative and recent information available from official sources.

title: Will South Korea decommission more than half of its nuclear reactors by 2035?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, more than half of South Korea's operational nuclear reactors, as of January 1, 2023, have been officially decommissioned. Decommissioning is defined as the process of retiring a nuclear reactor from service, following the guidelines and standards set by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). The count of South Korea's operational nuclear reactors will be based on the official records from the Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power Co., Ltd. (KHNP) and the Ministry of Trade, Industry and Energy (MOTIE) of South Korea as of January 1, 2023. In the event of any discrepancies between these sources, the information provided by the KHNP will take precedence. This question will also consider reactors that are in the process of being decommissioned if they have entered the decommissioning phase as per IAEA standards by the resolution date. Reactors that are temporarily shut down for maintenance, upgrades, or investigation will not be considered decommissioned unless they meet the decommissioning criteria. In case of a lack of clear public records or disputes regarding the status of a reactor, the resolution will be based on the most credible evidence available at the time of resolution, including but not limited to government announcements, IAEA reports, and credible news sources.

title: Will a new nuclear technology emerge by 2030 that significantly reduces the risk of radiation exposure during golf course maintenance?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new nuclear technology has been developed and is in operational use or has received regulatory approval for use, that significantly reduces the risk of radiation exposure during golf course maintenance. The technology must demonstrate a reduction in radiation exposure risk by at least 50% compared to the current standard practices as of 2023, according to measurements from a recognized authority in nuclear safety or a peer-reviewed scientific study. The technology should be applicable to and intended for use in maintaining golf courses, specifically addressing concerns related to radioactive contamination of soil, water, or equipment. In the event that multiple technologies are developed, the resolution will consider the one that shows the highest percentage reduction in risk. If no such technology is publicly acknowledged or if the reduction in radiation exposure cannot be quantitatively verified by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United Nations' Sustainable Development Goals significantly influence global economic policies by 2030?
body:
The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, at least three of the following five criteria are met:

1. A minimum of 50 countries have officially integrated at least one of the United Nations' Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) into their national economic policies, as confirmed by official government statements or legal documents.

2. The World Bank or International Monetary Fund (IMF) has released reports indicating a statistically significant positive impact of SDG-aligned policies on global economic growth.

3. At least two G7 nations have implemented carbon pricing or similar environmental policies directly inspired by the SDGs.

4. The United Nations releases a comprehensive assessment report showing that global poverty rates have decreased by at least 10% from 2020 levels, attributable to policies aligned with the SDGs.

5. A global treaty, endorsed by at least 100 member states, is enacted, focusing on sustainable development and explicitly referencing the SDGs.

In cases where official documentation is not available in English, translations provided by recognized international organizations will be considered valid. The resolution will rely on authoritative sources such as the United Nations, World Bank, IMF, and official government publications. In the event of conflicting reports, the majority consensus among these sources will be used to determine the outcome.

title: Will the discovery of dark matter have a measurable impact on global economic markets by 2040?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2039, there is a widely recognized scientific discovery of dark matter that has a direct and measurable impact on global economic markets. This impact could be in the form of new technologies, shifts in energy markets, changes in investment strategies, or any other economic effect directly attributable to the discovery of dark matter. The discovery must be confirmed by at least two of the following authoritative sources: the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN), the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA), or the International Astronomical Union (IAU). The economic impact must be reported and confirmed by major financial news outlets such as The Wall Street Journal, Financial Times, or Bloomberg. In the event that the discovery's impact on the markets is ambiguous, a panel of experts from major economic research institutions will be consulted to determine the resolution. This panel will consist of representatives from at least three different institutions, such as the International Monetary Fund (IMF), the World Bank, and a recognized academic institution with a strong economics department.

title: Will the global pharmacology industry exceed a market value of $1.5 trillion by 2025?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, according to financial reports or market analyses from at least three reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Financial Times), the global pharmacology industry's market value is reported to exceed $1.5 trillion at any point before December 31, 2025. The market value assessment must be based on the sum of the reported values of companies classified within the pharmacology sector, including pharmaceuticals, biotechnology companies, and any other entities primarily engaged in the research, development, production, or distribution of drugs. In the event of discrepancies between sources, the average of the reported values from the three most reputable sources, as determined by their global reach and journalistic integrity, will be used. Edge cases, such as significant market value fluctuations within a short period, will be resolved by looking at the market value trend over the preceding quarter. If no clear data is available by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Japan launch a mission to explore the icy moons of Jupiter by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2031, the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) or any officially sanctioned Japanese space exploration entity announces, launches, or successfully completes a mission aimed at exploring one or more of the icy moons of Jupiter, specifically Europa, Ganymede, and Callisto. The mission must be primarily focused on in-situ exploration, which may include orbiting, landing, or both. Confirmation of the mission's announcement, launch, or completion must come from official JAXA press releases, official government statements, or coverage in reputable scientific publications. In the event that JAXA collaborates with other international space agencies or private entities, the mission will still qualify as long as JAXA plays a leading or significant role in the mission's execution. Should the mission be announced or launched but not completed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as Yes if the launch has occurred. In cases where multiple missions are announced or launched, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first mission's announcement or launch. Edge cases or disputes regarding the mission's focus, JAXA's role, or the authenticity of sources will be resolved by a panel of experts in space exploration, with their decision being final.

title: Will a new genetic mutation linked to increased athleticism be identified by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a new genetic mutation is identified and scientifically validated to significantly enhance human athleticism.
