The mutation must be distinct from previously known genetic variations associated with athleticism and must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal of high impact (Impact Factor > 5.0). The discovery must be confirmed by at least two independent research groups. Enhanced athleticism is defined as a marked improvement in at least two of the following areas: strength, speed, endurance, or agility, compared to individuals without the mutation. The resolution will rely on reports from reputable scientific databases (e.g., PubMed, ScienceDirect) or announcements from major health organizations (e.g., WHO, CDC). In the event of conflicting reports, the consensus among the majority of these sources will be considered. If no such mutation is identified by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a scientific study establish a significant correlation between basketball playing and genetic markers by 2027?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, a peer-reviewed scientific study published in a reputable scientific journal (as determined by the Journal Citation Reports) establishes a significant correlation (p-value < 0.05) between playing basketball and the presence of specific genetic markers. The study must involve a sample size of at least 1,000 individuals and must be conducted by a recognized institution in the field of genetics or sports science. The findings must be replicable, with at least one independent study confirming the results under similar conditions. Studies that are retracted or significantly disputed by the scientific community will not be considered. In the absence of such a study, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a discovery of a new type of black hole by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a peer-reviewed scientific publication presents evidence of a black hole that does not fit within the currently accepted categories of stellar, intermediate, supermassive, or primordial black holes. The discovery must be recognized and confirmed by a major astronomical organization, such as the International Astronomical Union (IAU) or NASA. The evidence must include direct observations or indirect evidence that is widely accepted by the scientific community. In the case of competing claims, the date of the first publication to present the evidence will be considered. If no such discovery is made or recognized by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a former US astronaut announce a candidacy for the 2024 US Elections by 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if any individual who has flown in space as part of a NASA mission, or as a commercial astronaut recognized by the FAA, publicly announces their candidacy for any federal elected position (President, Vice President, Senate, or House of Representatives) for the 2024 US Elections before December 31, 2023. The announcement must be made through a national media outlet or an official campaign launch event. Social media posts must be from verified accounts of the individual or their official campaign. In the case of ambiguity regarding the individual's astronaut status, the resolution will defer to the official NASA or FAA records. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the James Webb Space Telescope provide evidence of the smallest black hole ever observed by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) provides evidence of the observation of a black hole smaller than any previously observed black hole as of the date of this question. The evidence must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and must be based on data collected by the JWST. The black hole in question must be confirmed as such by the scientific community, with confirmation based on the criteria used by the International Astronomical Union (IAU) or a similar authoritative body. In the event that the JWST is decommissioned or becomes inoperative before this date without having observed such a black hole, this question will resolve as No. If multiple black holes are discovered simultaneously that meet the criteria, the discovery must be confirmed and reported by December 31, 2024, for the question to resolve as Yes.

title: Will the Republican Party officially endorse a cryptocurrency for fundraising purposes by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Republican National Committee (RNC) or any official statement from a recognized authority within the Republican Party publicly endorses or adopts a specific cryptocurrency as a means for fundraising purposes. The endorsement must be clear, specifying the cryptocurrency by name, and must be intended for use in at least one official fundraising campaign. This resolution criteria does not include unofficial endorsements by individual party members or groups not recognized as authoritative by the RNC. In the event of a dispute over what constitutes an 'official endorsement,' a statement or documentation from the RNC confirming the endorsement will be considered definitive. If no such endorsement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Italy have a regulated cryptocurrency exchange operated by a major Italian bank by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a major Italian bank has established and is operating a regulated cryptocurrency exchange within Italy. A "major Italian bank" is defined as one that is among the top 5 banks in Italy by total assets, according to the latest report by the Bank of Italy or an equivalent authoritative financial institution. The cryptocurrency exchange must be recognized and regulated by the Italian Financial Market Authority (CONSOB) or another relevant regulatory body in Italy, ensuring it operates under Italian financial laws and regulations. The establishment of the exchange must be confirmed through official announcements from the bank and regulatory approvals made public by CONSOB or the relevant regulatory body. In the event that multiple banks meet these criteria before the resolution date, the question will resolve as Yes at the time the first bank's exchange becomes operational. If no such exchange is established by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Amazon integrate a cryptocurrency payment option for its customers by the end of 2024?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Amazon has officially announced and implemented a cryptocurrency payment option for its customers on any of its platforms, including but not limited to its main e-commerce site, Amazon.com, its mobile applications, or any of its subsidiary companies' platforms. The announcement must be verifiable through an official Amazon press release or a statement from a senior Amazon executive (Director level or above) in a public forum, such as a press conference, official social media account, or a reputable news outlet. The implementation must allow customers to complete transactions using one or more cryptocurrencies as a payment method. This includes the ability to select cryptocurrency at checkout, successfully process the transaction in cryptocurrency, and receive confirmation of the purchase. In the event that Amazon announces the integration but delays the implementation beyond December 31, 2024, the question will resolve as No. If Amazon announces the integration and begins a phased rollout that includes at least one country or major region by the end date, the question will resolve as Yes. Edge cases, such as the use of blockchain technology for purposes other than direct customer payments (e.g., supply chain management), will not count towards the resolution of this question.

title: Will any cryptocurrency be accepted as an official payment method for tickets at the 2024 Summer Olympics?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the start of the 2024 Summer Olympics, any cryptocurrency is officially accepted by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or the Paris Olympic Organizing Committee as a payment method for purchasing tickets to the events. Official acceptance is defined as a public announcement or statement from the IOC, the Paris Olympic Organizing Committee, or the official Olympic ticketing partner that explicitly states cryptocurrency as an accepted form of payment. This includes payments made directly on the official Olympics ticketing website, through official ticketing partners, or at physical ticket sales points designated by the organizing committees. The resolution will consider all forms of cryptocurrency, including Bitcoin, Ethereum, and any others that may be recognized as valid for transactions. In the event that the acceptance of cryptocurrency is announced and then retracted before the start of the Olympics, the question will resolve as No. If no official announcement is made by the start of the Olympics, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will a major aerospace company announce a project involving blockchain technology for supply chain management by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a major aerospace company (defined as one of the top 10 aerospace companies by revenue as of 2023, including but not limited to Boeing, Airbus, Lockheed Martin, Northrop Grumman, Raytheon Technologies, General Dynamics, BAE Systems, Leonardo S.p.A., and Safran) announces a project that involves the use of blockchain technology for managing its supply chain. The announcement must be verifiable through official company press releases, filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), or other authoritative public disclosures. In the event of a dispute regarding the legitimacy of the announcement, the resolution will defer to the most authoritative source available at the time of resolution. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Projects that are announced but not specifically described as involving blockchain technology for supply chain management will not meet the resolution criteria. In the case where a company is acquired or merges with another entity, the resulting entity will be considered for the resolution if it remains within the top 10 aerospace companies by revenue.

title: Will Google integrate a cryptocurrency wallet into its Google Pay service by the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Google has officially announced and integrated a cryptocurrency wallet feature into its Google Pay service. The integration must allow users to store, send, and receive at least one of the following cryptocurrencies: Bitcoin, Ethereum, or any other cryptocurrency that is among the top 10 by market capitalization at the time of integration. The announcement must come directly from an official Google source, such as a press release, official blog post, or public statement by a Google executive. The feature must be available to at least one of the following regions: United States, European Union, or Japan. If Google announces the integration but delays its release past December 31, 2024, the question will resolve as No. In the event that Google Pay is discontinued or rebranded before the resolution date, the question will resolve based on the existence of a cryptocurrency wallet feature within any successor service that fulfills the same role as Google Pay.

title: Will a microorganism be discovered on Mars that has a genetic structure fundamentally different from Earth-based life by 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, a microorganism is discovered on Mars that meets the following criteria:

- The microorganism must have a genetic structure that is not only distinct from but also fundamentally different from any Earth-based life forms, as determined by a consensus of at least three independent scientific studies published in peer-reviewed journals.

- The discovery must be confirmed through direct observation and analysis by a Mars mission that is recognized and validated by either NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, or an equivalent authoritative space agency.

- The genetic analysis must demonstrate clear evidence of a non-terrestrial origin, ruling out contamination from Earth-based organisms.

- In the event that multiple discoveries are reported, the resolution will be based on the first discovery that meets all the above criteria.

- If no such discovery is made by the specified date, or if all reported discoveries are conclusively proven to be of terrestrial origin or contamination, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will genetic engineering be used to create a life form capable of surviving on the surface of Mars by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, a life form has been genetically engineered and demonstrated to survive on the surface of Mars for at least 90 consecutive days without additional Earth-originated life support beyond what could be reasonably supplied by Mars itself (e.g., using Martian soil for nutrients, atmospheric CO2 for photosynthesis). The life form must be capable of performing at least one beneficial function for future Mars colonization efforts, such as oxygen production, soil enrichment, or radiation protection. Verification must come from a reputable scientific organization or a peer-reviewed scientific journal. In the event of conflicting reports, the consensus among the majority of recognized scientific bodies will be considered authoritative. If no life form has been publicly acknowledged to meet these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Republican Party include support for a manned mission to Mars in their official platform by the 2024 presidential election?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if the Republican Party's official platform for the 2024 presidential election explicitly includes support for a manned mission to Mars. This includes any commitment to funding, planning, or executing a manned mission to Mars as part of their policy agenda. The resolution will be based on the official platform document released by the Republican National Committee (RNC) or any official statements made by the RNC or the presidential nominee that confirm this policy stance. In the event that the Republican Party does not release an official platform document, the resolution will default to No. If the party's stance on this issue is ambiguous or subject to interpretation, the resolution will be determined by the most direct and explicit statement made by party officials or the presidential nominee. Secondary sources such as major news outlets, party-affiliated publications, and statements from influential party members may be considered in the absence of a clear official statement.

title: Will Canada become a global leader in quantum computing technology by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Canada meets all of the following criteria:

1. At least one Canadian company or research institution is recognized among the top 5 globally in quantum computing research, as reported by a reputable technology or scientific publication.

2. A Canadian-developed quantum computer achieves or surpasses a 100-qubit system that is publicly demonstrated and verified.

3. Canada hosts a significant international quantum computing conference, symposium, or summit that attracts global leaders in the field.

4. The Canadian government or a Canadian private sector entity announces a breakthrough in quantum computing technology that is recognized as a significant advancement by the international scientific community.

Recognition of these achievements must be based on reports from authoritative sources such as scientific journals, major technology news outlets, or official statements from recognized international technology organizations. In case of disputes over the criteria, the resolution will defer to the consensus opinion of experts in the field of quantum computing technology.

title: Will the Republican Party in the US propose a significant policy regarding technology that impacts at least 50% of the population before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the Republican Party in the United States officially proposes a policy or set of policies specifically related to technology (e.g., internet regulation, data privacy, artificial intelligence governance, etc.) that is estimated to directly impact at least 50% of the U.S. population. The impact assessment must be based on credible forecasts or studies from authoritative sources such as government agencies, recognized think tanks, or major research institutions. Policies must be formally proposed by a sitting Republican member of Congress, a Republican President, or officially endorsed by the Republican National Committee. In the event of ambiguity regarding the policy's impact scope or the percentage of the population affected, the resolution will defer to the most recent and comprehensive analysis available from a non-partisan source. If no policy meeting these criteria has been proposed by the deadline, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Tesla unveil a new electric vehicle model that is specifically designed for the European market by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if Tesla, Inc. announces, unveils, or releases a new electric vehicle model that is explicitly designed for and marketed as being suitable for the European market before January 1, 2025. The vehicle must meet the following criteria to be considered specifically designed for the European market:

- It must be advertised as meeting or exceeding the European Union's vehicle emissions standards.
- It must feature design considerations that cater to the preferences or requirements of European consumers, such as compact size, specific safety features, or charging compatibility with the European EV charging infrastructure.
- The announcement must come directly from Tesla, Inc. through an official press release, public event, or direct communication from a Tesla executive.

In the event that Tesla, Inc. merges with, is acquired by, or otherwise becomes part of another company before the resolution date, the question will still resolve based on the actions of the resulting entity. If no such vehicle is announced by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Donald Trump announce a policy position on nuclear energy or nuclear weapons before the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump, either in his capacity as a former President of the United States, a political candidate, or a private citizen, makes a public announcement or statement regarding policy on nuclear energy or nuclear weapons before December 31, 2024. The announcement must be verifiable through major news outlets, official social media accounts, or press releases from Donald Trump's office. Policy positions include, but are not limited to, statements on nuclear energy development, nuclear arms control, proliferation, disarmament, or strategic policies. In the event of ambiguous statements, the resolution will be based on the consensus interpretation among major news outlets. If Donald Trump is unable to make such announcements due to incapacitation, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will FIFA implement a policy related to nuclear technology, such as stadium energy sourcing or event safety, by the 2026 World Cup?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the start of the 2026 FIFA World Cup, FIFA has officially announced and implemented a policy that directly involves the use of nuclear technology in any aspect related to the World Cup events. This includes, but is not limited to, the use of nuclear energy for powering stadiums, the implementation of nuclear safety measures for event security, or the use of nuclear technology in medical facilities at the event sites. The policy must be clearly documented and publicly accessible through FIFA's official channels or reputable news sources. In the event that FIFA announces such a policy but it is not implemented by the start of the World Cup, the question will resolve as No. If FIFA is dissolved or the 2026 World Cup is canceled for any reason, the question will resolve as N/A (Not Applicable).

title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in the use of nuclear technology for epidemiological research or treatment by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant breakthrough in the use of nuclear technology for epidemiological research or treatment, as evidenced by one or more of the following criteria:

- The development and successful deployment of a nuclear-based technology that significantly improves the speed, accuracy, or scope of epidemiological research, with results published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.

- The introduction and clinical approval of a nuclear medicine treatment that demonstrates a substantial improvement in patient outcomes for a major infectious disease, as reported by a leading health organization such as the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

- The establishment of a new nuclear technology that enables a novel approach to epidemiological research or treatment, receiving formal recognition or an award from a reputable scientific or medical body.

In cases where the breakthrough is disputed or unclear, a panel of experts from relevant scientific communities will be consulted to make a final determination. The resolution will not consider advancements that are purely theoretical or not yet applied in practice.

title: Will Google develop a nuclear fusion reactor by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Google (or any of its subsidiaries or affiliated companies) has successfully developed and demonstrated a nuclear fusion reactor that meets the following criteria:

Operational Capability: The reactor must have been operated continuously for at least 24 hours, producing a net energy output (energy produced minus energy consumed to initiate and sustain the fusion reaction) that is positive.

Public Demonstration: The development and operational capabilities of the reactor must be publicly demonstrated and verified by an independent third-party organization recognized for expertise in nuclear fusion technology.

Regulatory Approval: The reactor must have received all necessary regulatory approvals for operation from relevant governmental and international bodies.

In the event that multiple entities claim to have developed a nuclear fusion reactor, the resolution will consider the first reactor to meet all the above criteria as per the date of the public demonstration and verification.

title: Will Italy phase out all nuclear power plants by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, Italy has officially shut down and ceased operations at all of its nuclear power plants, including those currently operational, under construction, or planned as of 2023. The shutdown process must be confirmed by an official statement from the Italian government or the relevant regulatory body overseeing nuclear energy in Italy. In the event that Italy announces the construction of new nuclear power plants after 2023, this question will also consider the status of those plants in its resolution. If any nuclear power plant in Italy is still operational, under construction, or planned but not canceled by the end of 2035, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, 'phasing out' refers to the complete cessation of nuclear energy production and the decommissioning of all nuclear power facilities. The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) reports and official Italian government publications will serve as authoritative sources for verification.

title: Will a major breakthrough in nuclear biology lead to a new form of cancer treatment by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, a breakthrough in nuclear biology leads to the development of a new form of cancer treatment that meets the following criteria:

- The treatment must be based on a novel mechanism of action, distinct from existing therapies, and directly related to nuclear biology.
- It must have received approval from a major health regulatory authority (e.g., FDA in the United States, EMA in Europe) for clinical use in humans.
- The treatment must demonstrate a statistically significant improvement in survival rates or quality of life in phase III clinical trials compared to the current standard of care.

In the event that multiple treatments meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the approval of the first such treatment. If no treatment has been approved but is in late-stage clinical trials (phase III) by the resolution date, the question will remain open until the outcome of these trials is publicly announced.

Fallback scenario: If no authoritative source can confirm the approval and effectiveness of a new treatment by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a breakthrough in space medicine that allows for long-term human habitation in space without significant health detriments by 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, there is a publicly documented and peer-reviewed scientific breakthrough in space medicine that meets all of the following criteria:

A significant reduction (at least 50%) in the health detriments associated with long-term space habitation, such as bone density loss, muscle atrophy, and radiation exposure, as compared to the standards documented as of 2020.

The development of a medically approved treatment or technology that enables humans to live and work in space for periods exceeding one year without requiring return to Earth for medical reasons.

The breakthrough must be recognized by at least one of the following authoritative bodies: NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, or an equivalent national or international space agency.

In the event that multiple breakthroughs are announced, the resolution will be based on the first breakthrough that meets all the above criteria.

Fallback scenario: If no single breakthrough meets all criteria but there is significant progress in multiple areas of space medicine that collectively achieve the desired outcome, the question may resolve as Yes at the discretion of the question administrators.

title: Will Elon Musk's companies launch a mission to retrieve samples from the Martian surface before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, any of Elon Musk's companies (including but not limited to SpaceX, Tesla, Neuralink, and The Boring Company) successfully launches a mission that lands on Mars and returns to Earth with samples from the Martian surface. The mission must be verifiable through either direct telemetry data, mission recordings, or official statements from the company or a recognized space authority (e.g., NASA, ESA). The samples must be confirmed to be from Mars through scientific analysis by a reputable institution. In the event of a dispute over the mission's success or the origin of the samples, a panel of experts from at least three different recognized space or scientific organizations will make the final determination. Missions that only achieve orbit around Mars without landing or that land without returning samples will not meet the resolution criteria. Missions that are launched but do not return to Earth for any reason (e.g., mission failure, loss of communication) will also not meet the resolution criteria.

title: Will a former 2020 US presidential election candidate be involved in a commercial space flight before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if any candidate who ran in the 2020 US presidential election participates in a commercial space flight as a passenger, crew member, or pilot before January 1, 2025. A "commercial space flight" is defined as any space flight conducted by a private company, intended for research, tourism, or commercial purposes, that successfully leaves the Earth's atmosphere and returns. Participation must be confirmed by flight records, the individual's public statement, or official announcement from the space flight company. In the event of a dispute over the definition of "commercial space flight" or the status of the flight as leaving Earth's atmosphere, the resolution will defer to the classification by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) or an equivalent international authority. If no such flight occurs, or if a candidate's participation cannot be independently verified, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a Major League Baseball (MLB) team employ a biologist to optimize player performance by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, an MLB team officially announces or is confirmed to have employed a full-time biologist whose primary role is to optimize player performance through biological insights and interventions. The biologist must be employed in a capacity that is directly related to enhancing the physical or mental performance of the team's players, as opposed to roles focused on general health or injury rehabilitation. Verification of employment can be through official team announcements, credible media reports, or statements from the team's executive staff. The role of the biologist must be clearly defined as focusing on performance optimization, and not merely a consultant or part-time position. In the event of a dispute regarding the biologist's role or employment status, a statement from the MLB team's executive will serve as the final arbiter.

title: Will Mexico establish a new scientific research station in Antarctica by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Mexican government, or any Mexico-based entity, officially announces and subsequently establishes a scientific research station in Antarctica before January 1, 2030. The station must be operational, with at least one scientific expedition having been conducted or in progress by the resolution date. The establishment of the station will be confirmed through official government statements, press releases from the involved entities, or coverage by major international news organizations. In the event of a dispute regarding the operational status of the station, the decision of the Antarctic Treaty Consultative Meeting (ATCM) will be considered final. If no station is established by the deadline, or if the project is officially canceled, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new species of mammal be discovered in the Amazon rainforest by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a new species of mammal is discovered in the Amazon rainforest and meets the following criteria:

- The discovery is documented and described in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.
- The species is recognized as new to science by a reputable scientific body, such as the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) or a similar organization.
- The species must be physically distinct and genetically divergent from previously known species, as confirmed by genetic analysis.

In the event that multiple new species are discovered, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first such discovery meeting these criteria. If the discovery is announced but not peer-reviewed by the resolution date, the question will remain open until the peer-review process is completed. If no discovery meets these criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a significant political event directly related to epidemiology, such as a major public health bill or a national pandemic preparedness initiative, announced in the United States before 2025?
body:
Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the United States government announces a significant political event directly related to epidemiology. This includes, but is not limited to, the passing of a major public health bill, the launch of a national pandemic preparedness initiative, or the establishment of a substantial new public health agency or program. 

Significant is defined as involving an allocation of resources or funding exceeding $1 billion USD, the establishment of a new national policy, or a program expected to significantly impact public health practices or infrastructure. 

The announcement must be confirmed through official government channels, such as a press release from the relevant government agency, statements from elected officials, or official government websites. In the event of ambiguity or disputed outcomes, the resolution will defer to the interpretation by a panel of experts in public health and political science, convened by the question's administrators. 

Edge cases, such as announcements made very close to the deadline or minor initiatives that are part of a larger, significant event, will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

title: Will NASA announce a new political initiative or partnership with another country's space agency for a joint mission before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, NASA officially announces a new political initiative or forms a partnership with another country's space agency for the purpose of a joint mission. The announcement must be made through official NASA channels, including press releases, official social media accounts, or a formal statement during a press conference. The initiative or partnership must be explicitly for a joint mission, which could include manned or unmanned space exploration, scientific research, or technology development in space. Collaborations solely for funding or logistical support without a specific mission objective will not meet the criteria. In the event of ambiguity regarding the announcement's intent or the partnership's nature, the resolution will defer to the most detailed official document or statement available by the resolution date. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Bureau of Labor Statistics report a significant change in employment rates in the political sector by the end of 2025?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reports a change in employment rates in the political sector (including elected officials, political consultants, and campaign staff) of more than 5% in either direction (increase or decrease) from the baseline rates reported as of December 31, 2021. The BLS's Employment Situation Summary or a similar authoritative report will be used as the source of data. In the event that the BLS discontinues this report or significantly alters its methodology, a comparable report from a recognized statistical agency will be used. If no direct data on the political sector is available, an estimation based on related categories (e.g., public administration, legal occupations) will be considered, provided that the estimation method is detailed and justified by a reputable economic research institution.

title: Will any city hosting the Summer or Winter Olympics by 2030 contribute to a measurable increase in global GDP growth in the year of the event?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, for any city hosting the Summer or Winter Olympics by the end of 2030, there is a measurable increase in global GDP growth in the year of the event compared to the previous year. The increase must be reported by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank. A "measurable increase" is defined as a growth rate that is at least 0.1 percentage points higher than the growth rate of the previous year. In the event that both the IMF and the World Bank report differing figures, the average of their reported growth rates will be used for resolution. If neither organization provides a specific report on global GDP growth for the year in question by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases, such as a city hosting the Olympics but the event being postponed or canceled, will result in the question resolving as No unless the Olympics are rescheduled within the same calendar year.

title: Will the US Senate pass a bill by 2025 that directly leads to the creation of at least 1 million new jobs?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the US Senate passes a bill that explicitly aims to create at least 1 million new jobs within the United States. The bill must be signed into law by the President of the United States and must include provisions that directly lead to job creation, such as funding for new infrastructure projects, tax incentives for businesses that hire additional employees, or significant investment in renewable energy or technology sectors. The resolution will be based on official statements from the US Department of Labor or a similar authoritative body confirming the creation of at least 1 million new jobs as a direct result of the bill's implementation. In the event that multiple bills are passed that cumulatively lead to the creation of at least 1 million new jobs, this will also result in a Yes resolution. If the bill is passed but later repealed or significantly altered before its effects can be measured, the question will resolve as No. In cases where job creation is ambiguous or cannot be directly attributed to the bill, the question will remain unresolved until clear evidence is provided.

title: Will a major climatological event cause a global economic downturn with a GDP contraction of at least 0.5% in any year before 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2035, a major climatological event (such as a hurricane, drought, flood, wildfire, or other significant weather-related disaster) directly results in a global economic downturn, defined as a worldwide GDP contraction of at least 0.5% in a single calendar year, as reported by the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF). The event must be clearly identified as the primary cause of the economic downturn by these organizations or a consensus of economic analyses from at least three major global financial institutions (e.g., J.P. Morgan, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley). In the absence of a clear consensus or direct attribution to a single event, a panel of five economic experts from recognized global economic institutions will be convened to make a determination based on available data and reports. This panel's decision will be final. In the event that global GDP data is not available or significantly delayed beyond the resolution date, the question will resolve based on the most recent data available prior to the delay.

title: Will a major philosophical theory emerge by 2030 that redefines human understanding of space?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new philosophical theory emerges that significantly alters the current human understanding of space. The theory must meet the following criteria:

- It is published in a peer-reviewed academic journal or presented at a major academic conference.
- It receives widespread recognition within the philosophical community, as evidenced by citations in subsequent academic works or endorsements by recognized experts in the field.
- The theory introduces a novel conceptual framework or significantly revises existing concepts of space, going beyond mere refinements of current theories.
- The theory is discussed in mainstream media or becomes a subject of study in academic courses.

In the event that multiple theories emerge, the one that first meets all the above criteria will be considered for resolution. If no theory meets these criteria by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Democratic Party (US) propose a bill focused on the militarization of space by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, a bill is formally proposed in either the United States House of Representatives or the Senate by one or more members of the Democratic Party that specifically aims to increase, expand, or enhance the United States' military capabilities or presence in outer space. This includes, but is not limited to, the development, deployment, or enhancement of space-based weaponry, defense systems, surveillance systems, or manned or unmanned spacecraft intended for military use.

The bill must be officially recognized and documented by a reputable source such as the Congressional Record, official government websites, or major media outlets. Drafts, informal proposals, or discussions not resulting in an official bill proposal will not be considered for this question's resolution.

In the event that multiple bills fitting these criteria are proposed, the resolution will be based on the first bill's proposal date. If no such bill is proposed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Norway's sovereign wealth fund, the Government Pension Fund Global, exceed $1.5 trillion in value before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Government Pension Fund Global (GPFG) of Norway's total value exceeds $1.5 trillion USD at any point before January 1, 2030, according to official statements or reports from Norges Bank Investment Management (NBIM), the entity responsible for managing the fund. The value of the GPFG will be considered in USD, and any fluctuations in currency exchange rates affecting the valuation will be taken into account. The resolution will rely on publicly available data from NBIM or other authoritative financial sources recognized by the global financial community. In the event of discrepancies between sources, the official NBIM report will take precedence. If NBIM ceases to exist or the GPFG is fundamentally restructured before 2030, the question will resolve based on the most comparable successor entity or fund structure, as determined by Metaculus Admins.

title: Will the United Nations establish a new international economic development program focused on post-pandemic recovery before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the United Nations officially announces the establishment of a new international economic development program specifically aimed at post-pandemic recovery. The program must be designed to address the economic impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic and should include measures such as financial aid, policy advice, and technical assistance to affected countries. The announcement must be made through official UN channels, such as a press release on the UN's official website, a statement by the UN Secretary-General, or a resolution passed by the UN General Assembly or the Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC). In the event of ambiguity regarding the program's focus on post-pandemic recovery, the resolution will be based on the program's official documentation and objectives as stated by the UN. If multiple programs are announced, the question will resolve as Yes upon the announcement of the first program that meets these criteria.

title: Will SpaceX successfully launch and return a spacecraft from a lunar mission by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if SpaceX successfully launches a spacecraft that travels to the Moon, completes its mission objectives (whether it be landing on the Moon, orbiting it, or conducting specific experiments in lunar vicinity), and then returns safely to Earth, with all mission objectives confirmed as completed by SpaceX or an authoritative space exploration agency (e.g., NASA, ESA) before January 1, 2030. The mission must be manned or unmanned with clear, predefined objectives related to lunar exploration or technology demonstration. Safe return is defined as the spacecraft landing back on Earth in a condition that allows for post-mission analysis or reuse, as confirmed by SpaceX or the overseeing space agency. In the event of a dispute regarding the mission's success, an independent panel of aerospace experts will be convened to review the mission outcomes. This panel's decision will be considered final. If SpaceX does not attempt a lunar mission by this date, or if the mission is attempted but fails to meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will machine learning technology contribute to a reduction in global unemployment rates by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, global unemployment rates have decreased by at least 5% from the rate reported by the International Labour Organization (ILO) for the year 2020. The ILO's standard measurement methodologies for unemployment rates will be used for comparison. This includes individuals actively seeking employment as a percentage of the labor force, excluding those in involuntary part-time or underemployed positions. A reduction must be observed in the annual average global unemployment rate, as reported by the ILO, to account for seasonal variations and ensure a consistent comparison. In the event that the ILO ceases to exist, is unable to report, or significantly changes its methodology, a comparable authoritative global economic organization's data will be used as a fallback. The resolution will also consider adjustments or revisions made by the ILO or its successor to the 2020 unemployment rate, provided such changes are publicly documented and justified based on standard economic practices.

title: Will France's economy enter a recession in the next five years?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if France's economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point within the next five years, as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies (INSEE) of France or any other authoritative economic body recognized internationally. The GDP growth rates must be adjusted for inflation and seasonally adjusted to ensure accurate comparison. If INSEE or equivalent authoritative body revises its GDP growth figures after the initial announcement, the resolution will be based on the revised figures. In the event that INSEE or a similar authoritative body ceases to exist, fails to report, or there is significant evidence of data manipulation, the resolution will rely on data from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank. If none of these sources are available, the question will not resolve.

title: Will Ukraine develop a new scientific breakthrough in radiation decontamination technology by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Ukraine announces the development of a new scientific breakthrough in radiation decontamination technology that meets the following criteria:

- The technology must demonstrate a significant improvement over existing methods in terms of efficiency, cost, safety, or environmental impact.

- The breakthrough must be verified by at least two independent and reputable scientific or technological institutions.

- The technology must be applicable on a large scale and have been successfully tested in at least one contaminated site within Ukraine or elsewhere.

- The announcement must be made through official government channels or recognized scientific journals.

In the event that multiple technologies are announced, the one that shows the most promise based on the above criteria will be considered for resolution. If no such technology is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will NASA discover definitive evidence of past or present life on Mars by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, NASA (or any entity recognized by NASA) publicly announces and provides evidence that meets the following criteria for definitive evidence of past or present life on Mars:

Microbial Life: Discovery of microbial life forms that are conclusively identified as having originated on Mars, through genetic or biochemical analysis.

Fossilized Life: Unambiguous identification of fossils that are conclusively determined to be of Martian origin, indicating past life.

Biochemical Markers: Detection of biochemical markers such as specific isotopes or molecules that are uniquely associated with biological processes and are indisputably Martian in origin.

Atmospheric or Soil Analysis: Results from atmospheric or soil analysis that provide incontrovertible evidence of biological activity on Mars.

The evidence must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or officially announced at a major scientific conference. In the event of a dispute over the evidence, a panel of experts appointed by NASA will make the final determination.

Fallback Scenario: If no direct evidence is found but there are significant indirect signs (e.g., unexplained methane emissions, organic molecules) that strongly suggest the presence of life, the question may resolve as Yes, subject to a consensus among a panel of experts recognized by NASA.

title: Will a new material be developed by 2025 that significantly increases the distance of golf drives compared to current materials?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new material is developed and used in the manufacturing of golf clubs that results in an average increase of at least 15% in the driving distance of golf balls over the current record, as measured by the Official World Golf Ranking (OWGR) sanctioned events or equivalent authoritative body. The material must be publicly acknowledged by a leading golf equipment manufacturer or a recognized scientific publication as being responsible for the performance improvement. In the event of multiple materials being developed, the one that achieves the highest verified increase will be considered. If no such material is developed, or if the increase does not meet or exceed the specified threshold, the question will resolve as No. In cases where the increase is disputed, the resolution will defer to the judgment of an independent panel of experts agreed upon by major stakeholders in the golf industry.

title: Will Germany lead Europe in electric vehicle production by surpassing 1 million EVs produced annually by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by the end of the year 2025, Germany has produced more than 1 million electric vehicles (EVs) within a single calendar year, surpassing any other European country's annual EV production within the same timeframe. 

For the purpose of this question, "electric vehicles" are defined as fully electric passenger cars, excluding hybrid models. Production numbers must be verified by an authoritative source such as the European Automobile Manufacturers' Association (ACEA) or national automotive industry associations. 

In the event that official production numbers are not released by January 1, 2026, or if there is a significant dispute regarding the accuracy of the reported numbers, the question will resolve based on the most reliable data available at that time, as determined by a panel of Metaculus Admins.

title: Will Tesla announce the construction of a new Gigafactory in Spain by the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Tesla, Inc. announces the initiation of construction for a new Gigafactory in Spain before January 1, 2025. The announcement must be verifiable through official Tesla communications, including but not limited to press releases, official social media posts, or direct statements from Elon Musk or other authorized Tesla spokespersons. The Gigafactory must be explicitly stated to be located within the geographical boundaries of Spain, and the construction must be intended to start before the end of 2025. In the absence of a clear announcement by Tesla, Inc. regarding the construction of a Gigafactory in Spain by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, a 'Gigafactory' is defined as a large-scale manufacturing facility operated by Tesla, Inc. that is primarily focused on the production of electric vehicles and/or battery cells. Announcements made in any language will be considered valid, provided they can be accurately translated and verified.

title: Will Brazil implement a nationwide 5G network, achieving 95% coverage, by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, Brazil has officially implemented a nationwide 5G network with at least 95% geographical coverage of its territory, including rural and urban areas. The assessment of coverage must be verified by Brazil's National Telecommunications Agency (Anatel) or an equivalent authoritative body. The coverage percentage will be determined based on the latest official reports or statements from Anatel or the responsible governmental body. In the event of a dispute regarding the coverage percentage, the resolution will defer to the most recent and comprehensive data available from Anatel. If Anatel is dissolved or its responsibilities significantly altered, an equivalent authoritative source recognized by the Brazilian government will be used for verification. This question will resolve as No if the 95% coverage threshold is not met by the specified date, regardless of the progress made.

title: Will any NHL team launch a cryptocurrency or blockchain-based fan engagement platform by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any team in the National Hockey League (NHL) has officially launched a platform that utilizes cryptocurrency or blockchain technology for the purpose of fan engagement. This includes, but is not limited to, platforms for voting on team decisions, digital collectibles, fan rewards, and exclusive content access. 

The launch of such a platform must be confirmed through official team announcements, press releases, or credible media reports. In the event of ambiguity regarding the platform's primary function or the technology used, the resolution will defer to the most authoritative source available at the time. 

If multiple teams announce or launch similar platforms simultaneously, the resolution will consider the earliest official announcement date as the deciding factor. In the absence of clear evidence by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a cryptocurrency's market behavior be found to have been significantly influenced by the 2020 US presidential election by the end of 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, there is substantial evidence presented in a peer-reviewed financial or economic journal that demonstrates a significant influence of the 2020 US presidential election on the market behavior of any major cryptocurrency (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum). Significant influence includes, but is not limited to, changes in market value, trading volume, or investor behavior directly attributed to the election's outcome. The analysis must be based on data and methodologies widely accepted in the field of economics or finance. In the absence of such evidence, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, a 'major cryptocurrency' is defined as one with a market capitalization exceeding $10 billion USD at any point within the year 2020. In case of conflicting evidence from multiple sources, the consensus among the most cited studies in subsequent peer-reviewed literature will be considered definitive.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency integrate a machine learning algorithm into its consensus mechanism by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a cryptocurrency that is ranked within the top 10 by market capitalization according to CoinMarketCap or a similarly reputable cryptocurrency market analysis website integrates a machine learning algorithm into its consensus mechanism. The integration must be verifiable through official documentation or announcements from the cryptocurrency's development team, and the machine learning algorithm must play a significant role in the decision-making process of the consensus mechanism, not merely a peripheral or minor task. In the event that CoinMarketCap is no longer available or considered reputable, a comparable authoritative source will be used to determine the top 10 cryptocurrencies. If there is any ambiguity regarding the integration's significance or the role of the machine learning algorithm, a panel of three experts in blockchain technology and machine learning, agreed upon by the question's administrators, will make the final determination. Edge cases, such as the integration of machine learning in a sidechain or secondary layer specifically designed to influence the main consensus mechanism, will also be considered as fulfilling the criteria.

title: Will France elect a president from a political party that has never held the presidency before by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1, 2030, a candidate from a political party that has never before held the presidency of France is officially declared the winner of a French presidential election. The determination of whether a party has previously held the presidency will be based on historical records from the French Interior Ministry. In the event of a dispute over the election results, the question will resolve based on the final decision of the Constitutional Council of France. If no election is held before the resolution date due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., a state of emergency), the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Norway introduce a new major policy to significantly reduce its domestic oil production by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Norwegian government officially announces and begins the implementation of a policy or set of policies aimed at reducing Norway's domestic oil production by at least 20% from 2020 levels. The policy must be significant, meaning it should lead to a tangible reduction in oil production volumes and not merely represent a shift in oil production strategies or a reclassification of oil production categories. The announcement must be made through official government channels, such as a press release from the Ministry of Petroleum and Energy, a policy paper, or a legislative act passed by the Storting (Norwegian Parliament). In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear governmental announcement, the resolution will be based on the most reliable and authoritative sources available at the time, including but not limited to official government publications, verified news reports, and statements from key government officials. If the policy is announced but its implementation is significantly delayed or cancelled, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a machine learning algorithm be used to make a legally binding decision in a national court in any country by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a machine learning algorithm is officially used to make a legally binding decision in a national court in any country. The decision can be in any form, including but not limited to sentencing, bail determination, or verdict. The use of the algorithm must be acknowledged by the court or a relevant governmental authority and reported by at least two reputable news sources or official government publications. The algorithm must play a central role in the decision-making process, rather than merely providing supplementary information. In the event of ambiguous cases, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative source available. If no such use is confirmed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will North Korea launch a satellite into space that is recognized by international authorities by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (North Korea) successfully launches a satellite into space, and this launch is officially recognized by any of the following international authorities: 

- The United Nations Office for Outer Space Affairs (UNOOSA)
- The International Astronautical Federation (IAF)
- The International Telecommunication Union (ITU)

Recognition must be in the form of a public announcement or official documentation confirming the satellite's launch and its successful placement into orbit. 

In the event of a dispute regarding the launch's recognition, the question will defer to the judgment of the UNOOSA as the final authority. 

Satellites launched for any purpose, including but not limited to communication, earth observation, or scientific research, will be considered. 

If North Korea announces a launch but fails to achieve orbit, or if the launch is not recognized by the aforementioned authorities, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Biden administration announce a new space policy initiative focused on lunar exploration before the end of 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before December 31, 2024, the Biden administration officially announces a new space policy initiative that is specifically focused on lunar exploration. The announcement must be made by an official government spokesperson or through a formal government publication, such as a press release, policy document, or official government website. The initiative must explicitly mention the goal of exploring the Moon, whether it involves manned or unmanned missions, and may include objectives such as establishing a lunar base, conducting scientific research, or exploiting lunar resources. If the announcement is ambiguous or does not explicitly mention lunar exploration as a primary focus, the question will resolve as No. In the event that the Biden administration ends before December 31, 2024, without making such an announcement, the question will also resolve as No. Should the administration change due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., impeachment, resignation), the resolution criteria will apply to the acting administration at the time of the announcement.

title: Will California have a state-issued cryptocurrency by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the State of California has officially issued, endorsed, or adopted a digital currency that is recognized as legal tender within the state. The cryptocurrency must be either created by a state agency or officially sanctioned by the state government, and its use must be legally recognized for the payment of taxes, fees, and other public charges. The resolution will rely on official statements from the California State Treasurer's Office, the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation, or any other relevant state authority. In the event of ambiguous or conflicting information, the most recent and authoritative source will be considered definitive. If multiple digital currencies are issued or endorsed, the first to meet these criteria will be the basis for resolution. This question will resolve as No if no such cryptocurrency is issued by the specified date. In the event that California endorses a federal digital currency, this will not count towards resolution unless the state plays a significant role in its creation or issuance.

title: Will OpenAI develop a cryptocurrency trading bot that outperforms the S&P 500 by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, OpenAI has developed and publicly announced a cryptocurrency trading bot that, over a period of at least one year, achieves a net return exceeding the total return (including dividends reinvested) of the S&P 500 over the same period. The performance of the bot must be verified by a reputable financial analysis firm or a peer-reviewed publication in the field of finance. The bot's performance must be based on live trading data, not simulations or back-tested models. In the event that OpenAI merges with, is acquired by, or significantly collaborates with another entity to develop the bot, the question will still resolve as Yes, provided the bot meets the above criteria. If OpenAI ceases operations before this date without having developed such a bot, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Russia develop a new encryption technology that becomes a global standard by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Russia has developed an encryption technology that:

Is officially adopted as a standard by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF), or another globally recognized standards body.

Demonstrates a significant advancement in encryption technology, as evidenced by widespread adoption in at least two of the following sectors: government, finance, healthcare, or technology.

Has been publicly disclosed and its specifications are available for review by international cybersecurity experts.

In the event that multiple encryption technologies are developed, the one with the widest adoption and recognition as a standard will be considered for resolution.

If no technology meets these criteria by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

Fallback scenario: If there is controversy or ambiguity regarding the adoption or standardization of the technology, a panel of three independent cybersecurity experts will be convened to make a determination based on the criteria above.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US make a landmark decision regarding the regulation of artificial intelligence by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Supreme Court of the United States issues a decision on a case that significantly impacts the regulation of artificial intelligence (AI) in the United States. The decision must directly address the regulation of AI technologies or the legal rights and responsibilities of AI entities. Landmark decisions are defined as those that establish new legal standards or significantly alter existing legal interpretations or regulatory frameworks. The resolution will be based on official Supreme Court documents and major legal analyses. In the event that the Supreme Court does not directly address AI regulation but makes a decision that indirectly impacts AI regulation significantly, this will also be considered for resolution. If no such decision is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a golfer break the current record for the lowest 18-hole score in a major championship by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any professional golfer breaks the current record for the lowest 18-hole score in a major championship (as of 2023, the record is 62). The major championships considered for this resolution are The Masters, the U.S. Open, The Open Championship, and the PGA Championship. The score must be officially recognized by the organizing body of the respective championship. In the event of a tie, where multiple golfers achieve a score lower than the current record within the same year, the resolution will still be Yes. If the structure or official recognition criteria of these championships change, the resolution will defer to the most directly comparable major championship(s) as determined by the organizing bodies' official statements. Tie-breaker rounds or scores achieved outside of the official tournament rounds will not count towards this resolution.

title: Will researchers discover a new fundamental particle by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new fundamental particle is discovered and confirmed by either the Large Hadron Collider (LHC) at CERN, the Fermilab Tevatron, or an equivalent or more advanced facility. The discovery must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal and recognized by the International Union of Pure and Applied Physics (IUPAP). The particle must not be a composite of known particles and must be a fundamental constituent of matter as defined by the Standard Model of particle physics or any subsequent model that is widely accepted by the scientific community at the time of discovery. In the event that multiple particles are discovered simultaneously or within the same research project, each will be considered separately for the resolution of this question. If the discovery is contested or requires further verification, the resolution date may be extended to accommodate peer review and consensus within the scientific community.

title: Will Formula 1 introduce a significant technological innovation that reduces average race times by more than 5% by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Formula 1 has introduced a technological innovation that is officially recognized by the Fédération Internationale de l'Automobile (FIA) as having reduced the average race times by more than 5% compared to the 2020 season. The innovation must be implemented in at least half of the season's races to qualify. 

For the purpose of this question, a "significant technological innovation" is defined as any new technology, material, or engineering approach that is not a minor modification of existing technologies and has been applied in the construction or operation of the Formula 1 cars. 

In the event that the FIA does not provide a clear statement regarding the impact of the innovation on race times, an independent analysis by a recognized authority in automotive engineering or motorsport analytics will be considered sufficient. 

If the 2030 Formula 1 season is canceled or significantly shortened (less than half of the planned races are held), the question will resolve as N/A.

title: Will a new microbiology discovery lead to a significant shift in the global economy by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a discovery in the field of microbiology leads to any of the following outcomes:

A new class of antibiotics or antivirals is developed, leading to a significant reduction in global morbidity and mortality rates from infectious diseases, as reported by the World Health Organization (WHO).

The creation of a microorganism-based technology or product that results in a market valuation exceeding $100 billion USD, as confirmed by financial reports from Bloomberg, Forbes, or similar authoritative financial news sources.

A breakthrough in microbiology that enables a sustainable alternative to a major agricultural or industrial process, leading to a reduction of at least 20% in the associated environmental impact, as verified by the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) or a similar authoritative body.

In the event that multiple discoveries meet these criteria, the resolution will be based on the first publicly announced discovery. If no such discovery is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

For the purpose of this resolution, a "significant shift in the global economy" is defined as a change that has a measurable impact on global economic indicators, such as GDP growth, trade balances, or employment rates, as reported by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank.

title: Will Donald Trump's business ventures significantly impact the US stock market by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any of Donald Trump's business ventures directly cause a movement of more than 5% in the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) or the S&P 500 index on a single trading day. The movement can be either positive or negative and must be attributed to a specific action or announcement from one of Trump's businesses, as confirmed by at least three major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal). 

In the event that the DJIA or the S&P 500 are no longer the primary indices for measuring the US stock market's performance, the resolution will consider the most relevant indices at that time. If no single day movement of more than 5% occurs but there is a cumulative movement of 10% or more over a calendar month directly attributed to Trump's business activities, this will also result in a Yes resolution. 

Edge cases or ambiguous situations will be resolved by a panel of three financial experts, with their decision being final.

title: Will there be a major engineering breakthrough that revolutionizes the construction industry by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a breakthrough in engineering is publicly announced and recognized by at least one of the following authoritative sources: The American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE), The Institution of Civil Engineers (ICE), or The International Federation of Consulting Engineers (FIDIC). The breakthrough must meet all of the following criteria:

Significantly reduce construction time or costs by at least 20% compared to current standards.
Demonstrate a substantial improvement in sustainability or environmental impact, such as reducing carbon emissions or material waste by at least 20%.
Be applicable and scalable to at least two of the following sectors: residential, commercial, infrastructure, or industrial construction.

In the event that multiple breakthroughs are announced, the one that is first to be publicly recognized by any of the listed authoritative sources will be considered for resolution. If no such breakthrough is recognized by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Scott Alexander publish a book related to technology forecasting by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Scott Alexander publishes a book primarily focused on technology forecasting before January 1, 2030. The book must be a new work (not a compilation of blog posts) and must be published by a recognized publishing house or self-published with significant public recognition (e.g., featured in major technology or literature publications). Digital publications are acceptable. The resolution will rely on public announcements, publisher releases, or direct confirmation from Scott Alexander. In the event of ambiguity regarding the book's primary focus, a panel of Metaculus admins will make the final determination. Pre-prints, drafts, or partial releases will not count towards this resolution.

title: Will a new biological computing device be patented by 2025?
body:
A "biological computing device" is defined as a device that utilizes biological components to perform computational tasks, which may include but is not limited to DNA computing, protein computing, or cellular computing systems. This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, at least one patent is granted for a device that meets the following criteria:

The device must utilize biological materials or systems as a primary means of computation.
The patent must be granted by a recognized patent authority, such as the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO), the European Patent Office (EPO), or an equivalent national patent office.
The patent documentation must clearly describe the biological computing mechanism and its computational capabilities.
In the event of multiple patents being filed on similar devices, the resolution will be based on the date of the first patent grant.
If no patent is granted by the specified date but is later found to have been filed before the deadline, the question will resolve as Yes retroactively.

title: Will a quantum computer solve a problem that is intractable for classical computers before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a quantum computer solves a problem that is currently considered intractable for classical computers. For the purposes of this question, a problem is considered "intractable" if no classical computer can solve it within a reasonable time frame, typically understood to mean within the lifespan of the universe using current algorithms and hardware. The solution must be verified by a peer-reviewed scientific publication and recognized by a leading authority in quantum computing, such as the Quantum Computing Institute at the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) or an equivalent organization. In the event of a dispute over the resolution, the decision of a panel of experts convened by the International Quantum Computing Association (IQCA) will be considered final. Edge cases, such as solutions that marginally improve upon classical computing times but do not fully demonstrate quantum supremacy, will not count towards the resolution of this question.

title: Will Israel deploy a nationwide 6G network by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the State of Israel has officially announced and demonstrated the deployment of a 6G wireless network covering at least 80% of its national territory. The network must be capable of delivering data speeds significantly higher than those of the preceding 5G technology, as defined by the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) or a similar authoritative body. The deployment must be confirmed by either an official statement from the Israeli government or a recognized telecommunications authority within Israel. In the event of a partial deployment (less than 80% coverage) or if the technology does not meet the specified speed improvements over 5G, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, 'deployment' refers to the network being operational and available for commercial or public use, not merely in a testing phase. If there is ambiguity regarding the extent of deployment or the technology's capabilities, the resolution will defer to the most recent and comprehensive data available from the ITU or an equivalent body.

title: Will the United Nations establish a dedicated body for regulating AI ethics and standards by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United Nations officially announces the establishment of a dedicated body tasked with regulating AI ethics and standards. The body must be recognized by the UN General Assembly or an equivalent authoritative entity within the UN system, and its mandate must explicitly cover the development, implementation, and oversight of global AI ethics and standards. The resolution will rely on official UN press releases, statements from UN officials, or documentation from UN websites as primary sources of verification. In the event that the UN announces the intention to establish such a body but it is not officially operational by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If the UN is dissolved or undergoes significant restructuring that makes the establishment of new bodies impossible, an alternative resolution mechanism will be considered based on the context at the time.

title: Will NASA develop an AI system capable of autonomously managing a space mission by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, NASA has developed and successfully tested an AI system with the capability to autonomously manage at least one aspect of a space mission, including but not limited to navigation, communication, or scientific research.
