The AI system must demonstrate its ability to perform these tasks without human intervention for the duration of a mission phase, as confirmed by NASA or an authoritative space exploration body. The development and testing of the AI system must be documented and publicly announced by NASA or through a reputable scientific publication. In the event of a dispute regarding the AI system's capabilities, a panel of experts from institutions such as the International Astronautical Federation (IAF) or the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA) will make the final determination. Edge cases, such as partial autonomy with significant human oversight, will not meet the criteria for resolution. If no such AI system has been publicly acknowledged by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Germany implement a national AI strategy that mandates ethical guidelines for AI development by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the German government officially announces and implements a national AI strategy that includes specific mandates or guidelines focusing on the ethical development, deployment, and management of artificial intelligence technologies. The strategy must explicitly address at least the following ethical concerns:

Transparency: Clear guidelines on the transparency of AI systems and decision-making processes.

Accountability: Defined responsibilities for AI developers and users in case of failures or ethical breaches.

Privacy: Strong protections for individuals' data and privacy in the context of AI applications.

Bias and Fairness: Measures to prevent and mitigate bias in AI systems, ensuring fairness across different demographic groups.

The resolution will be based on official government publications, statements from relevant German ministries (e.g., Federal Ministry of Education and Research, Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy), or credible news sources. In the absence of a clear announcement by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Mexico establish a government-funded AI innovation hub to boost its technology sector before 2028?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2028, the Mexican government officially announces the establishment of a government-funded AI innovation hub aimed at boosting the technology sector. The announcement must specify the hub's objectives, funding amount, location, and planned initiatives. The resolution will rely on official government press releases, statements from the Mexican Ministry of Economy or the National Science and Technology Council, or coverage in reputable national or international news outlets. In the event of ambiguous announcements, the question will resolve as Yes only if there is clear evidence of operational activities related to AI innovation, such as the launch of specific programs, allocation of funds, or commencement of construction on the hub's facilities. If multiple hubs are announced, the question will resolve as Yes upon confirmation of the first hub's establishment.

title: Will a cryptocurrency be developed that is specifically tailored to secure genetic data transactions by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a cryptocurrency is developed and publicly available that meets the following criteria:

- The cryptocurrency must be specifically designed for and primarily used in the transaction of genetic data.
- It must incorporate advanced security features that are uniquely suited to protecting the privacy and integrity of genetic data.
- The cryptocurrency must have been adopted by at least one major genetic data handling institution (e.g., a biobank, genetic research institution, or a healthcare provider specializing in genetic medicine).
- The development and functionality of the cryptocurrency must be documented in at least one peer-reviewed scientific publication or receive formal recognition from a reputable technology or financial institution.

In the event that multiple cryptocurrencies meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes at the time the first cryptocurrency is publicly announced to meet all the specified conditions.

Fallback scenario: If no cryptocurrency is developed for this specific purpose by the deadline, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a blockchain-based system for tracking biological samples be implemented in a major research institution by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a major research institution (defined as an institution recognized within the top 100 global research institutions according to the QS World University Rankings or similar authoritative ranking system) has fully implemented and publicly announced a blockchain-based system for tracking biological samples. The system must be operational and used for the tracking of at least 1000 distinct biological samples. Implementation is considered 'fully' when the system is in regular use for the purpose of tracking, verifying, and managing biological samples, including but not limited to DNA, RNA, proteins, and cells. The announcement must be verifiable through official press releases, publications in reputable scientific journals, or statements from the institution's official spokesperson. In the event that multiple institutions meet these criteria before the resolution date, the question will resolve as Yes at the time of the first institution's announcement. If no such system is implemented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In case of ambiguity regarding the 'major research institution' status or the system's operational status, the resolution will be based on the consensus of expert opinions in the field of biological research and blockchain technology.

title: Will OpenAI release a cryptocurrency-related AI model that outperforms GPT-4 in predictive tasks by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, OpenAI releases a cryptocurrency-related AI model that demonstrates superior performance to GPT-4 in predictive tasks related to cryptocurrency markets, investments, or trends. Performance must be validated through:

Independent benchmark tests comparing the new model's predictions against GPT-4's, with a focus on accuracy, reliability, and economic value generated.

Public acknowledgment from OpenAI regarding the model's superior predictive capabilities over GPT-4, either through official press releases, research papers, or statements from OpenAI executives.

In the event that OpenAI does not release any cryptocurrency-related AI models by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. If OpenAI releases a model but does not provide sufficient evidence of its superiority or if the evidence is inconclusive, the question will also resolve as No.

Edge cases, such as the release of a model with mixed evidence of superiority, will be evaluated based on the preponderance of evidence favoring its superior performance in the specified tasks.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration approve an AI-driven drug discovery platform for official use by 2025?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has officially approved at least one AI-driven drug discovery platform for use in any stage of the drug development process, including but not limited to target identification, lead compound discovery, preclinical research, or clinical trials. Approval must be explicitly for the use of AI technologies in the drug discovery process, as confirmed by an FDA press release, official FDA documentation, or a public statement from the FDA Commissioner. The platform must demonstrate the ability to autonomously generate drug candidates based on AI algorithms and data analysis, without requiring direct human guidance for hypothesis generation or initial candidate selection. In the case where multiple platforms are approved on the same day, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one platform meets these criteria. If the FDA announces a policy or guideline change that allows for the blanket approval of AI-driven drug discovery platforms without specific case-by-case approval, the question will also resolve as Yes, provided that the announcement is made before the resolution date. In the event of a retraction or revocation of approval before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an AI system be used to predict military outcomes or strategies in the Russo-Ukrainian War by 2025?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, an AI system is officially recognized for its use in predicting military outcomes or strategies in the Russo-Ukrainian War. For the purpose of this question, an "AI system" is defined as a software system capable of processing data and making predictions or strategies without direct human input, and must be acknowledged by either a government defense agency of any involved country, a reputable international defense organization, or a major defense contractor involved in the conflict. The use of the AI system must be documented in a credible news source, an official government or military press release, or a peer-reviewed academic publication. In the event that multiple AI systems are reported, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first confirmed instance. If no such system is publicly acknowledged by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will SpaceX successfully demonstrate a fully reusable launch system by 2025?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if SpaceX successfully completes a test flight of a fully reusable launch system, where both the booster and the spacecraft are recovered intact and are capable of being reused for subsequent missions without significant refurbishment. The test flight must be officially recognized by SpaceX and must occur before January 1, 2025. The successful demonstration must be confirmed through SpaceX's official communication channels (e.g., press release, social media announcement) or by a recognized authority in aerospace engineering. The launch system must demonstrate the ability to carry a payload to orbit and return both the booster and spacecraft to Earth in a condition ready for immediate re-use. If SpaceX discontinues the project or officially announces the inability to meet the criteria by the end of 2024, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases will be resolved based on the spirit of the question, focusing on the reusability aspect of the launch system.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the US make a ruling that significantly affects the field of biotechnology before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the Supreme Court of the United States issues a ruling that directly impacts the field of biotechnology in a significant manner. Significant impact is defined as a ruling that alters the legal landscape for biotechnology companies in terms of patent law, regulatory approval processes, or ethical guidelines. This includes, but is not limited to, decisions that affect genetic editing techniques (such as CRISPR), stem cell research, and biopharmaceuticals. The ruling must be clear and direct, impacting the biotechnology field in a way that is widely recognized by major news outlets and legal analyses. In the event of ambiguity or the need for further clarification, the consensus among a panel of three experts in biotechnology law, selected by Metaculus Admins, will be considered definitive. Rulings that indirectly affect biotechnology through broader legal principles or non-specific regulations will not be considered.

title: Will a new scientific discovery significantly change the understanding of physics in basketball by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a peer-reviewed scientific study or a series of studies published in a reputable scientific journal (e.g., Nature, Science, Physical Review Letters) presents evidence or a theoretical model that leads to a significant change in the understanding of the physics involved in basketball. This could include, but is not limited to, new insights into the aerodynamics of basketball flight, the biomechanics of player movements, or the material science of basketballs. 

Significant change is defined as a discovery that alters coaching strategies, player training methodologies, or the design of basketballs in a way that is widely acknowledged by the basketball coaching and scientific community. 

In the event that multiple discoveries are reported, the most impactful discovery as determined by the number of citations and mentions in reputable sports science and physics publications will be considered. 

If no such discovery is reported by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the US Senate pass a significant piece of legislation specifically addressing dark matter research funding by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the US Senate passes a bill that allocates at least $1 billion in funding specifically for dark matter research. The legislation must be distinct and primarily focused on dark matter research, rather than being a subsection of a broader scientific research funding bill. The bill must be signed into law by the President of the United States to be considered valid for this question's resolution.

For the purposes of this question, "significant piece of legislation" is defined as a bill that allocates a substantial amount of funding (at least $1 billion) directly to dark matter research. The funding must be new and specifically earmarked for dark matter research, not redirected from existing budgets or programs.

In the event that multiple bills are passed, the total combined funding specifically for dark matter research must meet or exceed the $1 billion threshold. If the legislation is passed but subsequently vetoed, and the veto is not overridden by the Senate, the question will resolve as No.

Authoritative sources for resolution will include official US Senate records, the Congressional Record, and direct statements from the President's office.

title: Will dark matter be directly detected by an experiment by the end of 2025?
body:
Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if any of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2026:

A peer-reviewed scientific paper is published in a recognized physics journal that reports the direct detection of dark matter particles, with the findings confirmed by at least one independent research group.

An official announcement by a major international physics collaboration (e.g., CERN, LIGO, or similar) confirms the direct detection of dark matter, with the results being reproducible and verified by independent analyses.

The detection method must involve direct interaction with dark matter particles, such as scattering events or absorption processes, and not merely inferential evidence based on gravitational effects or cosmological observations.

In the event that multiple experiments claim the detection of dark matter, the resolution will be based on the first publication date of the peer-reviewed paper that meets the above criteria.

Fallback scenario: If no direct detection is confirmed by the end of 2025, but there are pending claims under review, the resolution date may be extended by up to one year to allow for verification.

title: Will the United States launch a mission to directly study the effects of dark matter in space by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the United States government or any entity within the United States launches a space mission with the primary objective of directly studying the effects of dark matter in space. The mission must be officially announced and confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space exploration agency. The mission's primary objective must be explicitly stated as the direct study of dark matter effects, including but not limited to the mapping of dark matter, direct detection of dark matter particles, or the study of dark matter's gravitational effects on celestial bodies. Secondary objectives or missions with broader scientific goals that include dark matter studies as a component will not meet the resolution criteria. In the event of a dispute regarding the mission's primary objective, the resolution will defer to the mission's official documentation and statements from the leading agency. If no such mission is launched by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will President Joe Biden announce a new initiative for NASA focused on deep space exploration before the end of his current term?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before the end of President Joe Biden's current term on January 20, 2025, an official announcement is made by either President Joe Biden himself, the White House, or NASA regarding a new initiative specifically aimed at deep space exploration. The initiative must be distinct from ongoing projects and should focus on missions beyond the moon, including but not limited to Mars, asteroids, and the outer planets. The announcement must be verifiable through official channels such as press releases, official websites, or public statements during press conferences. In the event of ambiguity regarding the initiative's focus on deep space exploration, the resolution will defer to the most authoritative source available at the time of the announcement. If no such announcement is made by the end of the specified term, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Republican Party propose a significant increase in NASA's budget for space exploration in their 2024 platform?
body:
The question will resolve as Yes if the Republican Party's official platform for the 2024 United States presidential election includes a proposal that specifies an increase in NASA's budget for space exploration by at least 20% compared to the fiscal year 2023 budget. The budget increase must be explicitly allocated for space exploration activities, including but not limited to manned and unmanned missions, research and development of space technologies, and exploration of the Moon, Mars, or other celestial bodies.

The resolution will rely on the official platform document released by the Republican Party, as well as any official statements or press releases from the party's leadership. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clarity in the official documents, statements from the chairperson of the Republican National Committee (RNC) or the party's presidential nominee will be considered authoritative.

If the party's platform is not publicly available by October 1, 2024, or if the platform does not explicitly address NASA's budget for space exploration, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new aerospace engineering breakthrough for interstellar travel be announced by a major space agency before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a major space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, ISRO) officially announces a breakthrough in aerospace engineering that significantly advances the possibility of interstellar travel. The breakthrough must involve either the development of a new propulsion system, energy source, or material technology that demonstrably reduces the time or energy required for interstellar travel by at least 50% compared to current capabilities. The announcement must be accompanied by peer-reviewed scientific evidence or detailed technical data supporting the claimed advancement. In the event of multiple agencies making similar announcements, the first official announcement according to the timestamp will be considered. If no such announcement is made, or if the announcement is later retracted or disproven by authoritative scientific scrutiny, the question will resolve as No. In cases where the announcement is made but peer-reviewed evidence is not provided within six months of the announcement, the question will resolve as Ambiguous.

title: Will a new class of physics-based propulsion systems for spacecraft be proposed by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new class of physics-based propulsion systems for spacecraft is proposed and meets the following criteria:

- The proposal must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or officially announced by a recognized space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, ISRO).

- The propulsion system must represent a significant departure from current technologies, such as chemical, ion, or nuclear thermal propulsion. This could include, but is not limited to, concepts like warp drives, antimatter propulsion, or solar sails with novel mechanisms.

- The proposal must include theoretical foundations and preliminary experimental or simulation results supporting its feasibility.

- In the event that multiple proposals are made, the question will resolve in favor of the first proposal that meets all the above criteria.

- If no such proposal is made public by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

Fallback Scenario: If there is controversy or dispute over whether a proposal meets these criteria, a panel of experts from the International Astronautical Federation (IAF) will make the final determination.

title: Will the first vaccine for a space-related pathogen be developed by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2039, a vaccine has been developed, tested, and officially approved for a pathogen that is identified as originating from or being uniquely associated with space environments (e.g., microorganisms found on extraterrestrial bodies or in the space station environment). The vaccine must be recognized and approved by a major health organization such as the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The development of the vaccine must be documented and verified through peer-reviewed scientific publications or official statements from the approving health organization. In the case where multiple vaccines are developed, the resolution will consider the first vaccine that meets these criteria. If no such vaccine is developed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In the event of ambiguity regarding the origin of the pathogen, a panel of experts convened by the WHO will make the final determination.

title: Will a new immune system disorder related to long-duration space travel be identified by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, a new immune system disorder specifically associated with long-duration space travel (exceeding six months) is identified and confirmed by either the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA), the European Space Agency (ESA), or a peer-reviewed scientific journal. The disorder must be distinct from known conditions and must be directly linked to the effects of space travel on the human body, as evidenced by clinical studies or space mission reports. Identification of the disorder must be publicly disclosed through official channels or publications. In the event that multiple disorders are identified, the question will resolve as Yes upon the confirmation of the first disorder. If no such disorder is publicly identified and confirmed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In cases where there is ambiguity or dispute over the classification of a condition as a new disorder, a panel of experts from the International Astronautical Federation (IAF) will make the final determination.

title: Will the United States experience a significant drop (over 5%) in IT sector employment numbers by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) or an equivalent authoritative source reports a decrease of more than 5% in the total number of employed individuals within the Information Technology (IT) sector compared to the number reported at the end of 2020. The IT sector is defined according to the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) codes relevant to information technology services, software development, and related activities. In the event that the BLS discontinues its reporting or significantly alters its methodology in a way that prevents direct comparison, a panel of three independent experts in labor economics, appointed by a recognized academic institution, will determine whether the criteria have been met based on the best available data and methodologies. Should the BLS or equivalent source revise their initial 2025 report after the resolution date but before March 31, 2026, the question's resolution will be based on the revised data.

title: Will the United States GDP growth rate exceed 3% in any fiscal quarter by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the United States' real GDP growth rate, as reported by the Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA), exceeds 3% in any fiscal quarter before the end of the fiscal year 2025. The growth rate in question refers to the quarter-over-quarter seasonally adjusted annual rate (SAAR). In the event that the BEA revises its initial growth rate figures after the resolution date, the highest reported figure for any quarter within the timeframe will be considered final. If the BEA discontinues its reporting or significantly alters its methodology before the resolution date, a comparable authoritative source will be used to determine the outcome. Edge cases, such as economic recalibrations or redefinitions of GDP by authoritative bodies, will be addressed by a panel of three economic experts, whose decision will be final.

title: Will the US Congress pass a major economic stimulus package exceeding $1 trillion by the end of 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the US Congress has passed legislation that allocates funds totaling more than $1 trillion specifically for the purpose of economic stimulus. The funds must be designated for distribution within a single fiscal year or spread across multiple years, provided the total exceeds $1 trillion. The legislation must be signed into law by the President of the United States. 

For the purpose of this question, a "major economic stimulus package" is defined as a legislative act or series of acts that include spending, tax cuts, and/or financial aid aimed at stimulating economic growth or recovery. This includes, but is not limited to, infrastructure spending, direct payments to individuals, tax incentives, and support for businesses. 

In the event that multiple packages are passed that cumulatively exceed $1 trillion but each individual package does not, this question will still resolve as Yes. 

If the legislation is passed but subsequently repealed or significantly altered before the end of 2024 in a way that reduces the total economic stimulus to below $1 trillion, the question will resolve as No. 

Authoritative sources for resolution will include official US government publications, such as the Congressional Record, federal budget documents, and press releases from the White House.

title: Will a cryptocurrency be officially endorsed for campaign donations in the 2024 US Elections?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by January 1, 2024, any cryptocurrency is officially recognized and endorsed by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) of the United States for use in campaign donations for the 2024 US Presidential and Congressional elections. The endorsement must be explicitly stated in an official FEC publication or press release. 

In the event of a legal challenge to the FEC's decision that is unresolved by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If multiple cryptocurrencies are endorsed, the resolution will still be Yes, provided that at least one cryptocurrency meets the criteria. 

Cryptocurrency is defined as a digital or virtual currency that uses cryptography for security and operates independently of a central bank. This includes, but is not limited to, Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other blockchain-based currencies. 

Edge cases, such as temporary endorsements or endorsements subject to specific conditions, will be considered on a case-by-case basis by Metaculus Admins.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency integrate a climatology research funding mechanism by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a cryptocurrency that is ranked within the top 10 by market capitalization at any point during the year 2030, as reported by a recognized financial data provider (e.g., CoinMarketCap, Bloomberg), has officially integrated a mechanism dedicated to funding climatology research. This mechanism must be explicitly designed to allocate funds or resources towards climatology research and must be operational and verifiable. Integration is defined as the mechanism being included in the cryptocurrency's official documentation, announced through an official channel of the cryptocurrency's development team or foundation, and being active and accessible for use. In the event that multiple cryptocurrencies meet this criterion, the question will resolve as Yes at the time the first cryptocurrency announces its integration. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases or disputes will be resolved based on the spirit of the question, focusing on the genuine contribution to climatology research funding.

title: Will quantum computing technology be utilized in a space mission by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a space mission has been officially announced, launched, or completed that utilizes quantum computing technology in any of the following capacities:

Navigation or guidance systems
Onboard data processing
Communication systems
Quantum sensors for scientific measurements

The mission must be recognized by a major space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, ISRO) or a reputable private space company (e.g., SpaceX, Blue Origin, Virgin Galactic). The use of quantum computing technology must be clearly documented in official mission reports, press releases, or scientific publications.

In the event that multiple missions are announced or launched, the resolution will be based on the first mission to officially incorporate quantum computing technology as per the above criteria. If no such mission is announced or completed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

Fallback scenario: If there is ambiguity regarding the use of quantum computing technology in a mission, a panel of experts in quantum computing and space technology, agreed upon by Metaculus Admins, will make the final determination.

title: Will Germany establish a permanent lunar research base by 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2039, the German government or any Germany-based entity, in collaboration with international space agencies or independently, has successfully established and operated a permanent lunar research base. The base must meet the following criteria:

- Continuous human presence for at least 3 consecutive months.
- Capability to conduct at least three distinct types of scientific research.
- Official acknowledgment by the German government or a leading international space organization.

In the event of a temporary cessation of operations due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., natural disasters, technical failures), the base will still be considered permanent if it resumes operations within 12 months. If multiple bases are established, at least one must meet all the above criteria for the question to resolve as Yes.

Should the base be established but not meet all the specified criteria by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In cases where official confirmation or details are lacking by the resolution date, the most recent and credible public records or statements from the German government or involved entities will be used to determine the outcome.

title: Will Amazon deploy an AI-driven logistics system that reduces delivery times by 50% or more in any city by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Amazon has implemented an AI-driven logistics system in at least one city that has been demonstrated to reduce average delivery times by 50% or more compared to the average delivery times in 2020. The reduction in delivery times must be confirmed by a reputable third-party logistics or technology analysis firm, or through an official statement by Amazon. The system must be fully operational and serving the general public. Temporary reductions during trial phases will not count towards this question's resolution. In the event of a dispute over the measurement of delivery time reduction, the decision of an independent panel of logistics and AI experts will be considered final.

title: Will SpaceX employ AI technology to achieve a 100% success rate for its reusable launch system landings in a calendar year by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if SpaceX achieves a 100% success rate for the landing of its reusable launch systems in all attempted landings within a single calendar year before January 1, 2031. A "100% success rate" is defined as every attempted landing of a reusable launch system, including but not limited to Falcon 9 and Falcon Heavy boosters, Dragon spacecraft, and any future reusable systems developed by SpaceX, resulting in a safe landing and recovery without significant damage that prevents re-use. 

Success will be determined based on SpaceX's official announcements, mission reports, and any corroborating evidence from recognized space industry monitoring organizations. In the event of a dispute regarding the success or failure of a landing, the decision will be deferred to an independent panel of aerospace experts. 

For the purpose of this question, a "calendar year" is defined as January 1 through December 31. The resolution will not consider landings outside of this timeframe. In the case where SpaceX ceases operations or is unable to attempt any landings in a given year, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Germany implement a nationwide AI-powered surveillance system for public safety by 2027?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2027, the German government or any of its federal states has officially announced and demonstrated the implementation of a nationwide AI-powered surveillance system aimed at enhancing public safety. The system must be operational and cover at least 75% of the country's population, with capabilities including but not limited to real-time facial recognition, behavior analysis, and threat detection. The system's implementation must be confirmed by official government statements, press releases, or public demonstrations. In the event of partial implementation (covering less than 75% of the population) or delays, the question will resolve as No. If the project is announced but not sufficiently demonstrated to be operational by the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No. In cases where the implementation is ambiguous or information is conflicting, a panel of experts from relevant fields (AI, public safety, and legal) will be consulted to determine the outcome based on the available evidence.

title: Will there be a significant discovery in dark matter research that influences global political policies by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a significant discovery in dark matter research that meets any of the following criteria:

A discovery that provides direct, unambiguous evidence of dark matter particles, confirmed by at least two independent research teams and published in peer-reviewed scientific journals.

A technological breakthrough related to dark matter detection or analysis that leads to a new understanding of dark matter's properties or distribution in the universe, confirmed by the scientific community and reported in major science news outlets.

A policy change or initiative at the level of a major international organization (e.g., United Nations, European Union) or a G7 country, directly attributed to a discovery in dark matter research, with the policy aimed at space exploration, national security, or scientific research funding.

In cases where the discovery is disputed or requires further verification, the resolution will be extended by up to 6 months to allow for additional confirmation or consensus within the scientific community.

title: Will a major political figure from the 2020 US presidential election be indicted for election-related crimes by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if any of the following individuals are formally indicted for crimes directly related to the 2020 US presidential election processes, including but not limited to voter fraud, election interference, or illegal campaign financing, by December 31, 2024:

- Donald J. Trump
- Joseph R. Biden Jr.
- Kamala Harris
- Mike Pence
- Any campaign managers or chief strategists for the major candidates

Indictment is defined as the formal decision by a grand jury or governmental authority to charge an individual with a criminal offense. The resolution will rely on official public records or announcements from the Department of Justice or equivalent state-level legal authorities.

In the event that legal proceedings are initiated but not completed by the resolution date, or if charges are dropped or dismissed, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, an indictment does not include preliminary investigations or charges that are not directly related to the election processes.

title: Will a new international agreement focused on atmospheric carbon reduction be ratified by over 100 countries by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, an international agreement specifically aimed at reducing atmospheric carbon levels is ratified by at least 100 countries. The agreement must be focused on actionable commitments to reduce carbon emissions and must be verifiable through official documentation from an authoritative body such as the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) or a similar recognized international environmental organization. Ratification is defined as the formal approval or adoption of the agreement by a country's legislative or governing body, making the country legally bound to the agreement's terms. In the event of disputes over the ratification count or the agreement's focus, the resolution will defer to the most recent official statement or documentation from the UNFCCC or the agreement's overseeing body. If no such agreement is reached or ratified by the specified number of countries by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will California decommission any of its nuclear power plants by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, any nuclear power plant currently operational in California is officially decommissioned. Decommissioning is defined as the process of retiring a nuclear power plant from service, which includes the cessation of power generation and the initiation of the decommissioning phase as announced by the plant's operating company or a relevant governmental authority. The resolution will rely on public announcements or official statements from the plant's operating company, the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC), or any other relevant state or federal governmental body. In the event of ambiguity or lack of clear public announcements, the question will resolve based on the most authoritative information available at the time of resolution. This includes, but is not limited to, press releases, official reports, or direct communication from the plant's operators or regulatory bodies. For the purpose of this question, California's currently operational nuclear power plants are considered to be Diablo Canyon Power Plant and any other plant that may become operational before the resolution date. If all California's nuclear power plants are decommissioned before the resolution date due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., natural disasters, legislative actions), the question will resolve as Yes.

title: Will Norway develop its own nuclear power program by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Norwegian government has officially announced the initiation of a nuclear power program, which includes any of the following: 

- The construction of a nuclear power plant within Norway's territory.
- The commencement of a government-funded research program specifically aimed at developing nuclear power technology for energy production.
- The establishment of a regulatory framework designed to facilitate the development and operation of nuclear power facilities within Norway.

For the purpose of this question, a "nuclear power program" is defined as a government-endorsed initiative that explicitly aims to utilize nuclear fission or fusion processes for energy production. Announcements made by the Prime Minister, the Ministry of Petroleum and Energy, or an equivalent governmental authority will be considered authoritative. 

In the event that a program is announced but subsequently cancelled before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. If no official announcement is made by the specified date, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will the International Olympic Committee ban athletes from countries with recent nuclear accidents from participating in the Olympics by 2030?
body: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) will be considered to have banned athletes from countries with recent nuclear accidents if, by December 31, 2030, it officially announces or enacts a policy that explicitly prohibits athletes from any nation that has experienced a nuclear accident within the past 5 years from participating in the Olympic Games. This policy must be verifiable through official IOC press releases, documented IOC meetings, or public statements made by IOC officials. A "recent nuclear accident" is defined as any event classified as Level 4 or higher on the International Nuclear and Radiological Event Scale (INES) occurring within the 5 years prior to the policy announcement. In the event that the IOC does not make a clear statement but implements a de facto policy through selective disqualification or exclusion of athletes from affected countries, this will also result in a resolution of Yes. If the IOC announces a policy that applies restrictions or bans based on nuclear accidents but includes exceptions or conditions that allow for athlete participation under certain criteria, the question will resolve as No. In the absence of any official announcement, policy enactment, or de facto policy by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Democratic Party propose a bill that significantly increases NASA's budget for Mars exploration before the 2024 elections?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before the date of the 2024 United States presidential election, a bill is formally proposed in either the United States House of Representatives or the Senate by a member or members of the Democratic Party that aims to increase NASA's budget specifically for Mars exploration by at least 50% compared to the fiscal year 2023 budget. The increase must be explicitly earmarked for Mars exploration projects, including but not limited to, manned and unmanned missions, research and development of Mars-related technologies, and support for Mars simulation facilities. The resolution will be based on official records from the United States Congress, including bill proposals and their descriptions. In the event that the United States Congress website is not accessible, reputable national news sources will be considered as secondary sources for verification. This question will resolve as No if such a bill is not proposed by the specified date or if the proposed increase is less than 50%.

title: Will the concentration of atmospheric CO2 exceed 450 parts per million by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if measurements from the Mauna Loa Observatory report that the monthly average concentration of atmospheric CO2 exceeds 450 parts per million (ppm) at any point before December 31, 2030. The Mauna Loa Observatory, operated by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), is considered an authoritative source for atmospheric CO2 measurements. In the event that the Mauna Loa Observatory ceases operations or is unable to provide measurements, this question will defer to the next most authoritative source of global atmospheric CO2 measurements available at the time. This resolution criteria is designed to ensure clarity and reliability in determining the outcome based on scientific data.

title: Will a new class of antibiotics be discovered by 2030 that is effective against multi-drug-resistant bacteria?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new class of antibiotics has been discovered and is publicly recognized as effective against multi-drug-resistant bacteria. The criteria for effectiveness include:

- Clinical trial results demonstrating statistically significant efficacy in treating infections caused by bacteria strains resistant to at least three existing classes of antibiotics.

- Approval by a major health authority (e.g., FDA in the United States, EMA in Europe) for clinical use in humans.

- Publication of peer-reviewed research detailing the discovery, mechanism of action, and clinical trial results of the new antibiotic class.

In the event that multiple new classes of antibiotics are discovered, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first class meeting all the above criteria. If no such discovery is publicly recognized by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

For the purpose of this question, a "new class" of antibiotics refers to compounds with a novel mechanism of action not previously utilized in clinical settings for the treatment of bacterial infections. This excludes modifications or combinations of existing antibiotic classes that do not introduce a fundamentally new approach to targeting bacteria.

title: Will the Supreme Court of the United States rule in favor of a major federal climate change policy by 2025?
body:
The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the Supreme Court of the United States issues a ruling that explicitly supports a major federal climate change policy. This includes any decision that upholds, endorses, or mandates significant measures aimed at reducing carbon emissions, promoting renewable energy sources, or otherwise addressing climate change at a federal level. The ruling must be in relation to a case that directly challenges the legality or constitutionality of a federal climate change policy. 

For the purposes of this question, a "major federal climate change policy" is defined as any legislation, executive order, or regulatory action that has been enacted or proposed at the federal level with the primary aim of mitigating climate change. This includes, but is not limited to, policies related to carbon pricing, renewable energy mandates, significant emissions reductions targets, and comprehensive climate action plans. 

In the event that the Supreme Court does not issue a ruling directly related to climate change by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. If the Court's decision is ambiguous or does not clearly support or reject a major climate change policy, a panel of legal experts will be consulted to determine the outcome based on the majority opinion.

title: Will Brazil begin construction of a new nuclear power plant by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Brazilian government or any recognized private or public entity within Brazil officially announces the commencement of construction on a new nuclear power plant before January 1, 2030. The announcement must specify the location and intended capacity of the plant, and it must be verifiable through official government channels or major news outlets. In the event of ambiguous announcements, the question will resolve as Yes only if physical construction work has visibly begun on the site, as confirmed by satellite imagery or credible media reports. If multiple plants are announced, the question will resolve as Yes upon the commencement of construction of the first plant. If no such announcement or evidence of construction is made public by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Russo-Ukrainian War lead to a nuclear incident at a power plant by 2025?
body:
The question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, any of the following occur:

A nuclear reactor within Ukraine's borders experiences a meltdown, significant radiation leak, or any other catastrophic failure that results in an official emergency declaration by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) or the Ukrainian government.

A nuclear weapon is detonated, intentionally or accidentally, in a conflict-related incident within Ukraine or its immediate bordering nations, with confirmation from at least two independent international news sources or an official statement from a recognized government or international body.

In the event of ambiguous situations, such as unconfirmed reports of incidents or minor leaks not classified as emergencies by the IAEA, the question will not resolve until verified information is available. If no such incidents occur or are confirmed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the Republican Party (US) introduce legislation to significantly expand nuclear energy production by 2024?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, the Republican Party in the United States Congress introduces one or more pieces of legislation that aim to increase nuclear energy production capacity by at least 20% from 2023 levels. The legislation must be formally introduced in either the House of Representatives or the Senate and must specifically mention the goal of expanding nuclear energy production capacity. The resolution will be based on official records from the U.S. Congress website and reputable news sources. In the event of a government shutdown or other significant disruption that prevents the introduction of legislation, the resolution date will be extended by the duration of the disruption. If no such legislation is introduced by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will any major global corporation be found guilty of a significant ethics violation in the field of artificial intelligence by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any corporation listed in the Fortune Global 500 at any point between January 1, 2020, and December 31, 2030, is officially found guilty by a recognized legal authority (such as a national court, international court, or regulatory body) of a significant ethics violation in the field of artificial intelligence. A "significant ethics violation" is defined as any action, policy, or practice related to AI that results in a substantial breach of widely accepted ethical standards, including but not limited to privacy violations, bias and discrimination, lack of transparency, manipulation, or harm to human rights. The resolution will consider public records, official statements, and legal documents as sources of verification. In the event that multiple corporations are found guilty, the resolution will be based on the first officially recognized case. If no such cases are confirmed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the World Health Organization announce a global economic partnership to combat a future pandemic by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the World Health Organization (WHO) announces, on or before December 31, 2024, the establishment of a global economic partnership aimed at combating future pandemics. The partnership must involve at least three countries from different WHO regions and must include specific commitments related to funding, resource sharing, or technological exchange designed to enhance global pandemic preparedness and response. The announcement must be made through an official WHO communication channel, such as a press release, official statement, or a formal declaration during a WHO-convened meeting. In the absence of a direct announcement from the WHO, credible reports from at least three major international news organizations confirming the establishment of such a partnership will also be considered sufficient for resolution. If the WHO is dissolved or undergoes a significant restructuring that impacts its ability to announce partnerships, the question will resolve based on the actions of its successor organization or the equivalent authority assuming its responsibilities.

title: Will NATO launch a joint space mission with non-member countries by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, NATO officially announces and initiates a joint space mission involving at least one non-member country. The mission must be beyond preliminary talks or agreements and should have a clear objective, timeline, and designated resources. The announcement must come from an official NATO communication channel or a press release from the participating countries' governments. In the case of ambiguity regarding the mission's status or the involvement of non-member countries, the resolution will defer to the most recent and authoritative public statement made by NATO or the governments of the involved countries. If no such mission is announced or initiated by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, a 'joint space mission' is defined as a collaborative effort in space exploration, research, or development that involves significant operational, technological, or financial collaboration between NATO members and non-member countries. This includes, but is not limited to, manned and unmanned missions to outer space, satellite deployments, and space station modules.

title: Will Israel land a human on the Moon before 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the State of Israel, through any of its government agencies, private corporations, or public-private partnerships, successfully lands at least one human on the surface of the Moon and returns them safely to Earth before January 1, 2040. The human must spend a minimum of 1 hour on the lunar surface. The event must be verified by at least two of the following authoritative sources: NASA, the European Space Agency (ESA), the Russian space agency Roscosmos, or an independent verification by a panel of at least three experts in the field of astronautics recognized by the International Astronautical Federation (IAF). In the event of a dispute regarding the mission's success, the decision of the IAF will be considered final. If no landing attempt is made by December 31, 2039, or if all attempts fail to meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the United Kingdom announce a new government-led space mission to explore beyond Earth's orbit by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the United Kingdom government officially announces a new space mission intended to explore beyond Earth's orbit. The announcement must be made by an authoritative body of the UK government, such as the UK Space Agency or the Department for Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy, and must specify the mission's objectives, planned launch date, and primary spacecraft or technology to be used. The mission must be aimed at exploring celestial bodies beyond Earth's orbit, such as the Moon, Mars, or asteroids. Announcements made in official government publications, press releases, or during public government statements will be considered valid. In the event of ambiguity or partial announcements, the question will resolve as Yes only if there is clear evidence of a planned mission that includes a launch window and a defined exploration target beyond Earth's orbit. If the announcement is made but the mission is subsequently cancelled before the resolution date, the question will still resolve as Yes.

title: Will Italy launch a mission to Mars involving a human crew by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Italian Space Agency (ASI) or any Italy-based entity, in collaboration with international partners or independently, successfully launches a mission to Mars that includes at least one human crew member before January 1, 2040. The mission must achieve a successful launch, transit, and Mars orbit insertion or landing to be considered. If the mission is launched but fails to achieve orbit insertion or landing, the question will resolve as No. In the event of a mission announcement without a subsequent launch by the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No. Verification will be based on official announcements from the Italian Space Agency, credible space exploration news sources, or direct evidence of the mission's success (e.g., telemetry data, mission updates). In the case of multiple missions, the resolution will be based on the first mission's success. If no mission is attempted, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Australia lead a major international scientific discovery by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, Australia is the primary contributor to a scientific discovery that is recognized as "major" by at least one of the following criteria:

- The discovery leads to a Nobel Prize in Physics, Chemistry, Medicine, or a related field, where the leading researchers are Australian citizens or the research was primarily conducted in Australia.
- The discovery is featured on the cover of Nature, Science, or another leading scientific journal, with the primary research conducted by an Australian institution.
- The discovery significantly advances human knowledge in a specific scientific domain, as confirmed by a panel of experts from a recognized international scientific organization.

In cases where the discovery is a collaborative international effort, Australia must be credited as the leading contributor in official announcements or publications. If multiple discoveries meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first occurrence.

Fallback scenario: If there is ambiguity regarding the leadership role of Australia in the discovery, a panel of experts from the Australian Academy of Science will make the final determination based on the available evidence.

title: Will a machine learning model be the first to prove the Riemann Hypothesis by 2030?
body:
A "machine learning model" is defined as any computational system that utilizes machine learning techniques to analyze, infer, or predict outcomes based on data. This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030:

A machine learning model successfully proves the Riemann Hypothesis, and this proof is accepted by a recognized mathematical authority, such as the Clay Mathematics Institute or an equivalent organization.

The proof must be published in a peer-reviewed mathematical journal or presented at a major mathematical conference and subsequently verified by independent experts in the field.

In the event that multiple proofs are presented, the resolution will be based on the first proof that is verified and accepted by the mathematical community.

If the Riemann Hypothesis is disproved by a machine learning model, this will also result in a Yes resolution.

Fallback Scenario: If no machine learning model has proven or disproven the Riemann Hypothesis by the specified date, but significant progress is made towards a proof (as recognized by a leading mathematical authority), this may be considered for a partial resolution.

title: Will Switzerland be ranked in the top 3 countries for quantum computing research by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Switzerland is ranked among the top 3 countries in the world for quantum computing research according to at least one of the following criteria:

Publication volume: Switzerland must have a significant number of peer-reviewed scientific publications in the field of quantum computing, as indexed by major scientific databases such as Web of Science, Scopus, or Google Scholar.

Citation impact: Swiss research in quantum computing must achieve a high citation impact, indicating influential work in the field, as measured by tools like Google Scholar Citations or the H-Index.

Innovation and patents: Switzerland must be a leading country in terms of filed and granted patents related to quantum computing technologies, as recorded by the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) or similar authoritative bodies.

International collaboration: A high level of international collaboration in quantum computing research involving Swiss institutions, as evidenced by joint publications or projects with leading institutions worldwide.

In the event that rankings are disputed or multiple authoritative sources provide conflicting information, the resolution will consider the source most widely recognized for its expertise in quantum computing research. If no clear consensus can be reached among the sources, the question will resolve as ambiguous.

title: Will the International Cricket Council adopt a technology-based system for real-time player performance analytics in official matches by 2025?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the International Cricket Council (ICC) officially announces the adoption of a technology-based system for real-time player performance analytics to be used in official international cricket matches. This system must provide instant data on player performances, including but not limited to batting averages, bowling speeds, and fielding efficiency, during live matches. The announcement must be verifiable through official ICC press releases or public statements made by ICC representatives. In the event that the ICC dissolves or undergoes a significant restructuring that impacts its ability to make such a decision, the question will resolve as No. If the ICC announces the adoption of a partial system that only covers some aspects of player performance or is to be used in a limited set of matches (e.g., only in World Cup or T20 matches), this will not fulfill the criteria for a Yes resolution. The resolution criteria are designed to ensure clarity and fairness, relying on authoritative sources for verification.

title: Will the World Health Organization endorse a digital health technology for widespread use in member countries by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially endorses one or more digital health technologies for widespread use in its member countries. The endorsement must be documented in an official WHO publication or press release and specify the technology or technologies endorsed, along with guidelines for their implementation in healthcare systems. The endorsement should address a significant aspect of healthcare, such as disease prevention, diagnosis, treatment, or health system management. Technologies considered for this resolution include, but are not limited to, mobile health applications, telehealth platforms, electronic health records, and AI-driven diagnostic tools. In the event that the WHO endorses multiple technologies simultaneously, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first such endorsement. If the WHO is dissolved or undergoes a major restructuring that prevents it from making such endorsements, the question will resolve using the last available official statement or guideline from the WHO regarding digital health technologies.

title: Will a former or current Major League Baseball player run for political office in the United States by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any individual who has played in Major League Baseball (MLB) at any point in their career announces their candidacy for any elected political office within the United States, including but not limited to local, state, or federal positions. The announcement must be verifiable through credible media outlets, official campaign announcements, or direct confirmation from the individual's official social media accounts or website. In the event of a dispute over the individual's MLB player status, the official MLB records and player rosters will serve as the authoritative source. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Sweden implement a digital currency as an official means of transaction by the end of 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Swedish government or its official monetary authority (e.g., Sveriges Riksbank) has officially announced and implemented a digital currency that is recognized as legal tender for all types of transactions within Sweden. The digital currency must be fully operational and accessible to the public, with clear guidelines and infrastructure for its use in everyday transactions. 

For the purpose of this question, a "digital currency" is defined as a currency that exists in digital or electronic form, which may include but is not limited to, central bank digital currencies (CBDCs), digital versions of the Swedish krona, or any new digital currency introduced by the authorities. 

In the event that multiple digital currencies are introduced, at least one must meet the above criteria for the question to resolve as Yes. 

If the digital currency is announced but not fully implemented by the resolution date, or if it is only used for specific types of transactions, the question will resolve as No. 

Authoritative sources for confirmation include official government or Sveriges Riksbank announcements, press releases, and legal documents.

title: Will a private space company based in Virginia successfully launch a crewed mission beyond Earth orbit by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a private space company headquartered in Virginia successfully launches and returns a crewed spacecraft from a mission beyond Earth orbit before December 31, 2030. The mission must be officially recognized by either NASA, the European Space Agency (ESA), or the Russian Space Agency (Roscosmos) as having successfully reached beyond Earth orbit and returned. The spacecraft must carry at least two astronauts, and the mission must be completed without catastrophic failure resulting in loss of life or spacecraft. In the event that multiple companies achieve this milestone, the resolution will be based on the first confirmed successful mission. If no such mission is publicly acknowledged by the aforementioned space agencies by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, 'beyond Earth orbit' is defined as reaching an apogee greater than 2,000 kilometers above Earth's surface.

title: Will the International Cricket Council (ICC) organize a cricket match in space by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, the International Cricket Council (ICC) officially announces and organizes a cricket match that is held in a location that is not on Earth's surface. This includes any environment outside of Earth's atmosphere, such as aboard a space station, on the Moon, or in a spacecraft designed for human habitation and sporting activities. The match must be sanctioned by the ICC and adhere to a recognizable format of cricket, though adaptations for the space environment are expected. Verification will be through official ICC announcements, coverage by major global news organizations, or direct ICC documentation. In the event of a dispute over the location's qualification as 'in space,' the definition set by the Fédération Aéronautique Internationale (FAI) - which considers the Kármán line at 100 kilometers above Earth's surface as the boundary of space - will be used as the standard. If the ICC dissolves or is unable to sanction events before 2030, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will SpaceX successfully complete a crewed mission to Mars using its reusable launch system by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if SpaceX successfully completes a crewed mission to Mars, where "successfully completes" is defined as the spacecraft reaching Mars, landing safely with all crew members alive, and returning to Earth with all crew members alive, using SpaceX's reusable launch system, before January 1, 2031. The mission must be officially recognized by SpaceX and an authoritative space exploration agency such as NASA or ESA. In the event of a mission that reaches Mars but does not return, or returns without all crew members alive, the question will resolve as No. If SpaceX announces the cancellation of its Mars mission plans or if it becomes clear that a mission cannot be launched by the end of 2030 due to technical or financial reasons, the question will also resolve as No. Edge cases or unforeseen circumstances will be resolved by a panel of experts in space exploration, agreed upon by the question's administrators.

title: Will a Formula 1 car break the 400 km/h speed barrier during an official race by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, during any official Formula 1 Grand Prix race between the start of the 2023 season and the end of the 2025 season, a Formula 1 car achieves a speed exceeding 400 km/h (248.5 mph) as recorded by the official Formula 1 speed measurement systems during the race. This includes speeds recorded during any part of the race, including qualifying sessions, practice sessions, and the race itself. The speed must be officially recognized and confirmed by the FIA (Fédération Internationale de l'Automobile) and must be published on the official Formula 1 website or through an official FIA publication. In the event of a discrepancy between different sources of official data, the highest recorded speed that meets these criteria will be considered valid. If no such speed is recorded and verified by the end of the 2025 season, the question will resolve as No. In case of any disputes regarding the validity of the speed record, the decision of the FIA will be final.

title: Will Brazil invest more than 5% of its GDP in scientific research and development by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the end of the fiscal year 2035, the Brazilian government's official statistics or reports from the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE) or the Ministry of Science, Technology, and Innovations confirm that Brazil has allocated and spent more than 5% of its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) on scientific research and development activities. This includes funding for both public and private sector research initiatives. In the absence of direct data from these sources, reputable international organizations such as the World Bank, the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO), or the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) reports will be considered. If conflicting reports arise, the average of the reported percentages from these authoritative sources will be used to determine the resolution. In the event that none of these sources provide clear data by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Switzerland experience a recession with at least two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Switzerland experiences at least two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point before January 1, 2030, as reported by the Swiss Federal Statistical Office or another authoritative economic body recognized internationally. The GDP growth rates must be adjusted for inflation and seasonally adjusted to ensure comparability. If the Swiss Federal Statistical Office ceases to exist or does not provide the necessary data, this question will resolve using data from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the World Bank. In the event of a dispute over the data's accuracy or interpretation, the resolution will be based on the consensus of at least three recognized economic research institutions.

title: Will the global market value of baseball sports equipment exceed $20 billion by 2030?
body: The global market value of baseball sports equipment is defined as the total retail sales value of equipment specifically designed for baseball, including but not limited to bats, balls, gloves, helmets, protective gear, and training equipment. This question will resolve as Yes if, according to financial reports or market analyses published by recognized authorities in the sports industry or market research firms (e.g., Statista, Forbes, or the Sporting Goods Manufacturers Association), the global market value exceeds $20 billion at any point before December 31, 2030. In the absence of direct data, credible estimates from at least three independent and reputable market research firms will be considered. If conflicting reports arise, the average of the three most recent authoritative reports will be used to determine the resolution. This question will not consider sales of memorabilia, licensed merchandise not directly used in the play of baseball, or services related to baseball training or entertainment.

title: Will the European Union introduce a new common digital currency for its member states by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the European Union (EU) officially announces the introduction of a new common digital currency for its member states, intended for general public and commercial use. The announcement must come from an official EU body, such as the European Commission, the European Central Bank, or a joint statement from the member states' finance ministers. The currency must be designed for digital transactions and recognized as legal tender across all EU member states. In the event of a partial introduction (e.g., a pilot program in select member states or for specific types of transactions), the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a clear, official timeline and commitment for a full rollout to all member states by 2035. If the EU announces plans for a digital currency but does not meet these criteria by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In case of ambiguity or lack of clear official announcements, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative sources available at the time of resolution.

title: Will the average global temperature increase by more than 1.5 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels before 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, according to the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) or another UN-recognized climate monitoring organization, the average global temperature, measured across a calendar year, exceeds 1.5 degrees Celsius above the pre-industrial (1850-1900) average before January 1, 2035. The measurement must be confirmed by at least two independent UN-recognized climate monitoring organizations to account for measurement discrepancies and ensure accuracy. In the event that the WMO or equivalent body ceases to exist, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative source available at the time. If no such source can be agreed upon, the question will resolve as ambiguous. This resolution criteria does not consider temporary spikes in global temperatures due to specific events (e.g., volcanic eruptions) but focuses on the sustained average temperature over a calendar year.

title: Will Ukraine become a member of the European Union before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Ukraine becomes a full member of the European Union (EU) before January 1, 2030. Membership must be officially recognized by the European Union through a formal announcement or inclusion in official EU documents. Interim agreements or candidate status will not be considered as full membership for the purposes of this question. In the event of significant restructuring or dissolution of the EU as it is known as of 2023, or if Ukraine ceases to exist as a sovereign nation, the question will resolve as N/A. Verification will rely on official statements from the European Union or its official website.

title: Will a member of the Democratic Party (US) win the Nobel Prize in Physics or Chemistry before 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a member of the Democratic Party (US) is officially announced as a recipient of the Nobel Prize in Physics or Chemistry. The recipient must be a confirmed member of the Democratic Party at the time of the award announcement. Verification will be based on official announcements from the Nobel Prize organization and confirmation of party membership through credible public records or statements. In the event of a dispute over party membership, the Democratic National Committee's official records will be considered authoritative. If the Nobel Prize in Physics or Chemistry is awarded to multiple recipients, and at least one of them is a confirmed member of the Democratic Party, the question will resolve as Yes. If the Nobel Prize is not awarded in any given year or if the award is postponed, the resolution date will be extended accordingly.

title: Will India deploy an AI-powered surveillance system nationwide by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Government of India, or any state government within India, has officially announced and demonstrated the deployment of an AI-powered surveillance system that covers at least 75% of the country's population. The system must be capable of real-time monitoring, data analysis, and predictive policing capabilities. The deployment must be confirmed by credible sources such as government announcements, verified media reports, or statements from recognized technology or security experts. In the case of partial deployment (covering less than 75% but more than 50% of the population), the question will resolve as Partially. If the deployment is announced but not demonstrated to be operational by the end of 2030, the question will resolve as No. In the event of conflicting reports about the system's deployment status, the resolution will be based on the preponderance of credible evidence available by January 15, 2031.

title: Will SpaceX integrate an AI system capable of fully autonomous launch and landing procedures in their reusable launch system by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, SpaceX has successfully integrated and demonstrated an AI system capable of conducting fully autonomous launch, flight, and landing operations of a reusable launch system without human intervention.
