The AI system must be able to perform all necessary tasks, including but not limited to pre-launch checks, launch sequence initiation, in-flight adjustments, landing site selection, and landing sequence execution. The demonstration must be verified by either SpaceX through official announcements, FAA certification documents, or coverage by at least two reputable aerospace industry publications. In the event of a partial integration (e.g., autonomous launch and in-flight adjustments but manual landing), the question will resolve as No. If SpaceX discontinues its reusable launch system program or if the company ceases operations before this date, the question will resolve as N/A.

title: Will a quantum computer be used to significantly improve an AI algorithm's performance by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a quantum computer is used to achieve a measurable and significant improvement in the performance of an AI algorithm, as evidenced by:

A peer-reviewed scientific publication that demonstrates a quantum computer's direct contribution to enhancing an AI algorithm's efficiency, accuracy, or capability beyond the current state-of-the-art benchmarks as of 2023.

OR

An official announcement by a recognized authority in the field of quantum computing or artificial intelligence, confirming the use of a quantum computer to significantly improve an AI algorithm's performance.

Significant improvement is defined as at least a 20% increase in efficiency, accuracy, or another quantifiable metric relevant to the algorithm's performance compared to the best-known results as of 2023.

In the event of ambiguous cases, the resolution will be determined by a panel of experts appointed by Metaculus.

Edge cases and scenarios not covered by the above criteria will be considered on a case-by-case basis, with the final decision resting with the Metaculus administration.

title: Will the NFL engage in a significant political advocacy campaign before 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, the National Football League (NFL) initiates or publicly supports a political advocacy campaign that meets the following criteria:

- The campaign must be explicitly endorsed by the NFL's official communications channels, including press releases, official social media accounts, or statements from the NFL's executive leadership.

- The campaign must address a significant political issue at the national level in the United States, such as electoral reform, criminal justice reform, or major health care policy.

- The campaign must involve substantial NFL resources, including financial support, public service announcements during NFL broadcasts, or organized player participation in advocacy events.

- The campaign's political advocacy must be sustained over a period of at least three months to ensure it is not a one-time event.

In the absence of such a campaign, the question will resolve as No. If the NFL supports multiple political causes, the most significant (in terms of resources committed and potential impact) will be considered for resolution.

Edge cases will be resolved by considering the intent and scale of the NFL's involvement in political advocacy, with final determination made by a panel of three experts in sports and political communication, appointed by Metaculus Admins.

title: Will FIFA officially endorse a political candidate or party in any country's national election by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, FIFA (Fédération Internationale de Football Association) has made an official public endorsement of a political candidate or party in any country's national election. The endorsement must be clear, unambiguous, and publicly accessible through FIFA's official communication channels, such as their official website, press releases, or official social media accounts. Endorsements made indirectly through FIFA officials or representatives will not count unless officially sanctioned and communicated by FIFA as an organization. In the event of a dispute over the interpretation of an endorsement, the final decision will be based on the consensus of credible media reports and FIFA's official statements. If FIFA is dissolved or undergoes a significant organizational change before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a major political event be influenced by a scientific discovery related to black holes by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, a scientific discovery related to black holes significantly influences a major political event. A "major political event" is defined as an event that involves at least one of the following: a change in national leadership, the initiation or conclusion of a significant international agreement, or a substantial shift in national policy in at least one G20 country. The influence of the scientific discovery must be clearly acknowledged by at least one of the involved parties or by a reputable news source. The discovery must pertain directly to black holes and may include, but is not limited to, technological advancements derived from black hole physics, theoretical breakthroughs, or observational discoveries. In the event that the influence is disputed, a panel of experts from recognized institutions in the fields of political science and astrophysics will be consulted to determine the resolution. If no such event has been confirmed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will India launch a government-backed digital currency by the end of 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Government of India, through its Ministry of Finance or Reserve Bank of India (RBI), officially announces the launch of a government-backed digital currency. The announcement must specify the digital currency's operational status, indicating that it is either already in circulation or will be imminently by a specified date. 

For the resolution to be affirmative, the announcement must be verifiable through official government or RBI press releases, official statements, or documented in major national or international news outlets. 

In the event of ambiguity regarding the currency's status due to conflicting reports or lack of clarity in the announcement, the question will resolve as No unless clarified or confirmed by an official government or RBI statement by the resolution date. 

If the government announces a pilot program without a clear timeline for full public availability, this will not meet the criteria for a Yes resolution.

title: Will a new pharmacological treatment for Alzheimer's disease be approved by the FDA by 2024?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2023, a new pharmacological treatment for Alzheimer's disease receives approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA). The treatment must demonstrate statistically significant improvement in cognitive function and/or reduction in disease progression in Phase 3 clinical trials compared to existing treatments or placebo. The approval must be for a treatment that has not been previously approved for any indication, and must be specifically for the treatment of Alzheimer's disease. The resolution will rely on official FDA announcements or press releases. In the event that the FDA's decision is delayed past the resolution date due to unforeseen circumstances, the question will resolve as No unless the approval is retroactively dated to occur on or before December 31, 2023.

title: Will a COVID-19 vaccine with over 90% efficacy against all known variants be developed by 2023?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2022, a COVID-19 vaccine is developed and has been proven to have over 90% efficacy against all known variants of the virus at the time of its development. The vaccine must have completed Phase 3 clinical trials successfully and received approval from at least one of the following regulatory bodies: the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), the European Medicines Agency (EMA), or the World Health Organization (WHO). The efficacy must be determined based on the results of the Phase 3 clinical trials, as reported by the regulatory body or bodies that granted approval. In the event that no vaccine meets these criteria by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. If multiple vaccines meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the first vaccine's approval date. In cases where regulatory approval is pending but Phase 3 clinical trials have been completed and results published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, the question may resolve as Yes based on the discretion of the question administrators, provided that the published results meet the efficacy criteria.

title: Will a professional basketball team in the NBA start accepting cryptocurrency for ticket purchases by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, any NBA team officially announces and implements a system allowing for the purchase of game tickets using one or more forms of cryptocurrency. The announcement must be verifiable through official team communications, such as press releases, official social media accounts, or the team's official website. Transactions must be directly processed in cryptocurrency without requiring conversion to fiat currency at the point of sale. This resolution criteria does not include third-party resellers or platforms that offer cryptocurrency transactions independently of the team's direct sales channels. In the event that the NBA as an organization implements a league-wide policy allowing or mandating cryptocurrency transactions for ticket sales, this will also result in a resolution of Yes.

title: Will the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) issue guidelines for the use of blockchain technology in the tracking of prescription drugs by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has officially published guidelines or regulations that specifically address the use of blockchain technology for the tracking of prescription drugs within the United States. The guidelines must be detailed and provide a framework for implementation, compliance, and enforcement. This includes, but is not limited to, the use of blockchain for ensuring drug authenticity, traceability, and supply chain security. The resolution will rely on public announcements or publications on the FDA's official website or in the Federal Register. In the event that the FDA issues a statement indicating that it will not pursue blockchain technology for this purpose, the question will resolve as No. If the FDA discusses blockchain in a broader context without specific guidelines for prescription drugs, this will not meet the resolution criteria. In the absence of clear guidelines or statements by the specified date, the question will resolve as ambiguous.

title: Will there be a significant breakthrough in the use of CRISPR technology to treat a major human genetic disorder by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a widely recognized scientific breakthrough in the use of CRISPR technology for the treatment of a major human genetic disorder, as evidenced by:

- The publication of results from a Phase III clinical trial in a peer-reviewed scientific journal, demonstrating significant efficacy and safety in treating the disorder.

- Regulatory approval (e.g., FDA, EMA) of a CRISPR-based therapy for a major human genetic disorder.

- Public announcement from a leading health organization (e.g., WHO, CDC) acknowledging the breakthrough and its potential impact on treatment protocols.

A "major human genetic disorder" is defined as a condition that has a significant impact on life expectancy or quality of life, and is recognized as such by the World Health Organization or similar authoritative bodies.

In the event that multiple treatments are announced, the resolution will be based on the first to meet the above criteria. If no treatment meets these criteria by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will OpenAI release a publicly available AI model that passes the Turing Test by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if OpenAI releases a publicly available AI model that passes the Turing Test by December 31, 2025. The Turing Test, in this context, is defined as an evaluation where the AI model must engage in a conversation with human judges through a computer interface, where the judges cannot reliably distinguish the AI from a human based on the conversation alone. The test must be conducted under the supervision of a recognized authority in the field of artificial intelligence, such as the Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence (AAAI) or a similar body, and the results must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or officially announced by OpenAI. In the event of a dispute over the results, the decision of a panel comprised of at least three experts in artificial intelligence, appointed by the AAAI or a similar authoritative body, will be final. Edge cases, such as AI models that only pass under certain conditions or with certain judges, will not count unless the overall consensus among the participating judges is that the AI has passed the Turing Test.

title: Will North Korea officially announce the development of an indigenous quantum computer by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the government of North Korea or any official state media outlet publicly announces the successful development of an indigenous quantum computer before January 1, 2030. The announcement must include evidence of a functioning quantum computer, such as technical specifications, performance benchmarks, or demonstration videos, which must be verifiable by international experts in quantum computing. In the absence of direct evidence, credible reports from at least three independent and reputable international news agencies or scientific journals confirming the development will also be considered sufficient for resolution. If there are conflicting reports about the veracity of the announcement or the capabilities of the quantum computer, the question will resolve as Yes only if the majority of credible sources support the claim by the resolution date. In case of ambiguity or lack of clear evidence by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Tesla announce a cryptocurrency payment option for its vehicles in Spain before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if Tesla, Inc. announces the acceptance of one or more cryptocurrencies as a payment method for purchasing its vehicles in Spain before January 1, 2025. The announcement must be made through an official Tesla communication channel, such as a press release, official social media account, or a statement from an authorized Tesla spokesperson. The cryptocurrency payment option must be available to the general public in Spain and not limited to a specific group of customers. In the event of a temporary announcement followed by a retraction, the question will resolve as Yes only if the payment option is actually implemented and available for at least 30 days before the resolution date. If Tesla announces the intention to accept cryptocurrency but does not implement this option by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In case of ambiguity regarding the announcement's authenticity or the implementation status, the resolution will be based on the most reliable and authoritative sources available at the time.

title: Will a major cryptocurrency platform be involved in an ethics scandal that leads to a drop of more than 20% in its market value by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a major cryptocurrency platform (defined as being in the top 10 by market capitalization at the time of the scandal) is publicly implicated in an ethics scandal that directly causes its market value to drop by more than 20% within a 30-day period. The drop in market value must be confirmed by reliable financial news sources and data from recognized cryptocurrency market analysis platforms. The ethics scandal may involve, but is not limited to, fraud, insider trading, manipulation of market prices, significant security breaches, or violations of major regulatory requirements. If multiple platforms are involved, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the criteria. In cases where market value fluctuations are ambiguous or can be attributed to multiple factors, a panel of experts from major financial and cryptocurrency news outlets will be consulted to determine the primary cause of the market value drop. If no such event occurs by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Italy implement a blockchain-based voting system for national elections by 2030?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the Italian government officially announces and demonstrates the implementation of a blockchain-based voting system for at least one national election (general election, presidential election, or referendum). The system must be used by the general public in a live election, with results officially recognized by the Italian government. The announcement must be verifiable through official government channels or major international news outlets. In the case of partial implementation (e.g., pilot projects, regional use) or announcements without full deployment, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases or disputes will be resolved based on the most authoritative and comprehensive evidence available at the time of resolution. If no official announcement or implementation has occurred by the resolution date, the question will automatically resolve as No.

title: Will Elon Musk's companies play a significant role in the development of nuclear fusion technology by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, any of Elon Musk's companies (including but not limited to SpaceX, Tesla, Inc., Neuralink, and The Boring Company) have made a verifiable contribution to the development of nuclear fusion technology. A "significant role" is defined as any of the following:

- The development or improvement of a nuclear fusion reactor prototype that demonstrates a net energy gain, confirmed by an independent scientific committee.
- The filing of one or more patents directly related to nuclear fusion technology that are recognized as a substantial advancement in the field.
- Publicly announced partnerships or collaborations with leading nuclear fusion research institutions or companies, where the contribution of Musk's companies is acknowledged as critical to a project's success.

In cases where the contribution is disputed, a panel of experts in the field of nuclear fusion technology, agreed upon by both proponents and skeptics, will make the final determination. The resolution will rely on public records, credible media reports, and official statements from the companies or institutions involved.

title: Will the US dollar be used in more than 50% of international nuclear energy trade transactions by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, more than 50% of international nuclear energy trade transactions are conducted using the US dollar. Transactions will be considered in this context as any exchange of goods, services, or financial assets between parties in different countries involving nuclear energy, including but not limited to uranium trade, nuclear reactor components, and nuclear technology services. The assessment will be based on data from authoritative financial and energy industry sources, such as the International Energy Agency (IEA), the World Nuclear Association (WNA), and the Bank for International Settlements (BIS). In the event of discrepancies between sources, the majority consensus among these sources will be used. If reliable data for 2030 is not available by the resolution date, the question will resolve using the most recent full year of data available. Edge cases, such as transactions involving multiple currencies or digital currencies pegged to the US dollar, will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis, with a focus on the intent and effect of the transaction in the context of international nuclear energy trade.

title: Will a new element with potential nuclear applications be synthesized by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a new chemical element (with an atomic number greater than the currently known highest atomic number) is synthesized and reported by a recognized scientific body (e.g., the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC)) before January 1, 2031. The element must demonstrate potential for nuclear applications, such as in energy production, medical treatments, or weaponry. Potential for nuclear applications must be explicitly mentioned in the discovery announcement or subsequent peer-reviewed publications. In the absence of a clear application, expert consensus within the relevant scientific community will be sought for a decision. If no new element is synthesized, or if the synthesized element does not have potential nuclear applications as defined above, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a cryptocurrency be publicly endorsed by a prominent climate change denial group by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, a cryptocurrency is publicly endorsed by a group or individual widely recognized for denying the scientific consensus on climate change. The endorsement must be explicit, such as through a public statement, press release, or significant social media post, and must advocate for the use of the cryptocurrency as a financial tool or investment. The group or individual must have a substantial following or media presence, and their stance on climate change must be well-documented and publicly known prior to the endorsement. If multiple cryptocurrencies are endorsed, the question will resolve as Yes at the time of the first endorsement. In the event of ambiguous or disputed endorsements, a panel of Metaculus admins will make the final determination. The resolution will not consider endorsements made in jest, or without clear advocacy for the cryptocurrency's use.

title: Will an NFL team create its own cryptocurrency for use in merchandise and ticket sales by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, any NFL team officially announces or launches its own cryptocurrency specifically designed for the purchase of team merchandise and ticket sales. The cryptocurrency must be recognized and promoted by the team itself, not merely by a third party or fan group. The announcement or launch must be verifiable through official team communications, such as press releases, official social media accounts, or the team's official website. In the event that the NFL as a whole announces a league-wide cryptocurrency that can be used for these purposes across all teams, this will also result in a Yes resolution. If multiple teams collaborate to create a shared cryptocurrency for merchandise and ticket sales, this will also fulfill the criteria. In cases where a cryptocurrency is announced but not implemented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases or disputes will be resolved by referencing the most authoritative and recent statements from the NFL or the teams involved.

title: Will Google integrate a specific cryptocurrency into its payment system for the Google Play Store by 2025?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, Google has officially announced the integration of any specific cryptocurrency as a payment method for transactions within the Google Play Store. The announcement must be verifiable through official Google press releases, statements on the official Google Blog, or public statements from Google's executive team. Integration means that users can complete transactions using the specified cryptocurrency directly within the Google Play Store, without the need for third-party payment processors. This includes the ability to purchase apps, games, in-app content, and subscriptions directly with cryptocurrency. The resolution will also consider the sustained operation of this payment method for at least 30 days to ensure it is not a temporary or experimental integration. In the event that Google merges with, is acquired by, or otherwise becomes part of another company, the resolution criteria will apply to the successor entity responsible for the Google Play Store. If Google announces the intention to integrate cryptocurrency but does not implement it by the resolution date, or if the integration is reversed within 30 days of implementation, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an AI system be used to predict the outcome of a US presidential election with over 90% accuracy before the 2024 election?
body: An "AI system" is defined as a software or hardware system capable of analyzing electoral data, including but not limited to voter demographics, historical voting patterns, and real-time polling data, to predict the outcome of the US presidential election. The system must achieve over 90% accuracy in predicting the winner of the presidential election, as well as the percentage of the popular vote and electoral college votes each candidate will receive, within a margin of error of ±2%. The prediction must be made and publicly announced at least one day before the election day, November 5, 2024. The accuracy of the prediction will be verified against the official election results as certified by the Federal Election Commission. In the event that the election results are contested, the resolution date may be extended to accommodate the final decision by the Supreme Court of the United States or the resolution of any official recounts or audits that could affect the outcome.

title: Will President Joe Biden sign any executive orders directly related to the regulation of cryptocurrencies before the end of 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if President Joe Biden signs one or more executive orders that are directly related to the regulation of cryptocurrencies before December 31, 2024. The executive orders must specifically mention cryptocurrencies or digital assets and their regulation, oversight, or legal status within the United States. 

For the purpose of this question, "cryptocurrencies" are defined as digital or virtual currencies that use cryptography for security and operate independently of a central bank. This includes, but is not limited to, Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other blockchain-based assets. 

The resolution will be based on official publications from the White House or the Federal Register. In the event of ambiguity, the final decision will rest with Metaculus Admins. 

Edge cases, such as executive orders that indirectly impact cryptocurrencies by regulating associated technologies or financial practices, will not count towards the resolution of this question unless they explicitly address cryptocurrencies themselves.

title: Will China's central bank issue a digital currency that becomes more widely used than the US dollar in international trade by 2030?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the People's Bank of China has officially issued a digital currency (referred to as the Digital Yuan or e-CNY) that is used in more international trade transactions than the US dollar, according to the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or the Bank for International Settlements (BIS). The comparison will be based on the total value of transactions conducted in each currency for the calendar year 2030. Transactions involving the Digital Yuan must be verifiable through official records or statements from the IMF or BIS. In the event that neither the IMF nor the BIS provides a clear comparison, the resolution will be based on the consensus of at least three reputable financial news sources. Edge cases, such as the temporary spikes in usage due to geopolitical events, will not be considered. The resolution will also account for any significant changes in international trade practices that may affect the comparability of the data.

title: Will a cryptocurrency be used to fund a space mission by any government or private entity by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any government or private entity officially announces and provides verifiable evidence that they have used cryptocurrency to fully or partially fund a space mission. The funding may cover any aspect of the mission, including but not limited to, research and development, spacecraft construction, launch services, or operational costs. 

For the purpose of this question, a "space mission" is defined as any project aimed at exploring or operating in outer space, including satellite launches, manned spaceflights, or unmanned exploratory missions. The use of cryptocurrency must be explicitly mentioned in official documents or press releases by the funding entity or recognized space mission operators. 

In the event that multiple entities announce such funding before the resolution date, the first publicly verifiable announcement will be considered for resolution. If no verifiable evidence is presented by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will SpaceX develop an AI system capable of fully autonomous interplanetary navigation by 2030?
body:
SpaceX's development of an AI system will be considered successful if it meets the following criteria before January 1, 2031:

The AI system must demonstrate the ability to autonomously navigate a spacecraft between at least two celestial bodies, which must include Earth as the starting or ending point and another planet or moon within our solar system as the other point.

The navigation must include successful launch, transit, and landing phases without human intervention in the decision-making process.

The AI's performance must be validated through a real mission, either unmanned or with crew, where the AI system is the primary navigation control.

The mission must be officially recognized and confirmed by SpaceX through public announcements or press releases.

In the event that SpaceX does not publicly disclose such a mission, credible reports from authoritative space exploration agencies or organizations (e.g., NASA, ESA) confirming the AI's capabilities and mission success will also be considered valid.

title: Will an AI system win a Grand Slam tennis tournament against human players by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if an AI-controlled robot or system wins any of the four Grand Slam tennis tournaments (Australian Open, French Open, Wimbledon, or US Open) in the men's or women's singles competition by December 31, 2030. The AI system must control a physical robot that plays on the actual tennis court against human competitors. The victory must be acknowledged by the official tournament organization and must occur in a standard, officially scheduled tournament match, not an exhibition or special event match. The AI system must comply with all tournament rules applicable to human players, including but not limited to game conduct, equipment regulations, and match scheduling. In the event of a dispute over the AI's victory, the decision of the tournament's governing body will be final. If no AI system competes in or wins a Grand Slam tournament by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will there be a confirmed case of an infectious disease originating in space and infecting humans on Earth by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, there is at least one confirmed case of an infectious disease originating in space that has been documented to infect a human on Earth. The confirmation must come from a recognized health authority such as the World Health Organization (WHO), the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), or an equivalent body in any country. The infectious agent must be clearly identified as extraterrestrial in origin by genomic sequencing or other scientific methods that can unambiguously distinguish it from Earth-based organisms. In the event of ambiguous cases, a panel of at least three independent experts in astrobiology or related fields must reach a consensus that the infectious agent is extraterrestrial. This panel should be recognized by the international scientific community. If no such case is confirmed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new information technology emerge by 2030 that significantly increases the data transmission speed between Earth and Mars?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a new information technology has been developed and demonstrated to increase the data transmission speed between Earth and Mars by at least 50% compared to the highest recorded speed as of 2023. The technology must be verifiable through a peer-reviewed scientific publication or an official announcement by a recognized space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, ISRO). The measurement of the speed increase must be based on actual data transmission tests conducted under comparable conditions to those used in 2023. In the event that multiple technologies claim to meet this criterion, the resolution will be based on the first technology to be publicly demonstrated and verified. If no such technology is developed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases or disputes regarding the interpretation of 'significant increase' or the validity of the technology will be resolved by a panel of experts in the field of space communication, whose decision will be final.

title: Will the World Health Organization establish a dedicated division for space-related health issues by 2035?
body:
The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, the World Health Organization (WHO) has officially announced the establishment of a dedicated division or department focused on health issues related to space travel, space habitation, or any health concerns arising from human activities in space. This includes, but is not limited to, the study and treatment of health conditions unique to space environments, the development of health guidelines for space travelers, and research on the long-term effects of space habitation on human health.

The announcement must be verifiable through official WHO publications, press releases, or statements made by authorized WHO representatives. In the absence of a clear announcement by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

If the WHO establishes a partnership or program with similar objectives but does not create a dedicated division, the question will resolve as Ambiguous and will require further clarification from Metaculus Admins.
